review: I've been playing Rust since it was first released back in December of 2013 and I must say that this game has changed quite a bit from then until now. Even so the game has been an alpha release for about 3+ years now.Pros Fun and engaging combat but is still enough of a challenge to not make it all that easy to master Amazing visuals that have been greatly overhauled from previous Rust Legacy A cancerous community that makes any person want to kill themselves (everyone needs a little bit of cancer in their life) Day/night cycle + weather (i.e Rain... yeah that's basically it) Different biomes (i.e Plains forest desert beach etc...) Crafting system that has been reworked several times (and will possibly be reworked again since the devs love doing that) Tons of weapons to craft ranging from stone age weaponry to military grade weaponry Animals to hunt and kill (or be killed by) Simplistic base building mechanic that allows you to build and upgrade a home to live in Several different monuments to explore and loot (i.e airport water treatment plant power plant etc...) Great in game audio FX and soundtrack Weekly updates/monthly server wipes Official servers community servers and modded servers DX9 DX11 and DX12 support (DX12 experimental at the moment) Steam Workshop support (players can make different weapon/clothing skins and put them on the workshop to be voted on)Cons Poorly optimized even for high end PC's Poor animal AI/animals faze through objects (i.e rocks trees houses) A lot of bugs other than what I had just mentioned Has a memory leak that often leads to lag or using too much computer resources The community for this game is beyond cancerous in fact. About 97% of the player you meet in this game will kill on sight even if you're a nakedFinal Verdict (ATM)6.5/10Despite my cons I'd still recommend this game to anyone looking for a fun game to play with friends or by themselves. Though the community is terrible about 3 4% of the players in this game are actually pretty cool and you might even make some new friends while playing.The game is still in alpha so it has quite a ways to go before everything is finalized and is in a more stable state. (Review is subject to change throughout the lifespan of alpha/beta)
title: Rust

review: 9.3598419810498104984189/10 would buy again. got my money's worth and more lots of fast paced action slow crafting and harvesting. As I played through the game with all of it's changes that have gone through I learned to be looking over my shoulder all the time while I'm murdering the population of trees and nodes. Really love where the game is right now even though I would gladly go back to BP system but that's a thing of the past. I would definately reccomend the game to someone who wants to build up a base and have tons of fun in PvP wherever you turn. I really enjoy this game and would reccomend it to anyone looking to buy it especially if you have a few friends to play with going up against everyone else solo is quite difficult when you don't have many hours. There is a level of toxicity in the game on most servers so it comes as a very pleasant surprise when you get nice people running up to you and helping you out for no particular reason. Playing this game has been great and I'm wondering how it's still in alpha and think this game deserves more players. I'm gonna hit that thumbs up button for this crafting PvP building all around awesome game.Edit When I said there was a certain level of toxicity in the game I meant it. Most of the community is very toxic and kind of ruin the game for me there's also the dominant zergs that stop small groups from playing on high population servers which really is starting to annoy me as I'm a lover of combat in all forms from stone age weapons to high quality rifles.

review: Obviously i have spent alot of time on rust and have had tons of fun moments since december 2013. But the direction rust has gone since then is just no longer fun. If you are going to buy rust make sure you can put in at least more than six hours into it every day to keep your base up and running. Also make sure you have at least four other friends that play the game for six plus hours a day as well. Because if you join a server for just two hours by yourself you wont get anywhere you will be killed by people with guns when all you have is a rock or a spear. Dont even get me started on the community in this game rust's community is the most toxic and rude bunch of gamers i have ever seen. Everytime you are killed by someone with an ak i guarentee they'll say "THANKS FOR THE PICKIN'S !" or "you're so ing bad at this game kid go kill yourself" as i said ive had many fun moments on this game but these moments just dont happen anymore. The community is all the servers are run by groups of 8+ that have the ak (a laser weapon that can spray you down from 200+ meters in one second) and if you want to play solo you will probably never get anything better than a revolver blueprint because it takes hours and hours of farming to get a decent weapon to defend yourself. For these reasons i can say that i would NOT recommend rust to anyone. Do i regret buying it? Of course not! but i wouldnt put anyone through the pain of playing this game.

review: legacy rust was one of the funnest games i've played. unfortunately after they shifted to the new experimental (and now final release) version the game has been on a steady decline. this is all due to the increase in difficulty and time of even menial tasks.in legacy you could research faster gather faster build faster and loot was higher tier. any player could join a server find some rad pills go deep in big rad and get some weapons or armor. hell you got kevlar by killing animals with your bow. if you wanted to build a base you could chop wood piles for 20 mins and build a base out of endgame mats that took c4 to raid. this kind of gameplay made the game more easy going. you could interact with players deaths weren't a huge setback and progression could be achieved for even casual players.in this version of rust everything is much more difficult. it will take you hours to set up a minimal base that can likely be raided with just a few rockets or satchels. guns are incredibly rare and even if you find them fat chance you'll research them before you get raided. bases are optimized to hell because they are so expensive and dying means you're set back possibly hours depending on the circumstances. this shift in difficulty meant that players are forced to band together and form massive clans in order to survive. the former casual players who would thrive in legacy were forced to team up with the threat of being raided and wasting hours for no pay off. nobody interacts anymore since being killed by a hostile means you can lose tons of resources and time. this leads to a 100% KOS nature to the game where even fresh spawns are shot. Furthermore the teaming up of players to avoid the massive drawbacks to being a weaker fighter has led to huge clans dominating servers. why would you play solo when you can join the 20 man army and raid anyone you please? these unstoppable forces control servers and wipe out any and all solos or small teams. this all leads to an end system where players play the game like a job in order to avoid being raided. massive superpowers war on servers (which isn't as fun as it sounds) where whichever clan farms more materials wins. then the servers wipe and you're forced to farm it all back again. all the while the devs are obsessed with just adding meaningless content like farming or water collecting which means nothing to the overall game. the only survival you'll be concerned about is against other players. any animal AI can be outsmarted by building a foundation or killing it with a bow. there are no environmental conditions to worry about. this is barely a survival game.

review: First off personally I will not be playing this anymore because I can't maintain a sleep schedule because of how addicting this game is I've put almost 800 hours into the game and it eats away at your life because of how much time you spend playing you'll say alittle bit longer I gotta finish the rest of ore cooking then it's 5 am and it's Dawn you can't manage a normal sleep schedule due to the addictive and annoying culture of offline raiding it's the worst feeling ever when you've worked your way to the top of the server after you've spent 20 hours in the server only to have another group offline you and take everything and seal off your base because you killed them once but to be fair I've raided someone for hiding in dome while my group tried to take helli but he sat in dome with it on him don't get me wrong I've enjoyed every hour I've put in to this game id say if you were to play this game id say it's most enjoyable when you play in a trio server but it's rough playing this game I think this game would benefit from a mechanic where offline raiding requires alot more resources I saw a similar mechanic in ark once which seemed to work well. But all in all I would recommend this game completely you just have to be comfortable with loss and the screeches of nakeds and cave men not to mention the roleplayer it's pretty fun killing roleplayers and cavemen. But if you cannot handle stress well or can't keep your composure in a high tense situation you will not have a good time at all as sad as it is i was playing with a friend who threw up from the stress it was funny af tho I'd give this a 9 out of 10

review: *This review is mainly focused on Mac users*When I first got this game literally years ago it was an awesome and fun experience albeit a bit laggy on my mac. Although the game has vastly improved since the fetus days I played it the mac experience has not. If you are a MAC user reading this review do NOT get this game. I myself have been unable to join a server in years and the creators do not seem too focused on the fact that this is a widespread problem for the mac port as they do not seem at all focused on making this game playable for this platform any longer. On top of that the game is also poorly optimized and thus any mac players that can even play the game are likely going to have a very slow and laggy time. Overally my conclusion is thus although this game can be an incredible experience it is simply not worth purchasing on mac

title: Rust

review: I don't know how facepunch studios have done it because I thought easily that the worse game for PvP back in the day was EVE Online with the RPG mechanics and how much the older players griefed new players. However they have out done themselves in making a game that completely invites people to be the biggest possible towards new players and I am sure that the comments section if the other reviews were anything to go buy will be flooded by the angry wailing of fanbois claiming I'm a noob and I don't know how to play the game blah blah blah well you guys can off no one likes you and no one especially likes a bunch of fanbois who refuse to admit that their game is broken.For those who will actually read my review this is a good 'game' the mechanics are excellent I actually like the survival aspect of Rust however I have picked up on two glaring faults that are breaking the game completely. The first one is the most obvious when you are a newbie and you first try this game. The spawn system is flat out broken because of the way building works in this game what has happened is that especially on the small maps because the older players know exactly where newbies will spawn they actually build huge ing walls to stop them from escaping easily and there are players on there literally sitting and waiting on rooftops for not just geared up players to come along but specifically targeting brand new players for and giggles because they have nothing better to do than make people rage in the review section about this.With this spawn system it is therefore impossible for new players to have any chance of fighting back I'm no pushover I was really determined to try and take these ers down and I did actually manage to nail a guy who had let his guard down on one of the smaller maps with a stone spear when all his buddies came rushing after me once I got through the outer edge of his base he opened by accident. However there's just no fighting it especially when you're solo and you go in for the first time the newbies have to have some kind of balance protection against these people even DayZ wasn't this ing bad and EVE Online at least had safe zones where any of the veteran players would be gunned down in a second if they tried attacking players who were just learning.The second major flaw with this game is you gussed it the balance of the weapons again this is to do with the spawn system partly but fresh spawns cannot even go up against somebody with a bow if they're unlucky enough to be spawned next to someone like that and that actually ing happened to me. The spawn system is so bad when I spawned on the coastline ( Which I think is mainly where you end up generally which is why players could predict where you'd end up ) I ended up getting shot at before I could even react properly just as I had come in.This is a serious flaw not just with survival open world PVP games but open world games in general I tried Rust because it was pretty reasonably priced but had it been something like Elite Dangerous again I would have been pretty off because in the open multiplayer that game suffers from the exact same problems as well.Games developers need to stop ignoring these glaring issues if you offer up more private game options and community options then that would definitely fix things maybe even allow admins to change the spawn areas and so on or randomise things more just stuff like that. However with the way things are I am not surprised at all at the amount of raging people are doing over this game I can't blame them and it's actually reminding me of why I'm really enjoying staying in singleplayer games generally or really well balanced shooters that don't have these issues.If you're really intent on buying this game I would see if you can find a nice community server to play in where there's an active admin that will boot any griefers that's all I can really suggest if you are fed up of the griefing players right now that get off on ganking newbies.

review: The best times I had in Rust were when it was solely components everywhere and hiding the TC behind a bunch of walls was a good strat.Those times are over. BP forces you to grind endlessly for scrap Still need to grind for resources grind for survival (food etc) grind for components take 30 minutes to stand in the base and craft things grind extra mats because upkeep no official servers offer a no upkeep option servers die after day 3 get wiped by a 10 man tribe that has no lifersAs someone who has a job and is getting older and needs a break every so often. I just can't recommend vanilla rust. You will only have fun on a modded server with no upkeep but have fun finding an active one.

review: I woke up on a beach. I didnt have no pants only a rock. I thought to myself i better give him a name I decided to name him rocky to keep me company on this strange island. How did Rocky and I get here I wondered. Off in the distance i saw another Man with no pants. He also had himself a rock. So i chased him down and we became friends. We made our own little house with rocks. The we heard some people shooting in the distance we went to inspect. We were shot at and we legged it back to our little hut. Rocky and I hid in the hut for a few minutes I could hear foot steps. they were outside and on my roof. Someones here I dont know what to do... Ive got a rock and my .. i hear a Guitar playing and someone yells out that they are friendly and want to help me out. So i open the door with Courage only to be mowed down by 7 people with Guns. I could hear one of my Enemies screaming as they walked into my Bear Trap that i had luckily found in a Blue Barrel but that didnt save my home plus my friend Rocky was Sodimised ( This was my job i was saving it for a rainy day)Would recomend finding a big clan when you start off and knocking on their doors over and over untill they let you join and then make your way up the ranks via kneeling to god and swalloing when others usually wouldnt. Hint Hint.

review: Rust for me is really a pinnacle for what I believe the "source community" represents. Rust brings along alot of baggage a trifling community that really doesn't know what it truly wants in the heat of that moment where in a game you're almost always paranoid that feeds into a bad cultivation of "reviews" or if you're one to frequent chat amongst most servers is of people bickering and complaining. So for most reviews or opinion through word of mouth or even in chat of a rust server. It is important to shift through those reviews to find those that truly symbolize Rust and it's "culture" I am at large a fan of Facepunch as I seeped tons of hours before Gmod really hit it's fame via media. To this day I have a hard time deciphering if Garry really has a good grasp on ladders yet (anyways) Beyond all else this game is a tribute to survival games as they should be before the plague of BR came about. Rust will stand the test of time I feel even if you take a monthly break once you get raided theres a drive to come back to see if you can do it better next time. If it's your first rust experience spend the first few days with chat disabled or if you're like me and enjoy talking and creating allies and enemies via social game it's whatever route you prefer. Building makes you think and is ever changing couldn't tell you how many hours I've spent doing math on what ways my base could be raided and what I can do to resolve flaws. Vice versa using that knowledge to help my raid team get into a complicated intrciate structure. Loot systemThe loot system has gone through many changes and I feel the current one is by far the most balanced and by far the one I love. However I do expect it to be changed but the current system allows large groups to progress in a fair manner to a solo player can still keep up if they play their cards right. The many aspects of this game is what makes it so damn addictive.So in an overall I 100% reccomend this game if you're looking for more of a competitive long term shooter rather than a BR. (Just expect to lose alot more)

review: Fun addictive game not for everyone.I love games like this but you will die and lose hours of time often. When you finally feel like you are getting somewhere 3 very geared people will murder you break into your house instantly murder you again ruin enough of your house and take exactly what they know will screw you over and leave. I have been playing Rust on and off for a long time it is definately coming along nicely and is vastly better than it was only a year ago. Sound awful? It is but I keep coming back for more.But caution if you cannot handle KOS even when you clearly have nothing on you of value do not buy this game. Complaining about it in this game is pointless and is very much a part of the experience. By advice try and make friends with an established player or play with 2 3 friends. Starting out from scratch alone is a rough go.I took a long time off from Rust but I can back into it many changes and still getting used to it. I used to have some luck dissuading an obviously vastly geared player from instantly destoying me over comms So far im about 0/10 since I came back. It is a rough game but I love it. Do not buy this game and cry about KOS. It will happen.

review: You awaken on an island. A mountain stands behind you. A forest ahead of you. A quick check of your person reveals that you have a rock two bandages and a torch. You don't remember where the possessions came from but they're yours. You love them.You set off looking for anything. Something? You're not sure.After a while you haven't found much of anything. A shack. Some trees. More mountains.The sun is going down and you're frustrated. A pig appears in the distance. Your stomach rumbles at the thought of it. As you beat the pig to death with your beloved rock another man runs at you. You expect him to help you kill the pig share your bounty. His rock connects with your face rather than the pig.You're going to die here chasing a pig having accomplished nothing in your life. After a brief struggle that seems to last forever the intruder lies dead at your feet. You loot his body. He has a rock two bandages and a torch. These are yours now. You love them.You finish the pig and move on with your life. Until you hear a gunshot and the world turns to nothing.What is wrong with this place?

review: Most people get on this game and the first thing they see is the official servers that have 200 player populations as I first did when I first started...Community and modded servers are the way to go with minigames sped up "grinds" and more custom stuff.I do however recommend that you find some friends to buy and play it with you or find some friends in the game (friends in the game can be tricky because most of them dont really trust you and for good reason)This game has great visuals performance if you set the settings correctly and great survival gameplay.Most people complain about the game's community being trash but most of the time the people that do kill you only do it for the loot and to make sure you dont kill them hence why this game is a massive survival pvp game... get over the fact that you died and do better next time.Others complain about legacy and how it was so much better. I have to say from experience that whenever I first got this game and played it I wasnt too hooked onto it. But I do enjoy games that evolve and change over time as long as they dont get too broken. You have to remember that everyone else has the same limits you do unless they hack.Another great part about this game is the very minimal amount of cheaters that will harrass community/modded servers. Most of them go to the official ones which is great if you can find a decent community server to enjoy. Plus there are TONS of servers to choose from so you wont lack options either.I would rate this game 8.5/10

review: RUST is ok. To be honest it's suffering all the same issues that other online games suffer unfriendly players. I've been playing it for about a month on and off and have hit the same wall each time someone always kills me.People are reluctant to hook up into teams there is a pervasive atmosphere of mistrust that really drags the game down and which has put me off playing it.I had a base which got raided repeatedley. For those that don't know each time you get raided you have start again with your resource collection and that's a drag after the first couple of times. Building a base is a big investment of time and materials that is satisfying once you get it built.I hid one base away from the favourite spots near Rad houses tucked in amongst rocks managed to get it mostly stone built and was gathering resources to get armoured I got raided. There's nothing you can do but build a base that makes raiding difficult that's if you can hang on to your resources long enough to do that.It takes many hours of boring banging away on rocks (if you can find any) to get enough ore to then smelt into metal and you need a constant supply of wood for this.I spent more time hiding from better armed players or hanging around my base managing the smelting than I did enjoying the multiplayer aspect of the game.I know the dev wants it to be a gank fest doesn't want to enforce any features that limit a player's freedom and will never consider what I'm about to suggest the option to create squads and let ppl know you're looking to team up. I think this would improve the game massively especially for new players.
title: Rust

review: Look I love this game I really do. It's cool and scary and a nice idea. But HOLY the people are ing annoying. Now I know someone will call me a noob or that I just have to get goo but good lord you could stop sniping me from your City Skylines as I am walking to my modest little base. I play with a friend whose way better than me at the game but still we only stand a rats chance in hell. I would love for the developers to make it impossible for players to be blind raided. If I am online than whatever at least I have a chance at killing an attacker but when I get raided a 3am and wake up to see all my gone and a giant siege tower is outside my door I honestly feel like never playing again. It's an awesome open world game that feels epic and scary but would honestly be better in 3rd person. Overall I've had a blast with this game but would love this game if people would actually man up and attack a base instead of hiding until the time when most players are sleeping.

Most servers are infested with russians or obscene trolls the game itself doesen't have any endgame you just play untill servers wipe during next release. scenery is randomly generated with premade locations randomly placed on map. Playing alone is pretty much useless idea making alliances in game is impossible because people who have group don't trust you enought to do anything else but to shoot you and if you trust someone they'll most likely raid you when you're away. nature is filled with bushes and you hope to find hiding spots there but most of the gunmen seem to see through them with ease. Because people like me care more on performance to looks. I would play a game on lowest graphics to see it run like usain bolt. Besides the request great game. Tonnes of content and updating still. Lots of servers ranging in variety and some great looking maps. Love the overall style of the game and look. To be honest i'm not even going to request any gameplay features because i know Garry will be constantly updating this to bring these out even if i don't suggest them.Keep up the good work!

review: Bottom line Rust Chance Fear and Progression and is all around one big learning experience.Now this is one of the best survival games I have ever played period. That's saying a lot coming from a person whom collected Minecraft items and basically knew the stats for every piece item in the game. Rust Legacy gives you a very nostalgic feeling the New Rust is also very good with improvements every week keeping you at the edge and into the community. Progression is big aswell You survive It's what you do. That's the power in you.Fear? Pfft If you die it's fine you just get a group or join one and dream of the day you shove a machete in his fat ugly face while rockets are being fired in the distance of his base for thinking he could ever do something like that to you.(You can get a full set of clothes and atleast a spear in around 13 minutes if your in the right area). Warning When you run into people theres a 40% chance you will meet someone whos at the very least "Acceptable" to meet and wont kill you upon approach. The other 60% could be Micspammers Children Cannibals Lonewolfs Spawncampers Snipers Hackers or A naked phycopathic killing machine with a Rock..BOTTOM LINE________________________________________________________________________________

review: Rust is amazing. If we're generalizing here then it's a blend of DayZ (without the zombies and military accurate shooting mechanics) and Minecraft (without the blocky graphics). In Rust you start out with nothing but a rock. You can use this rock to forge your destiny by gathering wood from trees or stones from boulders or try your luck chasing a pig or chicken and timing the smash animation correctly to take them down and gather Chicken Breasts. You have a crafting menu full of starter recipes (Hunting bow cloth armor hatchet and the best part base building). The base building (foundations walls pillars wood and metal windows ceilings ramps traps spikes) is what really gets me excited because that's what made Minecraft so cool. Being able to leave your mark on the landscape. Voice chat is integrated and local (a'la DayZ) so anyone within about 30 meters can hear you talk if you hold down the push to talk key ("V" by default). When you die your body drops a backpack full of everything you had in your inventory and it stays there for quite some time so you could feasibly hike back to where you died and get all your stuff.. or the guy who killed you could loot it and leave you with a torch. PVP is rampant unless you're in a non PVP server (not as exciting because there's no real feeling of danger). Let me tell you some of the most satisfying moments in this game are when you start from scratch barely escape death at the hands of better armed players construct a secret base that no one finds stumble upon a real gun (M4 bolt action rifle or a nice pistol) and the tables turn for the first time. Now you finally have a decent gun and/or kevlar armor. You did it by yourself (or with the help of random buddies you met in game) The game really strikes a chord with me. I felt like DayZ was always missing base building. And I didn't like the fact that all servers (in DayZ) remember the last place you woke up so someone could feasibly log onto a diff server then outmaneuver you and log back into your server behind you and pop you in the back of the head. This problem does not exist in Rust. Also in it's current state (wouldn't even call it Alpha really just in development) there are some very real issues with hackers. Just don't get attached to your stuff try a new server etc. It's definitely worth the 20 bucks.

review: I put in 8 hours into this game thus far. Its not a bad game but it does have it's annoyances. For example when I first launched the game I woke up on a beach with a rock and a torch. After about 15 minutes I came across someone with a rifle and and of course they shot and killed me. This happened several times through the 8 hours of game play. In my opinion In this type of game you really shouldn't be able to get up to getting a rifle and killing anyone just starting the game for ths first time. If the official servers provided a game type that was more a community style IE minecraft state of decay this would be a pretty rockin game. Theres also a bug where sometimes when you start the game trees and hemp plants don't respawn or spawn at all. You have to exit the game and go back in to correct this. I understand this is a work in progress game I just hope the dev's balance the game better and correct some of the issues. Graphically the game looks solid there are some graphical issues but overall its pretty good. Also the official servers wipe the maps every few weeks so it basically undoes all your hard work. In some other reviews people have complained of other people hacking/cheating in my game play I haven't noticed this but maybe thats why theres so many people with guns? Pro's Graphics are pretty good Great idea Crafting system is pretty solid Worth the current sale price of 10 bucks Food and water dimish at an acceptable rate to give you a chance to forage and gather meat From my experience anti cheat system seems to be workingCon's Guns shouldn't be permitted to give new players a fighing chance and actually enjoy the game Servers reset every few weeks which will undo all your hard work of gathering resources and building a base Sometimes required resources don't respawn forcing you to quit the game and go back in I would prefer there be an option to band together with other survivors to ward off the jerk players gunning down new playersOverall I would recommend the game if your into survival/resource gathering games at the 10.00 price point other wise I would hold off till the official release and see whats been improved on.

review: Okay let me start off by saying Rust is good on paper. I mean alot of things sound good on paper like in the words of Ian Comunissm but if every thing that looked good on paper actually worked good we would have a much different world with fart powered ligth bulbs.I digress. Rust is at it's heart a good game. But like all the famous kid's in families there is always that drunk uncle or father who finally shows up when the kid takes off like a star. And then that uncle or father politely BASHES THE KID OVER THE HEAD WITH A BOTTLE AND MAKES HIM DO STUFF SO CRAZY THAT MILEY ING CYRUS WOULD CALL HIM OUT ON IT. The point I am trying to make is that well the developers did not think through how a " Admin " should work. They think that " Admin " must be a fancy word in a foreign language that means ALL POWERFULL GOD THAT MUST BE ENTERTAINED NO MATTER HOW 12 HE IS. YES I YOU NOT ALL ADMINS CAN HAVE GOD MODE AND ANYTHING IN THE GAME THEY WANT. YOU GET THIS BY SIMPLY RENTING A SERVER. * Cough * Pay to win. Admins and their C4 aside What really wore Rust's weclome for me is the comunity. DO YOU LIKE LISTENING TO EVERY 8 YEAR OLD AND THEIR MOM SCREAM AT YOU AND PRETEND TO BE THE WORLD'S TUFFEST BANDIT? I KNOW I DON'T. WELL THAT IS WHAT HAPPENS WHEN YOUR COMUNITY IS A BUNCH OF 8 12 YEAR OLDS WHO CAN DOWNLOAD HAX IN ABOUT 5 MINUTES AND RULE A SERVER IN THE NEXT 10. WHICH BRINGS ME TO MY NEXT POINT. HAX ARE RAMPANT. NEVER B4 HAVE I SEEN SO MANY PEOPLE HACK DDOS ACCESS CONSOLE TELEPORT AND OH DEAR WHAT ELSE. THE POINT IS BANNING IS NOT A THING. YOU JUST JOIN BACK WITH A DIFFERENT IP AND PROBLEM SOLVED YOU GET ALL THE GEAR YOU WOULD HAVE LOST AND YOUR BACK TO BEING THE KING.In all seriousness this game could be good but because of the excues " it's in alpha " they keep on putting on the crutch when the whole track team knows it healed up months ago. NOW RUST GET OFF THAT DANG CRUCH AND GO RUN. WIN ONE FOR THE COMUNITY OR I WILL NOT BE COMING BACK TO BAIL YOUR SORRY SELF OUT!

review: A refreshing original take on the survivor genre. Rust is extremely high risk high reward gameplay that will take a bit of patience during the beginning stage but you'll find the slow progression totally worth it once you've built a base with solid defense set up. As for the community its generally fight or flight interaction unless you have a mic in which case your PvP interactions may vary. You will be severely disadvantaged playing alone although its still fun if you enjoy a challenge. Finally one of the best parts about Rust are the updates. They are frequent and usually full of new content. By the end of each year Rust always feels like a completely new and more polished game. It is clear that the developers released this as early access with the intentions of finishing it.

review: Rust isn't perfect and while it is just the first survival game I've ever tried it also gave me a good enough impression that it broadened my horizons and I now want to try other survival games. I've poured several hundred hours of my life into this game had many sleepless nights and it has brought me joy happiness rage frustration sadness and feelings of hope which are eventually doused over and over and over again. In my opinion Rust is a game best played with friends. It is difficult to lone wolf but its doable and quite enjoyable (and intense). The community is a bit toxic but if you aren't a sensitive little there's some fun to be had. Remember its just a game and while the emotional rollercoaster that this game will take you on can be intense you will most likely find yourself coming back for more.The new updates with the component system are okay in my opinion. It makes it a bit harder to come up with the gear you want to craft but in a way I suppose that it ensures that even early/low level equipment will be more visible in the game which is good in my opinion.However there is one problem in this game and its the large amount of hackers present on Official servers that have slowly started to invade Community servers as well. Lots of aimbots and other hacks make this game very frustrating if you play fairly. Facepunch has been working double time to solve this issue but at present the problem still persists. In Community servers at least the Admins can ban hackers but then there are those hackers who have no problem with DDOSing the server until its unplayable for everyone else. I recommend this game despite the hacker issue and I recommend that you buy a pack that allows you to gift it to your friends. I believe its worth the full price but of course sales are the best times to purchase this.

review: This game is the first game on steam that I have reached over 200 hours on. One thing I have learned is expect to lose all of your work to a 12 year old who camped your door for 30 min. Don't take the game seriously. Be okay with getting screwed over by a clan or being KOS. Nakeds can hold both weapons and loot. That is why clans kill you or raid your 1 x 1 hut. This game has a cancer community that you can love if you play along with them. I love this game and will put many more hours into it. The "cancer" is what can make the game so spontaneous and fun. I highly recommend this game. Just expect to be screwed over at the least convenient time. You can leave your base 50 times with nothing on you and no one will be there but the one time you leave with good gear there will be someone there to kill you. You might want to look at rust videos to learn things such as air locks honey comb why keys suck using the alt look backwards walls ect. In conclusion I highly recomend this game. If played with the right mindset this game will bring many hours of fun.

review: Rust is a journey. I have never played a more immersive game. Everytime I hear footsteps outside or a helicopter in real life I get nervous. Its hard to describe what the essence of rust is to people that have never played it. Its hard to describe the feeling of sadness anger and defeat of farming making a base and to have it raided. Its hard to describe the feeling of joy and exhiliration when you make a play or raid a clan base. Rust really makes you experience the extremes of emotions. There has been a lot of good and bad times but I don't regret a single minuet Ive spent on Rust.

review: Great game for the right player. I enjoy the easy building system with all of the customization. It takes awhile to learn how the game works and the dos/donts but once you learn it the game can be very enjoyable. It is most enjoyable with a group of people. Be prepared though to lose everything. It is part of the game you will get raided eventually. If you get butthurt about losing things you spent hours gathering then i wouldn't recommend this game. However the rivalry/survival aspect of this game really becomes captivating. When you are the raider it is verrrry satisfying. Especially when its in retaliation to people who have raided you.
title: Rust

review: This game has something magical. It's a game with survival elements but it's also a psychological experiment. Do you raid the houses of people you bonded with just for their resources or do you make friends and play along?It's all possible whenever you'd like to and it's beautifull!

review: Retour en 2015 j'ai énormément joué à Rust principalement avec des amis. A cette époque le jeu était dur pas équilibré et le nombre de wipes par semaine était tout simplement abominable. Pourtant quelque chose faisait que je restais à chaque fois l'ambition des développeurs leur envie de rendre leur jeu de plus en plus équilibré et équitable.Nous sommes désormais en 2018 et Rust est devenu un monument du jeu vidéo. Système de crafting bien pensé graphismes impeccables sur une grosse config une véritable notion de "survie" que l'on ne retrouve dans presque aucun bon jeu du même genre et le tout très bien optimisé par des patchnotes très réguliers et des mises à jours hebdomadaires.Avant de vous lancer dans l'univers impitoyable de Rust je n'ai qu'un conseil à vous donner préparez des couches ça va chier !

review: I would not reccommend this game as it is.A great game terrible community. It's difficult but fun and rewarding once you get the hang of it but far too stressful for someone like me to play full time. I'm constantly on edge from hackers showing up at my door to mess with me or bears showing up at my front door to maul me as soon as I leave. If you're going to play give yourself at least 5 hours of constant play time to get a base set up and learn your Don't leave your place for too long before it's fairly protected (several sleeping bags code locked doors wood spikes on in front of external walls so people don't just break them down and walk in. Also tool box and a spare set of supplies always ready in case you don't make it back) I like to have at least two sets of locked doors to get into my house. If you can find friendlies cherish them. Don't be an . Please there are too many of those on here.TO THE DEVELOPMENT TEAM WE NEED NON PVP SERVERS! PLEASE! THAT WOULD MAKE THIS GAME SO MUCH EASIER TO GET INTO!

review: I wanted to love this game cause I think it got a great potential but I just can't. Its not the game itself but just the community thats all.. When you load in it looks like an online minecraft server where there is small buildings everywhere which makes it hard for a newbie like me to start doing stuff.Now for the actual community which I find a bit annoying since everyone is killing eachother just for fun.. It makes me wanna throw up... People kill eachother just because they can even though you're new and running around naked with a rock in your hand people will still shoot you.. I had one guy who plainly shot me while I was minding my own buisness gathering wood and after the death he said in the chat "Lol which newbie did I just shoot with my pistol?" I then replied and said "It was me and that was kinda unnecessary I just started the game so good start for me" He then answer "So sorry it was just for the sport and testing out the rusty pistol xD" Just this case sums up most of the community I my self with the experience I got find it hard to start up and even gather materials with people always killing you.. I have yet not got the chance to build a shelter cause I've been shot right before...So because of the community I will say this is not worth buying.. people are too strong and wont give you a chance to start up.

review: Now I've had a lot of fun hours now as I'm reaching 600 hours... However some of this fun has now been removed and I will try to explain why.I have mainly been a player going for the 2X 3X 5X Gathering servers. Faster pace shorter windows before wipe and quicker rebuild. At the same time I've played on the Standard Official servers enjoying the slower pace fear when out gathering alone and the excitement of sneaking up your first real door with a code lock. This is now mostly gone. Day 1 more or less all groups of 2 or more will have guns roofcamping newer players or simply hunting in 2's or 3's. Gone are the days of the possibility to play by yourself or occasionally with friends you need to hardcore or happen to stumble upon wipe. Its a rush on the standard servers... and its even worse on the modded servers. Might be fun for a while but the thrill of actually building towards something fun as a solo player are gone. If you are a group of 3+ active players go for it its a fun PvP game for larger groups that can play a lot of hours daily.For me I cannot recommend the game any more. Component system is good but its too easy to get gunparts the time to gather enough resources as a larger group is too quick and now they have made the Tier 1 raiding cheaper... it means bye bye wooden doors. Sad to see it happen.

review: I've played rust since it first realesed and back then i was able to survive on my own and thrive. NOW since the game was remade i cant go a full 20 minutes with out someone killing me for my loot even if I have none. It laggs at times but im alright with it but the constant pvp when i try to build a house which i cant even last long enough to do so gets VERY anooying. This is all on an offical server too if that makes a diffrence. Im one of those guys who wont kill anyone unless im being attacked and i try to make friends on this game and group up but its IMPOSSIBLE because anyone I try to talk to end up just shooting me in the face. Evry once in a while I will meet a friendly guy but would refuse to group up. So thats my expence in this game. Personally I liked it better before the game was remade even though it still had so flaws. So right now this game is terrible and will always stay terrible in my book.
title: Rust

review: Big Bird is the main protagonist of the children's television show Sesame Street. Officially performed by Caroll Spinney since 1969 he is an eight foot two inch (249 cm) tall bright yellow anthropomorphic canary. 3 4 He can roller skate ice skate dance swim sing write poetry draw and even ride a unicycle. Despite this wide array of talents he is prone to frequent misunderstandings on one occasion even singing the alphabet as one big long word (from the song called "ABC DEF GHI " pronounced /æbkədefgi dʒekəlmɪnɒpkɔ rstu vwɪksɪz/) pondering what it could mean. He lives in a large nest behind the 123 Sesame Street brownstone and right next to Oscar the Grouch's trash can and he has a teddy bear named Radar. In Season 46 Big Bird's large nest is now sitting within a small furnished maple tree and is no longer hidden by used construction doors

review: The players will ultimately run this game into the ground with a level of toxicity unparalleled to any other game Ive ever played. Everyone has god aim and will almost never miss you making it fairly difficult just to get off the beach or even go and do the basic tasks like farm to build a base or farm the roads for scrap as you will most definitely be killed by some brace face 15 year old telling you that you are bad. It is poorly optimized and the servers are laggy and glitchy with problems all over the npc's are op with insta headshot the animals running around are op For some reason when night time comes around it is so black its blacker than black making it impossible to see without a light which if you do turn on a light then everyone in the game now knows your location which brings you back to the beach as... dead yet again. Almost impossible to do anything if you are not on at wipe days and when wipe days are on there are so many people on that it makes the game almost impossible to play due to the shear amount of lag and frame loss that occurs. There is no reason this game should be sucking dry almost 16gb of ram which is an insane amount. If you want to die and respawn then die again and respawn in the same spot this is the game for you. But if you want to say $40 i suggest you do so and do not buy this game.

review: Honestly this is a good game. Not a great game but a good game. I have put in about 33 hrs and for the first half of that everything felt like a fresh experience. Then for the second half everything became kinda stale. Yes this is in beta so of course things will change and then experiences will most definitely change as well. I was gonna write a legthy review but decided against it. Theres really not a lot to say anyway. This game has potential to be an excellent survival game. They did away with the zombies so now its supposed to just be survival. However after a short amount of time playing you will have everything you need and in vast quantities. So its no longer about survival but pure PVP. Which is fun to a degree. But thats not why I bought into this game. I dont wanna log into a server just to go hunt down other players everytime. This gets old. But so does logging in just to build up your base a little better to prevent it from getting raided again. So roaming the map to raid a base and kill other players is the only real way to have fun. Other games in this genre have this same exact issue. When it comes down to it these games lack objectives. Something you can strive for and in the end get that reward that will make that once tedious task now bareable. Its all a vicious cycle. I believe that the devs could have a gem of a game here. But its still lacking in the feature department as of now. Im sure they have tons of features and ideas they want to add but at the moment I feel what we have may be what the core gameplay is going to be and thats it. Im gonna recommend this game based soley on the fact that it is fun and that it is still in development. So the devs could add some much needed features to spice up the gameplay and give it that zip that it needs.

review: When you can hold someone at gun point in front of their own house while your friend sneaks behind them from afar you know that you've got a gem of a game in your library. Then your friend yells "Hatchet in yo face NIQQAAA!" and proceeds to beat them to death with it. Then you work for literally weeks cooking meth and gathering rocks n' to make a shack just to get ed up by some kid whos admin of the server with his PS3 controller. Your friends refuses to wear pants because it blocks the freedom of his One doesn't use C4 because "Why should I use MY resources on this door?". Civil wars between two groups of friends break out and you hear about it constantly while in school. Sides are formed war is imminent. You make a fake steam account and purchase another copy of the game with dank cash just to sabotage one side by revealing their location and weakpoints to the other group of friends. You play the act for weeks and gain their trust all while relaying information to your true faction during class hours. Night falls and at around 5 am you raid them and take everything that they have. There is nothing spared. Yelling proceeds the next day at school. They are no longer friends but that doesnt matter in the end. The war was won and now you have braggin rights and label yourself a Benidict Arnold. You take pride in knowing you were the cause of such an incident. You are actually the only one who won. You are the best... Great game. )

review: Not just another survival game. An addictive and very fun to play game. You just have to know the basics when you are playing this very first time there are alot of beginners guide on YouTube go through any one of them and you'll know what and how to do stuff in this game. In rust you gather build upgrade hunt be hunted blow things up raid people get raided.And to the people complaining about the game that it's based upon clan play and give advantage to the people who have a clan and put those into great disadvantage who play solo. Well name a PvP multiplayer game which does not gives advantage to clan play vs solo play? Clans or multiple friends playing a game together will always have an upper hand in any PvP multiplayer game.Servers get wiped every month this means that everything will be wiped players bases resources items etc. My advide for solo players is make friends with people who play this game or join a clan or simply ask someone to team up in main chat it's quite simple.

review: I have been wanting to grab Rust for a while now for me the survivability mixed with building sounded amazing not so much for the PvP aspect. Now after 40 hours and countless houses later I can say I am extremely glad I finally grabbed Rust and it is every bit worth the 20 bucks. A good server is key to enjoying the game (in my eyes) and the server I am on has a smallish population which works out great. There is enough of a challenge through the PvP that I am not constantly getting my house destroyed but enough people to still warrant a challenge and having to start over occasionally. I was even raided by the nicest people ever. They killed me while I tried to defend then took only the materials while leaving me clothes and food to at least survive! Haha.The survival aspect is great as well. You can get too hot or too cold which will kill you as will starvation. But it is not impossible to have even the smallest amount of protection to keep you safe. If you enjoy Minecraft but want more excitement Rust is your game.
title: Rust

review: So far absolutely terrible. It seems that this game is only multiplayer (unless of course you want to run your own server just to play solo). The main issue i have with it is that when you log out from a multiplayer game your character is asleep in the game world on the server. Absolutely anyone can find you and kill you during this time taking all of your stuff. The gameplay may be fun if you could ever keep anything you build. Three days in a row I played for 2 hours on a server that supposedly was 'noob' friendly only to find that after I logged off on each of the three days my character was killed and my house and everything in it was destroyed or looted. I have no desire to start over every day and I was the only person on the server at the times that I played. It seems impossible that anyone would be able to start on an established server because everyone will destroy all of your stuff every single time you log off. The fact that I can't defend my stuff because I'm at work makes this game absolutely worth it. I would love to get my money back. I think the idea of the game itself is fine and it works alright for an alpha but it is unrewarding to login over and over again to see everything you've worked on is gone. Absolutely the most disappointing game I've ever played. Hopefully there is a plan to address this very wierd outstanding issue in beta or at least before the game is released. But at this point the game is not enjoyable by any means.
title: Rust

review: Want a great survival game then look somewhere else. In short Rust (in it's current state 03 05 2014) is a very bad value for your money. The Graphics are ugly textures are washed out 'blood' when hitting people or animals look like they're borrowed from the first Doom game. It doesn't help that the whole map is so similar everything looks the same no matter where you go. The hit boxes are terrible to hit you will have to stand almost inside of a person/animal to hit it however animals can almost 'shoot' hitting from long distances. When hitting there is no respond from the humans nor animals. The gameplay itself aside from the terrible hit boxes is okay. It's your standard survival game get food get tools fight other players. Nothing out of the ordinary. Stear clear don't waste your money.

review: I have been playing rust since it started back with the old single map format. Since then the game has changed massively and for the better. Gone are the rad towns with the zombies to the current and to be released soon XP system.Basic premise of the game is to survive not only against the wild but again other people. To survive you need to kill wildlife knock down trees and gather resources to build a shelter a home or a castle if you so wish. Building bigger buildings comes at a cost you can be raided. Other player can exploit weaknesses in your design and use that to enter your house and take your stuff! The world resources regen fairly slowly forcing the pvp aspect as time moves on. Although there are many low pop community servers which cater to new players with friendly no KOS rules. Personally i would start there to get the hang of the game before moving on.This Game is still in alpha due to a change in engine half way through the original alpha release. Meaning sometime servers have to be wiped to place the new version. this is a good and bad thing reset for an even playing field but also a loss of your hard work up to that point. Pro's Decent single player experience.Strong Team play experience.decent crafting progression.Strong sense of danger (bloody choppers)Con's Some s out there. (its the internet so no shock)resource regen is a bit iffy.still a way to go before a stable game is made.

review: while most elements of a survival sim seem like they are there they currently do not work (as expected for an alpha) however its been over a year since release and they still haven't been able to implement the "Thirst" at all and hunger doesn't seem to work at all so there is no point trying to test that. In fact all of the actual elements of survival advertised such as "Thirst. Hunger and cold" Really don't matter anyway as it all takes a back seat to the PvP so as far as survival sims go its really just shoot before you get shot if your lucky enough to find a gun a fps shooter that lets you build stuff. its really the community that makes or breaks these kind of games so do not play alone because everyone is out to kill or steal your stuff while your logged off anyway. Cannot recommend because its not working as advertised this far into production better off spending your cash on a survival sim that actually works like a survival sim and not just an fps. so in Garry Newman's own words "I wouldn't buy it" (unless your into lots of male genitalia because you will end up seeing that ALOT both rendered in the game world and in the qualities of the people you will meet.

review: Hated this game before the change it sat in my library for a year but since they have changed the game it is everything I could have ever hoped for. It is pretty much the love child of day z the forest life is feudal etc. It is insanely frustrating to have a base you spent hours and hours on just leveled but it goes both ways. There is nothing more satisfying than sneaking into someones base and loot everything they have. It is a survival game so if you can't take the pvp don't play survival games. Too many reviews I see people talk about how people are just mean and troll and kill you nonstop and it gives the games a bad name. That is how these games are played and always will be. What do you expect in the apocalypse? A bunch of hand holding? No. So if you are that person don't buy it. If you are looking for an addictive challenging frustrating satisfying great looking experience this game is most definitely for you.Graphics 7/10ReplayValue 9/10Controls 9/10 (Very intuitive)ROI 12/10 (more than worth the cost)Overall 8.5/10

review: First Reviewed 19 Jan 2014 Review This game is fun as hell. It's not too easy and not too hard.Reviewed 23 Jun 2016 Two years since my first review of the game. A lot has changed.Initially the zombies were removed and minor tweaks to gameplay. This marked the point in which I stopped playing Rust and moved on.Then the game as it was got scrapped and re done. What it once was is called legacy and what it is now is called Experimental.The game has completly been overhauled with the shift to a new engine (Unity).The first notable improvement is the graphics what resembled Quake 3 is now at times the most beautiful graphics (providing you have a Rig that can handle it).This game has gone from oh hey another player to oh another player. Currently the way the game has been balanced the player interaction is purely KOS (kill on sight). The in game player interaction can be summed into one word toxic. The weapons have ridiculous recoil and most often you'll just lose that prized AK to a naked with a hunting bow. The combat system is heavily reliant on RNG (Random Number Generated) damage which often means a Rifle shot to the head and you'd be fine 98% of the time.The crafting system is a blueprint system where you need to gather enough blueprint fragments to reveal worthwhile items or gather enough blueprint fragments to research a desired item with the added risk of losing the item.Building bases has gone from home style bases to giant eyesore cylinderical or box style monoliths an 8yr old draws when told to draw a house. Bases are built purely for defense and the lack of aesthetic items in the game makes the landscape on servers resemble a barren war torn post apocalyptic sess pool of high external walls.Offline raiding is the bane for any solo player. As the game currently stands if you're a solo player you're playing at a great disadvantage.But the game is fun.Reviewed 23 Jul 2016 The game has gone from a blueprint system to an xp system.Ownership is now implmemented depending on the percentage of resources you provide to an item determines your % of ownership thus allowing you to reap in that % of xp earned by a player using the item.The xp system is great however it favours large clans with 20+ players. The animals are still broken you an expect ninja bear &amp wolf attacks.Weapon recoil is still 1 bullet for you the rest for the sky gods.The developers are pretty much childish in nature and do not know how to listen to community feedback and implement their own variation which utterly breaks down certain aspects even moreso. Rust as it stands is a Rock &amp Tree bashing simulator.Reviewed 12 May 2018 Pure cancer. Game is dead.

review: Don't get me wrong. The base game is great. I've never played a survival game with farming as addicting as the farming in rust. Multiplayer raids are some of the most fun I've had ever playing a video game. I also like where the devs are taking it. The new items feel fun and I can't wait for vehicles to be added. My huge issue with this game is optimization. 10+ minute loading times constant hard crashes which force me to restart my computer and even taking key commands from the wrong keys. This is what you are in for if you get this game. Honestly I could run this game better a year ago before all the "optimization" changes than I can now. Not sure how they managed to screw it up this much but after my 2 000th crash at a loading screen I feel I have to say something about this game. Nothing is more stressfull than trying to log on and save your friends from a raid only to wait 10 minutes for the game to load crash and have to load in all over again. It is not finished. This one needs to stay in the oven quite a bit longer for it to be considered playable.

review: *********************************************Original post*********************************************This game made me reconsider my possition on "early access" games. I've had tremendous enjoyment out of it. Even the promo video you see is quite accurate (beach naked &gt gather &gt build &gt get airdrops towns &gt make friends or enemies &gt survive). I've even reported hackers with proof and gotten results straight from the developer and when I pointed out that same hacker had several accounts they also banned thoses. I could not be happier with this game and the developers.Game is in CONSTANT evolution. Not change EVOLUTION. Stop playing for a couple of patches and it's a whole new game. They do take in player input mainly from steam reviews and www.reddit.com/r/playrust and we often exchange our oppinions with the developers.&lt 3 facepunch &lt 3 rust.PS 600+ hours for $20.00 was a steal.*********************************************UPDATE 12/18/2015 12/26/2015 *********************************************Solo play is dead performance is getting really bad even on the lowest settings. I'm using an ASUS ROG 750g jw with an Nvidia 750g 2GB of VRAM + 16 gigs of ram + 2 SSD's. Performance is bad.*********************************************UPDATE 5/14/2015 *********************************************Turns out "gaming laptops" are not up to par with their counter parts. My Nvidia 750g had a tiny "m" that some how was supposed to warn me is of lesser performance than it's 750g desktop counterpart. Never mind that lesson leared. laptops.Now I'm on a custum built desktop with an Nvidia 970 AC SSC+ or what ever that means. Bottom line is I can maintain 60+ fps for the most part with costum settings.Now the gameplay Gameplay is good. Soloplay is dead. If you have to soloplay do it in a 2x gather or greater server. Otherwise you will never be able to craft enough explosives to catch up with the larger crews (&gt 3 people)Is this a good early acces yes. They update the game constantly and the game is moving in a generally positive direction.Will this game ever be completed I doubt it. They will keep this early access shennanigans for as long as they can. Steam needs to moderate this.

review: I really wanted to like this game... I mean REALLY thought it had potential!! But it consistantly crashed before the game even started despite my system being well within the requirements. It was a 'pre release' when I tried it but buggy beyond all belief. Developers there is a difference between internal testing alpha testing beta testing a pre release and a retail game that's why they have those deliniations. I would be willing to pay for a beta test or a pre release but this game was clearly still in the internal testing phase in terms of quality. This game gave no clue as to what a user was supposed to do no in game tutorial and unless I had a web browser pulled up in another window it was a certainty that I was going to die during the first night. It was a rarity that I would find another player that wanted to help. Most just wanted to run up and slaughter me while I was still trying to learn the ropes... made me think of the South Park episode in World of Warcraft only everyone was like the guy with no life.This game has a lot of evolving to do before it's worth the money you pay for it. I actually wrote Steam and demanded my money back... and succeeded. Pre release or no if I can't experience a game I deserve my money back. I was not going to pay them to develop this PoS. You're much better off buying Minecraft and applying Optifine. As a matter of fact that reminds me of another South Park quote "You've got a lot of growing up to do buddy. Suck my balls!"
title: Rust

review: It takes time and effort to say the least to get far into the game. Bears will tackle you and eat you wolves will chase you across the map and playerkillers are everywhere ready to kill even a freshly spawned noob. It keeps you on your toes and finding that one in ten thousand person willing to work with and help you is crucial. One of my complaints is the lack of official servers (that I can see anyways) and the odd weapon holding looks.Another is how generic the armor looks. It's minor but it can really help to know what armor your allies or enemies are wearing and what guns they're holding (all two handed weapons like rifles and shotguns all look like an M4 held like a pistol).It's a fun game none the less and I look forward for future updates even if it does reset all my progress.

review: For an alpha this is a very smooth game with very little crashes that I've experienced. The graphics are good the game play mechanics are great and I believe that there are only great things to come moving forward from here. I can't wait to see what they add or change in the future.So a great game...completely ruined by its community. On PvP servers it's incredibly difficult to do anything due to the mass amount of people who prey on newcomers and live to grief anyone who is in their path. Even on PvE servers it's nearly impossible to move around without seeing someone who lives to ruin your experience. They can't kill you on a PvE server but they can break into your shelter and steal your items...or follow you around until you die and loot your corpse. Hours have been lost to such events. PvP or PvE it doesn't matter you WILL have your experience ruined at some point. We've found some very helpful people in PvE "Learning" servers (You will LEARN not to trust anyone) but even that is overshadowed by the worst parts of the community. Hugely disappointing considering that game is good enough that you want to keep playing and discovering things.If you're a person who doesn't get frustrated easy can just let the trolls run off your shoulders or can get into a large group that protects each other right away this will be a great game for you. If you don't like virtually starting over every hour or two you might want to pass and see how the game looks sometime in the future.

review: Oh Rust.. there's nothing like it. No game has made me feel such moments of Euphoria and happiness victory and power and defeat and loss. It is a game that you must learn much from. I'm 750 hours in and still learn something with every wipe.. Wipes they aren't that bad. It is a good thing for the server to clean erase and start new. It allows for a whole new experience. Every wipe is going to be different. Some wipes you lose you die 10 15 times before even getting to build your first home. Some wipes you Some wipes however you win. There are some wipes that you are sitting on top of your dominating tower looming over the valley cooking sulfur to make explosives and planning your next raid. You look around at the nakeds who run by in terror and in awe of your creation that YOU built. At this point people on the server begin to respect you as you are a dominant force. You will find that people will do things for you just for items or weapons in return. Items and weapons that you didn't even have to make! At first I thought that losing everything was bad.. but then I realized the fun of starting new with a new map to make a new base back to bow and arrows and spears. The best moments of my gaming have been in rust. One moment in particular that stands out was when this group of guys were killing us over and over again. We were getting mad and extremely frustrated as they would taunt us after killing us. (We were unnarmed) My buddy and I wanted find a way to survive this harsh environment. Eventually got settled in a little shack under the side of a cliff. For the next hours we hid away and began plotting our strike on the group. Every item we found every chunk of sulfur that we mined brought us one step closer to getting back at these fools! Laying low under the mountain bought us enough time to craft the explosives needed. One day at the crack of dawn we attacked! Planted C4 straight through the front door! The boom echoed off into the distance for many others to hear.. As the debris cleared one enemy lay dead on the floor and then BANG! BANG! shots fired from behind the furnace! We duck out of the doorway for cover bandage ourselves up then together we storm the base! We jump in and deal with the remaining enemy. After the smoke cleared what we were left with was a room full of chests! Filled to the brim! Guns ammo meds explosives all of the things that we needed.. also all of the things that we had lost to these guys! We were so happy that we have gotten all of their loot! As we are about to head out the open doorway we hear footsteps outside... A massive sense of dread/adrenaline went through me. We did not want to fight anyone else with all of the stuff on us. My friend goes first instant gunfire follows. I see bullets flying by then blood gush out of my teammate. "Nooo" I charged.. Jumped out of the doorway and shot their pump shotgun straight at the guy coming up on my friend. Right after I kill him I reach down to help my friend up and bandage him. We then take off as fast as we can away from this place. As we are running back home the guys give chase with bows and arrows. We fire back at them with their rifles from attop of the cliff we were based near. After we locked our doors behind us and looked at all of the loot we had taken from out enemies.. yeah nothing quite beats that moment. I will say the community can be very toxic and hard to listen to at times. However I use it as fuel. I look for the people who are being the most toxic and now after had played some time to get better at the game I target those toxic/racist players. They are the first ones I raid! 10/10 Too much fun has been had. Has its flaws but every game does.

review: Rust. Some call it survival. Some call it fun. Some would even go as far as calling is "great". I believe none of those explations do it the credit it deserves.The word that best describes Rust is Friendly.The survival. The murderous animals. BUT especially the community.Are you a new player in Rust? NO problem! Experienced and leveled players on the server will always check up on you and look after you! Whether it is showing up at your brand new tiny barely livable house at random times. taking your few valuable items from your boxes JUST for safe keeping or watching over your spawn point to make sure you don't wake up too early. (Some are even known to do a little renovation and knock a few of your hard built walls down. Just to surprise you!) Rust's community is just great!But it all seriousness. Rust in and of itself will be a great game when it is finished and is already really fun. The community just sucks and if you aren't one of the first on the servers then prepare to get murdered just for fun and your hard work destroyed just because they can. I loved the first few hours and was addicted until I had to deal with more of the players.5/7 would bleed out on the ground again

review: The review below was published in 2014 when Legacy Rust was the only Rust. I loved Legacy it was my favorite game. It's a shame to see what these putrid developers have turned my loved game in to. This game is everything you could want in a real apocalyptic survival game. First and foremost it is in beta any complaints about lag glitches and the like are just silly because that's the whole point of a game going through alpha/beta otherwise it would just be called released.Second and what should be more important gameplay. The concept is basic but great you wake up with nothing (realistically no stat pants couldn't hurt haha) and every piece of resource you need you have to gather. One issue on some servers is that resources aren't spawning quickly enough or at all from what I hear but that's because the game is in alpha... aside from spawning rates resource execution is great maybe in the future they will reskin some rocks to look like discarded metal for realism but as far as gameplay goes it's all the same. In a real survival situation you wouldn't find piles of a variety of resources naturally just some wood and minerals. Animals are scarce in some areas and that's completely realistic too unless you're on a farm if there was real life apocalypse you would not see bears and boars walking around main paths constantly.The sleeping bag is a great feature. You can save a spawn point and use a metal door to hopefully keep your things safe. This allows you to actually form alliances and make friends but doesn't add a "haven/neutral" point in the game which makes it so much more exciting.Lastly community discussion. Yes the people are mean and vicious and perhaps they are kids (I like how that's become an insult these days it's a videogame for Christ's sake!). This is what makes this game great. Who expects there to be tons of people out there willing to help others and extend trust and a welcoming hand to total strangers in an apocalypse? Most people you run into will be desperate and selfish some well run the other direction because they are scared lots will become bullies because they can and a few will begin to band together in these beginning stages of hard times. This is what I've come across so far playing the game and this is what makes it pee your pants scary...what I assume you were looking for when you bought this game.For anyone who wants a nice community with easy to gather resources and mobs that hit you for 3% of your health play minecraft. For those who played for 30 mins or an hour and got tired of crap server lag and crashes and glitchy gameplay just keep in mind it's in alpha and will get better. If you don't have the patience put it on the backburner for later enjoyment!
title: Rust

Start banning MAC addresses and you may have a decent game Otherwise DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS HACKFEST!

review: Alright compared to some people my game time is MINIMAL. And honestly it's one of the most addicting games I have ever played. Hours fly by faster than you can imagine. The game itself is amazing and always has constant updates. As for the servers lets just say you might come across a few salty people on here. The crafting system is fairly simple to get down and if you're a person who doesn't like a ton of buttons everywhere the keys for the game are minimal which for me is great. A bonus to this game the modded servers. There are well over a thousand different modded servers on here and some have a great PVE environment if you're new to the game where it is strictly unallowed to harm another play or raid their base. LIke literally everyone is immortal so if your a noob and just wanting a great feel for the game I would def. check into that!Combat expect on official servers that lodge 200+ people to show no compassion for when you just start. You do in fact start butt naked with a torch and a rock. You will come across some prick who shoots you down even if you're no threat but once you get a small base acquired and get the grind in it gets addicting. Downfall Once you take the pride to build your base and have everything looted in your boxes stacked away you will get offline and potentially get raided. Trick is not to grow too attached to your home because it may end up being someon elses. Plus side you can do it right back to someone else and be "that guy". Overall I love this game I have met a lot of new people especially on modded servers who are very layed back and just thoroughly enjoy the game without being asses. Hope this helps you all out and best of luck to you if your purchase this!

review: So I started this game with no knowledge. I didn't know what to do where to go or even how to consume food. I started to die constantly by other players with better gear than me. review: They should change the name of the game to dumpster diving as your relentless pursuit of scrap limits your gameplay to smashing barrels and looking in boxes all over the roads. The game used to be better at accommodating solo players and a nomadic lifestyle of crafting on the go. Now you're limited to having to craft in the vicinity of a work bench that costs a ridiculously large amount of rubbish for single player s to effectively obtain. Having to run home every 5 10 minutes to upkeep your home and build a junk pile doesn t make for fun game play. The game has potential but unfortunately within the last year the game has gotten easier for clans and limited the solo player s ability to have fun. It still fun for a brief stint repetive play the need for a clan too many restraints and a lack of dynamics in an open world setting causes the game to get boring again after a couple weeks.

review: Rust is currently still an acceptable game but every successive update makes me think the devs are climbing further up the spectrum. They aim to remove honeycombing (Extra layers of walls on bases) and replace it with traps which are already in the game. The funny part about this is that the traps either activate once and are spent or come in the form of turrets which can have all their ammo drained without killing anyone. They also decided to make it so that people couldn't camp the top of launch site (A monument with unique high end loot that cannot be attained anywhere else. Even then the chances of getting said loot are abysmally small) So they made it do radiation damage through a rad suit (The strongest anti rad equipment in the game) The damage is so severe you can't even make it halfway to the top without med syringes and meds don't grow on trees. There's a difference between camping it and trying to actually get loot from it but the devs didn't think about that did they? I love the game but with recent updates it just seems to get worse rather than improve. For this reason I still will recommend it because of how long I have played it as the actual gameplay is good but the lack of a good anti cheat constant ddos and never ending tide of chinese hackers can make playing this game a really fu.....n experience
