review: It's An Amazing game all together. Some elements need work as with all early access games. The problems are not big. It's hard now to join a main large server and get anything done because other people will kill you and not care. (Lots of trolls and just plain jerks in main servers). Smaller community servers are great but you can't expect your stuff to survive. they reset their server whenever eliminating what you got done. This game is great for people who like to get so far one day but then want to restart again in a week or so. This game desperately needs a single player option like other survival games or at least needs a way to stop the trolls on the main servers from just destroying anyone new cause they can turn people off from playing this game or recommending it to other people.

review: So I've been seeing that a lot of people are complaining about the game because the "community" is bad or the servers are bad and that's just disingenuous. The game is made up of mostly community servers and you can't blame the game when a few of those servers aren't run to your liking. Besides there's already servers run that fix these problems such as the One/Two/Three rule on some servers to prevent mass clans and if you're having problems being raided because you don't play enough there's no offline raiding servers. If you don't like one of those aspects just join a different server don't blame the game.I've had this game for a long time and seeing it come out of early access was a surprise so I checked it out again and I've got to say it's improved immensely. They did a great deal of tweaking and it runs beautifully and looks beautiful and STILL do community updates ALL FOR FREE. This game blew me out of the water with how much support it's gotten from the devs and although it's taken forever to come out of early access at least the devs waiting until it was in a playable state... except animals still dont move.To sum it up don't listen to reviews racking on game due to servers play a server to your liking the game has improved amazingly and I'm probably going to play it a lot more in the next few weeks.

review: The twisting of DayZ and Minecraft with its own spin on immersing the player in an evolving world. To be able to build and craft you have to survive. What has surprised me the most is how diverse the game mechanics are from the first hour of playtime to the point where guns and ammo are common tools. The start out of your game is the "Naked" stage which literally means you are naked physically and metaphorically. You have no food or clothes but you do have a rock. This rock is your weapon tool and the stepping stool to survival. Maybe you'll be randomly killed by another player or perhaps a wolf will chase you down. If you're unlucky enough the area you search will have no resources availiable dooming you to starvation. When you actually do find your niche in the world you will prosper. Ypur humble abode will come together and you'll soon discover the key to survival isn't just food and clothing anymore. Guns and a Bow will ensure that Zombies and players are fair game. Players will make or break your happy experience. I found a group of survivors that took me in and we became rulers of a valley until a lone gunman used his superior skills and resources to wipe us off the face of the island. Another incident had a raider haunt our house for an entire night until we fought back unsuccessfully. Rust is kind of game you have play with people cooperation or competition is the best way to describe the interactions within the game.

review: You've probably heard this before but if you enjoy DayZ (or even the idea of it) along with the inventory managment/crafting aspect of Minecraft set in an MMO world. There's a high chance you'll enjoy this game. The biggest issue with Rust is not with the game itself but rather the community. Everyone has a "shoot on sight" mentality and there's a very good chance you'll get frustrated rather quickly. Sticking with it however will bring great satisfaction and reward. Rust is harsh. You start off with nothing but a rock and you must mine and gather resources to start building a home and protect yourself. Many things can be crafted at the start of the game but you'll find loads of blueprints out in the world that will allow you to craft additional guns mods survival gear along with many other items. It does take quite some time before you even get enough materials together to even protect yourself from vetern users in your server. So chances are you're going to spend 20 30min gathering items just to be killed and have to restart. There is PVE servers (official and community made) some of which are more of a trust system hoping others follow the rules but there are servers were you simple cannot kill other players. If you really want to enjoy this game you're better off starting there. Get a feel and understanding of the game and how everything works. Find the quickest ways to get what you need to be safe out in the real world. Then take on PVP. Of course this is an Alpha So for example all meats are labled chicken breast you can't tear down built items along with a few minor graphical and animation bugs. On the bright side it's rather stable and you can spend hours upon hours playing getting lost within the game forgetting it's an alpha. If you have patients and enjoy what you've read so far $20 is a steal.

review: Great game but not perfect. Before I start let me state that this has to be the most intense game I've ever played. The mechanics of the game create an environment where a death or a kill make a huge difference. You don't simply respawn like in CS. Essentially you're trying to get your hands on better gear so that you can research that gear and build it once you have the resources.However this game mechanic can quickly create frustration and leads to the biggest problem with the game. That is if you don't have a group of friends to play with you're going to lose heart.A solo player will quickly find themselves swarmed by small to large groups. I had one group of 6 spend an hour smashing down my doors with their axes and swords and there was nothing I could do to stop them. You can literally spend hours establishing yourself and lose it all in an instant if you come across a group of angry teenage trolls.So while I do love the intensity of the game the develops still need to nut out the larger group problem. Currently there is a huge turn around of new players who simply don't come back to it after getting crushed so often.I recommend grabbing the game when it's on sale and spending a few days having a great time. After that uninstall and try again in 6 months. Maybe the developers will have it right by then.

review: 7+ hours playing. 90 percent of the time is very lagy. 99 percent of the time when I die because of the lag. I have good internet. I get about 100 Mbps down and 15 Mbps upload. UPDATE (2/25/2017) Finaly fixed the lag about 20 50 hours into playing the game. After 241 hours total playing time since I bought it in Aprill of 2016. 55.6 hours for the past week alone.It has serios flaws. If you are a SOLO player If you play on a big pop. server your screwed. If you play on a low pop. server your screwed. If you play on a tiny pop (less then 5 active players) you might have a chance.If you join a big clan you should have a higher chance of surving the wipe. Thats if you know a clan or lucky enough to join a clan (I had no luck with clans).If you join a server that is in the middle or at the end of the wipe cycle your screwed.There are NO safe zones/areas!On the 1st day of joining a server you have to spend 3+ hours to gather resourses and set up your base so you have a slim chance of off line raided and get killed. That is if you join a low pop. server.Then you have to play every single day 6 8+ hours per day gathering resources and upgrading your base to you have a slim chance of not being RAIDED!After spending 55.6 hours in this past week. I played the best I had ever been gather tons of resources finaly able to craft and use a rocket for the 1st time ever making sure I make by base very hard to raid came all crashing down on me while I was off line I got raided! I think it would of taking 40+ rockets or 30 C4 (never able to craft and use one) to raid me.Did I had any fun playing this game? Yes for the most part.What I userly do after I been raided I userly don't play for about 2 4 months.This past week might of been the last straw.Will I go back playing Rust? Proberbly. Thats if I create a private server just for myself or become a admin on a plubic server (fat chance) or spend alot of $$$ creating a public server (fat chance).I am so depressed and mad at Rust I would trade the game to GameStop if I was able to. I do not like GameStop. I kind of regret $2 200+ on my 1st ever PC gaming rig and buying digital PC games. I think I should of stuck with gaming on consoles and continued buying physical copys of games no matter how under power the consoles are and less polish the games are.ON TOP OF THAT I THINK I MIGHT BE GETTING OUT OF GAMEING! I rarely play any games anymore.

review: The Rust that's available to play now on Steam doesn't look remotely like the Rust you might have played last year. Though you can still play that classic version through the game's launcher (under the title Rust Legacy) developer Facepunch has been slowly iterating on a new version of the title for months a build running on a new sleeker engine. However a few features from classic Rust have yet to be implemented in its prettier successor fans of Radtown scavenging for instance are going to be left out in the cold.It really doesn't matter how kind and forgiving a person you may be when you're playing Rust you're playing The Most Dangerous Game.It's a difficult game to describe and not because its core mechanics which blend DayZ's survivalism with Minecraft's resource collection and crafting are especially complicated. It's because no matter how you talk about Rust it never sounds like much fun. "Oh yeah I collected wood and stones for an hour made a bow killed a deer and then someone shot me with a hunting rifle and I started from scratch."Yes that sounds terrific. I'll take two.The true joys of Rust are found in its unexpected emergent moments of interaction with its deadly world and deadlier humans. For example this Overview video started off with Justin and I trying to showcase the basics of survival when starting a new life in Rust which was going really well until we stared into the mouth of madness and became the monster we feared so much.

No real point or end game aside from raiding and killing other players for their guns/armor/material. If pvp isnt your thing you can play on pve servers. Guns/armor/building abilities are pretty limited. Still in Alpha so has some good potential. I would say maybe worth the 20 dollars but it all depends on the person playing.

review: Rule no.1 of Rust BRING A FRIEND. multiple ones preferably. this game is not to be played alone.Rule no.2 of Rust find a server that has recently been wiped. just search for "wipe" in the community server list and find the one that was wiped most recently. otherwise you might join a server where half the population already owns tons of guns and C4.Rule no.3 of Rust DON'T get attached to your stuff. I have played for about ten hours on a certain server until my base was taken by some dudes. they got rid of our sleeping bags and put a code lock on the door so we couldn't get in anymore. ouch. that sucks.furthermore I recommend you to watch some videos about it on youtube before buying so you kinda know what you're doing. please beware that this is purely a PvP game and not really about survival. it is easy to kill bears and wolves even with only a spear and fifty health. it is easy to get food. the only hard thing is players and players will ALWAYS kill you on sight they have to kill everyone on sight because everyone kills them on sight as well so they have to do it first(don't get too mad at them a lot of them will be nice enough to help you up)I did thoroughly enjoy this game even though I have gotten a lot of frustration about it when I get constantly spawnkilled or when I lose my stuff every now and then.good luck!

review: Was very much looking forward to getting into Rust after watching some vids on youtube but I'm disappointed to find that it is completely unplayable on my Mac. I've tried several times to play it now but it only gets past the loading process 50% of the time without crashing and then I can't get past 30 seconds in a game without it crashing. I'm on a 2013 27 inch iMac with 2.9 GHz Intel Core i5 processor 24GB RAM. My graphics card is probably letting me down (Nvidia Geforce GTX 660M 512MB). I don't know much about gaming but my computer seems to easily match the supposed minimum requirements for Rust. I accept that this might be just as much of a problem with Unity as it is with the Rust game but I'm requesting a refund until there's a stable build for Mac. Even for an Alpha this is way off the mark

review: Miss this awesome game and going to start getting back into it.Ohhhh Rust where to start? I love this game I remember when everything looked so sh*t and I think that was when Rust was certainly at its peek for fun. This game has come a very long way from legacy to current day with all these very amazing and clever updates and bug fixes I think Rust will be a game that I will always remember being a part of my life. I remember all the big clans on some really big Rust servers and taking part in some of them especially all the 5 hour long sky high rocket raids. The base building system was and still is one of the most simple yet effective ways to spark people's imagination when it comes to coming up with the next generation of base designs. I have met some very amazing and awesome people throughout my journey playing Rust because of it's amazing player base and community. Love this game and hope that it never dies. D10/10

review: Saying that Rust can't be fun is an over statement it can be great fun but most of that element comes from beneficial associations with fellow players clan wars and the ability to build your own bases. The crafting has some pretty good elements with an excellent layout and options for building plans. So basically it's a platform for clan wars with just enough crafting to make life interesting. That's it.So why the negative review? Aside from the fact that game runs relatively poorly for its visual status has no queue system built in has had very limited developmental progress has its share of bugs and very limited value from an innate gameplay standpoint (exploration is bland no story no intriguing PvE elements etc. etc.) there is one core element best quoted from our good friend Obi Wan Kenobi "You will never find a more wretched hive of scum and villainy."You cannot truly appreciate the intricacies and full scale of the human potential for gery until you play Rust. The trolls and egocentric personalities that make up CoD or WoW? They are nothing compared to the Rust bandit and they are legion! You will be robbed murdered shot and left for dead insulted mocked stalked and have hours of work taken out from under you in a matter of minutes purely for saddistic pleasure. Converse to losing hours of work in minutes (which if they can't take it while you're logged on they'll get it while you sleep) you will spend considerable amounts of time being alive for only minutes only to be slaughtered before you can craft your first tool.So my recommendation? If you want to try Rust find a group to run with first and hope they don't betray you set up a community and enjoy its benefits. Otherwise Rust will only reward if you prey upon others or somehow enjoy being bathed in anger and seeing what little trust in humanity you have left being set on fire. Nothing is safe. Nothing is sacred. Rust is a prison shower scene without the manners and I suspect they'd have it no other way.
title: Rust

review: Overflowing with hackers in this game. It wasn't so bad in the beginning but now I'd say 15% of the people playing this game use some sort of aimbot not to mention theres a weird latency issue now that wasn't present before.Update. 10/04/2014Rust has had an overhaul. Supposedly fixed some of the for mentioned issues. I wasn't able to play long enough considering how BORING it was. Walked around for 30+ minutes on a server with 85+ people and saw no one. Finally after I managed to kill an animal(rare as hell) and get some clothing I was one hit killed by a player with a rock. He made no sound on his approach and I was dead before I knew what hit me. Do not buy this game until they fix this t. They don't deserve the money. It looks pretty though too bad im not playing this game to ing pretend im a ghost in the wilderness.Update. 1/23/2015I tryed to play this game again for reasons I do not know why. Hope I guess? Anyway the procedural spawning is MUCH better now. Once you get used to the new building style its really nice and intuitive. +1 for that. New items have been implemented and have relevance but animals are still difficult to locate. One thing I did notice is that the overall functionality of the crafting menus is completely counter productive. It's probably just me but moving stacks of items around inventories is like pulling teeth. The graphics are still nice but the my main 3 issues still exist in this "New Beta" version of Rust.1. Hackers People were no clipping through my doors within the hour of me playing.2. Jittering and lag/shaking/latency when looking at another player. You never really know where they are. This makes caveman rock to rock combat very difficult and unfair. I know it isn't me because this doesn't happen in any other game I play.3. Sound Other players often (95%) don't have a sound signature when approaching at high speeds or when they are bashing you with rocks. I was litterally getting hit by someone and didn't know it until the bleeding icon showed up on my screen. I have 5.1 surround sound headphones.tl dr Games still y and has been for a little under a year. Only purchase if you want extra sadness.

review: Rust is a game that takes time and patience and durability. On your first day you try to survive aginst other naked survivors then if you suceed you will be chased down with bows then if you suceed you will be chased by assult rifles and shotguns. you hide in a mine where no one has built and then you see a hole with a crate at the bottom and jump down you die slowly while regining health to loose a 2 hour complicated course of learning to build and iron equipment. You change servers to repeat the same steps but not to make it to iron gear whatsoever. That was my rust experience all the way. Good game but hard to master. I recremend it because it is addictive even if you are on the downside.

review: This game... Is just a masterpiece. I've got multiple reasons and let me explain some of them.1 The devs (Facepunch) are just f*cking amazing! They listen to the community and update the game weekly! In short They care about the game.2 The general gameplay is realy amazing if you're looking for a survival experience it can be so satisfying if you manage to get yourself started in your first few hours of gametime and yet you feel like that is only the pure basics and a beginning of a whole f*ck ton of your time happily invested 3 The comunity has it's ups and downs but in general it's just a bunch of crazy naked dudes trying to kill you. Praise yourself lucky if you find someone friendly BUT if you do it's just amazing 4 Vanilla servers are great for players that enjoy a slower progression but the modded servers are just a fun way to have fun in the weekly wipes it's totaly up to you how you play Rust! Conclusion Rust is a game that you just have to pick up it's still in Early Acces and it's improving weekly the game is best with friends but I personally had fun myself for 50 ish hours. Buy it and enjoy it. Bored? Wait 2 months and there are new and fresh mechanics added making it exciting again. Forgot to mention it's f*cking 20 bucks!! I know lollipops that are more expensive than Rust.. Just buy and enjoy Rust.
title: Rust

review: Rust is a really great game to play with friends but not otherwise. I have really loved my experience playing with friends on Low Pop servers. I heavily do not recommend starting on official servers as you will regret ever living with the EXTREMELY toxic community. I would have to say official servers are for experienced and battle hardened players only. Even on low pop servers the community is still somewhat toxic with KOS (kill on sight) being a large part of life. I also don't recommend playing with only your friends on a personal server as it kills the fun of having a battle with another play that has agreed to it. Overall while having an extremely toxic community Rust is a great game to play with friends on low pop servers. I would give Rust a 9/10 if not for the toxic community so therefore I give it a 7.5/10. Note Wait for this game to go on sale. Even with my playtime I would not say it is worth it for $35. I got it for $8.79 and I would pay a maximum of $16.99 for it.

review: Before I go on with any review when I first was looking at purchasing this I was thrown off by 20 dollars. The game looks kind of cool but things are always advertised better than they are. Well I have 111 hours logged and I can say the game was worth it even at 60 dollars.With what is actually in the game right now there's not a lot of content. But the content in it is great. The PvP aspect is enjoyable. When raiding a base you litterally raid a base. Put on your kevlar armor and your trusty M4 grab your satchel charges and take to your enemies wall. Not a PvP fan? PvE. Grab your axe cut down piles of wood mine piles of rock and create the biggest base you can imagine. It's hand and hand with PvP and bases.With how the game is right now the developers want to add a lot. I mean a lot. Farming and everything. There's a lot of games that have tried to make it to where Rust is and have failed. The thigns it does it does very well. With how everything is I'd rather have more building types more guns and more loot. The games base is amazing. If you can't cough up 20 dollars for this joy than this review is useless.The game is not for everyone and these are my pros and cons of the game.Pros Easy to get started. Weapons are found randomly and so cannot be camped or taken.Pros Basic gunplay leaving PvP fun and fast. Pros Greatly done base building.Cons Lack of items leaves collecting everything in the game an easy task.Cons Basic gunplay can become boring and flavourless.Cons Lack of building options leaves all bases looking the game usually.All in all in the current state I smack a 8/10 on this game. What it does it does well. It just need more things in the categories it does well in.

review: In this review I'll try and make it as clear as possible as to wether you should purchase this game or not.Perosnally I love this game.Really it is a game where you start off with nothing and you with your friends or alone will start to build up and become more and more geared and more powerful. You have to take into mind hunger thirst radiation and temperature along your journey which should be expected from a survival game. You will start off naked with a rock and a torch and you will scavenge for resources to build up a base raid other players bases etc.In my opinion I would recommend this game to anyone who would like an open world survival multiplayer game where you can build fight grind scavenge raid make new friends and more. P.S If you don't feel like grinding there are always modded servers which you can simply just connect to instead of community or offcial servers. More Warnings Include Don't expect to be friends with everyone you meet or for them to be friendly. Rust is a harsh world where anyone even fellow nakeds will try and kill you or destroy your progress to get what is yours but I find that to be all part of the fun and exciting.
title: Rust

review: Rust is a good game in its own right but a few things could be done to make it better. First off ppl still cheat in the servers and the anticheat engine doesn't always catch them. Second there should be a way to host a local game without having to create a server via downloading server files and hosting a server from that. Alot of games you can host a server directly from the game itself. Third would be a single player mode. To play sigle player right now you have to create a server running in the background via the downloaded files. A simple way to play the game with the server built in would be ideal. Still an all around decent game that is still growing.

review: If you love survival games then you must give this game a try. It is still in Alpha so expect some bugs but you're hours will fly by as fast as they do while playing Civilization. Me and a friend play this game together and while I admit it is hard to find your friend right now it is very rewarding once you find each other. Gathering hunting building surviving all of it is much easier with a friend. Especially when it comes to other players trying to slaughter you once they find your camp.Hint Make sure you build sleeping bags ASAP once you and your friend find each other that way you will respawn in your camp instead of somewhere random and spend another 30 mins or more trying to re find your friend. Hopefully they will fix this soon to where you can see your friends in the world. Maybe through a map or a waypoint that only appears on your friends.

review: For an Alpha this is an amazing game. the graphics are not the best but they are not bad ether. the gameplay in my opinion is amazing. Rust at it's core is a survival game. It does have zombies but it is not a dayz clone. Infact zombies are a very smal part of the game. In rust you have to survive. you must worry about hnger level radiation level body temp other animals (wolves and bears right now) the occasional zombie and the most dangerous preditor in the game. Other players. The community while some might think it is horrible is great in my opinion. if you press "T" you can type and everyone on the server can see it. You can get basic questions answered by the community this way. However do NOT run up to people to ask them questions. First that is just annoying and second they will assume you are hostile and kill you. Rust also has a really cool feature for a survival game. when you are in a particular proximaty of other players you can hear them talk (assuming they are holding down the talk button). they can also hear you talk. this can act as a warning system for possible hostile parties. If this was the finished product I would only give this game a 6/10 or a 7/10 because it is a bit buggy but considering it is in Alpha stage and you are still getting the final game when it comes out (not to mention you can give input and make this game into something that you would enjoy more) and the game makers are working on making the game less buggy and adding features I would have to give it a rating of 10/10 for now. Hopefully as it goes through production it will stay amazing.

review: Product received for free. I'm checking this as free because I got it in a bundle and instead of giving money to Garry Newman and his unfortunate lackies I gave the money to charity. Bite me.Let me just preface how much I hate Newman which is quite a lot to be honest not just for the attitude towards his consumers treatment of his staff and ungodly disgusting community he's spawned and harboured on Facepunch wherein a clique of nerds thinks they're top dog by being the only ones able to use 12 year old outdated technology and if you aren't in the mix already you never can be but mostly because his name is the same as that one fellow who wrote "Cars"As much as I loathe Newman and his platform this game unfortunately is pretty decent.Ignore all the t what went on behind the scenes with developers being forced to work in awkward shifts not recieving payments on time and eventually being cut from the project with their content still in it (until of course the "legacy edition" went away)Despite Newman's best attempts Rust is really honestly an almost decent game. Granted it's pretty early but so are a lot of things I've played in my time and they typically don't have the same issues or even as many issues as this game does.Granted again I've mostly been playing on a silent community server with just myself and a couple of my jack off friends stuffing my labia in their faces whenever given the chance glad beyond glad I managed to roll a female character with this asinine pick n mix bag of skin tones and genitalia. She was even white curiously enough.Then as if punishment for my hubris out of said labia claws a wolf. One second there was me some furry with no pants playing a game in which I was also a furry with no pants and then the next there was a wolf.It would proceed to kill me in one hit before I could even swing.This happened four times.I also fell out of the world once but that's actually under par for me playing games so I'm going to add a point for that.Rust is unfortunately "plagued" by raiders as in all endgame content is specifically designed for raiding other players.This means that every public lobby you jump into is going to be a boy's club of people hitting well armed men with stones trying to defend their 14 pieces of corn from the invading marauders that just shot down their door with an anti tank rocket. Now this is the natural progression of things when the only content is guns and magazines anyone is welcome to come and get their issue pick a fight with the nearest naked man you're certain isn't hiding an M249 somewhere on his personage and then repeat ad infinitum.The game doesn't seem to know what it wants to be so really it naturally becomes this as players realize all the guns they just spent eight hours crafting can be easily pointed at another player. I mean like we've got boars and bears running around makes sense you're on some remote island that is eerily familiar of coastal Maine complete with rusted out structures like the world ended either 40 minutes or 40 years ago but then you've got the Super Huey flying in to blast anybody bold enough to wear clothes and a C 130 freely dropping supplies at arbitrary points on the map. Sometimes directly through the map but again that kind of stuff seems to cling to me like a bad smell.There's no real tone to it and the cutesy cartoonish HUD elements really do a good job of working against whatever themes you're looking at more often than not. UPDATEThe game at this point has become overly toxic the terrible overhead at Facepunch seemingly having no idea what to do at this point. Years upon years of being "in alpha" has led to them losing their way with the idea of a survival game with a twist and instead focusing on the 'three day wipe going deep' crowd painting the game almost exclusively as a hardcore PVP experience and making it all feel like a waste of time when some cronies decide to wait literally 10 12 hours online in order to break down your walls once you log off and take whatever menial goods they want only to lose them on the next wipe.It's a game without direction and it really shows.How do you make a game commit 8 10 gigs of memory to completely regenerate a procedural map instead of loading it from file from the server? Who in their right mind would think it wise to do individual asset warmup and precaching over the course of several MINUTES trying to get into the game? Why would it be at all wise to then remove the command to circumvent asset warmup forcing players to sit in a loading screen and risk getting offline raided rather than have a small hit to performance when encountering non precached assets?I wanted to come back to the game I really hoped it had changed and it really looked like it had.Unfortunately the changes were for the worse and I really can't see the game getting any better.
title: Rust

Now you can play it like a crazy KOS player on these mainly crazy servers OR you can find a RP server or PVE server or even a low population server to meet people and enjoy building and surviving but its all how you deal with your first time raging against the people who get all powerful within the first week of wipes. Thes best thing you can do in this case is either join up with them somehow OR make them like you so they leave you alone. Ive played this game on and off since its initial release and Ive had so many fun times but its all how you try and play you have to be smart of your surroundings and even some people. playing weirdly and acting funny is probably the best way of not dying anyway id rate this game8/102 points off for the enraging community but 8 points for the pure fun if you get team members and the moments you will enjoy as a team.

review: Please try not to compare the game to some other finished game or some idealised version you have in your head. Compare the game now to how it was when we entered Early Access. That s the delta that we feel qualifies us to leave Early Access."This is what they say about leaving early access on Feburary 8th.This game was 10 times better when it entered early access than when it left.Entering Alpha The building/raiding system was good.There were zombies actual AI that you had to fight/avoid to live. (As well as the occational bear as is in the game now. Much better than a random chopper that flies around and 1 tank that patrols 1 area). The community wasn't completely toxic. I remember on my first days in rust on multiple servers specific spots would be built in and set up as a public trader where people went to trade blueprints and gear and HELP not SLAUGHTER the naked new players.Exiting Alpha You cant solo You cant get started on a server with more than 25 people online as its like a sport for geared players to kill nakeds. There is hardly any dangerous AI (Other than the chopper or tank which are really just a joke). Traders are now vending machines that are locked in boxes so you dont steal from them and you hope to god you don't see a player when using them.Literally the only thing that has improved in Rust in the last 4 years is the quality of graphics. And even this isn't a free and clear good thing as now half the reviews are about bad performance and optimization issues.Way back when (years ago) i reviewed this game with a thumbs up saying it could be a $60 game. Now i feel like its more of a $5 10 game that you get just to play for a couple days then let it sit in your library. Looking for a game like Rust? Play Ark Arma3 (Exile Mod) or even Unturned.

review: Played best with friends. Developers are invested and adding new content consistently as well as being open about development by posting weekly blogs.The community is generally great and you can sink a lot of time into the game if you want to. Equally there exists playstyles for the casual player and although you won't be able to build a huge base and be able to raid larger groups you can still annoy them by catching them offguard and stealing their stuff.I've found the best way to enjoy this game is to find someone that ticks you off (like someone that killed you when you had nothing) and then make their life hell (through the game).A recent example of this is when I wounded a guy that had shot me previously when I was only gathering resources. I made him watch as I planted explosives on his small base wall and stole his stash of weapons and equipment before running into the night. Nearly every time I play I come away with a good story.

review: World's greatest Caveman Simulator ever! This game has had a rough start but it's shown promise since it's beginning as well. Most videos of this game you see on youtube are most likely from it's legacy release where nights were pitch black and there were zombies. People complained when zombies were removed even though the Devs kept saying "They're only temporary we don't want them but the players need something to fight against in the environment until we can figure something out". Later the zombies were replaced with aggressive (and somewhat dangerous) animals along with the harshness of nature and other players. Yes this game can be brutal to the average naked man weilding a rock.I've kept track of the development road and it's definately improved since the game's original creation. Although I don't play as much as I used to I'm still a fan of it even if there's some servers where murder runs rampant and a naked person could very well be a bandit in disguise as he pulls an automatic weapon out of his naked butt and guns you down for your rock.

review: Short version The game is a solid open world PVP survival game. No doubt about that.You can build a base gather resources with friends and fight off people who try to take resources from you. In a nutshell that's the core of the game.The only drawback I can see is that there have not been many updates in... well a while. I used to run a Rust server many months ago and there haven't been any updates really since then. I realize the devs are indeed working on things which does count towards progress but people should be aware the pace is a little slow with stable build releases at the moment.Would give this game an 7.5/10 how it currently is mostly because the content is limited at the moment and updates have been so limited.Overall I wouldn't recommend it right now until the updates come out. Still it's definitely a worthwhile game.

review: So I know that this isn't some sort of ultra gaming rig but my laptop's an Alienware 14 with a Core i5 4210m 8GB of RAM and a GTX 765M gpu. It's no GTX 980 but most games play very well with tweaks. Between this and a fast internet connetion (150mbps down 20 up) rust has me jittering and lagging fairly bad and before this update took away my FPS counter I was seeing 60fps with everything in potato vision and the moment the textures are turned back into visible surfaces it halved. Why don't you stop adding features for one or two weeks and just optimize the out of the game instead of doing it as a side task. Would I reccomend this to a friend? That's hard to say. It's not horrible right now but this is probably the longest alpha I've seen and it still runs like especially for others with mainstream laptops running Intel HD graphics.

review: Originally I wouldnt have recommended this game back when it was a static map what we now called Legacy. It was buggy laggy highly exploited and hackers everywhere. Having been playing it for well over 700 hours I can confirm that this game has changed since the newest branch that they have been working is now the most played. Finally high FPS great gameplay and they are constantly adding new things to the game and arent even close to being finished. While this game is still Alpha I would personally consider recently gameplace on par with beta games. Sometimes their updates break things but that's a small price to play to have fun. Everything they showcase in the previous update that they are working on they tend to add the following update. Unlike other games they consistantly are updating game on schedule and are adding vehicles soon. If you have played it watch some lives streams to get the feel for the game if you have a few buddies then its worth buying and playing. Just expect to be raided no matter how you build it.

review: Better than Oxygen. Are you easily angered when you die and lose your possessions? Don't buy this game. You will die. Alot. You will lose your stuff. Alot. Go into this magnificent world expecting to get killed by a talking 10 year old or log in and find your base completely destroyed and your precious items you've been collecting all week missing. Do you have heart problems? Don't buy this game. I've almost gone into cardiac arrest multiple times trying to get an airdrop or going to my base with a ton of loot on me. When you get into a little PvP action you are most likely to have your hands shake palms sweat and heart bumping out of your chest.Do you like having a social life? Don't buy this game. Outside? Friends? These are ancient tales I tell to my child of the times before Rust. Before I woke up in the middle of the night just to make sure my base didn't get raided. You will chop trees hit rocks shoot bows and forget about the real world because Rust is your world now.In conclusion probably the most addicting game I've ever played I can sit on my computer for hours on end just running around looking for bases to raid and people to kill or (rarely) befriend. I'd recommend having at least one friend to play it with as solo play can get a bit boring and definitly a lot harder. For $20 it is a steal Facepunch is constantly updating a already huge world and listens to their player base more then any other dev team I know of. Although it is in alpha I would buy this game for $60 easy as I've found more enjoyment in this game then I have in fleshed out AAA titles.BUY THIS GAME.

review: Rust in it's current state is apretty fun game in some aspects but not so much others. The community is surprisingly really good. Hear me out here.For a survival "every man for himself" game a surprising percentage of people are actually really kind. Some people will give all your supplies back after killing the guy who snuck up and killed you while others will tell you they will return your gear jsut so they can kill you again. But the fact that most players are respectful to new players or "friendly" players really means something.Rust is a scary game. I remember one occasion shortly after finishing my first house hearing gunshots in the far distance and immediately packing my things to go find a new location. Just the sound of footsteps make me sprint away weaving in case someone is handy with a bow and arrow.It's an interesting and fun game it requires a lot of time input because it takes awhile on a server to actually get a semi secure house and usually logging off before that is acheived results in losing all your gear.I think in it's current state it isn't worth what it's priced but the developers are constantly coming up with some great new changes and The game will be totally different from what it is now. Definitely worth a try if you've got time on your hands.

review: If your going to buy an Early Access game make it this one! Tons of fun very addictive and very few game breaking bugs or glitches (me and my friends have encountered 1). Don't have to worry about this being DayZ where it will die in Early Access limbo every week they have a develop talking about what they are working on what's coming in the game what's going out possible ideas and concept art they have and sometimes even polls for content or content changes.Play it with a friend if I had a dollar for every moment we busted out laughing or just had a big grin on our face or even yelled over Skype "what just happened that experience was worth the game" then I would have enough money to buy Fallout 4 for all of my friends.What kind of moments could I be talking about? We joined a high population server rich get richer poor get killed. A rebellion started the "Naked Men Rebllion" which was 10 guys in a wood hut. We joined them and one by one convinced them to kill each other until we were top dogs.That's just one of many moments I cherish and think will be a found gaming memory for years to come. TL DR Worth every penny epically if you can play with friends.

review: Rust is an early access survival of the fittest type FPS that grants players the ability to build houses kill other players (There are PvP disabled servers for more casual players) create an arsenal and strive to forge alliances in order to survive the harsh apocolyptic wasteland given to them. Rust fits well in with tradtitional survival games by pressing basic needs into gaming by forcing players to hunt animals for food gather wood for a shelter and even use bandages when damaged by the unforgiving aspects of the wild. Pros Great Multiplayer game (Singleplayer doesn't exist but still a great MP game nonetheless) Strong survival aspects provide constant awareness ChallengingCons VERY hard to find any source of metal to build guns Due to lack of resources the experienced players can bully and ruin the experience for newer players Requires a HUGE amount of FPS unless you disable grass (Grass isn't needed though) The final verdict Rust is a fun multiplayer game that has challenging aspects to it. However it may be too challenging for those unwilling to spend hours trying to find the only metal ore on the map or those being bullied by stronger players. While it doesn't set any landmark strengths in the survival/FPS genre it's still worth the $20. Plus it's in early access so it has room to improve drastically.Rating Gameplay 8/10Graphics 7/10Creativity 9/10Quality 8/10 OVERALL RATING 8/10

review: There's been a large boom in recent entertainment for survival. Forgive the game's basic appearance for it's nature is quite remarkable. This is a game entirely driven on the nature of man in the wild. You start in the middle of the woods cold and naked with nothing more than a rock. Find some wood make a hatchet make a sleeping bag and then make a house to put it in. Make you home however you like. Though basic it is yours by the sweat of your brow. One day someone will try to come and take your stuff so find a community to team up and protect each other. Soon enough you'll have a town working together to further the general interest of a group that was comprised of Ex naked men from the woods.Buy it. While a raw game there is a ton of potential. This is by Garry of Garry's mod.

review: tl dr PvP is a crazy adrenaline rush. Raiding Is like a puzzle... or can be blow in shoot till nothing moves. Getting gunned down by a 20 man clan while you are just a naked with a bow can be annoying. No onther game does survival better than Rust.In Depth ReviewThere isn't much else that can give you a crazy rush like killing a geared guy with a waterpipe taking his ak and gunning down his crew. Rust I feel is one of the best games out there that has only player to player interaction. You get crazy stories to tell your friends from just one or two play sessions. "I woke to a band of naked men beating on my roof with pickaxes" like that. There isn't a game out there that does survival better than Rust. Spawn with nothing hunt animals gather build hunt people destroy raid. The beginning will be grindy but that just makes it all the better when you someone up. You know they went through hours of farming to get that gear. and now its yours in a 20 120 second period all of that dudes hard work gone because of you. The amount of emotional impact this game allows you to have on other people's feelings is crazy. You have the power to crush someone they could put tons of work in but you kill them in one pvp instance and now you have all that loot. When you buy this your first couple of play sessions are going to be not the funniest thing in the world. you are gunna get ed a lot. You will learn over time. Just keep waking up on that beach. Now that that is out of the way I am going to talk about a few things 1PVP 2RAIDS 3CLANSPVP Holy this is the best ing thing on god's green earth. Imagine this wipe day everyone is a caveman 300 people on the server all scrambling to get set up. you have the resources to set up a base you are just wandering around looking for a good spot. You are armed with a bow and a spear primitive tools. As you are looking to set up you get shot in the back by a crossy. All those hours of farming is on the line. You must win the instance of PVP or it's all gone not only will you lose all of that time and loot. You will make this feel like a god. He will be so happy to get your full inv of loot. I don't know about anyone else but the adrenaline is crazy at these times Like i can feel my heart pumping through my whole body.RAIDS Figuring out the best place to blow into is pretty fun it's like a puzzle. Also it's pretty fun to blow a hole in the side of some sad s house run in with you alone or with your crew. Guns blazing. shooting anything that slightly resembles a human's figure. Rockets C4 Flamethrower there's a lot of ways to go about rading all of them are pretty fun.CLANS This can be a problem for most players. I think its fine to join up with your friends and play some rust that's what the game is best at. but i think when you start adding people just to up your numbers is a bit y like 20 people clans. Its no fun to be zerged and it will happen a lot so just be prepared to be minding your own business when 7 dudes gun you down.

review: Rust is not for everyone and I can't even decide if I love it or hate it and let me elaborate on this (my experience is from modded servers).First of Rust is an open world survival game where you spawn in a beach with a rock and a torch and you try to survive by collecting resources and building a base. That's almost the basic principle of all the survival genre. But Rust is somewhat different as it emphasizes more on the PVP element. When you log out your player stays in the game "sleeping".As other have said you will spend a lot of hours building a base and collecting resources (the multiplier of gathering is different for each server). You start building a base with the concept of making it raidproof putting traps reinforcing the walls and all of that. Then you start crafting weapons and trying to find loot and recipes to create them on your own. After investing a lot of hours completing all of these tasks you log out to continue the next day but this is where things get more complicated. No base is safe. Griefers or rather raiders as these are 2 different things might come and steal all your precious items that you gathered. Sure you can always hide your stuff etc but the state of your base after a raid can be a little discouraging.This is what I think makes a lot of people discouraged to continue after a couple of raids. the basic principle of the game is "Nothing is safe". But I also think this is what makes the game special. Considering things like wipes and raids you will do all these things again and again but in the end it won't matter. If you have a friend expect to have a great time exploring and interacting with others (even though you will most likely find hostiles rather than friendlies).If you are not prepared to lose all of your progress in a couple of hours then this game is not for you but to others I am sure you will have a good time playing the game.
title: Rust

review: Out of all the mulitplayer based survival games I've played on Steam this is by far the most engrossing one I've come across. While it's obvious it's still in Early Access it has enough content and polish that it's at least playable which is more than I can say for a lot of games of this genre. It's got issues but the creators at least apperar to be trying to hammer out all the kinks and continuing to update the players at a completely reasonable rate. I've already got some good stories to tell from playing with my friends on here and I look forward to having more as the game continues to improve.

review: Rust is NOT your typical survival game. Unlike your standard survival game people are the enemy here and this is essentially a purely multiplayer game (you can play solo but it'd be no challenge and devoid of any sense of worry and life). As you are no doubt aware people exist that are awful and terrible. These s will bring themselves to griefing you and destroying all your hard work followed by a teabag and a "Wow you suck" despite having a stone hatchet in an open field against two 12 year olds with assault rifles and metal armor.This game will destroy your very soul more than any other I have seen and is one of the most beginner unfriendly games that there is. There are servers that have fully knit communities and welcome beginners but I'd actually recommend not playing on those and instead ing around on your own or with friends and failing epicly and hating your life in the process. Having your base stolen by a psychopath doorcamper with a pickaxe not only depressed me though. I learned. And that's where the beauty of this game lies learning and improving. This game has some really good gunplay to it and if you're not accustomed to FPS games like myself you will suck some hardcore monkey and never even get to realizing this for your first few dozen hours. Not to mention you're gonna suck in other ways building maneuvering and general tactics. This game was NOT designed for you to have a good time and I'm still with almost 300 hours played dumfounded at the skill some people have.The game is also ing phenomenal to play with 1+ other people and is a great addictive time killer with some friends.In my attempt to give an accurate review I would recommend this if you love difficulty think you have the ability or the ability to GAIN the ability to mentally move on after losing hours on hours of work. If you like typical PVE survival games this game may not be for you as it is mainly focused on pvp and is vastly different from standard survival games. However it'd definitely be worth a try on sale. If you're not as experienced with FPS games or difficult games but STILL want to learn and improve try bringing a friend to make things a little more fun cause the early hours will likely suck some

review: Rust is a survival game that heavily centres around base building raiding of said bases looting and guns. Being a early access game and still in alpha (they remade the whole game so this stage has been prolonged) many people have avoided it. Honestly this is the best early access game out there. The dev team is amazing and provide frequent updates (no they have not given up on it and don't seem like they will). It has a healthy player base with new people joining all the time. The survival aspects are there. You start off naked with only a torch and a rock and you have to move your way up by creating new and better tools and weapons. You face dangers such as the wildlife a patrol helicopter and most importantly other players. In order to make new items you need to gather wood stone metal and sulphur from the enviroment. 'Monuments' and 'rad towns' provide land marks on the map and can be explored in order to find loot such as weapons tools and blue prints. Each item requires a blue print in order to craft (you have many 'default' blueprints right from the start) the more advanced the item the harder it is to craft and the harder it is to get the blue print.Rust uses a modular building system that allows players to build whatever their heart's desire. Want to build a shack with one room? You can. Want to build a massive compound with towers and a castle? You can if you put the effort into it. Be aware that people can make explosives in order to raid you. To try and mitigate against this make sure to design your home well. Try and make peace not war with your neighbours unless you want to make it a race to get C4 and blow down the other's base. Don't worry if you can get raided. It happens to everyone and not just once. Try and rebuild in a new area make new friends and new enemies. Explore the amazing open world.Rust currently updates biweekly compared to the weekly updates it used to have and each update is either filled with amazing content to keep the game fresh or backend developer stuff to hasten the introduction of new content and provide much needed improvements. The dev team seems to get a lot of crap for not catering to everyone's needs and by being a normal person you would understand that just isn't possible. I feel this has been caused by the dev team being so good many people have become spoilt brats. I guess that's a good thing. In my opinion this is the best dev team as they work hard and infact do listen to the community. You won't be seeing any DayZ style yearly updates (I still love you DayZ!).One warning is that Rust takes up a lot of time. Yes you can jump on and play whenever (you might want to play on modded servers which speed up the process of resource collecting. Each modded server has their own set of features) but to get the most enjoyment out of it having a weekend/week with little on is the best way to play. For $20 or the current sale price of $13.39 this game is a no brainer.

review: First and foremost this is a review from someone that really didn't put much time into this game (as I asked for a refund on the first day of playing it) please do take this in consideration when reading this.So this is how it went After buying and downloading the game I entered a random server a pretty well populated one (I believe it was London 1 or soemthing like that) and after some loading managed to appear in a beach sleeping. Wild "Fps issues" appeared! So I turn everything on minimal (so that you know my Pc is a capable enough machine running Gta V on almost max setting without any issues) which doesn't help I get killed a couple of times before even managing to get up. I log out change setting again enter a empty server to test it still problems I try to change it from there which causes a game crash okay no problem it's unity I get it no biggie I'm sure I'll find a solution on the internet later. But on the meantime a resolution change seems to fix my problem. Cool time to play. I enter a less populated server (55 people the least populated official one at that time). I start collecting wood A guy kills me with a rock didn't say a thing just killed me for no apparent reason. Ok I try again I found a naked guy on the beach and try to approach him. Nope rock to the face manage to run away to get killed by a guy with a bow. Ok nice. Then got shot and finally got stabbed with a spear.I died uttering with my last breath "CONGRATS M8 YOU GOT A ROCK".So is this game nice? Sure I guess if you have enough people to play with and don't mind having to deal with players that instead of trying to survive together and kill better equipped players for their loot kill every fu***ng one that they see just because.So yeah this might be an issue solved with the magical words "git gud" but as far as I'm concerned I'm outta here.Pd If the community ever gets better I'm gladly coming back it's a truly unique game with enormous potential and which I regret having to run away from due to the experience I had on it. Pd2 If there was an intermediate term between recommending it and not I'd likely click that button but and this is just my opinion which I don't intend to force on anyone I don't recommend this game as per right now.

review: Rust is one of those games where once you start playing time ceases to exist. A few weeks later you'll finally rip your eyes from your monitor glance at the 258 missed called on your phone and 482 texts take a and bask in the glory of your armored fortress your fancy collection of human skulls and your large wooden box filled with c4.The idea behind this game is simple survive and by survive they mean by any means necessary. Chopping wood smelting ore refining crude hunting animals building shelters crafting weapons ammo tools clothing collecting blueprints and avoiding that damn copter. Make allies and enemies form crews or play solo. The possibilities in Rust are endless.Your game play experience will highly rely on the server you join. Recommend server hopping until you find the right one for you. Game play has greatly improved with devs adding new things/fixing bugs with every patch. Out of all the survival multiplayer games out there this is definitely one not to miss and I'd say one of the top if not the best.

review: For those who have played ARK the style of gameplay is very similar.Collect items from the world around you build tools to colelct from new sources/more efficiently and don't let the vicious animals see you or they will eat your face. In Rust however there is no character creation. You all spawn as a big naked dude. Thank goodness for the pixelation or else I would have had a LOT of explaining to do to my mother.It is quite difficult to figure out what you are doing in this game especially on a server. I reccomend either finding an empty server or starting one in order to get used to what is going on. Early game it's easiest to hang around the towns where you can readily find blueprints water food and items.Right click is usually "throw" avoid clicking this unless you want to fling your items into the bushes to be lost forever.As far as finding your friends navigating the map is rather hard. My suggestion would be to either find a rad town and follow the road/powerlines until you locate one another or to have one person set up a quick base with a sleeping bag for the other person to spawn in.Starting as a new player on a server with established clans isn't going to work. You are going to be killed repeatedly it's going to be frustrating and you're never going to get to actually play the game. PVE servers are great for learning and the people there are usually very willing to help you along just pay attention to the rules.Helicopters are evil. If you hear a helicopter RUN. You cannot win againt this thing without some serious firepower. Hide somewhere with a decent roof and away from open windows/doors.Watch the sound levels especially when first logging on. If you think the footsteps are loud? Wait till someone sets off a shotgun near your head. I about jumped out of my skin.There are a few serious glitches in the game but nothing that absolutely breaks it. Be warned bear traps do NOT in fact work on bears. Doors can be glitched through under the right circumstances and occasionally the naked people who logged off will float above the ground for no apparent reason.Overall this is a fun game but seems to be one where you can upgrade everything to a point and then have nothing left to do. This is solved on PVP servers by having others around to attack/be attacked by however it leaves little to do for those on less populated or PVE servers. Hopefully there will be more updates for the game as I am greatly enjoying it so far and hope to continue.

review: I had played this for a while when it was first gaining popularity and I must say it has truly come a long ways.Gradually the game was getting more polished and the devs really listened a lot. They were also stiff when they needed to be.I like the path this game is taking. Graphics are pretty good but rendering problems will crop up once in a while on lower strength machines.The gameplay is fun but somewhat unforgiving. You also need to find a server that is just right for you. As far as combat goes I love it. There is truly many ways to go about fighting. While on the other hand there is crafting and resource gathering.It can be tedious but when you have a full set of gear and a cozy little base it truly is rewarding. This is a game that lives on the players interacting so be ready for plenty of that.Generally this is a great game and I hope it keeps going strong. I recommend this highly for people who enjoy multiplayer combat.

review: Разработчики конешно молодцы пытаются оптимизировать эту игру с сделать как можно больше реалистичной я наиграл в этой игре уже 1500 часов и я понел что я многое не знал как можно провести время.Играя вместе с друзьями это очень круто так же хочу отметить да же на довольно слабых пк можно оптимизировать раст и сделать что бы не лагало разработчики долгое время убили что бы поднять FPs в этой игре что бы как можно играли в эту игру.Как по мне эта игра супер но не хватет нормальных сервером что бы игра стала еще рудше.Плюс в этой игре в том что добавили канешно компонеты.А минус это что многие игроки считают что эта игра не оптимизирована.Ну а так по мне эта игра Хорошая РАЗРАБЫ если вы считаете этот комент класс.Характеристики моего пкПроцессор Intel Core i7 6700K Материнская плата MSI H170A GAMING PRO Видеокарта MSI GeForce GTX 1070 FOUNDERS EDITION Оперативная память Kingston HyperX FURY HX424C15FBK2/32 32 Гб Блок питания Cougar PowerX 700W PowerX700 Система охлаждения Thermaltake Pacific RL120 6 Тб Жесткий диск Toshiba X300 HDWE160UZSVA 480 Гб SSD накопитель Kingston HyperX SAVAGE SHSS37A/480G Корпус AeroCool XPredator черный Так как у меня хороший пк я не жалуюсь на то что что то логает все прекрасно

review: TL DR It's a great game awe inspiringly terrible community wonderful outlet for sick power fantasies.Rust is a mixed bag of a game and wether or not I recommend it is the hardest review decisions I've made. (after playing it some more It isn't as hard as I first thought. more on that later) The gameplay is simple and not bad at all the game flows nicely and makes sense and it looks good too. Resources are usually pretty self explanatory to gain or they flat out tell you how to make them. The base building aspect is well balanced and executed the resources are spread out competently what you and your characters learn is carried over from server to server and charactyer to character (ex. a new player may not know how to make an AR but someone who's 15th out of 83rd character saw it can) the backstory is mysterious and in the background without being nonexistent and overall the game is quite compitent. This leaves one question left. Why am I relatively turned off from this game? Well let me answer my own question with another question have you ever played public Payday 2? Without anyone you knew just random scrubs who own the server that you're on? If so this game will feel like a return to the olden days. That's not a good thing. Raiders pillagers creeps and noob abuse is not only common it's something you plan for and still fall beneat hthe mighty tread of. The way to start a solo game or even a game with one or two friends is to take your rocks and run for the hills off of spawn beach to build the beginnings of a base hidden from the prying eyes of nude greifers. The "nakeds" act like savages the people with guns imitate natural disasters on player populations and being in between the two phases just means that you get targeted by both. I have fond memories of paying someone for killing one of my earlier nude pursuers only for the guy to break into my house and kill me twice. Yes you Ex0. You suck. Later I met a man of similar tastes and tried to start a clan with him. The server died we moved on built a new home learned technologies had a nooby base of loyal soldiers and then got ravagted by the server's equivalent of Donald Trump. The reason for this was that we'd killed their newest emmber after he was caught sneaking up on our base and they sent ROCKETS after us while we had what we'd found on the dead guy and basic handguns for protection. We died got killed again by a different group at the second base then I gave up this pile of forever. Here's the deal should you decide that you want to check the game out further ask yourself if you can alternate between murderous paranoia and phsycotic rampages. If so Rust is the game for you. Otherwise you better be able to do one of those things really well.

review: Written by AndreasMy first day on the island did not go well. Waking after some unknown calamity it was only a few minutes before I stumbled upon a man made structure and encountered its owner working diligently to expand and improve his home. He was somewhat less pleased to see me however than I was to meet him. "Leave or I kill " he said four short words I failed to take sufficiently seriously and a few seconds later he hit me in the face with a hatchet and then again and I was dead. That's life and death in Rust an open world survival game that falls somewhere between DayZ and Minecraft and has a way of bringing out both the best and the worst in its players.A babe in the woodsRust's only goal is to survive and it's always challenging. You begin with nothing but a rock a torch and a couple of bandages and if you try to spend more than two nights out in the open in that condition you will die. It's an intimidating sink or swim introduction to the game but Rust isn't a forgiving experience. Most of the game world will do its best to kill you and while epic multiplayer battles are rare ambush murders are not. Nor are you particularly durable unlike conventional videogame characters and if somebody puts a few bullets in you you will die. Yet that fragility coupled with the near absolute freedom offered by an open world no rules arena is exactly what makes it work. "Go forth and do whatever the hell you want" is exhilarating.There's a primal thrill to running through the jungle like some latter day Tarzan but if you're serious about staying alive then sooner or later you'll want to build some form of shelter. Construction options are quite limited so you won't be erecting any great architectural masterpieces but having a relatively safe place to crash and store your stuff can extend your lifespan dramatically. Crafting is an even more important component of the game and while it's likewise neither particularly interesting nor flexible at this early stage of development better equipment is the key to survival. The transition from prey to predator can be tedious but once you're packing heat (and pants) the real fun begins.The conventional fauna is bad enough but there are also deadly zombies and radioactive hotspots that give the game a faint whiff of S.T.A.L.K.E.R. Worst of all are your fellow players who ensure that no matter how powerful you are you're never entirely free of danger. At one point well armed and equipped after several hours I was hunting zombies near some radioactive fuel tanks. Quick double taps from my MP5 dispatched them and I was starting to feel like a real badass which is probably why I wasn't paying as much attention to my surroundings as I should have been while my attention was occupied by the inventory of my latest undead victim a pair of bandits snuck up from behind and creamed me with a shotgun.That's not to say that everyone you meet is a paranoid kill or be killed social Darwinist and in fact there's a considerable degree of cooperation to be found in some locales. But it comes cautiously while vicious violent death lurks everywhere. There are non PvP servers for those who prefer less capriciously lethal entertainment but while that cuts down on griefers it also does away with one of the most undeniably exciting parts of the game Random encounters with other human beings in which anything can happen. As frustrating as it is to be blown away without warning that pervasive uncertainty is a central part of the survival experience and Rust is vastly diminished without it.It's not too soonThe Rust alpha test is available via Steam Early Access and as you'd expect it's very much a work in progress. The graphics are no great shakes and you can expect wonky shadows occasional clipping errors and other glitches and the sound effects don't even pretend to venture beyond minimal. Lag is sometimes a challenge especially when you find yourself caught up in a spot of unpleasantness with your fellow island inhabitants and simply finding someplace to play can be a hassle Official servers tend to be crowded while unofficial ones can be unreliable. Server wipes happen with major updates so it's best not to get too attached to your stuff and there are plenty of gameplay oddities for instance every animal you kill from boars to bears provides "chicken breasts" for food. (I haven't found any chickens in the game.)Rust's alpha is rough but it's surprisingly playable. The underlying systems are essentially complete and functional (or at least appear to be from an outside looking in perspective) and recent updates have dramatically improved the performance of the server browser. Rust has a ton of potential and it's an intense and impressive experience even now.Price $20Release date Out now via Steam Early AccessDeveloper Facepunch StudiosMultiplayer Server dependent typically 128Link http //www.playrust.com/Play it on Dual core CPU 8GB RAM DirectX 9.0c video cardAlternatively DayZ

review: What a frustratingly disappointing game. The premise is great execution is solid enough but the PvP focus just ruins it. If you are looking for something casual and fun to play where you won't feel like you need to pour all your free time into it turn back now and find another game. The sad part is it isn't the developer's fault. Facepunch did a great job. The game works exactly as advertised. It's the community that makes the game rotten.TL DR version Game itself is a solid 6/10 but the community is a 1/10.Pros Nice graphics areas are beautiful and structures look nice Runs well no crashes or errors so far Decent building system Fun to explore as some areas give off a very creepy vibe. Neutral Grindy. Could be a pro or a con depending on your outlook. Mods can be used to make it less grindy. If you find it relaxing to go farming materials in Minecraft Ark etc. you'll enjoy this part too.Cons Lack of a true single player experience. You cannot load up a local only single player game where you are in control of what mods are used. The only way to do this is if you rent a server host at an additional cost and time setting up. If you're not interested in that you'll just have to hope you find an empty server that has mods you like and a bearable connection. The existence of other players. You will always be shot and killed on sight even if you're a brand new player totally naked with nothing but your rock and torch minding your own business. The meager belongings you have on you and the pathetic twig shack you'll cobble together after a few minutes won't be worth the gunpowder used to make those bullets but no lifer PvPers will still spray their AKs at you. On high population servers you will have no room to build and nowhere to hide. Constant wipes. Every server is constantly wiped of all content most on a weekly basis others more or less frequent. This means that whatever progress you've made you will lose. Your base your gear your collected materials gone. Even if you did manage to make a foothold for yourself somehow it will be gone soon anyways.

I did as told and started building. Sooner or later my base was done and made out of stone and I happened to get someone to join my crew. This was the peak of my time on that server as we where bullying people left and right the tower was now fully metal and the loot was endless. We had so much loot we built a seperate building for it but then got raided for the first time (They didnt take much and never came back). Then the wipe happened once more and I waited to play once again.I was solo again and I had a pair of pants then I got shot and they took my pants.Over all I give this game a 10/10 not for the mechanics but for the people I played with
