title: Rust

review: Rust is a very good game. The developers are extremely hard working and release a status update every week showing the amount of progress they have made. It's clear that the developers spend a lot of time creating concepts and models for the game as we constantly see detailed art for unimplemented mechanics such as the Caretaker and cars. However Facepunch doesn't always make the best decision for their game and this results in a lot of backlash against their efforts. Recently the developers released an XP system which was in development for several months and the community hasn't received it so well. Rust essentially shifted genre from a survival PVP game to a survival MMO. What's wrong with the XP system? Previously the method of progression was a system involving blueprints. You could go to radtowns for hours smashing barrels hoping to find the blueprint for an AK or high external wall but come back with nothing of use. Where the blueprint system shined was the research table. With the research table if one owned the item they wanted to be able to craft they could research the item (in its best condition) for a 30% chance of receiving the blueprint for that item which can be traded or learned. This chance could be increased by consuming an amount of blueprint fragments farmed from radtowns. This system was PERFECT. If you weren't good at pvp you could farm at radtowns for hours looking for the blueprint you want or you could trade for it. Someone who was good at pvp could roam around killing people with better gear and bring the gear back to their base and research it essentially skipping the radtown grind. With the introduction of the XP system the research table was trashed essentially FORCING YOU TO GRIND. You get XP by hitting rocks and trees picking up rocks/wood/hemp opening barrels/crates/trash piles killing animals sharing tools fishing and crafting things for the first time. Gone is the excitement of roaming with a crossbow and wood armor and hoping that you happen upon the stereotypical spray and pray large clan member who will get you that high level blueprint. You can have the item in your hands and not even know how to craft it. I have lost the excitement of killing geared people because there's no reward.No one goes to radtowns anymore even though they are the best source of XP. You have to hit rocks for days to get max level or else you will be behind everyone who has floors full of sulfur from hitting rocks. Once someone reaches c4 level they basically have hundreds of loot pinatas scattered around the map to choose from because anyone who is a decently high level will have chests full of stone and sulfur. The XP system was implemented extremely prematurely as there are no dynamic ways to level up. All of the ways you level up involve repetitive left clicking/pressing e except hunting. It's too bad the animal AI is horrendous as you can defeat a bear with a wooden spear by building a twig foundation and standing on top of it. The only way Facepunch can save this game that is quickly hurtling downhill (concurrent players went from 60k to 35k after the XP update) is by reintroducing the research table.I'm still going to recommend this game because the XP system will probably be fixed in a year and once that happens Rust will once again become my go to game. However the grindy nature of the XP system discourages casual play and causes the people who can hold left click the longest to become the kings of the server no matter how unskilled they are. Buy this game and wait until they fix the XP system to play it. It's not worth playing right now.Edit Can no longer recommend. Seems like XP system isnt getting changed which is a shame because the previous system was perfect. I can't see any players except veterans enjoying the game anymore you are forced to grind for hours to advance through the tech tree. Wow the latest update has totally changed my mind. The component system brings back the nostalgic feeling of hopping servers and making an early play to skip progression. Facepunch has finally nailed the legacy feeling and it's amazing.
title: Rust

review: 9.5/10*Crude language ahead and spelling mistakes.I've waited a long time to make a review on this game so I'll be as honest and heartfelt as I can Pros This game has given me more individual memories between my friends and I than any other game the sheer potential of a game that relies completely on player interaction in such an intimately violent medium is vast. Rust essentially gives you all the tools you ever need to be a bad person and a player's value is determined by his refusal to become this bad person or his ability to trancend into a next level of hatred who ambushes strangers plotting day and night for no end except that his target will suffer. The essential effort of Rust is to be so ruthlessly and creatively a degenerate that your opponents will stop playing Rust. When I started this game naked in the woods with a rock I admired a game with no tutorial only wonder of what my ability was. Thats the great part you never know the end of your ability. It was not long after I learned to craft my first spear that the power got to me thus beginning my two year spiral into hateful despise of all my fellow man. Soon I was sticking up the non opportuned with crude weapons just to hear how upset they were looking at how to backhandedly kill every person that stumbled my way in the desert and wood. I built an empire from the cracked skulls of the countless hordes that fell before me each one more butthurt than the last. But as Rust evolved so did it's community it's idea. Soon there were bigger fish. The previous sessions of my pals and I cutting down the poor were rustled apart by a new age of war where armored men with assault rifles ruled the land and my tactical prowess could not compensate for their brute force and firepower. I became a scavenger poking about the rusted shell of my former empire to hopefully slaughter the weak and destitute that fell in the wake of those stronger scrapping by and hiding from vicious people who walked the Earth. Like Rust I eventually evolved. The same massive encampments that had harmed me and kept me in hiding would unkowingly make me a force to be reckoned with. With large numbered forces ruling the game I was forced into a life of guerrilla warfare and everything changed the weak were now quick to bond with each other and the powerfull had become content. In no time I could band together a group of fighters with bows and arrows and a lot of hate attacking in the dark and from multiple directions abusing spawnpoints throwing desperate bodies at the enemy. Blood laden assault rifles clattered to the ground under the weight of a thousand naked bodies before the poor began to replicate the enemies stolen goods. All of the goodness had been stolen from my people and only hatred filled demons walked the Earth. We killed all in sight and ushered in an age of crippling violent paranoia the likes of which have never been seen. The world has been weakened now made even and the line between success and extermination has become forever blurred by inconsistent chaotic violence. I walk Rust now 390 hours into hell and remember every moment that I cant turn back from here. The game is very aesthetically pleasing with good lighting effects and attention to small animation details and events. Progress in game developement has been consistently effortful and players have been kept up to speed by developers Game has given me two years of enjoyable play with various friends without ever becoming too stale. Every player has lost their mind and will listen to outlandish ideas if you just role play them. Map design does a great job at forcing players to compete for resources instand proximity chat communication makes for good player interaction and seemless transition from talking to panicked shooting. The volatile nature of the combat system makes it possible for someone with 1 hour of gameplay to best someone with 400 making the game always keep you on your toes.Cons Character model is not customizable. Armor and clothes make character identification and uniforming relatively easy but I would be able to mentally invest more of myself into make character if I could build him/her from scratch. Although the Somalian pirate like nature of my code generated character and his abnormally large genitals have lead to some funny interactions I just love a game more when I can make my identity. The frequency of server wiping updates can demotivate players against large projects but the game is in Alpha and that is completely understood. Notes The game is very difficult to progress through on your own this game has been great for me being in the military because people are forced into situations where I have hours to explain my Rust eploits and win them over to it. But if you are less of a social gamer try to team up with people in game using proximity chat and work with low level people first. Starting the game working with powerful people will hurt your skills in the long run Rust is all about journey rather than destination. I wish the best of luck to anyone who plays this. It's been the source of many "HELL ING YEAHS!!!" and "GOD DAMMMMIIITS!!!" for me and I hope it can give you as much of a ride. Also there are a lot of over experienced players in Rust where my 400 hours seems like small potatos compared to a lot of players.Pro tip The Eoka Pistol can fire shotgun shells. Be wary.
title: Rust

review: Loved it at first now its one of the worst gameplay experiences ever.Learn this one thing and you will understand Rust 95% of the time a typical game experience is this 1. Spend a lot of time fervently scavanging enough resources to survive mother nature.2. At any given point in the process of trying to survive you WILL encounter a roving OP troll player or gang3. Get harassed and robbed while just trying to make it out alive.4. Inevitable get murdered by said OP trolls5. repeat steps 1 46. Realise the definfition of insanity is doing the same thing expecting a diffrent result7. Quit RustI will say it is in very rare occasions possible to break this cycle if you and a couple of friends join a freshly wiped server with a half decent admin. Only in this VERY rare enviroment do the chances of you having a somewhat enjoyable gameplay experience rise to at least an acceptable level. Most players than who reach this level then troll others to secure their continued prosperity thus prepatuating the cycle.In short troll or be trolled.I implore you don't waste your time or your money with this game. Has good graphics and good technical mechanics..... but thats about it.

review: This game is still in alpha so it's still got a long way to go Even still it's looking really good so far. Manage your hunger survive the cold nights build your home/base gather resources craft equipment join with players or defend yourself against them everything you'd expect from a multiplayer sandbox game. This game is especially fun with friends. However in its current state I'd still avoid recommending it because of how ridiculously easy it is to hack/exploit. My friends and I worked hard to build ourselves a heavily defended structure. It took us days to set up. During the set up we put up with multiple attacks griefers bandits 24/7 players etc. But in the end even with all of the resources and planning we put into our structure and all the crap we put up with it was all for nothing. Why? Because two s decided to hack/eploit. That's probably the biggest problem with the game. Even with everything looking great for an alpha all the effort you put into this game will all be for nothing because of a couple bored s decide to literally walk right into your base 'for the lulz' or some other like that and steal everything you've got.Besides the jackasses in the community the game is off to a great start. I'd recommend it once they at least fix this glaring issue. There are some other issues that need to be worked on specifically balancing issues removal of some items which (IMO) either shouldn't be there at all or should be made difficult find or craft. But those will be addressed over time (hopefully) If you don't mind knowing that everything you worked for could be taken away easily give the game a try. Until the exploits are fixed (at least so that it's not so easy to do it) I don't think i'll be wasting my time on this for now.UPDATEChanged to recommended now that hacking has been reduced slightly. Still not perfect but at least they're on the way to fixing the issues up.
title: Rust

review: Rust as many of you know is a full survival game. The survival aspect of this game is pretty spot on. Where as most survival games you need to work hard to get enough food to survive but you also have to do it with caution as the wild life in this game can be pretty ferocious. A boar is just as dangerous as a wolf or bear. There are many servers with plenty of players. The are a fair amount of cheaters but not as bad as in early Rust. Since the game doesn't have a PvE setting you have to kill or be killed and you will most likely not get shown pity or any remorse for trying to be friendly. There are some servers that are PvE and the owners will punish you for killing players. A good one is Plague's PvE. Plague (the owner) is pretty cool and has a good community and the people are nice. Rust has a dynamic survival feature that many games I've seen/played don't have. It has caves that can go on for ages fish traps copying the genes of plants to grow your farms production and the everyday struggle of getting food water ores wood and variety of other items you'll need to survive Rust. Their are plenty of weaponry ranging from spears to bows to guns even to a flame thrower (who doesn't love using a flame thrower on that bear at your door P). Get your group of friends get your trusy rock and go play Rust
title: Rust

I have many fond memories of teaming up with strangers to have a great experience.You will die.... many times. You will be raided (also many times) but you will also get out of the game what you want to get out.I highly recommend this game to anyone.

review: Great game to play solo or with friends. Gather resources and buid a base. Go out farming for blueprints to learn how to build new items/building blocks. Team up with others and raid other player bases to get lots of resources quickly. You can tell the game is Alpha and Early Access but the developers are VERY active and always releasing updates and keeping their player base in the loop. YES there is hunger/thirst but it is NOT like most games where it's a giant pain. In this game it's very easy to manage you don't take five steps and need to eat you eat once every few hours (RT). PRO'sFun survival gameDeath isn't permenant put down a sleeping bag to respawn at the sleeping bag (otherwise it's random)Building is simple yet requires a strategyGood animationsGraphics are nice or Alpha (you can tell what's a placeholder and what's finished)Maps are large but not too largeSandbox gameSurvival gameCON'sSome things don't have textures (But it's ALPHA so it's not a huge deal)Lots of players will kill you on sightIf you don't like MMO survival games this isn't the game for youThis is the only game I will leave a review for.
title: Rust

review: Yes I do recommend the game. Unfortunately though it has the most toxic community you will ever encounter online. Definitely try a few servers to weed out the bad ones as there are SOME servers which have fair play rules. Dont for a second think you are safe just because you joined a server and are naked with just a rock and nothing for anyone to steal from you because 90% of the people who play this game are people who dont pick on people their own size so to speak (meaning players who at least have some sort of weapon or armour). The fact that you just joined a server and have nothing and the next person who has been there for a week or two has an ak heavy armour and tons of bullets and resources in a very high security base means nothing to them. A normal person would leave you alone to start the game allowing you to get to a point where you would represent a challenge to them but they dont want a challenge. They will shoot you on the spot call you a noob regardless of your thousand hours on record and to them thats "winning". In other words dont hate on this game as much as you probably would within the first month of playing. Try a few servers get killed a million times by idiots as described above eventually find a server that has players who actually treat the game as it was meant to be played and not as a pvp haven and profit.I give the game a 35/47

review: Rust is an open world PvP sandbox in which you must survive. Build your base hunt animals scavenge ruins for loot and live to see another dawn. Think Minecraft crossed with Day Z.The idea and for the most part execution is brilliant. Considering this is in alpha it looks stunning and the crafting system is intuitive enough and will at least tell you what you need to make something. I spent hours crafting walls forging my weapon and ammo to survive in this unforgiving land. The community was helpful and we thrived made fun of each other and traded. It was a great time.Then one day I was running home and a bloke shot me with five of his mates. All my loot gone for no reason. I respawned in my house neaby only to have the wall blown off and bed murdered yet again my sleeping bag destroyed and my spawn point lost. This is what will make Rust fail the overly toxic community. Fine steal my stuff. I get PvP it's a survival game and no one is safe. But destroying the sleeping bag is deliberately being a prick for the sake of it. It's actions like this and people who don't want to go to a PvE server and fight against the bandit players (because your stuff can still be blown up in a PvE environment) that will fracture the playerbase in to the Lord Of The Flies 'kill anyone you can see' attitude. The idea of game is that you can progress. With relatively little effort prospective months of progress can be lost when you're not even online and the hours will count for nothing. This is the one major flaw with Rust.The rest however is fantastic. Get on a PvE no sleeper server and log off with all your valuables on you and fall in love with a beautiful survival game that will suck away your weekend.
title: Rust

review: Almost but not quite for me anyway. I will stick with it though and see how it develops over time.I purchased DayZ and 7 Days to Die (7DTD) as well as Rust in hopes to find a good survival game to play with my sons. Though all 3 are still in Alpha I've had the most fun so far with 7DTD. I'm a Walking Dead fan and playing 7DTD gives me that same feeling of man vs zombie and other men and resources and time and on and on... If I had to rank the 3 I would go 7DTD DayZ Rust.As far as Rust specifically I like the open world sandbox concept the idea of survival of the fittest teaming with others to advance personal and team goals the graphics...I don't like difficulty in finding critical resources early (i.e. stone food) being completely defenseless as soon as the game starts (maybe a 1 2 day grace period to give you some time to get just a bit settled before getting shot in the face for your measely 5x stone and 20x wood) or start you off with a small amount of the critical resources lack of crafting depth (though I think this will change as the game develops so not a big concern).If you can wait then wait. No need to rush in and get this one right now.

review: So let me start off by saying that the game itself is pretty good. Sure it has bad design in some places and sure some things don't work but this is all to be expected as the game is in early access. While all of this is true the community surrounding Rust does not match up to it.Lets start off with my very first experience in game. I first log in alone and try to get wood (as you must in most survival games). There are a few houses in the general area but I think nothing of it and keep chopping. Needless to say I was immediately team killed by a group of two people. Angry I respawn and look for my house but seeing as there is no map system whatsoever I get hopelessly lost and decide to find another area to start over. I am killed again.This cycle occurs over and over again and while at first it adds to the survival aspect of the game you soon realize that most of the people that kill you are either on godmode or using aimbots. Almost everybody people in the game kill on site and even if you get lucky it's hard to continue when admins are always destroying your stuff for fun.After a day of not touching the game my friend comes online and I phone him up so we can play the game together (I bought it for him too originally expecting a game that would be fun with others). We spent an hour trying to get the game to not lag on his computer (A half decent Asus machine) and finally opened it up. This start revealed an entirely new issue not all of the servers were on both of our lists. We spent a bit finding a server and eventually logged on.Trying to find another player in Rust is like trying to find a needle in a haystack. We spent hours trying to look for each other with such dialogue as "Are you next to a mountain"."Yeah""Is it a big mountain""No" etc.One person would look for forty minutes only to have the other be killed by a hacking player or abusive admin. We finally met up only to be killed by a twelve year old screaming something into his microphone about us being "noobs". Needless to say it wasn't a fun experience and despite finding each other multiple times the longest we were ever together was around ten minutes.Despite my current seven or so hours of gameplay only about one to two hours of that was actually spent playing the game while the other five to six hours were spent trying to find my friend or trying to run from a bunch of naked players with way better guns than me (fun at first gets old quick).When it all comes down to it rust has some fun aspects however they are masked by the constant player level imbalance irresponsible admins and the amount of people that hack the game. I am sure that over time they will improve whether it be adding better systems to get rid of hackers or adding better ways to report people. Either way all I have to say is do not buy the game in its current state. One to two hours is not enough to justify 20 dollars being spent.
title: Rust

review: Things I've learned from Rust 1. Never ever trust anyone2. You CAN hide an Assault Rifle in your when naked3. 5 makeshift shotguns is better than one better gun4. Groupthink is real5. There are no consequences to eating another person.6. Practice Taoism. Nothing is permanent. In fact everything will go away very very fast.7. When life gives you lemons use those lemons to beat other people into an unrecognizable puddle and take their lemons. Then use their lemons to kill more people to accumulate massive amounts of lemons. Then retreat with your stockade of lemons to a safe location that looks like nothing and protect it well so you can go out using the same amount of lemons you would have used after killing the first person over and over again until all of your lemons go bad and the world destroys your home and there's nothing left to do but cry about how many lemons you wasted and how you just got amazing super explosive lemons and now it's all gone forever and you have to do it all over again so you decide to swear off lemons for a while only to crave them later like a depressed hopeless housewife to an abusive relationship (not to make light of domestic violence those are horrible situations and anyone who puts their spouce or children in the way of domestic abuse deserves to be lynched and castrated.)7. Chickens are ing worthless.10/10 would take your lemons and leave you in disrespectful positions again.Also I think 350 hours of entertainment is well worth $20 and if you don't you can go suck your own randomly generated privilaged

review: I've had Rust since release. Most of my hours were on Legacy. As many have said this is a fantastic game. Even better with friends. But as has been said over and over the community is incredibly toxic. If you can find a quite private server (or start your own) it can provide endless hours of fun. review: A sadist s wet dream that s what this game is. It can be a fun romp with friends that s for sure but past that point...well things get rough. The one true enjoyable experience that I have had within the game consisted of me strumming a guitar while my friends and I were running from a hail storm of sniper rounds and sure I admit this random player curated aspect of Rust is quite enjoyable but that is not how I play these games. I am a builder and the fact of the matter is that I cannot get past putting up the third wall. If one has any aspirations of thriving or having fun as some call it you would need to live by razor thin margins in terms of how much if the game you would actually want to experience. As a naked you are at the whim of anyone and anything and while that may seem fun at first. The fact of the matter is that you won t be able to get past that point very easily and if you were to try you would end up doing nothing but losing your items to someone else and wasting a few hours of your time. Rust is an RPG that brings out quite literally the worst in all who play it me included and quite frankly if you are not someone who calls other people fam and actively participates in the t meme culture that is all so popular these days you will not like this game because that seems to be its whole player base and they have no chill once so ever. You will be shot and killed a plenty and left to start again. Past my personal view if you are someone who likes to befriend and join clans to screw over weaker people well you re a sadist and this is the game for you!

review: One of the best survival games on Steam but given the field of survival games that isn't saying much. Gameplay mechanics are intuitive but the community makes this game like all survival games almost unplayable by yourself. Without a squad of friends you'll spend the majority of your time collecting resources only to be shot in the back. Since resources are scarce it's almost impossible to build a proper base without investing more than a few hours into the game. If you can play with a small group of friends Rust is enjoyable. But if you plan to play alone you're wasting your time and will find yourself very often outnumbered and outgunned in encounters with other players.

review: This is a ing wierd game and let me tell you why it's so but so fun. Reasons it is &gt They strayed from Legacy style (Which was smooth the effects were nice the rads actually worked)&gt It's buggy as all hell.&gt Hacking is more than out of control.&gt The devs don't listen to the players.&gt It runs like absolute (For the first 30 minutes on max I run at 60 fps and then I drop to about 10. My friend with a 970 I have a 960 can't even max this where a 750 ti could max legacy rust)&gt Building system is ed up.&gt Blueprints (in the regular experimental) are way too random.&gt Don't even get me started on the community.&gt The gun sound effects are dull and boring.Reasons it is fun &gt Buggy as hell&gt Easy multiplayer experience (DON'T PLAY ON OFFICIAL SERVERS)&gt Fun to goof around with friends&gt Fun PvP&gt Derpy dongersOverall if you like survival sandbox type games this game is fun but the fps is often unbearable and the people are ing toxic. I'd say yes but that's only because I like this game type and I think it's still moving along faster than DayZ. I love this game it has a great art style and they're getting around to doing optimizations. I'd recommend and I think it's way better with friends.

review: ForewordFirst and foremost this is a game with great potential however I will state that it is unplayable in its current format yet I feel that this could be bigger than minecraft if properly implemented.IssuesFirst IssueHackers have completely overrun this game and grief on a industrial scale for fun. Due to the steam refund policy Hackers use a 24 hour window to cause mayhem then get a refund and a fresh steam account and proceed to start the same circle of griefing. Nothing has been done by Facepunch Studios or Steam on this issue and for the foreseeable future this will continue to blight this game meaning any protracted amount of time in game will be ruined eventually by hackers.Second IssueThe second issue is that this game used to have a Minecraft style of play where you could delete entire buildings but this changed later on to prevent people from wiping player buildings. What has occurred is that servers are now loaded up by half finished structures and this has caused major issues with latency (think of playing on a server with 300 400 ping and you have a clear picture how frustrating it gets). AfterthoughtsTreat this game as a hard alpha if you must buy it but I would make a personal recommendation to wait until this is in beta and the 2 issues above are fixed.

review: YOU MUST HAVE FRIENDS BEING SOLO IS JUST NOT POSSIBLE FOR A NEW PLAYER IT'S VERY EASY TO MAKE FRIENDS IN THIS GAME IF YOU KNOW WHO TO LOOK FOR AND HOW TO TALK TO THEM. (Fresh spawns neighbors and people in chat)Get some damn friends grab an external voice chat program like Discord and just mess around shooting people with bows on thursday. Rust is a brutal Base Building Bandit Simulator. If you're coming here for roleplaying build a pretty home expecting not to get a spear shoved so deep into your oriface it comes out your mouth for the first 300 hours don't buy it.This game is riddled with things you need to learn and practise equally before you're going to get anywhere. You'll need to learn things such as basebuilding shooting knowing what and when to craft certain items the proper way to stay away from others who/when to engage in bandit fun learning what is raidable and way way more.Don't expect to be good at this game 3 hours after you get it don't expect 50 expect closer to 300 hours before stuff starts to make sense and you're kicking other people around rather than being the kickee.This is a game you start every Thursday when the update comes out and build a base after all the servers wipe you don't start in the middle of the week unless you're looking to get totally destroyed.Stick with it it's one of the most unique and incredible games I've ever played even if it makes me want to break everything around me.

review: First of all this game is NOT for solo players. If you want to play it by yourself you won't have as good of an experience as if you played with friends. I recommend playing with at least two other people.My #1 problem with this game is that it is wayyy too difficult to raid. They nerfed tools to the ground so that it takes like 200 pickaxes just to break through a stone wall. This is completely illogical. The best way to break into a base is with rockets or C4. But good luck doing that because it will take you 100 hours just to get enough C4 for one raid. The most frustrating thing is that it takes 8 C4 to break down a wall that it took no more than 10 minutes to create. 8 C4 will take you at least 25 hours to make.. 25 hours for 10 minutes of work... ok.If you don't want to play a grindy game like your typical MMO don't play this game. If you have a lot of friends who will play with you and love doing the same thing over and over for hours for a small reward this game might be fun.I enjoyed the game at first but once I realized how much of a grind it was I felt like I was playing Runescape all over again.If I were to offer some constructive feedback for the game it would be some things like.. Add an advanced leveling system so that the more you play the easier it will be to gather resources. This means that even if you get raided and lose 100 hours of work you will still keep your levels so it won't feel like you are starting over from scratch every time. Increase the damage and durability of tools when hitting buildings. Add boats for crossing water and let people ride horses on land More random events less rain Try to remove the grindy feel from the game. Remove/Reduce griefing. Let people do something like set an area as personal property (like with the build cupboard). If your house gets raided then the raider can decide whether he wants to steal your house or not. If he does then he can take over your tool cupboard and place walls and stuff. Otherwise he cannot. Limit the amount of 'property zones' you can have so people don't just place them randomly all over throughout the map. It's really dumb to have someone come in to your house place walls all over and ruin it and then not even keep the house.Hopefully this game will make some solid progress and I can change my review. For now I'm definitely not recommending it to people.
title: Rust

review: 10/10 Rust is a grinding game but has some awesome graphics. You will die...alot be it by bear wolf human or your own stupidity. The building structure is where you will probably spend most of your time I think it is one of the best parts crates are too heck most of this game is great especially for an alpha build. The developers are constantly upgrading and I cannot wait to see what is instore for the game next!

review: Let me just tell you how this game works. You run around and have fun gathering materials to build your base and arsenal. You do this for a few hours get a good base going and are all around having a fun time. You then decide to get off for the day. You log back on the next day to continue progress on your base and you are on the beach with nothing as a fresh spawn. You teleport back to your base to see that it was raided and is now rubble. You then switch servers and repeat the process it just keeps looping. Still a fun game but the community is ruthless. THEY WILL RAID ANY BASE THEY WANT AND WILL KILL ANYTHING THAT GETS IN THEIR WAY.

review: Day 1 Respawned in a totall wild.... wait a second whats that? Oh some kind of unfinished structure wait another one hey and another well whole landscape is ruined by random constructions started by players and left unfinished.Lets try to harvest and build own one! "Hitting single tree for 10 mins" Got 10k wood from it can't build anything but the wooden platform. OK it let's explore.Landscape doesn't change grass trees and unfinished random constructions. Suddenly a wild deer appeared. Time to act like a real hunter. Crouching slowly aproach deer so that he can't smell your presence in air nor see you to the point that you can equip a stone and kill that mother er to death. Yeah deer down (didn't even try to escape). Punching it's remains with stone to gather raw wolf meat (looks like deers here aren't vegetarians anymore). After a long day full of adventures a deep dark night startedNight 1Time to light a torch a survive a night. "Me prepared for worst standing and listening to the ambience... nothing happens" OK time to move on. After like 15 mins night passes and day came. I did literally nothing during night nor finding anything special.Day 2Crafting a spear killing some more of deers/boars. Crafted fancy burlap clothes so that my isn't shown to the world anymore. First encounter with other player. Totally naked guy charged at me equipped in a stone. Got quickscoped by spear right in his naked fallus. Loot nothing. Guy just attacked me hopng to gain anything cause he didn't have anything to lose. More constructions everywhere beside that single guy no more players encountered. The only ones are Russians speaking language on all chat. Good that I know Russian from CS. Got nothing to do nowhere to go time to cook that wolf meat then. Crafted campfire lighted it and put on the ground. No idea how to cook but went straight into flames and got ignited. Panic run to the lake hp left 10. Burning stopped but I saw a body under water. Status messager informed me that im too cold and wet immidiately hp went to 0. Lost all stuff and resped in another ruined by unfinished contructions place. Yeah I'm done for now with this game. O climat so far but maybe I started on wrong server (100 ppl online)

review: This was my first crafting survival game and first game I bought on steam. When it was first created it was crazy fun and I played for hours. But once it was updated to the smooth fresh look my computer couldnt process it past the server selection menu. Before the update it was amazingly fun. It did get boring after awhile once you find that perfect spot to hide your base and have a huge stock pile of needs to survive without leaving cabin. I dont know how the game is now but I would recommend it for those players that like wide open plains filled with murderers wildlife and critters!
title: Rust

review: For old review look below. REVIEW First of all this was written on the 26th of November 2015. Some things may have changed since then (now for me)First the basics of the game.Graphics Sound and Performance 4/5Highest settings take quite a beefy setup but I can get a fairly steady 30FPS on medium settings.The ambient sound effects are alright but I don't hear them much.The game looks amazing when you have a good computer.I will now review the gameplay in 2 ways a busy (50 100 player) PVP server(A) and a PVE server(B).Combat/Hunting A) 3/5 For a game where everyone is instantly hostile the combat could be improved/made more realistic (like Fallout's crippling system making hitting the legs better) B) 4/5 The animals are difficult to kill sometimes from the AI both helping and hindering at the same time.AI A+B) 4/5Sometimes it is very realistic as hostiles will follow for ages and the movement speed is just right for hunting but I have seen horses run up vertical cliffs.Building A) 3/5The system is good but the community just tears it apart.B) 5/5I would have been happy with this game if all I got was this building system. It is complex yet easy to learn and upgrading is the easiest thing to do. The construction cost is balanced.Community A) 1/5My experience is that as soon as another player finds you they will follow you with a rock till you or they die. building is a nightmare if you are on a raid server.B) 5/5The server I am on most of the time has great admins players and we all respect each other. No hostility just the beauty of the games graphics.Overall Score A) 3.5/5B) 4.5/5Would recommend for the PVE only recomend PVP to people who are good at or like that sort of thing. OLD REVIEW written approx. March 2014?Gameplay wise this is great. But... (obviously a but as its a downer) The Community. Is. The Worst. I have benn killed umpteen times because of semi naked rock hurling cavemen. I like the game but a solo/LAN mode is needed for the Thumbs Up.

review: Honestly the game itself is pretty good what ruins it is the fact that every single person you come across will probably want to kill you. This game is littered with hackers too it's awful. there's absolutely no way that I've found to deal with them either. it's nearly impossible to get any sort of team together unless you have some friends or you're a youtuber and it's nearly impossible to survive for long without getting your head blown off by some jackass who feels like shooting something. And I hate how easy it is to destroy someone's base. I hate how you can work on something for months and then in 2 minutes it's just gone because some jackass stored up c4 or some hacker was feeling like ruining someone's day and you just happened to be in his crosshairs. If you do want to play it do it with a large group of friends maybe 20 or so to defend a base with or just on a small server that has maybe 4 or 5 people on it. I'd say don't waste your money wait until the game gets updated a bit more and is a bit less crazy with naked idiots with shotguns. Also I don't have the best computer but it can run games pretty well at medium settings and on this game even on the lowest settings the game still runs like sh*t.

review: It's DayZ but so much better. Very much PvP survival as the PvE aspect doesn't pose too much threat. The building aspect is well done maybe a little too central. Somewhat grindy but worth it. Most advancement is researched based so some exploration is needed in order to find "blueprints" to craft better things. You can make some pretty freaking awesome super forts which are overkill for playing on an empty server so give yourself a challenge and make yourself a target. See how well you can defend yourself against others.

review: I love this game...or at least I did before the update. Havent played enough to know what all has changed but one thing is for sure...THAT HELICOPTER IS WAY WAY WAY TOO AGRESSIVE NOW! Used to be that when you heard it coming you could hide in a bush or up against a rock and 9 times out of 10 it wouldnt see you. This time it killed me from quite a long distance and I didnt even see it coming. I faintly heard it so I ducked down into a bush. Didnt help any! There are not enough places to hide from it. I for one dont like to die and loose all my stuff that I worked hard to get. My home in the rock cave is gone now too so I am starting completely over which sucks. If it wasnt for a friend helping with supplies I would have to wait until a day I can just sit here for hours on end (which I dont mind doing just dont always have that much time) to collect more resources and build my home all over again.

review: At first the community seems to be quite horrible but when you dig you just realize that it's way friendlier than it seems. Competitivity is a huge part of that game and you'll have to deal with it but like everywhere else it gets cooler when you get to know other players. Always be extremely careful make sure to trust the right people and this game will become one of the greatest experience you'll ever know.On the technical side this game is a memory CPU and GPU hog. However developers are always improving the engine. One month ago it would've ran at 10FPS if I pushed the settings on max on my GTX970. Now it runs at 30FPS avg on max settings.Last advice Try out those high drop rate servers they're quite great if you can't invest yourself that much or just to learn the basics before going on vanilla servers.

review: Relatively good game great concept. Build Survive Defend. I like the learning and evolution from naked and with a stone to guns and armor from just a campfire to a fortress. pretty good game in general. 50% of the community are friendly where as the other 50% are trolls and asses. THE ONE PROBLEM I HAVE WITH THIS GAME!you have a building Cabinet which allows/prevents players to/from building in a radius around the cabinet. you think "Great my house is safe from people building up to my 2nd floor which has windows. and my first floor doesnt." WRONG!Rust has a mechanic to where if youre not allowed to build in the building zone you cant build. but if youre just outside the building zone you can build in it. thus allowing players to build where they are not authorized and thus defeating the purpos of the cabinet and the safety of your home.As i said before I like this game alot because of 50% of the community and the concept of the game i WILL not play this game untill the issue with the cabinet is fix.I dont not recommend this game to anyone who Does not like getting raided Does not like getting raided because of a mechanic flaw Does not like getting killed by bears.

review: Old rust was amazing beyond belief me and a few of my friends would all play together and it was a blast but then the devs were like .. Lets make it graphicly pleasing for console kids and remake our early release game to being an early early release game. You basicly need a NASA supercomputer to run it with good fps and for the envirnment to not look like a patato. But they added all these new items like a guitar and you can draw paintings in game its soo kooool you might say. and your right they have added new things like that into the game. Does it make up for the lost charm old rust had? or a map that you could navigate? or even the radtowns and how critical they were. The game keeps moving forward and maybe in a year it will peak my interest to try it out again until then im done with this game and i'd stay away from the game unless its super cheap and you want to try it. I wish old rust would come back...

review: You'll awaken naked on a beach and immediately begin hitting things with rock to scrounge whatever meager tools you can quickly improvise. It will feel familiar if you've played any other hi res Minecraft clone. You may start to make plans or mentally assess your surroundings but really none of that will matter.Within a few minutes a nine year old with auto aim will tag you with a spear giggle like a sociopath or clumsily insult you and then you'll get to listen as he carves the meat from your still twitching body.This is the chief issue your first five minutes of Rust and the subsequent hours are going to play almost the exact same way.You can join others if you are lucky in whatever defensive structure they've managed to erect. But this game does not incentivize teamwork AT ALL it incentivizes exploiting people to do your heavy lifting for you. Ultimately you'll be betrayed by one or more of your members all they have to do is type your four digit password in Steam chat to a member of a raider clan and that's the ballgame.Because of this heightened tension you are as likely to be killed by your allies as you are by your enemies due in no small part to everyone looking like everyone else. You can also be easily overrun or simply killed and farmed repeatedly by raiders while trying gathering resources outside the walls until your entire operation becomes anemic.Clothes are tricky to build because you either have to enter the killing fields of the forest to gather hemp or somehow spear the very few animals which spawn. There is no farmable crop to produce cloth or wood. And because you will be killed often you (and virtually everyone you meet) spend most of this game with your pixelated dong flopping in the breeze.People have logged over 800 hours in Rust and there's a reason for that. There's something to the appeal of a game where you have to struggle and suffer for every inch. If you enjoy titles like The Forest and The Long Dark where you are actively hunted at all times Rust will offer a superior experience. Human players are infinitely more creative and brutal than AI regulated MOBs.There are two core issues 1) Rust is easy to hack because of the Unity system.I saw several players glitch through walls and a few flying through the air. A persistent and authoritative moderator could mitigate this but it would take an exhaustive amount of effort. The Steam Anticheat protocols help but they do not remedy every issue. And any game can be ruined by hacking eventually but when it's this simple it becomes pervasive.2) The Rust community is god awful. They often have severe personality issues and tend to make the experience feel cheap. Their schemes are largely transparent their jokes are cringey and the game mechanics bring out the worst in almost every single one of them. If you're a functioning adult the experience will likely be nauseating. You can to an extent alleviate this by playing on a lower volume server or running it on a password coded private server with a 7 10 friends.A few elements could improve Rust a greater level of terrain destruction the ability to fabricate autoturrets a larger animal population. But at that point you might as well play a game which already features those elements H1Z1 Ark DayZ 7 Days to Die or Life is Feudal to name a few.If you have a book report due on Lord of the Flies and you're having difficulty getting the tone of the work or if you really enjoyed the 1994 film No Escape you should play Rust. If you want to see measurable semi permanent progress in a game you into which you sink hundreds of hours play almost any other survival/crafting title.

review: MY RUST ADVENTURES SO FAR wake up surrounded by wooden houses start running in the opposite direction into a field. At that point I had to go to the bathroom so i did when i came back my head was getting bashed in with a rock. i died respawned got a better start this time. I got wood metal and almost had enough materials to start making a house (even though those are not very good idea) but i wanted to anyway. i made a metal door and a little wood hut and went out with my bow feeling confident to look for some more metal for a gun. was walking along when all of the sudden a pack of red eyed and furred wolves started chasing me. I started to run and try to shoot them with my bow. I was low health stumbling up a mountain with just 2 more wolves chasing me. i had run out of medkits and was running towards a cliff with 8 health left and still wolves chasing me so i tried to jump to the next ledge but sadly missed... the next thing i knew i was in a field with some naked guy standing next to me threatening me with a rock for all my tuna (i'm guessing he is a pauseunpause fan) and so when i said i had none he started running at me with a rock i instinctively tried to hit back and we were in at that point running around swinging giant rocks at each other like mad men. all i could hear in the background when we were fighting was we are the champions playing from the other guys mic... So after a long rock battle i finally smashed his head in and ran away with his rock at that point a group of 4 people in kevlar came from the mountins came running at me screaming at me for me to give them everything i had. i did and they repayed me by blasting me in the head with a shotgun. so after i woke up again nothing really exiting happened so i worked my way up to getting a waterpipe shotgun and a revolver and a 2 story 1 x 1 shack. eventually those same people in the kevlar (at least i think it was them) came to my humble abode started to break in i killed one as they smashed down my door with c4 i pipe shotgunned him in the face ran up to the roof and made my last stand there shooting at them with my revolver untill they at last killed me with a bunch of M4s.REALLY fun game 10/10 will play againEDIT This is about a year and a half later and I can honestly say that this is probably one of the most unique epic fun and intense games I have ever played. I wish I could triple recommend this game. The only thing is that you NEED as in this is a necessity to get the full effect of the game to have a medium to high end computer to really get the feel for the game. The graphics are absolutely stunning. And the sound effects are literally the best in any game i have seen. There is honestly nothing like sitting on a hill watching a huge base being torn apart by a attack helicopter while the inhabitants desperately try to defend themselves. Hearing the explosions and seeing the huge balls of flame as missiles rain down is worth the 20$ alone.Some of my favorite times in this game come from what is called the purge night on the rustified server. Where admins start giving out guns and spawning in like 5 10 helicopters is an experience that is only found on rust.In all I can't say enough about how amazing this game is.... the only thing is that this game makes you rage extreamly hard as well... something about working hours on a base and gearing up only to have some other guys with better gear come and kill you and take all your work is a bit aggravating to say the least.

review: A story by a noob.So dispite all the hateful things my friends told me about the game I decided to get it.I joined a server with with around 40 people online a little bit after joining the server it was getting could and dark and I needed a shelter so I'd then ask my fellow peers how to build after countless request for help I'd then have to try to figure it at three minutes after I finaly found out how the next morning I was really running low on food and needed to go hunting If I'd like to live any longer I walked outside and wen't to the near by river and was sniped (it was a head shot)luckly the server had a tp home otherwise i would of never found my house. after my failed attempt to hunt (and survive)I planned on fortifying my house to protect from raiders I went mining and began very fastly began making my base a place raiders could not get into. (so I thought) two days later I saw to men walking a bit to close to m base so I fired a few warring shots to prove a point (they had lowgrade gear on clothing) moments after they bolted and were no were to be found two nights later I was working on making blueprints for the ak I found durring that day I then would start to see things that pointed towards a raid on my base it was extremely dark and then 7 lights began to dash towards my base I managed to get a few kills then a rocket flairs toward my base I'd then perish lucky for me I had hidden a few chest round the world just incase I was raided by the time I got back there was nothing to save I was defeated. I decided to abandon my base knowing that wasn't going to be the last time they came on my long journey I was held at gun point by the enemy clan to the one whom just destroyed me I told them what happend and they they let me join their town that had a big wall and watch towers they showed me a place I could set up my house and I stared pulling my weight and was accepted as a full members like all good things peace in the town would soon end the clan who destroyed my last base planned to destroy the town a big bang happend at our southern weak wall we all rushed towards the wall and a swarm of 15 men ran through the town we had lost a few men but we survived all the clans had had enough of their random attacks so banned together and marched to their compound we blasted our way in and left nothing but bodys lying around. my story shows that you could be a lonly helpless noob and half a day later be one of the power houses of the game.although I cannot garantee my story may be your own I can tell you that you will regret not buying itI would buy the game regardless what your friends have to say (but the game is best with people to survive with) From what I've heard (correct me if I'm wrong) the dev team updates every weekend so it's not one of the games were you will get little to none updates.my rating on my full experience(although short) 9.5/10

review: I very much enjoy this game. At the beginning I couldn't get started with all of the KOS (Kill On Sight) experienced players did. After learning to not play on Official servers I found a great community one that was noob friendly. I have put 300 hours into this server alone am now an admin and am now helping new players. I love the people I play with now. I suggest all new players to go to noob friendly servers to learn the game then go from there.I bought this game after being overly frustrated with H1Z1. That game was bug after bug and no update on survival. That's not the case here. They do weekly updates monthly wipes w/ big patches adding more interesting items every so often have a ton of concepts they are producing. There are Battle Royal servers for those that like to fight there are creative PVE servers for those that like to build. There are great community servers that are like family to one another then there are massive clan servers. You pick your poison. You can go modded gather everything quickly and have a fully protected base in 5 hours or spend days just getting your first floor to sheet metal. The devs really pay attention to the community and give them what they want. They fix the game in a timely manner and are awesome people all aroundFind a good server make some friends have fun. Play your way and follow the rule's on whichever server you choose.
title: Rust

review: This game has been great to me! I have enjoyed it immensly for over a year now and while playing on and off have always had a great time! First of all i'll start by saying that if you intend to play on a vinillia server this game is HARD when playng solo or in a small group. There are many different ways to sucseed in building a base collecting materials hunting ect. and everyone has their own way...that's what makes the game great. The building aspect is absolutley awe inspiring. Between all the walls windows doors and other such items there is a lot of opportunity for big and small groups to build bases that will deter raiders. How you do so is again different for everyone. Besides the gameplay the graphics are really good once you learn to forgive the blur motion. If you take the time to look at a sunset or an airdrop there is really a weath of visual information that all plays really well with the lighting. As far as updates go they happen almost EVERY WEEK Gary is very committed and always hardworking. For $20 this game will test youre abilities to hate love fail and succeed but in the end it's all worth it.

review: I bought this game in the very beginning and have been a fan ever since. Legacy was great but the new version is even better. Hackers can be an issue sometimes but with the new VAC and EAC countermeasures you see a lot less. First off trust no one. Don't trust naked men (should be obvious) and don't trust anyone wanting to be your friend. I suggest teaming up with friends from the real world and working together. You will die but the way that the new blue print system works helps make death less of an issue. Build your bases strong and find a rad town to snag new tools and weapons from boxes and barrels.Good luck and be prepared to stare at a lot of wieners.

They can be found anywhere on the map and I mean anywhere. That gives solo players like myself (as of right now over 550 hours with groups bigger than 10) a chance at playing the game casually. I have enjoyed rust there has never been a moment where I had doubt in the game. 10/10

review: Great game if you have the time to commit to it. I would consider myself fairly casual. As a single player who only has about 2 hours an evening to devote to playing video games It is hard for me to play in a meaningful way. Just about every time I have a good start after a wipe the next day I log in it's back to square 1. This problem can be avoided if you have a group of a few people as there is a point to which you can reach a low risk state and less potential of an offline raid. Because of this I have stopped playing regularly. I follow the dev blog to watch for how they are adapting to the playerbase but unless there is something that changes the gameplay to be more rewarding for online raiding I will most likely stay away. Every Thursday I think about starting a week. I'm to casual for an official server but solo/duo/trio servers are still a strong option for a player like me. Enjoyed my time and will continue to enjoy watching the development. This game outgrew 7daystodie which was my time competitor for a while. Now that Ark is full release I will give it a go to see what it's all about.

review: I have had Rust since Legacy in 2014 and this is still one of my favorite games to play. Player interaction is great graphics are great building system is great and the list goes on. Yes this game will make you angry because of the high amount of KOS and cancerous players. brings me back to playing it and grinding on it nonstop for periods of time. Roleplaying servers typically have more friendly people than modded and official servers. The gunplay is great in this game and puts you on edge when you hear others around you. Also the dev team is fantastic for this game. Rust is constantly being updated every week or 2 weeks and was just released out of early access several days ago. The game looks gorgeous ever since they added new landscape textures. There aren't a lot of bugs with this game and not many hackers (more in official servers.) I would highly recommend this game if you are looking for an open world survival game that is massively multiplayer.
title: Rust

review: My friend and I were playing Rust about a month or so after it was released. We managed to get a bow some arrows and a nice wooden shack. Eventually we hear a barrage of gun fire outside our home and the screams of men being gunned to their demise. We close our door and extinguish the fire and pray they don't see us. Are prayers failed as our door was blown to bits by c4. A man then rushed into our home with an AR15 and held us hostage. Our door was then replaced with a metal door. We urgently start messaging a man we met earlier to come help us. He does and he blows the down the wall of our home. He is unfortunately swiflty shot down. Our captor then exclaims he was out of ammo. We took this opportunity to bolt out the hole in our shack and run for the hills. He was apparently not out of ammo and we were shoot several times in our skulls and perished. 8/10

review: If I could sell this or return it I would. I was so dissapointed with this game. First off the game concept seems really cool something that I have been looking for for a long time. However as most of the other reviewers are saying the player community sucks. You can spend an hour trying to build your area up with shelter weapons caches etc. Basically you do this to have it ****** up by some player who pops out of no where. Which wouidn't be so bad or unexpected if they didn't then camp spawn you or have this same scenerio happen every 30 minutes or so. It is like the community doesn't want new players to actually be able to play. I bought this game when it first came out and you could buy it in pre release... Mistake. My first experience with this game has darkened my all around view of it. If there were better developer decisions made certain things within the game wouldn't be such an issue. But it really is a free for all which sucks because you build from the ground up. Unless you quit your job break off your relationship ignore your kids and move back into your mum's basement your chances with this game are little to none...

review: Update 9/1/2017I will admit this game is not like it used to be of course that's obvious because of how much the game changes every Thursday when they release a new update that fixes/removes/adds content. Despite these constant changes this game never fails to bring something exciting to your doorstep. Playing this game will make your heart pump more than running TheFitnessGram Pacer Test over and over again. It gives you a feeling like no other when adrenaline is rushing through your body and the high of being in a life or death encounter with other players who want what you have. It's intoxicating and extremely addictive and one of the few reasons I love this game so much I honestly do. It is one of my favourite games and has helped me meet extremely amazing people who also share love for this particular Early Access game we know as Rust. I've been through most changes to this game and I'm a rather experienced player I know the ins and outs and I know how to PvP well enough that it makes it fun for me and that's personally MY preference this is game that is OPEN. You can explore whatever you want whenever you want and how you want you can play to PvP or play to PvE you can even fu cking play to roleplay it does not matter because it is YOUR preference. This is game like no other game I've ever come across before and due to how unique it is I am completely obsessed with it.There are many players like me that love this game and the devs that release weekly updates in HOPE to better the game (I say hope because usually they release something completely untested and hope the community responds positively but usually it's pretty bad. Ex aimcone heavy armor nerfs muzzle brake buff etc) truly do love this game. This community is pretty toxic in the way they treat their devs believing them to be brain dead and stubborn but the truth is the devs do care the devs we know as Maurino Vincent Andre Taylor Diogo Alex and Garry. They all are great devs when they listen to the feedback and they usually do. It might take weeks or months but they will listen. TL DRRust is game that allows you to choose how you want to play and has commited developers that release updates every Thursday although stubborn developers that release untested changes they are willing to amend their mistakes and listen to the community so long as the community is willing to complain to them non stop.r8 dis gaem 11/10

review: Rust is a game that you will love and hate at the same time. The PVP can be both brutal and rewarding. Team up with friends make a clan and DOMINATE!If you are looking to play this like an RPG where you are rewarded for playing more you will disappointed. This game will chew you up and spit you out. I have gotten killed over and over and over. Learning how to play smart build smart and stash smart is what makes this game "survival". It isn't supposed to be easy. Yes the game is a bit buggy at times but the game is not finished.I highly recommend this game because it overall will give a satisfying playing experience in a short amount of time if you enjoy the challenge of survival. If you want to run and gun go play COD. If you want to build go play a city builder. If you want to do both while being shot at and doing the shooting this game is for you.

review: This game can be split up into two talking points. The developers and the game.The developers I purchased Rust and played it before the dev team swapped over to the Unity engine. It's come a long way from where it was. From what I have seen the developers have put a lot of work into it but in my opinion they aren't as focused as they should be.Just an example the developers planned on adding a female model to the game. This was announced around their 65th devblog. We re currently on devblog 87 and no sight of females being added. In fact they haven t seen them mentioned since the couple of devblogs after the announcement.Not to say they never add anything. They've added a lot of things to the game but at the end of the day things aren t balanced or fun for everyone. Their approach to game design focuses too heavily on adding new things than making what they have currently balanced fun and stable.The game Rust isn t earth shattering. It s okay. The fun isn t about playing the game. In fact the game is pretty boring. Summed up actually playing the game consists of the following Day 1 Thursday (Wipe day) If you re lucky you were able to keep your blueprints. If you did it s a rush to get resources to build a house. Which is boring. You re competing with 80+ other people over resources to get a house up before them you get killed with the resources you ve collected so far. If you re lucky you succeed and you re safe for the time being. If you re not you ve been killed and now have to spend the next 30 minutes banging a rock against another rock until you have enough stone to bang your rock against a tree so you can make rock tools to back against more rocks and more trees. If you weren t lucky enough to keep your blueprints get ready to spend the rest of your day getting killed in radtowns while searching for barrels and boxes.Day 2 and onward If you kept your blueprints at this stage you re just going to kill people. Yup. You re going to kill people and take their stuff. So you can make better stuff. Once you get better stuff you can use that to break into other people s bases to take all their stuff. Until next Thursday. Next Thursday all the stuff you have stolen (or all the stuff everyone else has stolen from you) will be wiped from the map and everyone starts over again. So. Mechanic wise the game is pretty . There isn t really a point to gathering a lot of resources. You re going to lose it next week anyway. If you re not raided before then that is. Where Rust shines isn t in its mechanics. It s in your interactions with people. That being said. You re going to have more fun if you have people to play with. If you are a solo player you re generally just going to be a target. You will get raided by bigger groups and the game will just be frustrating. Play with friends and it will be tolerable. TLDR Play with a group or you re going to have a bad time. If you don't have friends to play with don't buy it.

review: This game is a very fun one for the survival freaks that like games like Don't Starve or The Forest. It's a really great game with a amazing community that might or might not shoot you. There are 3 types of servers Official Community and Modded. With official you are playing straight up rust. Find materials and survive with normal loot dropping. Community being the same but you might have a few seconds off of your crafting and some more wood when chopping. Modded however is crazy and fun! There are different gamemodes you can play some giving you 200 000 wood when you hit a tree and you get starter guns. Some like one in the chamber where you play with 1 bullet and a rock and its 1 hit to kill. All in all it's a great game and if you can get some buddies to play with you it will go by very smoothly until you finally get your base setup and then armored even. 10/10

review: Rust can be described in many ways. Fun hard diffrent bad etc. These are all good words to describe rust. Rust is like any other survival game with a few diffrent things. For one the map is huge one of the biggest I have ever seen for it's genre. There are forests desserts snowy mountains and even just fields of nothing. It gives you the choice to build your base wherever you desire. It has great mechanics and awsome features a lot of other games don't give. You need to find certain items to learn how to craft them or even build a research bench to learn how to make game changing items. You can craft c4's and rocket launchers or even grenades. All of them with their own unique and diffrent design. Grenades are basically bean cans filled with gunpowder and some guns are just you hitting the end with flint. While there aren't an extremely large ammount of guns they all do diffrent things. Although as much as this sounds fun this game has an side you wouldn't see at first. The people who play rust can only be summed up in one sentence. Complete s. Now not everyone shall be this way but you will most likely spawn 5 25 times where you just get shot or beaten by someone with a stick. You may die multiple times in a row. Then the combat is very bad. Atleast at first it is. You could build your first little pistol sort of thing. And while you may feel empowered with it you are not. No that gun is not as good as you think. It may do less damage than a spear thrown at you. You could shoot 5 shotgun rounds from it at someone and hit them each time but they live. But they grab a bow and kill you in one hit. That leads to the major bad part about the game. If you have no friends who play rust or can't then you are immediatly screwed. Without multilple friends (around 3 or more to start) then you won't get anywhere. You could have an assault rifle but three guys with rocks come up behind you and kill you. You could have a great base which would be great with multiple people. But 3 guys with some ladders and spears come in and immediatly kill you. While this is great allowing the game to be balanced and allow anyone to win a battle it doesn't do it well. If you have spent hours in the game just for you to lose it all in minutes by some noobies then it is unfair and very frustrating. So I only reccomend this game if you have friends.
title: Rust

review: This game... my god.... My story is I got a house made by someone else had a few doors missing and I jumped on the chance. Later raided my neighbors when I had the tools and they were offline then they came back and were devastated. An admin helped me build up my strength...but not before kiling me several times for no earthly reason. My friend joined and built his house next to mine... then complained still when he didn't have enough wood to make his 4th floor complete... idiot. And when I found the recipe for C4 oh boy was I overjoyed... especially when it went to use. Then some Korean hackers came on and begged me for ammo... so I shot them both 1st w/ a shotgun 2nd w/ a BA Rifle.In short anger hatred fear despair doubt pride violence betrayal power thieving helplessness inevitibility stupidity ruthlessness conquest destruction brutality teamwork vengeance judgmet insanity isolation/lonliness friends and enemies are all going to be used as weapons of war. Against or with you they will provide the greatest test against the world.One of the best games I've ever played and am still playing it. Good luck in the field. And never trust ANYONE.

review: DO NOT BUYI have played 90 hours of this game and I cannot stress enough to anyone who is maybe interested in this game that it is and will be a waste of your money. At first glance it looks like you're run of the mill survival game. Which is very apealing but upon actually gettting into the game you realize that it is all a lie.If you can actually get into the game it barely functions. Lag. Dissconnects. DDOS attack. Hackers. 12 year olds screaming through the in game voice chat. Did I mention hackers? Dont even think about building your base because the second you have something valuable here comes a flying (yes flying) aimbot script kiddie screaming at the top of his lungs through the mic headshotting you with a 9mm while he zooms around in the air. Maybe its the server? NOPE its every server. Even the offical ones.Disconnects/lag/DDos attacks The game was playable up to a point. Recently it has gotten MUCH WORSE. Try to get into game and get disconnected 10 seconds later. Come to find out that rust itself (Which is flagged as a virus by AVG/Malewarebytes/Norton/Bitdefender/Kypersky) has DDos'd your modem and has crashed it. Dont even think about posting on the dev website. The devs and fanboys will ridicule you call you dumb for trying to troubleshoot THEIR software problems to make workarounds for the countless problems with their game. 100/10 DO NOT BUY

review: Biggest pucker factor I've felt since Demon's Souls or any of the Dark Souls games. It's incredibly frustrating and rewarding. Rust is a lot like an adult Minecraft it's less imaginative but more competitive in every way. I highly recommend it to anyone who has the time and patience for a persistant world where people can raid your base when you're offline if you haven't properly defended it. For me it's easily the most motivating/addictive game of all time. For its flaws it's definitely a labor of love with a regular update schedule (once a week for EA once a month once released) that makes it evident the devs really care. Check out the blogs.

review: I literally can't even. I don't understand how this game could be patched so often and be so frustrating to even get working properly (when I can run similar games like Life is Feudal on max graphical fidelity with no real issues). I had to go on youtube to figure out a work around on how to actually get the game to launch to begin with. Just loading up it stops responding several times (and sometimes crashes while doing it). Loading into a server can take 5 10 minutes. Once in game features seem to be constantly breaking or stop working the way they did minutes ago with no explination (despite asking about them in game looking at the guides and sarching for info on it otherwise). On the most minimalistic graphical settings it crashes constantly or refuses to stay connected to servers. There are hugmungous frame rate drops transitioning between areas. Steam even crashes while trying to play this game. Even after exiting this and steam my computer runs horribly until I reboot. I can't even tell if I like the actual game or not because I can't play it long enough without issues with running it to really get into it.
title: Rust

review: I spawn inBases ing everywhere you lookGo into a town. See a guy with a gun. shoots me without even trying to talkManage to run away to the forest but bleedingGuess what? Bases ing everywhereTry to find some animals to make some bandage. No luckBleed to deathUninstallThis game is broken. I don't always say this but goddamit if Dayz ain't better optimized then this. However I do like the new grapich changes and inventory changes aswell as the new crafting system even though I didn't get to use it. The game is heading to the right direction but as with Dayz it needs improvements. EDIT So I played it some more with friends and I enjoyed it. For me however this game is only fun to play if you have friends to play with. Only then can you build a base and actually keep it together. Don't buy this if you are alone. Otherwise buy this game if you sine budds with you to play with.

review: My opinion and an early access reviewGreat Game. I played the legacy version mostly. It was fun how everyone was feinding for weapons. People setting up little trades in side chat and adding each other to do secret meetings. The paranoia of player interaction. How people would cry when they had their bases raided and when people backstabbed one another. I myself guilty of backstabbing lol. Good times.The social interactions like gaining their trust to let you see their base location only for me to come back later on and raid it. The no lifers guarding the server 24/7 raiding when people are offline letting them build up slowly over days only to destroy it all in one peaceful night of players being offline. Savouring the moment when they all log back in and cry. I am guilty of this once over lol. Had to be done for a good experience.Very tough game solo you really need friends in this game.Now Legacy has been abandoned hackers run rampant. But if you find a good server it is still great.The new rust is poorly optimized for my computer atm. I cannot run it smoothly so not much to say about the new rust.I look forward to playing the new optimized rust it will surely be great! And the finished product will be an EPIC game im so looking forward to it biding my time.10/10 in my opinion

review: When I first bought Rust over a year ago I was expecting an unfinished but functional game. That was more or less what I got. I will admit it was pretty entertaining at first. There were some actual updates coming in and there were hardly any hackers in the beginning of the game. Even if there wasn't many supplies away from the road so there wasn't much room for exploring the (small) world. I set the game down for a few months to focus on other titles. When I reinstalled I opened up a no PVP server to get started and was met with a gun to the face. I was confused. It was a no PVP server?? I spawned somewhere else and after an hour of hitting trees with rocks and making a shack some person noclips through my wall and shoots me. A couple deaths later I leave and uninstall. Que another few months later and I start up the game again hoping to see improvement. What I see is more hackers more useless admins no more zombies and a smaller world to explore. What started off as such an exciting and fun concept has turned into a rather mediocre game. Don't waste your money with this filth.
title: Rust
