review: This game forces you to use your mic to create friends or enemies or you can chose not to talk to any one and be that lonely mute guy who lives out in the woods. The official servers reset at the beginning of each month allowing you to "do it better." At the start of a fresh wipe you will get first dibs on a good home location that's littered with rocks animals wood fresh water and cloth. You will want to defend the land around your base from the pesky neighbors that are always trying to still your resources. Once you have solidified the area around your base stalk the annoying neighbors and find out where they live next you want to stay up really late one night and wait for them to fall asleep raid their base and take all of their resources back to your base.

review: Rust will never be a game for casual casuals although for casuals that doesnt mind getting kicked in the nut once in a while rust will be ok. Ive been playing solo ish grop of 3. usually solo for gathering and building and fortifying. With that said im not a weekend warrior and that keeps me and my supply on check. You can play rust solo for sure as long as you know how to get that 2x2 up and fortified as soon as possible.i recommend buying rust with the mind that it's always changing. for the 3 months that ive played a lot have been seen and done and changed around that makes the experience new every two weeks. Sure it's in alpha for 3 years but it's gary we're talking about... he made a mod that has been sold a lot of times rust wont dissapoint. expect a salty community cause this game calls for salt. if you dont like salt in your meal then don't.Rust needs the salt and that's what makes it more and more motivating to fling a ton of rockets and c4s to the s base and teabag the scumbag.Salty Rust is the only Rust.Still a great game! Component system toasts the level system

As this is not to be FacePunc are likely going to fix it soon now the new progression system (component system) has been made.With weekly updates and truly the best developer to community interactions I have seen Rust is only growing in popularity and will soon be a must have game on PC.

review: Rust is a game that unironically rewards skill brains dedication and charisma. Every single negative review is from people who lack these things. What makes rust such a good game is the incredibly fun gameplay and the charming community.Here's how your first wipe will go 1. Stupidly aggressive PVE will frustrate you. You'll die while trying to get resources for a base.2. After hours of work you'll finish a base.3. You'll get into your first PvP encounter and get ed.4. You'll get sniped from a tower and get ed.5. You'll get ambushed while looting and get ed.6. You'll grind for weapons and still get ed.7. You'll kill one guy and be happy maybe tell your friends about it. Your effort has finally achieved something.8. You'll get raided and then quit.How your second wipe will go 1. You'll avoid bears and aggressive mobs get your base up faster.2. You'll get your first air drop and maybe a couple of kills.3. You'll get ed and flamed by someone better than you.4. You'll get some decent blueprints and gear and maybe even finish a base with high externals.5. You'll make some friends. Maybe have a small village or coalition against the big groups. Maybe you'll be terrorized by the big groups and try and suck up to them.6. You'll raid bases that aren't just shacks.7. You'll get raided and then quit.How your x wipe will go 1. You've played through a few wipes. Mobs aren't really an issue anymore.2. You'll find bases as a caveman and ambush them murdering unexpecting victims and taking their resources.3. You'll get a reputation and some people who hate you because you beat them not the other way around.4. You'll get a base up with high externals.5. You'll ambush and kill people take their things and maybe flame a bit.6. You'll use guerilla tactics around airdrops and have hour long skirmishes.7. You'll organize a raid against another powerful group or join a coalition against one. After hours of grinding for resources and organization you'll start the attacks.8. You'll drop C4 go running through the smoke gun down your enemies and after hours of work you'll eradicate the group from the server. You'll flame them at least a bit.9. You'll defend raids against groups larger than you but because you're better than the noobs who hate you you'll win.10. You'll raid those around you and make them quit.If you reach wipe x you'll see why rust has such a dedicated community. Don't listen to the people who haven't reached it.
title: Rust

review: I cant recommend this for one simple reason you will always wake up to find all your stuff gone. Even if you are skilled and merciless (which this game requires) and manage to get good stuff (usually by stealing it) it will never last. making it past the noob with a rock stage is almost impossible since you will get killed by people or animals. gathering enough stuff to make your own gun takes amazingly long (in which time you will almost inevitably die) and the gun you get will still be no match for the AKs some people have. so really the only way to make progress is by ambushing people with your stone hatchet when they have guns and hope they dont notice you or are in their inventory or something like that. but even if you manage to kill an AK wielding raider with your hatchet you will wake up to find it gone. The only way to avoid this is to play in a group where people are online 24/7 but this is unrealistic for most people for a few reasons.1) you need to have people in different timezones but these people will play on servers close to them due to ping2) if not people in diff timezones you will need people who stay up all night but these people are hard to find and even harder to befriend3) nobody wants to sit at the base just protecting it which leaves you vulnerable to attackLastly even if you manage to maintain night time protection for your base you will probably just get raided during the day since your base will probly be undefended because nobody will just sit there defending. That is the most boring thing imaginable. Why buy a game to just sit there? Who would sit at their screen for hours on end doing nothing but watching carefully?
title: Rust

review: Rust is just an amazing game no matter how you look at it. No NPCs (except animals) at all. Start out with close to nothing a rock and a torch... Well soon you will make tools and with those tools you will make tools that are at a higher tier. With your resources you can fully customize your base to fit your wildest dreams! But watch out because once other players see your base it's game on. Defend from raids with traps or guns! Yes that's right you can go from a rock and a torch to an AK 74! The game is truly limitless with what you can do. Make allies or enemies. Your choice.

review: Legacy Rust Great game great starting ground tons of fun. Decent ammount of hacking which sucked but otherwise pretty clean game. Experimental Rust(current version) Great starting place has new engine or wtv. cool maybe they can work on it better. See dev posts and changed every week. Have hope the glory of rust will return. Father Garry tells me that it will be like legacy again. I shed a tear and await patches. Patch 45 games still not even close to legacy. Every new little thing that gets added causes tons of errors and causes the servers to wipe just to introduce more bugs and problems. Don't get me wrong this game is soooo much fun. But every patch kills me more and more as they don't adress the communities needs and simply enjoy ign with what Garry called his creative project. Well have fun playing with your game Garry because honestly I can't take the inventory looting bugs the stacking issues and the fact we wipe every week just trying to get the new patch and then you don't live up to your word and its even further from legacy rust than before. Animal run 1000 miles an hour hit boxes are incredibly innacurate as are every weapon in the game but the AR. And then the AR is more accurate then God's sniping capability. 10/10 great game 5/10 poor production team.EDIT So I saw this game was up to be on sale this week and I had to update my post. At this point the game has been in production 2 years and is no closer than it was day 1. Changes still happen but they are small and are not what needs to be done to finish the game. Currently they have no plan for release and could in all honesty never release this game. A lot of the hype has died down now and servers are boringly empty or overun with people who play daily and will destroy you before you even get a chance. I urge you do not buy this game untill you hear them start working on final builds. I cretainly got my moneys worth from the game but 90% of my fun was when I was with friends and back when it was in the original version.
title: Rust

Probably not Until updates

review: This game was great during the summer of 2016. Since then the developers have ruined it with every patch they put out. Instead of fixing the real problems that were occurring in game the developers wasted time and effort on other things. Some prime examples would be the cheaters. I remember a time when modders could noclip right into your base steal all your loot and aimbot you instantly. This went on for months. The forum was filled with complaints what was the developer s response? Let s introduce item skins. Just one of many examples of Facepunch fixing everything except what is broken.Did you spend months farming blueprints? Developers &gt Introduce XP system. Once the community backlashed against the XP system Gary released a flowchart claiming he had great changes in the patches were praised by the community for a short period of time then people would complain again. This I thought was inaccurate. If it isn t broken don t try and fix it. He went on to encourage people to quit the game. The XP system was scrapped then the even more terrible component system was introduced. Then they brought blueprints back with the components. The next thing that breaks the game for me is the new recoil system. Really? A gun that recoils in the shape of an S? Now I must learn a different recoil pattern for each gun?Even if I get past all the other BS that breaks the game for me and decide I just want to build a base now I must keep farming materials and keep it stored in the cupboard so my base doesn t super decay? I wish this game didn t depend on some central server somewhere and I could find a rolled back version. This game had great potential. I loved it. Now I can t stand it.

review: welcome to the valley of knobs knocking about in the desert the forest and the snowy mountains )rust took recipes of minecraft and dayz ish survial games and merged em in one very successful survival experience. this is review of new rust game old one called legacy is long time gone in sense of popularity and population. this new improved version of rust looks amazingly good true candy for our eyes. it was very laggy and broken and nothing to do kind of game. but after few amazingly good updates now its marching again towards the very throne of survival games. we all know what rust is about you wake up naked on an island with only rock in your hand and trying to survive building shelters hunting and cooking food looting materials crafting clothes weapons and tools. you must survive and stay safe many things lurking after you other hostile players/survivors wildilfe weather conditions (cold heat...). the best way to enjoy this game is to play it with at least one friend loot together build together survive together look after each other. building system is also very improved and very nice now you can secure your fortress in many ways. also sharing with group member is nice too with permitions and crates etc... all in all this is one of the top survival games.
title: Rust

review: I've put my fair share of time into playing rust and would have to say for the price I haven't felt like I got ripped off. I've watched how this game has progressed and it has change a lot most for the better some for worse depending on how you look at it. This game really comes down to you finding the right kind of server for you. If you are completely new i wouldnt recommend a high populated server. You will die that is all i can say. If you like being able to build a place hunt harvest blow sh*t up and kill. You can make friends or be that lonely d**k that just does his own thing. There is a lot of learning from experiences of failure and you progress as you learn the game. I've played a few other games for this price and I have to say Rust was probably my best buy.

review: Day 1 I wake up on the shore completely naked with nothing but a Rock and a torch.Day 2 meet another player and asked if was friendly they said yes.Day 3 trusted player enough to share base with them Thought met a new friend and fellow survivor tohelp survive this.Day 4 new friend steals all my guns and food and builds a base at the other end of map after killing me and detroying my sleeping bag.Day 5 Raided a Rad Town and found an Assult Rifle and a ton of ammo.Day 6 Crafted some explosives to prepare for revenge against the jerk.Day 7 blew off the front door took all my items back and shot them all and then Blew up their base.DAy 8 built a new armored base to store all my weapons and shoot everyone on site D.Btt in all honesty this game is awesome All in all id give it a 9 out of 10 due to the bugs and getting kicked to the main menu once in a while but then again my computer is lower than the min specs reccommended for this game and it still runs somewhat smoothly. I would definately reccommend this game to anyone that looks for a good survival game with raiding etc. just have to watch out for the occasional troll or 2 that will probably kill you upon spawning bt thats why its best to find a server with a large map so when respawning theres a small chance of ever running into that player again.

review: So while I haven't played this for very long I happened upon a server with a bunch of experienced players who immediately showed me the ropes. After I was outfitted with a gun and some armor that they gave me I went out trekking into the wilderness of Rust. The first thing I have to say is that the game handles really well. It's a clever mix of minecraft style survival with mild FPS overtones and even with a slight "Sims" feel to it. If you're lucky enough to play and hop onto a server like I did you'll find it a lot of fun to communicate with different team members and take down bears while your houses become mansions. If you're not so lucky you'll have fun with your first few hours trying to build just one wooden shelter before being eaten alive by wolves. Even while being in the Alpha the game plays brilliantly. The environments are huge and captivating the enemies fierce and frightening and the crafting and various items add a clever survivalist feel. As it's in the Alpha I hope they get around to changing some of the minor concerns (messy GUI small amount of materials not a whole lot to build not a whole lot of scaling) because this game has a hell of a lot of potential. If it doesn't look interesting don't get it yet wait until the full and final version. If however you're intrigued it's definitely worth the price and the servers are always populated.

review: As of writing this review most of the recent negative reviews are because people don't like the XP system (Though I prefer it over the Blueprint system) or can't run the game on their low end hardware. As far as open world survivals go Rust runs better than most. Now for an actual review. Once you find a decent server to join based on the ping and population you start out by spawning on a beach. You are naked but you at least can't spawn in the frozen north or the desert south. For whatever reason you have a torch and a rock with you. For a while the rock will be your only real tool. The torch however is mostly just a great way to get yourself spotted and killed. Your goal is to find enough resources to not starve or get murdered. From here there is 2 main paths you can take you can try to build a base upgrade it to wood stone and metal amass resources while leveling up and only killing players for self defense. OR you can be a hunter going around to monuments and landmarks (in which every one is referred to as a Rad Town by older players (Not to be confused with the actual Rad Town)) to break barrels and loot boxes and crates hoping to get lucky and find some valuable resources/weapons. This method involves killing everyone on sight. You won't make any friends doing this but it's high risk high reward. And while that is the basis of the gameplay Rust has a lot of good things going for it. The dev team figureheaded by Garry Newman and lead by a guy named Helk are usually very open about their plans for Rust and listen to community feedback to make (and revert) changes. The team is constantly doing what they can to improve performance while also updating the graphics and visuals. You will get mad. You will get murdered. You will murder people. You might even make some friends to murder others with and take control of servers with them. Which in turn will make others want to kill you. Rust is an experience you simply cannot get anywhere else and it's one hell of a time sink.Garry pls add birds.

review: 90% of Rust is a game where you run around and kill people. You can do other things while killing and being killed but all activities take a back seat to fighting with other players.RUST IS NOT A SURVIVAL GAME you die all the time including committing suicide. Death is no big deal in Rust.Rust is a FPS with the goal of gearing up as quickly as possible. So that you have statistical advantage over other players. The setting starts post apocalyptic and quickly becomes full of player built walled compounds. Resulting in two modes fighting in the open using natural ground cover or attacking/defending compounds.

review: The game is very meh. It throws you into a survival world with little knowledge of mechanics and it has a fairly steep learning curve. Not to mention you HAVE to play on an online server that is wiped every month. I found little to no enjoyment on any of the "suggested" public servers as it seems to be full of the toxic variety of players. A lot of servers are also very poorly moderated. While it's more of a petpeeve thing when a server says you can't kill people after spawning on a bed roll or something and it happens but nobody is around to stop the person from doing it over and over it looks bad. The game itself still needs a lot of work and when updates are made the changes are the small things not the big major issues if there are any. Last one I remember was the fix for the keypad lock exploit. It can be fun if you get some friends and friends of friends together on a small server or for a close and small game community to just screw around in. But I shouldn't nor should anyone for that matter have to go and buy a server to have an enjoyable time.Rust needs a lot of work in the community which I know isn't really possible for the devs to fix and the game itself before I can even say it's worth the price tag. If you really want it wait for a good sale. I wouldn't pay more than $10 to $15 for this in the state it's in.
title: Rust

review: Rust....First off i do not recommend this game for solo players YOU WILL get rekt. I recommend atleast a duo as you can pretty far with just 2 people(I play duo most of the time). Rust also requires alot of tactics whether its pvp or base building. It is also a grindy game i do not recommend it if you dont feel like grinding or if you do not have the time to be on atleast a few hours a day(i have only been playing for alittle over a month and have 410 hours yes i dont have a life). All your grinding and progress can all go to as you can be raided by someone over night so thats something to keep in mind. It is easy to learn the basics and get into but hard to master such as pvp it will require some time and practice to get used to recoil and guns etc. this isnt your typical call of duty style pvp it takes alot more skill(I recommend you go onto a battlefield server and get the feel of the game). Overall i give this game a 9/10 I'd say the price is worth as you can spend endless hours playing Rust.

review: My previous review was unfair for this game as I have enjoyed hundreds of hours of fun playing this game throughout the many stages of its development. I've been a player and an admin and both roles proved to be entertaining in Rust. As an admin the posibilities are endless for this game you can play nearly any way you want if you know how to configure a server well. As a player the game can be frustrating but I've found half the battle is in selecting the appropriate server for your playstyle. This is a hardcore survival game that is unforgiving and the smallest mistake will put you on the radar of a group of raiders just looking for something to do. If you are new join a small group server and don't build a huge base. Build small well hidden and don't run around blowing up or spraying machine guns because someone will follow the sounds and show up looking for a fight. As a new player don't talk in chat about your location or plans as veteran players will help you learn the hard way and use this information to raid you or camp your doors.

review: Rust is a game where addictive gameplay and infinite possibilities for creativity pull you back time and time again. In the beginning of Rust's development the game was plagued by hackers and cheaters but in its late development it seems to have solved that problem. Rust is beyond a doubt the most dynamic base building visually satisfying suspenseful and addictive survival game on the market today. It's first person shooter elements are also professionally done but this isn't like most shooters. In Rust if you die you can be looted and subsequently lose everything on you so while carrying that fancy new gun you spent days trying to find might give you an edge in combat every second you carry it is another second you risk losing it.Getting sweet revenge on that jerk who killed you and stole all your materials early on is a satisfying experience to behold. But you could also be raided at any minute and you only have your base design and various traps to protect it when you're offline. If player's successfully raid your base and make their way to your loot rooms you could potentially loose everything. Fortunately the game offers a variety of defenses including autoturrets flame turrets shotgun traps land mines and bear traps etc. Maps also come in a wide variety of sizes and are pseudo randomly generated. This offers players the opportunity to build their bases in as remote or hidden locations as they choose. You can build in the rocks at the top of a snowy mountain far near the edge of map across long stretches of tundra or even in hidden cave structures where players rarely venture. If you choose to be closer to the action you can build right on ruined roads where barrels and other loot items spawn in the middle of open pastures where your towers or open windows can grant you visibilitry for what seems like miles or nearby major monuments where the rarest and most highly sought after crafting materials and items can be found.Rust has been a game in development for many years and it has tested many waters but in the end it has evolved into a very rewarding experience for any survival gamer. Today's Rust is a no brainer. For most it'll easily be worth a purchase.
title: Rust

review: This is my favorite game of all time plain and simple. Never in my life had I had so much adrenaline and fear pumping through my veins while playing a video game. If you arent careful someone will walk up behind you kill you and take everything you've been working for stealing hours or even days worth of hard work from you. Everything you own is constantly on the line and you have to be able to defend it or at the least run away and hide it. You have to be willing to die a lot and often and keep fighting to improve if you ever want to achieve anything in this game. If you like your games eay and fun then this likely isn't for you. People are going to kill you and they will do it often. They will make you trust them and then shoot you in the back. You will die over and over and almost always due to some sort of treachery or someone just being a You just have to be smarter than they are hide your base and goods and keep pushing on.

review: This game is pretty fun experience. I never had such adrenaline in other games. Its nearly impossible to survive alone u have to find clan or alies to get on top. Building bases strategically so raiders would have bad time raiding. I dont have much experience but personaly i love this game. I started from the bottom now im here. My history is i found my self some alies then we started to gather recourses i was the woodcutter secondly we made a base it was pretty basic. But after we rebuilded the base into a big one we had to defend from raids and it was hard. First of all we dint have that good equipment i was the one who had a Bolt (sniper rifle). Not that many guys had even thompsons. So we somehow managed to survive the attack but that wasnt the end. After 2 hours they came again but in that time we had ak's and i wasnt the only guy who had a bolt. There was a problem they had c4's... We collected all the loot we could and ran away. Now we are building a new base.Id say buy this game if ur not a ragequiter cause u will die alot like ALOT. Even when u are very strong u will die and u cant do anything.

review: Wait till it releases and don't waste your money on it until they make a finished product. I think this is what lead to the downfall of this game. Beta games should be free with donations to reward hard work. Rust got rewarded way to early and now it seems the developers are taking it slow.The game used to be good but the developer decided to start all over again and the current version is still inferior to the original version.Rust used to have a vision a direction which is now unclear where this game future is headed. The game is also getting a lot of competition now and it will eventually be surpassed by something better because they are taking to long to finish the game. Anyway if you want to try it hey go for it just don't except Rust to be done anytime soon.The game is playable and enjoyable if you like pvp. I changed this game to recommendation again because the game is finally playable and almost as good as legacy Rust. Still think people should wait for a finished product.

review: Oh boy what a wild ride this game has beenIt started okay during the very early alpha stages it as very rough but playable with some friends. The best memories I have from this game was during that stage like the first time I met up with my friend after searching for almost 2 hours.But as the game got "better" the community got worse... like really ing fast.They started drifting away from the survival crafting aspect of the game and started leaning towards more pvp oriented gameplay and it this point this game really is just a bad shooter with basebuilding and crafting mechanics.To win rust you basically have to be the fastest person to get and gun and be the guy who can stay online the longest.If you don't stay online 24/7 someone will destroy your base and take your stuff while your buzy doing thing in real life instead of spending your time defending your virtual valuables.There is no "friendlies" in this game everyone who can will kill you no matter what. Walk you to someone and I'll guarentee that 9/10 times they'll shoot you in the face even if you don't have anything.You could say "just join pve server if you don't like pvp" but the thing is that the PVE side of this game is barely present anymore there is no challenge or interesting aspect especially when there aren't any non player enemies except the occasional bear clipping through the mountains. There is no struggle for food water or shelter either. If you build a shack find some apples a can of tuna and a waterbottle you're set for days and don't even have to think about anything else.So I guess that's the excuse for people to pvp there literally isn't anything else to do in this game anymore but to kill other players.Other than that there are minor things like hackers bad building and the fact that the game has been in EA for like 5 years or so.oh and don't forget the developers toxicity towards his own playerbase even before he created Rust. Garry Newman and his mods were infamous on the facepunch forums.He also told Rust players on Reddit who complained about certain aspect of the game to "Stop b i t c h ing" and "stop playing the game"TL DR This game is a joke and the community is even worse
title: Rust

review: Not advised for solo players or average small teams. Rust is a hardcore pvp shooter experience. I haven't played since my husband told me about a game breaking patch a few months ago and before that it was almost impossible to play around my work schedule. This game can easily take your weekend up or whatever days off you have. If you start on a low pop server then you're safe until the hackers and elite players get banned from the higher pop servers a few days into a new wipe. I said hacker and elite players. Hacks are the main reason I haven't given this game a real try again since I left my old job. You can't be too good in this game and you can't play private servers if you don't know the admin either. Over half my hours are from Legacy and I admit I miss it but I like the ideas and how things look now. I really liked the exp. system even though I didn't have the time to sink into the game. All it really takes is to have that one person that does have the time in the group. If our group calls us back we will likely go back but right now I think everyone needs a break from this game.

Loading somethingwarmup for an eternity. then Loading somethingelsewarmup for an eternity. And then guess what? IT CRASHED! AND NO ERRORS. JUST BLANK! I started the game only to get a launch error and it's been the same ever since. And I can't uninstall because then i'd have to buy it AGAIN. and no I would not be refunded. So face punch. How about you actually CHECK SOME ERRORS. AND MAKE SURE YOUR GAME IS PLAYABLE.

review: So with over 1k hours and playing for over 2 years I've seen a fair amount of changes some good some bad it's been a toss up for a while and after a short break the new BP system has changed it completely. I was a little stand off ish to begin with because it is a little bit of a grind as a solo player right now. when I play with my clan it's a dream but as solo its a bit of a grind but doable for sure. just gotta make the plays. The community from when i first joined has changed a lot it became super toxic in the sense of KOS or insta raid from the first couple of hours but the new BPs have changed this forcing more interactions and changing how people act to one another. I've really enjoyed my 1k+ hours in the game sure there has been plenty of BS moments but I've made some really good mates from this games and some truly entertaining rivalries and enemies. Give it a go take a chance give it some time and you will enjoy it.

review: I really want to recommend this game. This game has a lot of potential to give you unforgetable experiences and those 'top ten gaming moments'. It has weird social interactions a world setup for awesome role play and a great loot and crafting system for replayibility. All this is buried under the mounds of t.It's 50/50. Either the game or the players ruin it for you. I am still having issues with memory usage with this game. This is partially a fault of my own hardware but when you have to input a command into the console so the game will flush out junk in the memory instead of doing it own it's own is unacceptable.The community is also a biggest complaint by many in this review board. You either play alone on an emtpy server or play with friends you know well on populated servers. There is no inbetween as far as basic gameplay goes.I've been dealing with these issues since I recieved the game years back and I honestly don't think it's fixable at this point.And now this game is leaving Early Access into a 'Full Release'? Sure....You're better off watching YouTube videos of people having a good time then wasting over 100 hours for a single good one.

review: Many people have different opinions over this game and I can understand why. If you want to buy Rust you will need a lot of time to play videogames this is not a 30 min come play and leave. As it is said on this page Rust is in Early Access and that means a lot of changes happen and servers reset a lot meaning that if you make a base don't expect it to go on for two weeks in fact it would be a miracle if it survives for a week. As of June 6 2015 the game is kind of unbalanced in my opinion in which you can easily raid bases with c4 or rocket launchers and it's hard to make a good base. Rust has a lot of potential for becoming an even more amazing game than it already is but in order to get there it's going to take time. I woud recommend for you to play with friends and to not get frustrated the first time you play as you will probably die 10 times before making a base since you will probably have no clue what to do. Watch tutorials on how to do stuff and you will be ready to go! I love Rust but sadly it also has a lot of problems it needs to fix. Would I recommend it? Yes. Rating 7/10

review: Well... I may just be bad at the game but well this game is probably made for them who like to die and start over completley.IN GAME I couldn't play on a single server without getting a lack of food. Sometimes I wouldn't even see a animal one single time it clearly felt impossible. you would just end up dying with the stuff you have collected these minutes of playing. itThe weapons i don't have much to say about because I've never used one ( because of the first reason l ) but the bow is just stupid. Well it's a survival game where you have to collect sh*t and others sh*t to survive and those arrows can be the meaning of life and death but Rust's creators made so that you dont even have a aim for the bow not even a little dot in the center of the screen which clearly made it impossible for me to use it.PLAYING WITH FRIENDS This might just be because the game is in alpha but it took ages to find a friends server and if you did find it it would most of the times take ages to join. IF YOU LIKE THE GAME Be careful about bying the game if you have a bad download speed. I got 0.25 mb/s ( I know it sucks b***s ) but i can play a normal game with 60 constant ping but now to the point. Every day or atleast every second day they will make an update that is between 80 mb 220 mb and it may not be the longest update in the world ( prefered to Planetside 2 which made me stop playing that game ) but after a while you will get sick of it. It will clearly try to destroy your brain.

review: This is a tough game. Not a second goes by where you are truly safe from anyone. Even a naked with a rock has a chance with a surprise attack. You're going to be constantly looking over your shoulder creeping through the forest wondering if your being watched. You're going to die a lot. Eventually you will make a base somewhere that you can feel a bit safe. Until the moment you hear footsteps outside your door and hear the faint beeping of the enemy c4.You could play the game passive build far away from others hunt mine build. Or you can build right smack dab in the middle of the map in the heart of the towns and surrounded by 20 other bases. Kill a guy take his stuff get killed lose all your stuff. The challenge is a thrill and what keeps me playing every couple of months.

review: A rather challenging game when it comes to surviving but that is the beauty of it.To set goals and to achieve them and if you die without having built anything useful then you can start all over from scratch.This game can get boring but it has loads of interesting features and it is only in its alpha state!Word of advice play on a less crowded server than the main ones. Best of luck )EDIT (October 2014) This game has changed a lot recently. The zombies have been removed as frightening as it may sound. That means an end to PVE (except for some wolves and bears. yay...).On the bright side the level design (environment) has grown very beautiful and waay better than the previous version. But that doesn't change the fact that the game is without purpose.I am no longer recommending this game.

review: Still early access so the game still has bugs. Not greatly optimized yet so it runs a bit slower than it should at times. But none of that takes away from how fun and addictive it can be. It's a crafting and gathering sandbox game wtih a heavy PVP aspect. Survival where everything can be gone in an instant whether it's being on the losing end of a gunfight having your base raided overnight or having allies turn on you.There are a bunch of servers to select from official to community run ones that go from vanilla to heavy modificiations. Most seem to be PVP a few run PVE. PVE is less dangerous though NPC bears can kill you and you could still get raided.My first twelve hours were spent on a heavily popuated PVP server with clans Within minutes as a "naked" I was sniped. Repeatedly I would respawn naked on the shore. Sometimes I was far enough from others that I could figure out how to gather and craft basic things like clothes and crude tools. Going solo and being new these ventures rarely lasted long before being killed. Sniped clubbed beaten with rocks mauled by bears and attacked by wolves get used to death. Seconds after a respawn death by sniper. Building a shack solo don't be surprised to be shot before you're done.You can certainly find strength in numbers joining clans or finding random people to help you. Most people I ran across killed me on sight on PVP servers though. Wanting to figure out a fast and effcient build order getting to the point where you can kill and explore the abandoned towns and learn new levels of crafting makes the game very addictive. If you're at all competitive in nature you'll waste endless hours seeking social and strategic ways to get ahead in this game.
title: Rust

title: Rust

review: This game is pretty awesome. I got it through humble bundle but I would definitely pay full price for this any day. There are some nice people in the community surprisingly. I was expecting a lot of toxicity and was told to steer clear of people but several people helped me learn the controls and what not since it isn't very straight forward and there's no tutorial of any kind.It took me a few hours to build a pretty nice base gather a bunch of materials and get a good feel for the game.I've taken down a boar and a deer and it wasn't too hard. I have yet to run into any hostile wildlife but I hear that bears suck a lot.It's not hard to get started at all just some of the work can be a bit tedious.Loot crates and drops are your friend in this game. Big time. I would not have gotten nearly as far as I did if I hadn't found an ice pick in a loot crate.But be wary of air drops on crowded servers. If you are not prepared you will die.Search abandoned buildings that aren't player made when you first start out. Thats where you can find loot from weapons and tools to ammo to medkits and even food if your lucky.Everyone seems to build near the beach but that's only because it's easier to build on flat ground and the flattest ground is near the beach.I was chatting with a player who had been with Rust since the beginning and I made an offhand comment on how I liked that this was a survival game without zombies and they said there used to be but not anymore.I could not be happier for that. I love survival games and finally finding one that wasn't survival horror is amazing!I went in expecting buggy stuff for it being in alpha rude players and few server choices. I was pleasantly surprised when the only issue was ping every once in a while and if I was on a smaller server there were supposedly Koreans who KOS.All in all this game really gives you the feeling of human survival. You can easily starve to death but it's also easily preventable. You can bleed out hurt yourself falling. Burn yourself on fires! It's all there but it's also a pretty easy game if you're used to survival horror games where you die 8 times in 10 minutes to freaking zombies.If you want a game where you can plan out your base and possibly band together with a few buddies without the awful moans and groans from zombies this is it! I don't think there's a better game in it's field zombie or not.

Devs LISTEN to communities. The sky is the limit with this game. I've played and watched it grow for sometime now and it is incredible.Base building is second to only one (Hurtworld I love the nodes style they implement) combat is great and is growing in leaps and bounds. Enviroment is harsh and beautiful. Bears are and wolves ninja drop jaw clamp you at every turn. This is truly a game that will turn even the most harded gaming into a people hating rage monster within 6 weeks.If I lost my steam account today I would buy again. 10/10

review: I have backed Rust since the day it released as an early access game. I have watched this game evolve from an unpolished ruthless survival PvP to a polished well designed survival PvP.In the early days Rust was a hot mess. The community hammered the devs on how they were under developing such a high potential game. What surprised me is they listened.Out of all the early access games I've participated in Rust stands alone as the one and only early access game where the developers pulled their heads out of their asses and became a true professional game design company. There is no more you could ask from these guys. They proved their ability and deserve every penny they can muster from this title. I for one can't wait for the next!If I could say anything at all to the developers of Rust "Thank you for not giving up! You have trully created an epic game. As it stands today you are the benchmark that all other early access game designers should be striving to become."Do I recommend this game? YesIs this game a raw survival PvP that isn't for the weak at heart? YesWill this game allow you to head shot all those troley *ss kids and provide tears as you raid their assets from their "super awesome base build"? F*CK YES!Do yourself a favor grab a few good men hop in a TS go chop some trees get yourself some makeshift pistols and take no quarter! KOS!

review: So as you can see from my playtime I really have enjoyed this game. Been playing for years. If you are playing solo then you will die alot there are a few things you can do about that 1) Look for modded servers some of which are PvE rather than PvP focused. I've seen servers that are PvE during the day then PvP at night for example2) Set up your own server. Takes some tech skills and of course don't try to set up a server and play from the same computer if you run a potato.3) Look for friendlies on a server and join their group.Rust is primarily PvP based so dying a lot should come as no surprise. You can play solo and have a good time just pick the right server or make your own.I've been running my own server for about a year if that is not your cup of tea you can get a hosted server as well. Either way you need to know a little about computers to get it set up. But once you do you can do things your way.The gameplay and graphics have gotten better and better in my opinion. The crafting has had its ups and downs but is decent now.Even playing solo on your own server can still be challenging...I've lost track of how many times I've been killed by a bear or wolf but that is part of the excitement of the game trying to survive then thrive.The game has been around so long you should be able to find plenty of reviews and videos to help you decide if you want to try it.I highly recommend it!

review: Well it's a great game! A few ya know MAJOR PROBLEMS 1 Raiding. Think your base is safe? Wrong. I found out the hard way about 50 times. Greifed into quitting!2 No "Local" games/ servers. No SP. So you always have to worry about getting raided killed greiffed and cut into skulls.3 Constant server/ game whipes depending on the server. Sometimes whipes are mandatory. So be prepared to have to completely restart after being greifed/ raided OR the server being whiped.4 Slow resource collecting. The best thing to do is to find an OXIDE server a modded server with x3 resources or something like that.Dont get me wrong this game is absolutely amazing but i cant play it anymore. Im just so tired of spending REAL LIFE days to make a house for some asswhipe to destroy it and make me have to completely restart. This game NEEDS either free custom server hosting or the capability of hosting a LOCAL server/ game with a max of 4 players multiplayer for free. And having a "Keep inventory for every world" option would be nice and it could be turned on or off by the host of a server to allow players to bring their items from other servers or to restart fresh for that server only.Get past the raiding and constant restarting 10/10 IGN
title: Rust

review: How to explain my love for RUST.......i can't not something i can put into words the game is truely amazing whether you play standard community servers or Modded servers the game is fun either way. only downside to rust is if you join a server for the first time and it hasnt been wiped for a week or so you have tonnes of people running around with guns and timed explovies killing an destroying everything they come across even if your a freshie so you will get some rage from that but if you can go past that the game is truely amazing and extremely addictive. Make enemies and allies to build survive and raid others always a challenge around each corner new updates always coming new players every day and even new servers coming online each day trust me you will LOVE RUST. But if you buy and don't like it feel free to send me a message telling me how stupid i am for liking it.Safe to Say Rust is a Drug to me. i can't get enough and i get when i havent had my dose of RUST.

review: I was skeptical. I was unwilling to buy this game after hearing about the downsides of it all I took a step back took a breath and braced myself for the cold water.I am now warm and swimming happily. Mainly because it's not that bad. I've played on PVE servers and PVP server PVE of course being much more enjoyable. However PvP isn't always "Spawn and get mowed down" You spawn and have time to collect things. Don't be an idiot and don't dawdle around you won't get shot. Also DO NOT build your home near or even slightly far from ANY spawn points or out in the open. They do have a chance of being looted if you don't have a metal door.This game does have hackers sometimes. It's alpha I'll say that. Rubberbanding annoying. Keep in mind that'll happen. No matter what rig you have. Frames are awful even on high quality rigs. Animals somehow phase through player structures and they're all made of chicken breast. (That stuff is delicious though.) All in all not everyone in every server is terrible. This game has potential. You're investing in something that isn't complete. Remember this. Hopefully the devs continue their great work and don't let this game die.I recommend this if you know what you are buying into and have checked the game out via youtube before hand.

review: Rust BF4 without the vehicles. That's the best way I can describe Rust in its current state. The game has MASSIVE potential but that potential currently goes untapped. What does that leave you with? Mindless PvP where newspawns are killed for fun because there's nothing else to do once you know how to play the game. The building aspect of Rust is currently nothing more than lipstick and the novelty of it wears off fast. The first time you play you'll probably spend a day or two building your perfect base only to find that game is currently so imbalanced it's not funny. It takes a matter of seconds to break into buildings that people spend days making and that leaves you wondering why build at all? This conundrum has lead most servers turning into a PvP fest where gangs roam around griefing newspawn because it's about the only thing to do. Should you buy this game? Right now I'd say no. Don't get me wrong. You'll be hooked after playing it for the first time but unless you are a prepubescent teenager that has no job is on holidays and can stay up all day drinking red bull then you'll come away from this game more often than not feeling frustrated and annoyed. Great game great potential but seriously broken.
title: Rust

review: When I think about "Rust"and the things I've done while playing the game makes me wanna punch my closest friend in the teeth and yank out his eyes. Why? Because this game can really stress you out! You will burn out in no time! It's fun while getting the hang of it but the community will do anything in it's power to prevent you from advancing in the game. Survival of the fittest defines this experience. There are moments where the learning curve gets a little too steep and you begin to grow ever more impatient. At one point you will just quit the game. Such game genres have a mental expiration date. Also when it comes to content it's got ways to go until it have a decent amount thing to do. With the not so recent graphical overhaul the game has gotten unstable for certain hardware like mine. It's playable but at moments the FPS just drops. For me "Rust" will always have a special place in my heart and I do have fond memories but I just got burned out. I hope that the developers continue to develop the game. Score 8/10 Just don't build your house near rad town or some random dude will pay you a visit with a bunch of C4.
title: Rust

review: First off I want to first say that not all servers and not all players are s on Rust. I have over 500 hours logged and Ive met alot of cool people and had alot of really fun gameplay. There is a high possibility of running into someone and getting screwed over but thats kinda a part in every game. I look at rust like a post apocalyptic survival game. I spend the time not in conflict preparing for war because someone will eventually find you. I think that kind of gameplay make the more mundane parts still seem fun. Setting traps and fortifying your home. If you dont like that much conflict and want to create There are thousands of servers with low populations that are friendly. The second aspect to the game is raiding and firefights so If you like action then you will be pretty happy. There is a joy to breaking into someones base and stealing their after hearing them call you a over and over again in the chat. On the larger population servers it can get a little difficult to survive without friends and you often log in to find your stolen but thats just motivation for revenge. It is early development and I have had some issues with the dev team when it comes to the gameplay. There are highs and lows to each early access. I fell in love with runs back in the legacy days and its just about at the same playing level as its predecessor. There are annoying crashes and bugs occasionally but the dev team is easily contacted and usually fixes the issues pretty fast. All in all the game is one of my favorites now. I had owned Rust for 5 months before playing more than an hour of it and it has transformed from a basic minecraft parody to a new much more advanced and beautiful survival crafting game. In the past few weeks the additions have included custom clothing and weapons modifications. Soon we will be getting vehicles. Mad Max here we come.

review: 10/09/2015 12 hours played only so not full review just quick word of my first game on it. )I was torn between getting this or Evolve both atm the same price this is a bargain for the money now get it if you want a great MMO survival game to play similar in a way to ARK still in early access and so much content to it thats the main reason i wanted it so much to do and actually an excellent looking game at first i thought it looked ok but water is set low default and a few other sliders and effects to change times i look when playing and do think photo realism i do love a game to look real good in the graphics i know gameplay is most important but both together are a perfect mix.I have played ARK on a friends setup it is a great looking game and i had played many hours on it nearly wanting to buy it myself but now i am on RUST and am really happy with the core gameplay i in learning mode now but like the fact the DEVS are really putting great effort in constant updates and fixes/tweaks.I have found most servers are lag free 95% oof the time what is great the server count on some is upto a massive 500 players! that is a real big multiplayer! and there is always many players busy infact 24 hour cycle.I feel this is well worth the asking price of under 15 as i have said much more going on in this for the money than EVOLVE not that EVOLVE is no good at all but maybe just short of general content for what it is i know it's a different type of game but just because they both a shooter type.I won't say muuch about RUST yet as i have not played it enough but have enjoyed my first number of hours and feel it easy to pick up and get into even with not asking for help just going with it at my pace i do think it's worth a shot if you bored at the moment and want something to play. I have played DayZ a bit in the latter weeks but find it to be a little boring at times still it is good but it does need much more work hopefully the DEVS will add to it more and tweak out the engine and of course get a great Zombie nation ravaging the lands as i haven't seen any Zombies in it for ages maybe one in about siz sessions of play. review: The gaming experience in Rust is unparalleled to many similar games of a genre so hyperbolized in systems graphics and gameplay. It becomes so difficult to truly find which game is best for you. So how does it compare?Rust is undeniably one of the most impressive and well established survival games I've had the opportunity of playing. Despite this game being in early access (has been 1 month and 8 days since release) it is already extremely well built and enjoyable. Initially this game boasts an extremely well populated community with hundreds of players on a game at a time with hundreds of games running in all. In game the game plays fairly well with solid fps even on moderate laptop and pc systems. To sum up the experience you will find yourself spawned in any random locaiton of the map (an island) with a number of biomes ranging from plains and mountains to radioactive zones and coastline. The day and night cycle is impressive with a general atmospheric experience that has you truly immersed. While there currently isnt any weather system in place I am certain there will be one in the future. Wildlife and enemies are sparse throughout the game a situtation that has plauged gameplay as explained in the cons below. Furthermore a simple yet enjoyable crafting system and random event (air drops) makes the game extremely pleasurable. Lastly the crafting systems leads to an impressively fun building system allowing players to be creative with their homes and defenses. CONSDespite the amazing well built gameplay and graphics the game lacks in the MOST important aspect of all the multiplayer.My ONLY critique of the game is the overall lack of stability in multiplayer. Inititally playing I had faced multiple players as a fresh spawn often times finding myself outgunned by veteran or well established players. These players undeniably hold themselves to a standard of KOS (Kill On Sight) rampaging and hunting players throughout the game. This can be EXTREMELY disconcerning for players especially for new ones. I have oftentimes been attacked within the relative safety of my home as bandits attack new players' homes until they are forced to come out. Oftentimes this results in a shotgun blast to your head an instantaneous end to all of your hard work. To add to the inequality of the game loot and resource spawns are extremely unequal. Oftentimes spawning in specific areas of the map resulting in highly contested areas of extreme wealth and other areas lacking any (if at all) resources. This makes it extremely difficult for these new players to establish themselves if they are forced to contest these resource soaked areas while undeniably outgunned by established players. IF there is any lasting note I have to say about this game it would be that Rust is an enjoyable impressive and entertaining experience for any/all gamers to the survival genre. Multiplayer games can be enjoyable while the game runs smoothly in an impressive aesthetic world. Further enhanced by its crafting system. Only qualms are that you should worry about other players and initial inequality. But once you find your mojo and truy begin to establish yourself in the game the experience becomes second to none. I highly reccomend this game and do hope that the issues (few as they are!) shall be fixed (this IS early access afterall!!!) eventually. So go out and play some RUST! You will learn to love it!!

review: There are a large number of survival games these days."Minecraft" is kid friendly sandbox of digital Lego."DayZ" and "7 Days to Die" simulate a zombie apocalypse. "Rust" on the other hand simulates "Lord of the Flies".You arrive in the world naked hungry and only carrying a single rock and torch. You need to kill animals to eat make tools make a base and learn new skills up a tech tree to find ways to survive as long as possible and outlast everyone else. The environment and other players on your server will ensure that you experience enough challenge grief comedy and frustration in the process.Unless you band together with real life friends in the game to form a gang you don't really have much of a chance of surviving very long.... and you need time to develop the essential skills you need to survive. While it's possible to make friends with other players and work together in the game this is unlikely to ever happen. The optimal solution to the "prisoner's dilemma" game theory is routinely used since the rewards of killing other players is greater than cooperation with them. To the rational mind it is stupid. The primitive civilization that exists at the start of the game could get much further ahead if everyone worked together but this simply doesn't happen. Hence the only rational playing strategy is shoot on sight kill or be killed. Often the mere sight and sound of other nearby players should strike fear into you.The possibilities abound for the evil player to cause grief. Of course you can pretend to be friendly and then turn around and stab someone and this is a common and cliche tactic. You can also pretend that you are naked and carrying nothing to lure in opportunistic thieves only to pull out an AK47 assault rifle. You might simply choose to be an opportunistic player who camps outside other people's bases ready to kill and get inside as soon as they open the door to leave! There's some strategy in base building to be learned but it simply delays the inevitible. Most people will set up base near loot rich areas on the map close to landmarks which are interesting to explore in their own right which creates common areas for random encounters fights and death to occur. Aside from online barbarism you can also have some fun with roleplaying. You can offer yourself up to clans and get forced into indentured servitude to other players. You can set up your own shop and draw signs and pictures for others to see. You can try to be a wandering door knocking religious pacifist preacher (with the expected results!). You can start handing out weapons to your more primitive neighbors to see what happens. The best moments of the game occur when the game's entropic dynamic is turned on it's head and the other players own descent into madness creates hilarious conversation and emergent gameplay opportunities most of which ends up with a swift death!Getting higher on the skill tree takes a lot of time effort and resources. The more players who work together and simply put more hours into the game than you did will get there before you at which point it's too late for you to catch up. In order to really "win" you need to be playing the game like a full time job with a large number of friendly players and that's just not feasible for many people. Nor is it a good or fair gameplay device. To top that off the "always on" nature of the game's servers mean that when you log back into the game you will often find your base raided looted and destroyed. It takes a long time to build a base but only a short time for a hostile raiding party of other players armed with bombs and assult firearms to trash it. Your problems simply compound if you are completely wiped out by other players and have to start all over again from scratch.Ulitmately the brutality of Rust will crush your spirits. As the game's name implies Rust is all about entropy. There is a total lack of fairness and balance in the game although it feels like there should be but this is interestingly determined by all the other players. By no means is anyone compelled to kill but they do. After a while the server becomes chock full of everyone armed to the teeth with firearms and base destroying rockets and bombs. A newbie entering the game naked will simply get killed on sight "just because" and fail to make any headway. Rust eventually becomes like a heated game of Monopoly where not only do you lose friends but you start the game with nothing while all of the colour groups are owned by other players who have built hotels everywhere for you to land on. After a week or so the servers have to be routinely nuked clean to set everyone back to a level playing field. I presume that this is the "final solution" because the game does hint that you are living in the aftermath of a nuclear war!Solo players would be better suited to other survival games as they simply won't get to see all this game has to offer. If you do want to play solo then it's best to find a server that isn't very busy. That will give you time left to your own devices to learn enough crafting skills from blueprints to be able to compete in combat at least. Later on you will be able to build a small base that will dissaude powerful players from mounting a siege. If you REALLY have a huge bank of knowledge you may be able to set up a shop or bargain your way into larger gangs who may want to utilize your skills. Even still however the higher level items require huge amounts of resources to research and the game requires an inordinate amount of busywork when you aren't being constantly hunted. Cooperation with other players is supposed to happen at this point but it doesn't. If playing solo prepare for many frustrating deaths and if you live that long a huge grind for loot. There's a lot going for the game graphically and the mechanics of the game are well thought out and executed however the learning curve is brutal. Aquiring blueprints for crafting items is a bit random. Many people will simply give up in frustration at some of the toxicity of the other players. Even those that make it far enough to develop a nice base after spending many hours will eventually be heartbroken by the base raiding. It's fun to be on the other side of that equation but it's really not much of a victory if the base's occupants are offline. It deprives players a chance to defend their base and hence ruins an otherwise good opportunity for an epic siege battle with people present to at least "try" to defend it. At the moment the offline raiding doesn't feel fair at all. Aside from the base raiding your base will degrade if you don't spend time to maintain it. Combined with the regular server wipes that will ultimately clear out all your hard work you are constantly reminded that nothing is permanent in the world of Rust. Combine this with the brutality of the other players and this makes the game feel utterly futile on some level for artistic effect. Since you can't take everything with you when you die in this game just as in real life you may as well jump in cause as much chaos as possible and try to have a good time doing it.It's games like this that teach us what a lawless anarchy looks like when there are no laws no incorruptible police force and no restrictions on weapons and firearms. It also teaches us what humanity must have had to go through to reach the civilization we have today bringing new light to colonial conquests in history and seeing them through a new lens. The game is stragely addictive and educational at least. If not it's a subtle warning about the darker side of human nature.In this game you will either die a hero or live long enough to become Rust's arch villian. "Better to reign in hell than serve in heaven" maybe as Rust's world truly is a paradise lost.Rust works in this way as a piece of philosophical art.

review: "Very posetive" t. I bought this game early on in its development and paid four dollars for it. Not even worth that. This game is stupidly unforgiving and that dosent even account for the players. Basicaly you'll start off with nothing and spend 45 mineuts at least just to get the resources to build a measly shack But good luck getting there because every player and their mother who isnt also just starting (and sometimes them to) will be out for your blood for no reason whatsoever. If they kill you good luck finding where you died or the house you started on. After ages of grinding and avoiding the overabundance of players you may finaly get to settle into a cozy little house that you feel safe in. Let me remind you that this is at least 3 hours into the game (if your lucky). Congratulations for not dieing thus far. But look at the time! You should be getting to bed. WRONG! No! your not allowed to leave this everlasting torm of bad map design and even worse players. You leave its over. if your gone for more than 8 hours and you dont have a house made entierly out of reinforced steel its all gonna be gone when you get back. Yep players can kill you and steal everything you own while your not there and theres nothing you can do ab out it. The amout of time you have to sink into this (actualy pretty boring) game is rediculous for the rewards you get. Theres no point of even starting unless your playing a 12 hour session and even then after you get up from your power nap and inject more Mt. Dew into your bloodstream theres' still no gaurentee that all your wont be gone and you'll be back at square one. DO NOT BUY. EARLY ACCESS AND ALWAYS WILL BE. NOT WORTH $20 NOT WORTH $4 NOT WORTH THE MEMORY SPACE ON YOUR COMPUTER. GARRY NEEDS TO STICK TO MODDING.

review: Alpha game. Doesn't have all the features implemented. Not optimized. Even though it's in the alpha stage I still expect a perfect AAA release quality game NOW! I can't wait I paid for it now why isn't it perfect? What's the developer hiding?Also this game is a PVP survival game. Other players kill me all the time for no reason! Why? I knew the theme of the game when I purchased it but I don't like how I keep dying! Other players shouldn't kill you in a PVP survival game. Also don't like the survival aspect. Now that I've covered what most of the negative reviews say I'd like to give my own perspective.It's probably best played with a pre existing group. You WILL get your shot off while carrying nothing but a rock and/or spear. No warning just shot. The strong dominate the weak and it's hard to become strong. It takes skill and a whole lot of luck. Your best bet is to make friends on the server. This will be extremely hard unless there's a nice group around but if you can get in you'll be okay. just prepare to die a lot and lose your stuff. It's a true open world game. Go live in it. Die in it. Don't expect to become king of Rust. Set your goals low see if you can do better next time.

review: Once apon a time there was a young boy who wanted to play rust. He got the game from a humble bundle at a criminal price. The little boy had seen lots of rust and those who played it. He thought that rust would be a game with common goals for all players. He thought that that common goal would be to have the best base and most guns. He was right except he forgot about 75% about all of the videos he had seen. He realized that each video had someone being raided or raiding. He had overlooked this key fact. On the first day he built himself a nice little shack out of wood. He came back on not 30 minutes later to find out that the entire base had been burned down and he had been killed. He thought " Oh well. **** happens. " This continued for days. And the days turned into weeks. Until he just had enough. He thought that if he had played more than an hour on a small server he could get atleast a small unraidable base. He was wrong. Very very wrong. So he quit rust. But the allure of getting good loot had won him over. So he had enough. He played 7 hours straight until he had a big base. He then logged off for a day. He was blessed that the rust gods had favored him. He had not been raided! He played almost endlessly. All the way until he had raided many and had many enemies and allies. At the end of the day he was very proud. What he didn't know about was the fact that the wipe happened the very next day. He was depressed but he still fought. And to this day he still plays rust. The End.Now that the story is over Rust is a game that has no end to fun. The rage meter is high with this game. Think about the most you have raged at a game and then multiply that by 5. That is how much you will rage. The game also takes a lot to get used to. But overall if you want a game with almost endless fun then purchase rust. I had gotten rust for 5 dollars in a humble bundle sale. The price that is listed on steam is still criminal. I do love rust for the friends i have made playing this game and i reccomend this to any average gamer because all servers are not PVP. If you want to sharpen your skills or just build then join a PVE server. Don't join PVP unless you want to rage like a bull.

review: The game to me in it's current state is basically Don't Starve meets DayZ. Within the first five minutes of my playing a wolf killed me. The next ten minutes included me finding some resources getting some raw food from a pig and finding some shelters built in the middle of the road. Then I started starving because I could not figure out how to cook food using the campfire after searching for a little while on the internet I came back to my game to find a man standing near me. He talked to me and taught me how to cook so I made my food and ate. Went to a hidden area made small shelter and got off for the night. The next day (real time) I got back on and the same guy was on. he told me he was making a base somewhere off. He said he had some blueprints he didn't need along with some other stuff so he came all the way back to where he met me the night before and gave me said blueprints and a gun with bullets. Then he led me to his base. Since then we've been resource gathering and building our bases I built mine right next to his (we're making sort of a town). I came into the game expecting all bandits but he's given me a lot so far including a flashlight mod pickaxe guns etc. The rest of the people I met on the server have so far been friendly. Some more populated servers may be really bad with that but so far my expereince has been just. Right now there's no real goal but like minecraft you can make some goals. Currently my goal is to make a house and make it well enough to where if bandits do come they won't be able to get to me and my stuff. Also there are a lot of craftables in the game that I can't even delve into right now because I need the blueprints.

review: Playing in both Legacy and "New" Rust I've had a quite enjoyable experience. I still remember my first house from two years ago my first friend my first enemy my first server. Sometimes while loading the game I still get that excitement that I got when I had first purchased it. However the days of hacker valley and the P250 are over. The "New" Rust looks better than ever coming from untextured plains to a world with several environments to live in with mountains valleys and lakes. Although I dislike that the focus has strayed to far from survival and is now simply a gather and kill FPS in which you eat someone's leg every few hours to fill your food bar. As I say that though the devblogs have revealed concept art for the reintroduction of rad animals a nice addition to the group of adversaries. As of the current state of the game the wolves and bears still come out of nowhere and destroy your like no ever could and players enjoy killing you for your gear or for the sport. But it is definitely managable. Playing solo is possible if you are smart and finding friends is not that incredibly hard unless you aren't socially adept. Even cancerous trolls can find some Nazis in a cave to base with. I would fully recommend this game for players that enjoy surival games in which some amount of skill and game knowledge is required to play to their fullest potentiel. Tips for new players1. Find players on the reddit forums to play with2. Find a server that you'll be able to succeed on One without too many big clans3. If on a server with big clans become a slave Gather resources for them while they teach you of the game and give you blueprints Do not single handedly betray them unless you like that pixelated to get by 10 dudes4. Pressing tab does cool stuff including crafting menu inventory and upclose image of testicles5. Hit trees with a hatchet6. Hit rock nodes with a pick axe7. Don't hate the player hate the game

review: If I could refund this game I would.Let's go through a couple average days in Rust.You spawn in and immediately there are two naked black men coming at you with rocks in their hands. One of them catches you beats you over the head. RIP.One of your friends (Jimmy in my case) is lucky to find a base which is unlocked with someone sleeping inside. He turns the man's skull to paste and takes the base for himself. He assigns you and your friends sleeping bags so you can spawn there. After about an hour of tinkering around with loot inside the building you hear a stampede outside. Suddenly you hear a mix of squeakers Russians and squeaker Russians. One of your friends (Mitch) opens the door to see what they want. Suddenly there is a tidal wave of naked men who run in screaming and your axes are no match for their screaming and rocks. You are dead.TL DR Don't buy this game. It has turned into DayZ Episode 2. Save your money buy skins on CS GO or something.

review: This is coming from a day one buyer of rust. I understand that things change you want to improve the way your game is this company and the game rust have alot goign for them and always have and always will. My point of this review is to say how disappointed I am that they just completely forgot about what people call rust "legacy" now. I dont expect daily weekly or even monlthy updates to the rust "legacy" however i feel the community that supported this game from the start at least enough to make this a big deal have felt left out and betrayed. Give us the sniper scope as the 5th attachment give us a few bug updates. at least to make it more complete. It just seems this company has done so well they have almost forgotten about the "old timers" if u want to say it like that. I've taken time to play both versions and I know legacy is my game of rust i prefer..please someone understand this and spread the idea of legacy getting some more updates at least to polish their old ideas...for the ones who dont want to move on..for the ones who dont lifke change..we paid for the game to you know..we have a say.good luck to this game and its developers.

review: The idea behind Rust is a great one. Sandbox resource gathering crafting survival. Realizing that it is still in Alpha stage it delivers on all immediate fronts. That being said... it looses its appeal rather quickly. More so if you play on your own server and full access to everything. The amount of griefing on other servers happens to be substantial though there are ways to keep it from happening. At the moment I wouldn't say it was worth the full price tag. $5 off maybe but not the full $20. There needs to be more added to the game to bring me back. Bigger world space more towns bring the zombies back with better AI (still not entirely sure why they were removed). Great game... just needs a little more to keep people in bring previous players back and gain new ones.

review: So it had taken me several hours to get enough food and wood to make a small shack and start building a proper house. I had died several times and had to hike cross country to find my stash of food.But now I was doing alright huddling in my shack at night once or twice huddling while a bear snuffles around the outside. But I had a house with walls and part of a ceiling. I had a furnace and I was making metal for the doors.I was near a barn that I could steal rarer supplies from and rocks and log piles showed up in a nearby field across the road. One day I was super lucky I had found a laser sight in one of the crate.I came out of the barn to see the bear. It slowly turned towards me and I started running. I was almost to the road when I heard shouting over the growling. "Stop! Stop! you n !" I spun around in surprise. Three men in leather armor were chasing me one had a gun. They shotgunned the bear. One of them kept on calling me the "n word." Once they killed the bear they yelled for me to leave it was their kill.I went back to my shack I had a larger store of materials and my sleeping bag in a house higher up but I didn't want these three to know that. They didn't seem to want to kill me. I had the problem that I didn't want to use my microphone and chat seemed to have stopped working.So I began off loading my stuff into the small box I had in the shack. Then I heard them. "Here's where the n lives." This guy was in charge and he clearly was an . I had to be careful. "Come out you n !" I came out. The guy had a hand cannon I though about pulling out my 9mm I had just finished. No I couldn't win a fire fight with the three of them. I didn't know what the other guys would do.They checked my box outside there were only rocks inside. "I'm taking your rocks n " I didn't care. Then he threw me a pickaxe "get to work you n " He and one of the guys ran off. I was going to survive. The last guys stood there. Then over the voice chat he said apologetically "here have some food. Sorry man." I grinned this was Rust. I didn't tell him I already had 30 cooked meat. I took the offering. I didn't mention that I had a better hide out. Later I found my shack ransacked the box inside was gone but the box outside had some good leather armor. That night I put metal doors up and went to bed. Who knows if I'll be safe in the morning. But I don't care.
