review: RUSTIt has so many layers to it so where to begin.Well. I'm no writer so I'll try to keep it to the point.Typical negative stuff said about RUST Hackers haven't ever seen one. 587 hrs on record. Grind Sure. But there are tons of servers with x3/x5/x10 even x1000. You think it feel like a grind simply pick another server. Griefers Once again. Pick the right server with no griefs allowed. Griefed anyways pop a quick message to admin and they'll help you. If not then you're doubtfully on the right server. Lag Not really not anymore than the next game even though there has been some at late I haven't really noticed any since 2 updates ago. Only people who shoot on sight Simply not true. Alliances are made and RUST has somewhat of a self justice enviroment. Especially if you like to be part of the social aspect chat helping people ect. It's my clear opinion that jackasses often get's as deserved. It really is a living social world where you'll meet the same people many times which is why you'll know who's who form alliences build neighborhoods ect. If you are a lone wolf like playing solo well unless you're one of those Chuck Norris kind of guys unlearn that quick to survive ) Offline raiders Build better bases it's a big part of why I enjoy RUST. Trial and error baby learn from your mistakes. There is alot of different ways to keep those unwanted visitors out and I personally love to see how raiders have to give up. I don't understand why people get so upset over raiders. They are doing you a service by testing out your design... for free and they use plenty of ressources to do it. Unless ofc they find your lootroom..What else.. What do I don't like?All of above still jazz

review: heard this game was terrible but after awhile I gave in and bought it.Day 1 woke up naked discovered my amazing breasts and beautiful black skin. Score. My only possessions a rock and a torch. Using my rock to smash trees until I unlocked some tools and a spear. Built a spear now I am a neolithic woman of power. found an elk snuck up on in because I am a rogue seriously. I stabbed it once then threw my spear at it and watched it climb a steep hillside instantly with my spear hanging out of it climbed up the mountain like a boss because of my powers found the elk with a wobbly spear hanging out it ran right at me and so I screamed and smashed it with a rock for the win retrieved my power spear met my buddy who came online to help me we build a nice two level shack and gorge on pig meat after another hunt We add a third storey to our shack and stand on top of it marvelling at our domain and quoting the lion king "Everything the light touches is our kingdom" spot a small foundation built within spitting distance of our dwelling head out on a quick raid to demolish it. While breaking it down a dude jumps out of the bushes and throws a spear into my chest it wobbles there and I scream still alive jumping and whipping out my own spear which I plant into my assailant's instantly while my pal bashes his head with a bone club. We return to the base and dine on man flesh then wait out the night sitting by the fire laughing about our fortune in battle. the sun comes up and we prepare ourselves for a day of gathering stone wood and meat We stand on the top deck literally seconds from departing on our day BAM a bullet rips one of the walls off and we dive for cover as a pair of dudes with AKs and rifles basically shred our entire existence inside of 10 seconds. They came with the dawn. We are so very boned. I am shot and fall to the ground screaming and bleeding out while my homey valiantly defends our claim with his stone spears. With his dying effort he heaves the spear like Leonidas at Xerxes but it misses and he goes down in a hail of gunfire Wake up in my sleeping bag another raider standing right over me shoots me in the face again. 240 seconds to respawn and they have taken everything from me. I respawn literally on the other side of the map. My second life went so much better. Survived three human days had a fort on top of a hill like KING THEODEN. Went to work got a text from my homey 30 minutes after I left saying how we lost everything while they went out smoking.11/10 would bring dawgs to the yard with neolithic breasts any daySigned an enthusiastic gamer Day 632 (161 hours playtime)There are no safe places in the blasted lands outside our valley. Here the grasses are lush and the trees spread their limbs toward pale windswept clouds while elk graze in the meadow and wolves howl on the ridgeline loping long shadows that seem to drive the night. Their mournful howl slames the cold fear of death into my very soul. The darkness creeps over our meagre claim closing us in its cold grip. The night holds much terror but soon we will be much safer.We are nearly ready to begin construction of high stone walls to encircle the entire claim. This will take many days of stone harvesting but our group's cohesion makes these runs easier and easier each time. More warriors have joined our tribe sat in peace by our fires and spilled blood in the name of our brotherhood. Nearby tribes wish to break bread with us and pass by our clansmen without bloodshed though with their numbers they could easily have overwhelmed us and taken our belongings. Perhaps they fear us but the truth is unknowable. We place our faith in Big Brother the dark face with eyes that reflect moonlight. He guides us and his eyes watch over us.

review: My first several days in Rust Cannot figure out how to kill deer. Die of starvation. Start over. Finally find boars much easier to kill. Cannot figure out how to cook meat die of poisoning from eating raw meat. Start over. Forgot to put a door on my shack first night and zombie killed me Start over. Build first home with wooden door. Gets broken into first night and lose all my stuff. Start over. Build a home without a ceiling and someone build a staircase into my home messed up stuff and killed me Start over. Ran into wilderness for 10min to log out in a field somebody killed me while i was sleeping Start over. Watch someone get killed by zombies pickup their full rad suit and several weapons FEEL LIKE A BOSS. Get squashed by Airdrop and loose all my new toys. Start over.Needless to say I keep playing the game because at its core it is fun as hell. If you don't like the frustration i mentioned above play on a PvE server with Sleepers disabled but be prepared to have a difficult time finding resources.Considering the game is still in ALPHA i HIGHLY recommend picking it up!

I think the best part about Rust is that you start out so primitive and make a huge tech leap or die trying at least. That and maybe more RP aspects. review: My Review of Rust . As this is a pre release that is not a finished game we should expect issues in linux and windows.Over all the game is good even at this stage when it's playable. after todays update it stops at bootstrapping or the like and will not load. also before this after a update the text to get into the servers was too light to be seen you have to guss what server and key to log in. thats all my gripes with the game so far (besides getting kicked).I was able to play for long time. and while not the most over high demanding scenes it is well done . game play was smooth most of the time. due to features not being setup you can't save servers etc . So I've played on had and on newbie servers alike. So i've had to restart many a time and not just from other player killing me.It is kinda Dayz Forest Mindcraft but better visuals then mindcraft. the game makes building fun and I've seen house/base designs that truly impress(mine not so much) after a long time of not being albe to cook meat and asking for so long that i'm sure players i asked wanted to cook me (by the way you can do this meat from humans).Player range from those that are way ahead of you to same as you in level and lower . New players if you can see server list start on a newbie server to gain skills etc.meat is gotten from animals you kill with a rock your default weapon go for pigs. if you run into a wolf or bear on normal server you most likly will die. killing these animals is also how you get to not be naked.If this offends you and or you don't like this don't let your kid play . no girl models are in the game as yet as we can guess what the male gamers would do alot of the time just watch Dayz and you will see . but girls do play.I'm on a intel i7 2600k 8gig ram nvidia gtx 650 + linuxMint 17 64bit and it plays very well.As now early in the day you can find empty servers also good for new players(weekends as well).I love the game and besides the issues at the top of this post/review you will enjoy the game.It is well worth the money in my view . try it out you will have fun and your supporting a new game on your platform of choice . I look forward to future addons and the full game.It's open world thats is done pretty darn well . you build your base weapons etc and in the end it makes the game that much more your own. No one will have the same base and just the size of the world is nuts.Oh snow areas desert areas have lots of rocks to get your ore up . forest has food and trees and ore.it's all a balance you have to learn and work with . You will end up and deal with those that prey on the weaker players. your house may be broken into. you may and most likly will be killed many times. your stuff will be taken on servers that allow it.I learned all this the hard way. I just jumped in .enjoy The Modding Den

review: Rust got me back into gaming after a long break. The videos on Youtube looked hilarious and fun.I'll admit it can be maddening at times frustrating and hateful.BUT you just roll with it and keep going and it has some of the best gameplay I've ever experienced.The world is gorgeous and feels realistic. Aside from bears phasing in and out of reality the wildlife is threatening and life like.Building is fun farming is actually not unpleasant. Now... you are going to get killed. A LOT.I was murdered by a rock to my skull literally in my first two minutes of gameplay the first time I logged on.This hasn't really slown down in the higher population servers.But you get smarter. You get friends to join you or you join them. Or you make new friends.OR you just go quiet like and adapt gameplay accordingly.Some updates you'll hate but for the most part you'll enjoy the ever changing nature of the game.10/10 I recommend. I'm addicted and my enjoyment hasn't slown down at all.

I had a rock and a torch other than that I was completely naked ppl came at me with bows swords spears and even guns and they were wearing heavy armor.. so they decided to kill the new guy just getting started... 3v1...sounds like fun??? might be if you are 1 of the 3 s but seriously... do better with your life...if you feel like getting ganked 100 times before you ever get to chop down a tree or see a wolf... this is the game for you!(Edit made after trying on a test server that has pvp disabled )But to make matters worse the game itself takes a on you litteraly everything you build you have to repair and maintin on a regular basis and we are not talking once in a blue moon you build something out of STONE... it will be gone in 4 5 days... Everything you have needs repairs except apparantly your clothes the shoes you trek hundreds of miles in terrain mountains dirt roads sandy beaches they last forever...But try using a tool after you repaired it a couple of times it is the ultimate capitalism wonderland build new throw away... don't bother repairing they might aswell remove the feature... even for guns it is the same the more you repair the more crappy it gets...The worst part is you don't rly need to do any of it.. just go for a stroll and destroy a barrel or look in a box you allways find ammo guns tools... so basically just use the tool till it is at 20% health go destroying barrels and with the last 20% to get a new tool and some blueprint frags along the way...Good ing luck... For a game that came out in December 2013 that is now almost 2 years ago...It has a hell of a long Alpha test period.... and after 2 years you would have emagined they had ironed out something like the fact that all animals wether it be a Chicken Horse Bear Boar Deer or a Wolf... they all drop wolf meat.... But you can actually go find a "cooked bear steak" or "roast Chicken" in a cardboard box... so they made the cooked version but didn't bother implementing the raw meat and every thing just became wolf meat....2 years and that is still going on... omfg...Furthermore they try and sell you skins for your clothes at crazy prizes 5 10$ for a SKIN wow..

review: OK where do i even begin...THIS GAME WILL TEST YOU AND YOU WILL FAIL._________________________________ This is one of if not THE hardest game i have ever tried to continue to play. Playing this game is like being in a relationship you keep getting abused in but you keep comming even though it tortures you by letting you know how bad you are. THIS GAME IS NOT FOR EVERYONE...but its can be the most rewarding game ever As a guy who has over 1 300 hours into this hell Let me sum all the good and bad about this game.PROS Base building get creative and protect your stuff with traps and show off how good of a builder you are. Gunplay For the most part feels pretty balanced and when you lose it genually feels like its your own fault. RNG Maps every map you play on always feels unique your probably never gunna play on the same map twice in rust. Built in monuments these places are the uniqe part of rust with all the style and loot you want and desire. Survival although clearly not at its peek the survival elements you face do tend to be a big factor on how you play. Community servers PLAY ON THESE SERVERS IF YOU WANT ACTIVE ADMINS 24/7. Updated Frequently Because of this the game never really feels boring knowing your going to get new updates soon. AWSOME DEVS seriously underrated and underapreaciated thing in the whole game are the developers that make it they love this game more then we do and it shows.CONS New players im sorry but your going to struggle more then anyone else in this game because 9 times out of 10 the person you try to make friends with will very likely kill you before batting an eye at your plead for mercy. Solo life the struggle is real every time my advice for solo players is to get on solo or low pop servers. THE GRIND weither its for stone components or scrap the consistent grinding for stuff will wither on your soul. ZERGS the worst thing about rust are the s that band like 30 people in one group and take out anyone that even looks at there general direction. Offline raiding unless your solo your scum for offline raiding pure and simple and most of the people that play this game are scum. Also there is no real way to protect your base from offline raids but traps do help. Hackers people who dont have any skill use hacks to ruin everybody else's fun feels bad when you actually earn and some asshat with an aimbot just takes if from you. Server deaths most servers just die too quickly in about 2 or 3 days having no people on for you to play against sucks. Offical Servers STAY AWAY unless you want to risk being in a server with hackers and no admins to help with that. The Community I know all games have there cancer part of there fanbase but rust has at least 75% of there population made up of egotistical memeing thunder that will camp your door for hours just to get bug the out of you. Its actually at the point that the community are scaring away the new players that just want to play for fun and thats .PROS FOR NEWBIES TIPS They just recently added some helpful goals and advice for prople new to the game. Wooden lock update also recently added was that you no longer needed a key to keep if your the one who made the lock and key raiding is now no longer a thing good for yall ) I'll be honest even if you fall in love with this game your still going to hate it eventually but Im glad this game is offically out it deserves to have more people on and i look forward to the future updates of this game according to the roadmap of rust this is just the beggining. 8.5/10

review: Read this if you want to have a completely unbiased opinion on playing SOLO in the current build of rust otherwise go and read someone elses eview. I have played this game on multiple servers and the style of play doesn't vary. Therefore I put it down to the game rather than the players for the current state of the game.To save you reading this whole article if you don't want to you simply can no longer play Rust casually solo and enjoy it like you used to. Now I'm not just gonna slate the devs of this game because all in all they're doing a ing good job however I am gonna explain why some of the new features will never work like they have intended. Back before XP update the game was simple. You earn items by unlocking them through a blueprint and then crafting them with different recources which were obtainable at any stage during the game. At any time a player could obtain a high value item from a blueprint simply by hitting a barrel. Now the XP system has been introduced and updated multiple times you must grind for a minimum of at least one hour to obtain the weakest projectile weapon the bow. Before the XP system all a new player had to do was grab himself 50 cloth and a bit of wood and he was able to engage in tense early game pvp. The fact you could join a new server and get straight into pvp is what made the game so immersive and enjoyable for me.In the current version of rust I hate to dissapoint you but as a solo player 90% of you will never unlock a higher tier weapon than a crossbow. I have played for 2 wipe cycles now and by the end of each cycle I was not able to achieve a higher level without labouriously farming and grinding for an amount of time that summed up to literally hours. Of course in a larger group it is a lot easier to get levels provided you know how to utilise the ownership method to maximum efficiency.Being a solo player this is not the kind of game I would have purchased when it first came out. It's not that I completely despise the concept of farming because that is what creates part of the survival element in the game. HOWEVER as we all know if we have played rust the outrageously intense PVP is what sets this game apart from all other survival games. The fact that players must now grind so much in order to be able to fight other players now means that majority of players (unless in a group) will be at a huge disadvantage when it comes to PVP and therefore do not do it anywhere near as much as they used to pre xp update. This means that for all other solo players they will rarely find a situation in which they encounter another solo player for those intense battles the game is renonwned for.Let me know what your thoughts are and I hope that a dev will perhaps stumble upon this review.
title: Rust

review: What the **** did I just play...I literally went from running butt naked along the beach to cutting down a tree with a rock wrecking animals with a spear and then getting an AK...Woah we skipped some steps... This game is for the gamers that have time... For the gamers that are passionate and will play constantly because if you don't you will abandon your base get raided and get nowhere in the game...This game is a grinding game in which you need to gather a lot of things to make bases weapons and systems like quarries to get resources faster therefore you should connect with your friends and make a huge fortress...You need to remember that in this game once you die you lose everything so get ready for a wild ride in the world of Rust.Also keep in mind that the game has mods in which you can practice your pvp before risking your items in battle and also that the game is not well optimized so you will most likely need a pretty good rig or just stand many frame drops with no constant fps at all. 8.5/10

review: Even though i recommended the game there are problems with it. First problem is the "wipe" feature. I understand its mainly to get rid of buildings that someone has left and not touched but that ruins what players who DO play often have made. My friends and I have made countless fortresses and castle like buildings that took hours on hours of work only for the server to wipe it away. Also if someone says "Its to add the update into the game" games like Minecraft and others do that and don't wipe what you have made. Doesnt matter on how different the games may be. The second is frame rate / graphics. Obivously this is an early access game so i dont mean this as a big problem but a little more work into the graphics would help. Its a great game and has potential but i personally have stopped playing due to the #1 reason being i personally can't stand the wipe feature. Overall id say give it a shot and maybe if would fit you.

review: Ever since I bought this game I've come to love it a lot. I am a Rust Legacy player meaning I play on the non experimental version of the game mostly because it's a bit bare and my computer (which is pretty standard) can't run it smoothly enough. However I prefer Legacy anyways. No lag on low settings awesome gameplay I love being able to craft build and survive. It is very well done in terms of having stuff to do. The mechanics are fine the graphcs and models are a little wonky but it makes Legacy what it is. You meet a lot of people on this game. Some friendly others that you never want to run into again. All in all I definitely recommend this game. Just find a decent community server until they fix the hacker issues on the "official" servers.

review: Poor ventilation in the bathroom causes problems like Rust. The game is as alpha as it gets so I'm giving it some credit for the massive potential its concept has. But the execution so far has been poor...and the "community". The people who play this game? Foul antisocial adolescents. Not a game for grown ups atm. Or people who prefer not wasting their time with absolutely no defense against griefers. The general gameplay experience is as follows Spawn Get wood Look for rock Find no rocks and eventually starve to death naked and weaponless. Repeat until bored. Quit. The game is also very laggy in more than one respect. The servers obviously but the menus also freeze for a not so insignificant amount of time when navigating and choosing options.Not to mention the OVER zealous banning system they created I am for all intensive purposes banned. What is my crime? I dunno. I got a message on the game stating i was banned no explanation. SO i contacted the support team. Asking what or when it happened. The response was " your ban was legitimate." Not what or when. the best i can surmise is the poor connectivity I have with most "official" servers. So ya I've had this game for a LONNNGGGG while. and you know what. I waited for it to get better. IT REALLY HASN'T. I truly wish I could be refunded for this pile.Poor ventilation in the bathroom causes problems like Rust. Sorry it's just so fitting

review: So I decided to change my review. My choice to change it happened when I realized that the developers are working not only to get new skins in the game but also to make the game run more smooth. It seems to me they are always trying to find a way to improve the game. I only noticed the design and "feel" of the game developing previously. Now I'm finally experiencing it. This game now runs smooth on the minimum recommended specs maybe not on ultra settings but still. Smooth. And the developers are not afraid of trying new things. The most major change was when they implemented a level system but maybe the most interesting time was when they removed it after a while realizing Rust wasn't that kind of a game. Also I'm a PVE player allthough 95% of my time has been on PVP servers. With the new items and the desire to implement new stuff such as power and powersources more and more PVE servers seem to pop up. In the end you shouldn't be surprised if the whole system has changed from being mainly a PVP game to a game where settlers sometimes NEED to co operate. But that's only speculating. I am very excited about this game and the future of it. I highly recommend people to start playing now. This has proven to be a great journey so forth._________________________________________________________Previous not recommended review "So unless you have 12 available hours to start your game and you know exactly what you're doing and have found a spot where noone with explosives can find you this game is not for beginners. Like beginners in Rust. This game is almost only for old time Rust players. There are no friendly servers only raiding and killing. Don't matter that you're obviously new you're just an easier target and you will get killed and raided. Unless you have a bunker as I said. "You wake up naked on a beach with a rock and a torch. You have about 1 hr to make tools for hunting or find wild growing food before you die of starvation. Bear and wolf will attack you and kill you. So you must build a house to be safe from wolves and bears. You can only "harvest" wood and stone for building material in the beginning. Bears have no trouble getting into your wooden house so you need a second floor or find more materials to build a tool storage so can upgrade your house to stone. If you're not into running around naked while doing all of the above you also need to find materials for clothes. But the biggest threat are other players that will kill you on sight (most probably) raid your house and make you start as you did first time you pressed "Play Game". You can make your house unraidable but then you need a furnace and a lot of materials. And of course ppl have explosives so they will get into your house unless you make it all armored but that take even longer time.So unless you have 12 available hours to start your game and you know exactly what you're doing and have found a spot where noone with explosives can find you this game is not for beginners. Like beginners in Rust. This game is almost only for old time Rust players. There are no friendly servers only raiding and killing. Don't matter that you're obviously new you're just an easier target and you will get killed and raided. Unless you have a bunker as I said.

The only real hope for not being raided is build a looking place with hundreds of walls around it or joina server early on before too many players join the server and become a bandit yourself. review: Rust sells itself as a survival game "The only aim in Rust is to survive. To do this you will need to overcome struggles such as hunger thirst and cold. Build a fire. Build a shelter. Kill animals for meat. Protect yourself from other players."That selling is only correct in the last sentence.I assumed that there was a more compelling "man vs. nature" element to the game scarce food scarce clothing scarce shelter and that it would drive player interactions. Sure I may team up with someone and make a shelter together. Or it could be that only one of us can live with what we've got. In which case one of us may have to kill the other. We may team up and defend ourselves. Or we may turn on each other or hunt players as the best means to survive against the elements.In reality there's an over abundance of resources. The materials to make food clothing and shelter are everywhere. One doesn't have to kill anyone to survive against nature. Ever.Which brings out the actual gameplay one has to kill other players because they will kill you and take your stuff. For fun.This isn't a man vs. nature survival game. It's a PVP/looting/raiding game. Which for some reason wants to start you out with a rock and no pants.Still it's fun in it's own way. But whenever I play I'm always left with the feeling that this isn't the game I thought it was.

review: Rust is a very interesting game with a lot of potential but in my opinion removing a very liked system (the bp system) from the game and replacing it with a bunch of different less liked by the community systems (xp component) ruined the game. I say this because of how the game feels now versus back in the bp system rust used to feel like a community game full of solo and duo groups that were relatively friendly towards eachother but since the gain in popularity the playerbase has shifted to extremely large and hostile groups removing the fun of playing casually. Now I understand a change like this makes sense but the devs haven't helped simply made it easier for large groups with every change they make for example the components system made it easy for groups to control monuments and prevent the spread of compenents necessary to aquire almost everything. AKs need rifle bodies to craft and that means loot spawns can be exploited so you have no chance of standing up to larger groups with better weapons than you. Rust's buiding system used to be so fun to play around with but alas now it has been downgraded for mostly smaller groups. How was this done you may ask 2 changes 1. Allowing building within an unowned building cupboard 2. Removing wall stacking from the game. Wall stacking was an amazing feature that allowed for strong bases that were very compact and it was very expensive to scale it up to a large clan size so it mainly helped everyone else.TLDR Not worth $35 play with a group of friends you don't care about losing

review: I love this game and I hate this game.DO NOT BUY THIS GAME IF you want to do anything other than raiding and PvP unless you play on your own server. The playerbase is a toxic puddle rivaled only by League of Legends. SURVIVAL in Rust is not about fighting the elements disease or even hunger. It's about human interaction. You know what you're probably on your PC to avoid. Anyway I suspect the "Survival" tag must be a Facepunch joke because you never ever will.What is hilarious about the playerbase is that there are people who claim to be friendly but just like a real life situation you have no way of knowing what will happen. This results in interactions with players that are so tense you could swear every player's butt is physically gripping the very seat in which in rests in anticipation of a hostile action. This is going to result in a lot of ruined computer chairs.The economy of this game is raiding. If you play on a public server and you don't raid you're a naked broken pile of that now owns a decrepit decaying hovel has no food no means of defense and a broken angry disappointing view of life that hates itself as much as it hates you. If you play on a public server and you do raid you're a naked broken pile of that just raided another naked broken pile of But your place... well your place isn't so bad any oh you were raided.

review: i see players ing about other players and rust's pvp elements and how they kill you when they see you even if you're butt naked and got nothing more than a stone and a torch with you etc etc.but that's not the problem with rust. i think it actually adds a lot of thrill and a little bit of difficulty to the game.the actual problem with rust is it's emptiness.after more than 2 years of development it still feels like an empty shell. once you got all the craftable stuff and a nice home base there's nothing more to do. the game ends. of course you could team up with other players and raid some bases. of course you could expand your home base make it huge. but for what? after less than 100 hours of gameplay you already saw everything. researched everything. explored everything. did almost everything you could do. the experience comes to an abrupt halt as you reach the limits of this game.the real problem is rust's lack of content.another thing that bothers me is more technical in nature.there are still plenty of bugs like weird lag when an active player is near you (gives you sixth sense P). teleporting bears and wolves. wildlife that runs through rocks and walls. bears and wolves spawning right next to you or directly under your foundation killing you through walls. etc. etc. etc.altogether i enjoyed the game so far and i'm looking forward to more content. and yes i'm going to play it in the future. but i really can't recommend it as it is right now. buy a game with more content till they fixed some bugs and added content that increases rust's replay value that's my advice.
title: Rust

review: Excellent Game its fully online there is no single player unless you create your own server. The standard servers are crazy so many players killing noobs. The community and modded servers are much nicer there's Rust++ and oxide addons to download for your server you can control pvp day settings chat etc.. The basics of the game is to stay alive. Gather wood rock and metal to build houses clothes and weapons. Make bombs to blow up other players walls and raid there house shoot them and steal there loot. You can't dig or fly there are no cars or bikes. The map is big enough for about 150 players but you notice 20 50 online it is easy to get lost but not to the extent ull never find home again.My advice its worth the price I brought it for a weekend game something to do IM now hooked with a full M4 with laser dot holo sights silencer and a flashlight as well as a sniper rifle a huge metal house with spikes on the walls. kevlar armor and cans of tuna! And all I started with was a rock and a fire torch.

review: I love this game I loved legacy but honestly #FireHelk. I understand he's turning his game into his vision but now it's just getting ridiculous.Twig update needs to be reversed raiding is stupidly easy and you're lucky to survive one day on a server.Servers empty out within 2 3 days. (20/300 online players 560 sleepers on most servers I play on for example) Incompatibilities with most software like f.lux and MSI Afterburner cause stuttering and sometimes just making the game unplayable. No documentation either just forum posts and finding out the hard way.Early Access for 4 years still isn't in Beta. New roadmap shows another possible two years before game is fully released.EARLY ACCESS IS FOR GAMES REQUIRING FEEDBACK OR ALMOST COMPLETE AND NEED BUGS REPORTED. A BARELY DEVELOPED GAME SHOULD NOT BE FOR SALE AT $20.Constantly changing between core systems.Blueprints worked fine and people are actually switching back to that old version and finding it to be better.XP System was complete garbage and they removed that after a while.Components is unbalanced and barrels are broken as you can hit a barrel get a gun or hit 30 barrels and maybe get enough gears to make a decent door or a ladder hatch. Random components that do nothing fill the loot tables as well.I've played this game way more than I should have. I've made a lot of friends a lot of enemies and I've spent a lot of time having fun but at this point I just can't recommend it to anyone when the stuttering and issues have gotten so bad if I can even launch it. This is not just me either most of my entire Discord of 30+ people are unable to have good gameplay.

review: This early access game is kind of like "modern society simulator". Finding the right server and community to play with being part of that community getting friends getting betrayed and a lot more is included in this game.The company developing this game Facepunch developer of Garry's Mod keeps the game updated and it contains loads of fun especially if taking into consideration the fact that it's still in alpha stage. Bugs and such do exist in the game though usually they are minor and the most major ones are fixed by the team in few weeks even days.Getting started in Rust is going to be a long journey if you have no knowledge of the game. Gathering enough resources to craft your very first Stone Hatchet is a satisfying trip to learning more about the game and what you might find when proceeding closer to the end game gear. Got your base ready set of Kevlar equipped enough weaponry to beat anyone who comes at you? Go and blast a wall of another player. Grab all the loot you can. Get the hell out. Developed better tactics for... Whatever you might need. Raiding building surviving trading there are several things where you can develop.if you have any doubt if you should buy this or not I recommend to do so. The game is still unfinished but still great.
title: Rust

It will cause you to panic but teaching you that survival works best if you have another player with you. Once you play for a while you will eventually get a virtually indestructable base you will get nicer weapons and you(and hopefully friends) will all raid bases in hope of obtaining better loot. review: This game has some fantastic qualities. It really makes you feel like this world is desolate and anything could go wrong at any moment. It is harsh realistic and makes me execute choices I would actually make in real life. Such as whether to shoot someone or to talk it out with them.There are also no bandit points which measn no one is FORCED to be good. You always need to watch your back. Its also has things i would like to change. Sometimes groups can get way too powerful and just take over an entire map. That should be balanaced out. Also finding guns is way too easy. You can find freaking military style rifle blueprints EVERYWHERE. The guns need to be trimmed down or much harder to find. I find the idea of more homemade guns much more exciting and challenging and realistic. Also the game needs ggraphic help becuae sometimes it gets really really laggy even on fastest graphics.

review: Well the concept is good but the game is not confusing as hell and poorly constructed. Now i dont have much time in the game because its hard to get into theres no map very glitchy and laggy (and its not my computer i have a 2014 alienware mx17). Also the resources (other than wood) are SUPER hard to find. I have played 1.5 hours so far and have yet to find stone/ores its impossible. Many feel the same via chat. RECCOMENDATION TO THE MAKERS Please please please add a map for starters first thing hands down next make resources easier to find and mabey even a different color than the mountain of boulders. The game is just to hard in the beggining very frustrating and discouraging. Lag and glitches seem to be the norm so mabey limit the amount of players in a server and reduce some detail. My setting is on fastest and its still horrible. In conclusion i think you have a great idea and i do reccomend the game based on the vision but as far as were is stands now I do not reccomend to people this game at its current stage it definatly is not worth $20 as it is.

review: After playing this game for a few days now and reading a lot of the negative reviews Ive come to realize that most players judge the game by a few idiot players who dont want to build or craft. All they are interested is braining others with their rocks and hatchets. Advice Find a good server (shop around) you paid money right? Take the time to find a good server. Ive been through about 12. Cheating admins who give their buddies full kevlar and M4s bad server. 189 ppl out of 200..... probably bad server. People screaming and chasing you... probably bad server. Find a low population server Less populaton means less chance to run into someone and more resources for you. Having a fresh wiped server helps too. Even playing fieldPlay with buddies!!! this makes the game SO MUCH BETTER! its kind of obvious but still...Lastly and probably the best advice I could give for solo play build AWAY from the road. I understand its a pain in the to be away from zombies as they drop good stuff but thats where most of the population sits. Build a bow craft some cheap armor hit the rad camps when no one is on or at day break. Learn the map and where you can pick off a few easy crates and zombies and dont bring anything important with you. Its a huge map use it to your advantage. Everyone has a unique oportunity to see this game grow and anyone with a brain can see the potential this game has. Agreed not everyone is a PVP fan but its gonna happen. Very few games had people interacting like this who has power who doesn't what to do when you give a hand grenade to a caveman who is at his neighbor? It WILL you off you just have to take the time and play the game and not write an angry review after someone blew a hole in your wall and took all your chocolate bars.Lastly... again If anyone important is reading this... this game needs DINOSAURS! Pick a hidden corner of the map and put a valley of the dinos or something.
title: Rust

review: Overall Rust has so far been a very enjoyable title and I don't generally have much to complain about. Although some things obviously do not make sense being it is still in development. A bear running towards me at should probably definetly NOT be able to survive two shotgun slugs consecutively in the cranium. I'm no scientist but this just appears very implausible to my pea brain. I would only reccomend this game if you have a few friends willing to embark on your adventure since in fact not only do you have to deal with other large teams but bears that have super powers. I kindly request my loot to be returned as soon as possible. Thanks!

review: I think this game is pretty good overall.If you are looking for a survival game you are at the wrong adress. It's mostly grinding and PVP.Interactions between players seem really scarce mostly everyone will just shoot and kill you even if you have nothing since there is no reward for not doing so.Base building is pretty simple and easy learnable at least in my opinion.if you playing solo as a new player you are gonna have a hard time.I would recommend this game to poeple who love to PVP / dont care much for interactions and poeple who do not mind losing everything (including theyr base and stuff) and start fresh every now and then.

review: Great game but could have a few adjustmentsThis is an awesome survival game probably one of the best yet. Very hardcore though you have to play it often because when you go offline your character is sleeping and can be looted and killed. This is fine for most people and it certainly makes the game more exciting but if you dont have alot of time to play i dont reccommend it. Ive had alot of fun with it though despite being killed multpile times and having to start over. DProbably one of the biggest "cons" for me atleast is that it takes alot of internet connection to play smoothly even with graphics quality down. So unless you have some of the best wifi around DEFINETELY turn down your graphics quality.Suggestion/complaint Beside the connection requirement really th eonly other problem i have with rust is that you spawn with a random gender and skin tone. I did a bit of reading and i learned that it was created like that to be realistic. I understand trying to be realistic but i personally think its over the top. I mean you get chicken from any animals you kill but you cant chose your gender... REALLY?!

review: Rust so far has been an impressive comparison to Minecraft for a survival genre. It lacks the extensive creativity and freedom that Minecraft gave you but it offers up a more challenging experience. The days are as dangerous as the nights save for the light you're given by the sun. The variety of what you can make and how you can get materials is fun in itself making you find plans to craft better items rather than handing it all to you. The only downside I have found thus far is the lack of animals that spawn unless you find one of the few areas that are teeming with them. At the same time it provides little love for any new comers risking your survival by placing you in any random location including ones with the more dangerous mobs. I look forward to updates and the completed product.

review: Firstly when playing this game you must remember it's in ALPHA. That means it's still undergoing a lot of development so nothing I write is based on playability or glitches. That said if you choose your graphics setting carefully at the start (there are only 3 options to change) it is pretty good for an Alpha release.To set the scene you're a survivor of an apocolypse. The world has been sent back to the stone ages but survivors have a lot of knowledge of 20th 21st century inventions like guns and buildings.If you're one of those players who like to reach a goal in a game this game is not for you. It is ruthless! Actually it's just that many of the players are ruthless the game itself just gives you the tools to choose how you want to behave.When you first spawn you're almost a caveman. You're naked (only males in this game which is sad for the perverts out there) and you have in your possession a rock (that's your weapon and tool) a couple of bandages and a wooden fire based torch. You're in a large world like environment similar towalking around the map of Skyrim.Don't light the torch!Torches fires furnaces etc can easily be seen by other players especially at night It makes you a potential target.The location you spawn in is fairly random but having respawned next to ther players like me I'm guessing the spawn points are pretty much pre decided but that's OK I'd rather spawn near some noobs with the same limited items than appear in the middle of a gunfight.The next thing that usually happens for new players is death. That's because most people playing the game don't trust anyone. Not even someone with an almost harmless rock as a weapon. They tend to kill and ask questions later. Don't get upset it's the nature of the game. You will get used to it.There is no built in map no compass in fact very little to help new players other than blogs and guides written by other players. Sounds boring doesn't it? Let me assure you it isn't.If you only like games where you always gain the upper hand in a fight this game is not for you. If you're a rage quitter this game will ruin your keyboard from quitting so much. You will get angry you will make friends (make friends seriously if you don't you will die a lot) you will feel pride in your achievements and you will become house proud of a few bits of wood nailed together to make a shack or hut.Research the game download and print a map (there are some online) and read the guides. At the very least read the beginners guide written by a player and hosted on the Steam guides page. Next you're ready to play.If you've already played or ignored what I said in the previous paragraph you died didn't you? Get used to it In this game you will die a lot and respawn in pseudo random locations. The trick is to figure out where you spawned and where you want to be so you can get there.If you read the guide and survived your first night here's a few tips to help you move along in the game.1. Find a place to liveSounds easy? Not when you have to build it yourself away from too much traffic and close enough to resources to build it quickly. Don't start off planning to build a super fortress similar to others you're likely to see You don't have time yet. Build a simple hut (not a shack like the guide suggests) so later you can add to it. Once you have a small home put a sleeping bad in it. A sleeping bag makes a future respawn point if you leave the game. You do not respawn there if you were killed.2. Keep warm.When you kill animal for raw food (every animal give you raw chicken even a wolf or bear) you also acquire a few by products like cloth Make some cloth armour (be honest they're clothes with a fancy title). It will keep you warm at night so you don't feel the cold but also make you an attractive target during the day as it signifies that you have something worth taking.3. Make better weaponsYou will need them. At the very least make a stone hatchet to improve the speed you acquire resources and replace your rock with it.3. Grab some blueprintsLet's be honest we're not all engineers. To learn how to make better things you need knowledge. in this game knowledge is power. You gather blueprints from several places including zombies (the black ones usually harder to kill of course) a few suitcases dotted around and by disassembling an item you acquired from another player you killed.4. Avoid excessive radiation exposureDid I mention the game was set in a post apocolypse? Several areas in the game are radioactive and can cause you harm especially if/when your 'rad count' exceeds 500. The good news is the rad count decreases when you're not being microwaved by ambient radiation. I wondered why the game designers would include such no go areas but it seems there's lots of loot in them. If you can get in and out quickly you can gather weapons and lots more. There's even a blueprint for a rad suit to make you immune to the stuff.Beyond that it's a case of building a better home (or base) making friends online so you have a clan or allies and stay alive as long as you can. You can choose to be a bandit (typically no base as such just roam around and kill people) or helpful. Personally I try to help. because I've had my face blown off enough times to learn how much it hurts.There are many new elements being added to the game (like cars they're planned for a future release) and always something new to learn. You can talk in public via text chat (visible to everyone) or you can talk verbally (nearby players only). Usually clan members and allies will talk privately on Skype etc but you'll soon figure it out.Many common questions I've read and replied to include 1. How do I cook food?Kill an animal get some raw meat build a campfire look at the campfire and when it says "Use" press and hold the "E" key. This opens a small sub menu and allows you to use your mouse to click "Open". Add raw food (I suggest 2 chicken per spare slot) and some wood (1 piece will cook 2 pieces of chicken in each slot giving up to 6 pieces for 1 piece of wood). Light the fire and wait till it goes out then the food is cooked and safe to eat.2. Is there a map?No. Not in the game itself read above and find one online.3. How do I know where I am?More importantly how do you know which way you're facing? The sun will tell you this. It rises in the east sets in the west and typically a game day last 45 minutes the night lasts 15 minutes. To figure out "where" you are run down the road and find a common landmark. You can usually work out where you are on the map once you find one. To help work out the direction you're travelling if the road seems to bear to the right you're usually travelling clockwise handy to know if the sun is overhead and you have no idea which way is east/west.4. How do I craf something?Open your inventory (press the TAB key). At the top of the screen is a crafting option to open the menu. From here you can select items to make and also determine what resources you need to make any item you're aware of.5. Can I go to one server craft something and bring it here?No. Each server is a self contained world. You can play on multiple servers if you want you cannot transfer resources between them.Overall I love this game even though I'm really bad at playing it. I was never fantastic at shoot em ups but I love playing them. I never really got into building games except maybe Little Big Planet and this games puts both of those games into a blender mushes them together and produces a FPS building game combining all that's best of games like Minecraft and Call of Duty with a medieval twist.If you don't like dying (a lot) this game is not for you If you like a challenge you will love this! Friends enemies and bob the builder all rolled into one!

review: I like this game because it's a combination of elements from DayZ and Minecraft while still having elements that give it its own identity. It's an alpha game at the moment that has plenty of hooks to keep me playing and was well worth the $20 pricetag. Rusts runs well smoothly with very few bugs that either aren't noticeable or they are easily fixed via console commands. This game has PvE content but the main focus is PvP and base building. There are problems with cheating/hacking but if you find a good server with a vigilant admin then those problems become non existant. I am playing on a Canadian server and having a blast and am impressed with the admin's ability to step in and "resolve" problems.

review: So as some of you may know I recently purchased the video game Rust a survival game roughly based on the likes of Minecraft and DayZ. Day 1 I was dropped into the game as a naked caveman (don t worry it is censored) with nothing but a rock torch and flashlight. What could possibly go wrong right? Well this is exactly what I thought until I realized that there were two people with guns and in full armor heading towards me. Without a second thought they shot me in the face and I had to start over not that I had accomplished much.This is exactly what Rust is. Kill on Sight mayhem having all your hard earned supplies stolen from you dealing with liars and bandits but despite all the FRUSTRATION and ANGER at the game and other players to begin with you finally start to get the hang of it. Before long you ve crafted your first hatchet and you re happily gathering wood Chicken Breast (which comes from every animal in the game strangely enough) cloth and stone. Eventually you ll have a bow and arrow and are able to defend yourself from zombies and wolves except at this point you are still highly fearful of other players who may have guns.The game is based in a post apocalyptic island in the middle of nowhere. The island is MASSIVE and at any one time there can up to 300 people connected to the game. Walking through the wilderness for hours on end not seeing a soul or even so much as an animal but yet seeing the ruins of people s houses that came before you people that made mistakes and got raided and killed is a very strange and even eerie feeling. You learn that even though you can become powerful in the game control all the guns enslave others it is a very slippery slope back to being a naked caveman again. Once you have fallen why would people trust you again and help you back up?I honestly don t know what keeps me drawn to this game but it draws me like a magnet. The game is incredibly fun long term but very frustrating short term. Whenever you lose everything be it from death by a wolf naked caveman with a gun or simply starving to death yes it s annoying yes it angers you but you gain experience which makes bouncing back even easier than before. I had a mansion but it is now little more than a pile of ashes on the ground thanks to raiders. This sort of thing will make you very angry however you have learned not to build near the road.Lastly even though you meet people who kill you on sight the thing that makes me feel really good is when you meet someone and they don t kill you instead they give you a gift or help you with something. These are the types of players that make the game worthwhile these are the players that restore your faith in the game and these are the players that make this game work so flawlessly.
title: Rust

review: Rust is very fun. That's basically why I would recommend it. Because despite various bugs and glitches at its core it is fun. Especially the tense (and the silly) moments it creates. Like one experience I had the other day I was struggling to find food when suddenly I came across a small valley full of boulders and animals (targets for my makeshift stone hatchet). I quickly killed and collected all the animals and resources (because screw animal lovers I guess?). Then darkness fell and I went back to my little hut. Night is quite long in my opinion and this story happened the day before the patch that made night not so black. During the extensive period of pitch black a naked Irishmen approached my door with a revolver and a hatchet. He attempted to break down my door. When I talked to him over the mic he offered to let me live if I gave him all my stuff. Well I thought then I might as well die. I told him "You know I have shotgun."I lied...He replied "we both know you're gonna die." And then I thought...SCREW THAT. I'll kill him first! And so while listening to him smack my wooden door with a hatchet I crafted a pipe shotgun and 30 rounds of homemade shells. When I was done I opened the door and fired a round into his torso. He shot me twice before I closed the door. He started swearing at me and said I must be hacking for not dying. Suddenly an unknown savior sprinted into the clearing and blasted my assailant with a shotgun (a real one not a homemade one). I found the Irishmen's body in the morning with a nice load of food and ammo but he was missing his gun. If I had to complain or give constructive criticism I would say navigating is difficult as the lanscape is all the same. And night is still too dark.

review: Easily one of the best survival games I have played and far better than DayZ. 5 minutes into the game I met another player who helped me kill a wolf and get some cloth armour. He gave me a pickaxe so I wouldn't have to use the rock and gave me some pointers told me if I needed anything to just come by his house then sent me on my way. I was then taken by surprise by three other players with leather armour and M4's they were asking me about raiding their camp but I told them that I had just started they took my word and even gave me a full set of leather armour and apologized for threatening me. That first encounter is what really made me want to play this game more to help other newcomers. It is an amazing experience alone but fantastic when you have a friend to play with. As it says the only aim is to survive. If you've been looking for a good survival experience that is still only in ALPHA look no further than RUST.

review: I bought into the hype and purchased Rust in a drunken holiday sale binge. I'd never played any sort of survival/free play game (like DayZ etc) so the concept alone was new to me. I also did no research or reading on the game so I entered completely blind and dumb. I'd say it took me a good 5 play sessions of 30+ minutes apiece to start getting the hang of things. Figuring out how to even gather resources the 0th step essentially took me some time not only because I got KOS'd a couple times but also because resources aren't available everywhere (wood is from trees but it's super super slow/inefficient). Once I found resource spawns then it took me awhile to realize that crafting is available all the time from a dropdown at the top next to inventory and armor. After that it's less a survival game and more of a social engineering/navigation game where you are more worried about being killed gathering wood by some random player than zombies or bears. But there is that drive to keep surviging longer each time. I've died a ton and have only gotten started on a 'base' that might actually survive a day but it's been a blast and it's awesome being able to experience it all as it is developed.
title: Rust

review: REMINDER This game is in Early Access it's not going to be perfect!Pros Graphically beautiful! Each map has a variety of different environments (biomes) all hosting distinct features!Easily understandable progression system (subject to change). The blueprint system has made this game less EZ MODE for clans which is good and bad for solo players.Forces you to be social! Sorry you hermits you either make friends in the game or you die!Cons Not optimized to it's full potential. There are some areas that can come under some serious FPS lag. (This issue has gotten better over time.)Side Notes This game is kill or be killed. New/Solo players can/will find it hard to play if you jump straight in to a high population server! Please don't hurt your chances of loving this game by going somewhere that's above your current skill level! I've seen too many new players get turned off by the fact that the more serious players on high pop servers rip them to shreds on sight. This game is great and has amazing potential once it hits beta. Please play with friends or start on low pop servers!

review: As I'm sure has been said a thousand times Rust is best described as a cross between Minecraft and Day Z You wake up in a relatively deserted landscape collect supplies build a house craft weapons explore and survive zombies/animals/other players. And like Minecraft and Day Z there is something inherently fun about this simple goal. Yet in it's current state (an Alpha pre release) it tends to be quite frustrating too.Playing with only a handful of other rival players can be difficult and playing with a full server is pretty much impossible. A lot will obviously be changed over the course of the development but I really hope they make the early part of the game easier to get into. I almost gave up after the first time playing as it's fairly easy to spend a lot of time building supplies only to have everything wiped out after getting killed by a stray zombie (who will continue to hang around your house and kill you over and over if you attempt to collect your items).I have a lot of minor complaints most of which I wont bother with as I'm sure they will be addressed in future updates. But they really should re engineer things like stucture decay and looting. It's demoralizing coming back to the game after only a couple days absence and finding everything you've worked toward completely gone. What makes a game like Minecraft fun is that you can keep building on what you've done. But in Rust you are forced to start from scratch too frequently and collecting the large amount of wood an rocks required to rebuild a house isn't fun enough that I want to keep doing it.I am recommending this game because it shows potentiial. No matter what direction the developers go in I'd be willing to bet modders will eat this game up. And there will eventually be gameplay styles for all tastes and sizes.My rating (so far) 3/5
title: Rust

review: Don't waste your time with this game. You might have some hours of enjoyment hell maybe even get your money out of it. But with how things are going this is appearing to be another abandoned project in favor of other smaller ones. It may or may not get finished.As well The community mindset is a terrible one kill or be killed. Even if you establish a house or base to live in somebody who has been on the server far longer then you is going to find it ruin it and kill you because they have nothing better to do. The game gets repetative after only a few hours so unless you like resource grinding running the same routes over and over and losing all your progress when you die or your house is destroyed then this isn't the game for you.As well Don't expect to be able to host your own server for a very long time unless you have additional funds to shell out to a third party company every month. There is NO hosting ability outside of that you will be forced onto servers other people have and goodluck trying to set things up with your friends. The community is toxic and not fun to try and associate with.Again I wouldn't reccomend this. Yes I've gotten over 90 hours out of it but that was before it became a chore to play.

review: with a persistent character presense on the server (ie when you log out your unconcious body is still killable) you need to carefully plan out were you hide from scavengers and bandits. wildlife is definitely a consideration even the zombies but the most dangerous creature in this world is the ravenous greed of other human beings and this game presents this well. The building mechanics work very well but easily griefed (yet more strategic building considerations to take into account).all in all considering this game is still in alpha there is a LOT like and with the recent fixes to most of the hackers the game environment is more and more fun.word of advice though. find friends and find them fast a solo player is easily squished.

review: Mental Anguish.If you want serious emotional highs and lows so much indeed I feel comparing it to crack wouldn't exemplify it enough! I have experienced each emotion within a single gaming session(6.4 hrs avg.) I feel I should be seeing a shrink. However if you are looking for a replacement to Minecraft that is more in tune of mature audiences then Rust is for you. If you are looking for a zombie survival feel but instead of mindless zombies trying to kill you its intelligent(sometimes..) humans and AI trying to kill you. Then Rust is for you.That being said I love this game and am looking forward to more updates(vehicles?!). The survival aspect is amplified in this game which is a serious desire I had not previously known existed. You must survive against violent animals and violent humans plus more things designed to kill you. Disappointment is constant feeling. And yet I must find my way in the unforgiving Rust lands and design the most secure yet awesome looking base I can while still conforming to honeycombing(look it up) lest I be annhilated within a day. For the small victories are worth the pain it takes to get there...TIR

review: The gameplay is fun but there are some serious issues that need to be taken care of before it can be successful 1. Aimbotters are all over. They make it impossible to play the game because they'll headshot you from 70m away with a pistol. Two consecutive shots and you're dead already without even seeing them. With a BAR or maybe M4A1 I can understand but not a 9mm pistol.Along with this they do not seem to have any form of moderation on their official servers. Private servers obviously have some staff to address issues like aimbotting but the official servers do not have any.2. The game has horrible white noise 24/7. The day is worse than at night. It's like a constant waterfall in my ears and it's NOT pleasant. After playing for an hour and taking a break my ears shouldn't be ringing when I'm on 7% volume.This white noise can't be from radiation as radiation doesn't actually create the noise.Those are my problems with the game. I understand that aimbotting is always going to be there but there should at least be people on the official servers who can combat it.

review: The gameplay is really fun. I really liked how your player is still in the game when you arent playing. Making friends and exploring or banding together and fighting against other groups is really cool. I've put about 80 hours into this game and theres always something new. Logging on and seeing that the camp we all tried to protect was raided sucks but its also kinda fun! It's part of the game. One problem this game has is cheaters. By cheaters I mean hackers. When someone crafts or finds door charges then blows a hole in the side of my base or blows open a door I know they worked hard to craft those charges or get to an airdrop. Seeing people fly around and glitching through the ceiling of bases and taking everything really takes away from the fun of this game. I couldnt reccommend it to anyone until hacking is eliminated.
title: Rust

review: Fun game to play!
title: Rust

review: Best 20$ I ve ever spent on a game in my life. With over 20 years of gaming and more then 1300 hours invested in THIS game I can honestly say it is my favorite game I ve ever played. At times the community can be extremely toxic but the same is true for any multiplayer game. I m greatly impressed with how quickly bugs and exploits are fixed and the rate at which Rust is being developed. You can tell the dev team really cares about it. A desperate market existing for in game skins is a great way to generate additional revenue to continue developing further content. I strongly recommend this game above all others in fact and have only now reviewed it at the request of Kcmo Vertiigo Suspect and Helk after watching the latest KCMo video on YouTube (10/18/17). I do agree mostly with Vertiigo that the game needs more of a survival aspect(I.e. more scavenging environmental hazards air encounters etc.) but as is the game is exceptional. Good fighting the good fight devs!! Your work is appreciated.
title: Rust

review: Let me be clear about this review I am rating my experience with rust so far over my nearly 1600 hours of game play (so far). When I rate this game or any game it s about the hours of enjoyable played time you get vs dollars spent on the game Rust is a 20$ game so you should expect at least 20 hours of enjoyable gameplay out of it right?Wrong.Pro s Rust is an open world survival game that gives many people thousands upon thousands of hours of content and it s still in early access. I have plainly and simply enjoyed nearly all the time I have spent playing this game and I ll list the reasons why below.1) Semi weekly weekly bi weekly monthly server wipes provide endless content and keeps the game fresh.2) Active developers who pop out weekly updates and are vigorously trying to improve their game.3) The game has a big team aspect that encourages players to play with friends.4) Recently improved gunplay gives firearms in this game a higher skill cap for more gifted players to shine.5) Raiding system encourages good base building as a counter measure.6) Current farming system feels right in the amount of materials given and keeps the early game going longer.I m sure there are more pro s but for now this is my list.Con s Helk hear me I say this with love.1) Auto Turrets are too over powered 1 or 2 turrets outside of a base that s being raided and it s almost impossible to counter and achieve anything.2) Gun damage isn t high enough on some guns for example the Semi Automatic Rifle and Revolver take like 5 8 shots to put down a full geared guy depending on distance and where you hit them. Not everyone is Curtis Jackson and can manage getting shot 8 times and living to tell the tale.3) Med pens are too easy to make I feel that they heal for the right amount but they need to do something to make sure someone can t just pop down a wall and use 6 med pens to full heal if you just shot the guy 5 times and he didn t die.4) High external walls should be for base defense (only droppable in TC range) and not be deployable in the open this causes too many entities in the server and for some people with less extravagant computers often experience lag because of the hundreds of entities introduced by the new BP system5) I am not a big fan of the new bp system because of how it extends the early game it s mainly because I m not that good at primitive combat and am mainly skilled with fire arms.6) This is NOT friendly to solo players or people who are new to the game.With respect this is one of my favorite games of all time I love it it needs work but that s why it s still in early access. If you have friends that play and can show you the ropes this game is great. I recommend it 100%.
title: Rust

review: This game is cutthroat. Make no mistake. You will die a lot. You will try things and you will fail. You will work hard and another player will roll up on you and take ALL of your stuff. And that is what makes this game unique and fun.I'm not particularly good at this game and I tend to lose my bases to clans or I lose fights because I get outnumbered. But that's competitive online play no reason to be salty about it. I just jump on again later and start from square one. The progression is fun the combat is good and the building/crafting system is far better than what every other game has to offer.People complain about changes lately but this game is evolving faster and it catering to the community more than any other game that I have ever played. The devs are putting in hard work on this game and that needs to be recognized. So much love and effort has gone into this masterpiece and it shows.

review: This game should be used by parents to teach their children about life. Rust teaches you if you to work hard work countless hours towards a goal and you'll be rewarded with great things!....rust also does a great job of teaching you that someone else will think it's way easier to just kill you gloat about how awesome they are and take all your stuff.You may hold on to your morals/dignity for a while but eventually you'll give in and realize that the only way to get ahead in "the game" is to become that which you hate.Later after establishing yourself and "making it" you'll have the oppurtunity to help other people by providing them with supplies and friendly banter. Sadly once out of your line of sight they'll be pillaged and left for dead. On the upside at least you feel better about yourself!End game is pretty boring though. Once you've built a house and collected more than enough supplies their isn't much else to do at the moment. Your bordem will lead to ransacking your neighbors houses for more stuff that you don't need. Eventually you'll need more room in your house to store the stuff you don't need and have to build a bigger house.....and it goes on and on.5/5 I enjoyed the social aspect of the game. At times I wanted to quit but I stuck it out and was rewarded with other people's stuff.

review: Rust is a crazy fun game with a few friends if you can get passed the first native stages of bows and spears. Getting your base down and crafting up the weapons tools and armor to go terrorise the locals is rewarding and creative enough to keep you coming back for more. As a solo player this game is ruthless filled with teams of experienced killers waiting to find your lonely buttocks to take all of your hard earned loot. Staying alive and under the radar is key to surivival alone. It may seem hopeless at times especially when you can't get passed the hordes of spawn killers at the beach. Strive through the turmoil and find the most rewarding experience you can ask for in a game not hospitable towards anybody. You are not special in anyones eyes. If your social skills can earn you new companions you may find friends you keep for good. Those few may teach you the lessons required to survive in a heavily PvP oriented crafting survival masterpiece nowhere near its completion. Expect more from this game than you can imagine. There is still more to come.

review: Rust EA alpha was one of the most fun experiences I have had in years sadly it was very short lived. The developement of the game itself was virtually nonexistant. The vision and route the creator and his team had for the game was almost exactly opposite of the community at every single turn.Great basebuilding and player created raiding and combat were quickly made a non factor by rampant uncontrollable hacking throughout every server.The entire game was ruined with in a few months as the community left and the game slowly died. Instead of dealing with the issues and fixing the rampant hacking they choose to design an entirely new system game and abandon their progress in the old version.This further killed the playerbase and ended any enjoyment people were currently having in private servers despite the hacking.I will never again trust or support a single product from garry his company or anyone in conjunction with.Peace.

review: IMO this game does survival Better than DayZ. In addition to the various survival mechanics (hunting hunger warmth) you also have the ability to build and communicate with other players with earshot voicechat. This provides something to strive for!I have 2 complaints about the game though 1) it's poorly optomized. It runs on my computer (2.4GHz dual core CPU GeForce GTX 675M 16GB Ram) but the framerate is a bit sluggish and my comp heats up prettly badly compared to my other games. There aren't many options to adjust this.2) Stones. In a landscape full of crazy cliffs and rock formations you'd think this resource would be abundant. Sadly the only rocks you can mine are scarce lone boulders which give off more Sulfer and Metal than they do Stones (4 stones a pop). Also WHY does it take 5 stones to make a stone hatchet? (which is literally a single stone tied to a stick.)

review: Wow.I'm so sad I'm writing this review right now.Anyway Rust is a post apocalyptic survival game as you probably already know. And I would say its worth buying but it just doesn't have the same charm as it did back in experimental. Back then it was hectic scary exciting... it was really fun to play.And then slowly it was turned into a boring grindy and well the community's gone down the sh!tter (but thats not really Garry's fault).I remember first getting this game and falling IN LOVE with it!But now I don't even really have the drive to play it any more.It started once they left experimental for me and its just gotten worse from there.You can't even play this game solo!At first it was hard to raid but now the game benefits clans so your base will be gone within 48 hours. And its not all the developers fault because the COMMUNITY suggested these ideas and when Helk or another developer puts it into place the COMMUNITY says "actually i changed my mind" and throws a fit. What are the developers supposed to do?Anyway I will definitely change this review if the game changes.Overall I'd say 3.75/10(P.S. the game is very nice on the graphics side therefore being quite demanding.)

review: It's not a bad game. I said it. BUT it's no longer a mix of survival horror and crafting. Currently it's more a mood survival game (zombies are gone) with crafting. But they seems to be into an identity crisis so purchase this game at your own risk (I recommand you to wait). The current problem with this game is than it get unbalanced really quickly once people know how to craft kevlar and have automatic guns when you start naked with a rock. So when people get bored well they "raid" (and often destroy with C4) other people bases kill newbies and such. So it can become frustrating to have put time and effort building something when you can find it in ruin the next day you log in. On the bright side the sunlight and nights are well rendered (and its VERY dark at night so a shelter is HIGHLY recommended) its beautiful and realistic. The crafting is well done at the beginning making you feel like you are crafting basic weapons out of an apocaliptic movie... as for the end game you get rifles kevlar armor laser target... It is currently very unbalanced and the end game doesnt fit the beginning. As for the building it is easy and well done. It is an Alpha and as the creator say "only 10% is in the game" so I hope it will evolve into something great.I will recommend it once it's clear where they head because right now people get bored and even if you get a taste of survival at first the current end game is more a bully simulator...
