title: Rust

review: Rust is a game in which it is completely survival in turn can create a multitude of options if one desires to do so. You start out with a rock you must be thinking "A rock? What the hell do I use this for?" but this is not any rock this rock is the only thing in your possesion at the moment that stands between YOU and NATURE (and society for the most part). Now you have gathered some wood by hitting trees and piles of logs with your trust rock! Time you built a shelter! With all the trusty wood you have collected you make a fort to call your own! Night now comes you make a fire in your shelter to sway away the cold you hear some noises you someone or something laughing you hope to god it's not the devil himself. You pek through a crack in your house it's a noob with a shotgun peering right back. You crawl to the back of your fort as the madman kicks down your door laughing. With one single blow your DEAD wondering why you died. With one final thought you considered that putting your fort in the middle of an open field was not a good idea. Rust is a good game if you know what you are doing if you don't well I think I have explained it well enough already. If you do happen to purchace Rust do check a study guide it could be a matter of life or death.

review: I love almost everything about this game. The map could use work meaning adding more loot zones and more places outside the road circle. The road circle is nice tho and should be in new maps. Also shift clicking should be added to make putting things on easier and putting things in chests easier. When putting items into inventories or boxes if you dont put the item directly in the center of a square it pops back to your inventory or box. Allow snapping for that. Add more hostile things such as hostile mobs like raiders not zombies. Zombie enemies are outdated. Add a way for your friends to find you more easily. Trying to group up takes time to find eachother. Add vehicles. The weapons break really fast which seems odd. Otherwise I like this game.

review: For all I can tell this is a fine game. The mechanics are decent and the world looks nice. But enough of what the game might be because I have no clue how this game actually plays. I ran this game initially at the second highest setting which I can do with most games made even in 2017 (see specs below). The opening screen looked pretty terrible and upon booting into game the game ran at an abysmal frame rate. Even looking directly at the ground I could not get a stable 60fps. There is so much going on that the game contsantly dropped down to 20 or 30fps. This made the game unplayable and I immediately quit to turn down the settings. The same thing happened on the next setting down and so on and so forth until I got to the second worst graphic setting. The game peaked at 100 fps and was still frequently dipping down to 40 or 50 fps. For a game that is almost 4 years old this is completely unacceptable. This may sound very whiny but you have to understand that constant fluctuation in frame rate makes a game terrible and for this reason alone I can't reccomend this game.SEPCS i5 6500 3.2GHz (underpowered I know but still runs games like R6 at a constant 100fps)GTX 106016GB DDR4 2400rpm

review: Rust is a great game hands down. It manages to be relatively in depth in all aspects while also mainting a pretty simple and user friendly UI/crafting system. There is a variety of servers with different mods and such allowing for many different types of players to enjoy the game equally. I'm not going to go too far into detail on the gameplay though because it basically comes down to if you're the type of person who likes survival crafting games. If not steer clear if so I'd say this is a must have. The only reasonable downside is that there is no singleplayer but finding a friendly or low pop server isn't difficult.

review: Rust is a fantastic survival based scavenger pvp builder with decent graphics.The community of players is toxic as ... and the reason being is this game is dominated by 12 year olds who find screaming the racist homophobic and sexist slurs the most entertaining thing to do in the world. Every 50th player you come across has a 10% chance of being decent.Playing solo is doable if you know what to do and how to play but its still very hard (you need a good amount of luck to get anywhere solo). Its too bad the game is also dominated by 10+ people clans that wont play on clan servers because they suck at the game. So they build and play on normal servers preventing anyone else from being able to do anything.There have been some solo/duo/trio servers but they just die out too quickly or never get a large enough population to attract other players. Great game but it kind of hurts it self because there is no hard regulation of how the devs want the game to be played. Clans are killing the game they will end up being the only ones who play and they wont end up playing because all the solos and small groups will leave.

review: I haven't gotten stuck in any walls the UI isn't completely the combat actually works you can switch weapons reliably and your character is only hungry when he goes a long time without eating. There's another really terrible survival "game" which could learn a lot from Rust. This game is relatively simple and has room for development but it's already really fun and addicting. I would definitely recommend buying it but when you do make sure you find a good server without too many people there to ruin your experience. The huge number of custom servers and the modding community really add a lot to this game especially for newer players but if you join a game with 100 200+ players expect a lot of idiots running around spamming their mics and slaughtering innocent naked men.

review: Rust most defintely plays out in a different direction than its current survival competitor DayZ. Instead of scrounging materials to survive in the shells of old residences you harvest materials for construction in much the same way as you do in the king of all survivals Minecraft. However instead of digging a hole and holding out against creatures of the night instead you build a residence or fortification and begin to carve a space out as your own within the different valleys. The main difference comes about with playing this game with a friend or two and working to build a community together. You are allowed to build structures and fortifications but are limited to the size and scope of your buildings through the placement of your foundations. As a result if you are aiming to achieve a stylized look or feel to your town working with some friends will get crafting and building done much faster. Definitely recommended as a great exercize in communal planning and collaboration but this comes with a caveat. Although the large majority of players are looking to be your friend or do their own thing there are always a few people in the servers looking to grief new players.

review: The new version of Rust is cool and all but it still has some pretty devastating problems.One is that bases are horrendously underpowered. You basically spend hours building up your base just to have someone axe down your walls and steal your loot while you're sleeping. (Yes I said axe down your walls a few minutes of cutting at a wall will break it).Another thing is that the coding is bad. This game has been in early access for over a year now and they have not addressed any of the serious bugs. In the older version (Rust Legacy) the game was well optimized and had all of the serious bugs addressed. In this newer rebooted version it is plagued with optimization problems. My computer is pretty strong for a gaming computer I can run games like Crysis 3 and Battlefield 4 and Ultra settings at around 60 FPS. However on Rust despite being on Unity my computer will have framerate drops and my components would be working on overdrive just to run the game. People with not as powerful computers find just navigating the start menu a pain in the The best part is that instead of addressing these game breaking bugs the dev team just keeps releasing skins textures and items.I was excited for a Rust reboot and gave it a chance multiple times but I can no longer recommend this newer version to anyone. If I were Gary I would scrap the reboot and just continue building up Rust Legacy. For now on Rust Legacy will be the game I play. The only reason I'm giving this a thumbs up is because I believe the old version alone is worth the $20 you spend.

review: We joined a server not knowing what to expect. I was (and am) new to the game and was struggling to simply get on my feet. About five minutes in we realize the server we were in was a Spanish speaking server. "No problem" we said we didn't plan on talking to anyone outside of TS and I know enough Spanish that I could survive if thrown into a Spanish speaking country. About ten minutes in one of our friends runs into a group of people in "The unraidable base." They all have Kevlar M4's AND CHICKEN! SO MUCH CHICKEN! So he screams at them (in English and using a harsh southern accent). One guy opens the door and kills him stupid fast. But he got the guy's name. So we waited... and waited... and waited for this person to log off the server. An hour and a half later he disconnects. My buddy changes his name to the guy who just left's name. He runs up to the giant base only a stone hatchet in hand. I tell him how to type "share the door with me." After a few seconds he starts laughing histarically. They let him in! He goes in and shuts the door as these people are speaking all around him in a language he doesn't understand. He says he will be right back and goes into a corner... waiting for one to actually go AFK. Then one does behind one of the barricades in "the unraidable base" He hatchets his head in takes all his armor gun and ammo. Then he started shooting. He killed them all in seconds. Looking up he could see a few spawn and put bullets in them as well. We ran in me and the friend without any gear and decked ourselves out. Setting up a base then in the hills we lived care free away from any other people. The only other times we would speak to people is when I would scream at them to "stop" "put your hands up" "drop everything or we will shoot you " and then... "I'm sorry!"

review: Edit 8/24/16I have done many things on rust...from playing solo and getting chased down by bears. To joining Role play servers such as dark ages and then meeting the KING whom was on shadowfrax's youtube D!!! And also joining clans whom hold up innocent people and KOS. Rust to me is more than just a battle royal kinda game I play it as a surivival game. I recommend new players finding a rp server with a no KOS/kill on sight rule! review: This is the most polished Alpha game I have ever played. More so then most full releases. The video above regarding first day / first week in Rust really does give a good indication of the kind of game it is. It's survival farming building exploring looting raiding hunting playing accoustic guitar making traps setting up trading shops/vending machines... it's whatever you make it. There's no rules no limitations put on the player... if you find it you can make it. So it really is whatever you make it. Fair warning it's easy to invest alot of time in this game and have it quickly undone by being raided or killed. The converse being that sometimes you get the drop on someone or raid a base and make off like a bandit filled rare and wonderful loot. And sometimes you make friends. It's a little bit of social commentary on how people will treat each other given that you all wake up naked with nothing but a rock on a deserted island. I have over 3.7k hours in this game. I HIGHLY recommend it more so for a full time gamer but also for casuals (just don't be a solo if you're casual join a group ))
title: Rust

review: The game is good with alot of potential however there is a steep learning curve to the game. For instance like 90% of the players you run into are hostile and will kill you for no reason. The game is really fun though once you learn the basics. Base building is very nice and has limitless potential. Gun play is nice in the sense of realism someone can't just spray you down from a long distance because horizontal recoil is almost impossible to controll. Overalll I recommend this game even in alpha its fun as hell.Pros Base building is very simplistic has many possibilities. Realistic gun play. Tons of content to keep you occupied for hours. Modded servers that change up the game in a good way.Cons EVERYONE kills on sight very rarily will someone actually be friendly and help you so watch your back. There are few weapons at the moment but i'm sure the devs will add more as the game progresses (this is more of nitpick than a con).

review: "Вместо оптимизации мы просто поднимим системные требования." Хороший ход. Пол года назад эта игра шла в 40 60 кадров в секунду на средних. Теперь 20 кардров максимум на минималках + жесткие фризы. Раньше минимальные системные требования были 4гб сейчас 8. Просто идите далеко и на долго. Тоесть вы ребята под конец разработки таким макаром сделаете обязательное наличие шлема VR для полноценной иры? Так дела не делаются. На одном серевере того же ВОВа обычно находятся по 1000+ человек огромное количество объектов полигонов анимаций + огромный мир. Все это синхронизированно и оптимизированно. В расте на сервере бегают от силы 150 человек и по кд лагают даше если у них топовое железо. Браво. Отправье уже своих програмистов на курсы по повышению квалификации. Или наймите больше людей. Но как сделать раскрашеные шмотки это мы завсегда. Это последний купленный мной ранний доступ.

review: I can't seem to put this game down. It is oddly addictive.You start out butt naked with a rock 2 healthpacks and a torch.You have to use the rock to forage for wood ore and also use it to bash the out of wild boars for chicken meat..yes I did not realise this either that pigs bears coyotes and wolves are made of chicken. Fan ing tastic.By this time you would want to start worrying about building a shelter. Once you get your out house looking shelter assembled then make sure you put a nice wooden door on it. The door will help keep you safe inside your house until the shotgun toting hillbilly players break it down steal your hard earned loot and leave you naked in a pile of blood.. If you have managed to get a shelter build up some good stacks of wood ore chicken and also throw together a makeshift shotgun then it is finally time go killing ZOMBIES! Oh wait I mean you can kill wolves and bears that are RED....and each of them seem to drop a kitbag with supplies. I killed a red bear he dropped a kitbag Inside the kitbag were 4 metal doors a med kit and a 9mm. This bear really had his together. I used the 9mm to kill a naked dude that was asking to take up refuge in my shack shelter and stole his rock. I then used the 4 metal doors to make a sweet hide out in which I had 4 ways to enter/exit. All in all this game kept me entertained way longer than I thought it would and it is much better than I tought it would be. It is only in alpha so it can only get better!

review: Had a lot of fun with game. It gets monotonous having to constantly gather material such as wood and certian minerials. Like honestly most of the time your cutting down random piles of wood or breaking random boulders for metal ore. Or killing animals for meat and fat. But once that crap is done you get to make guns and explosives and pretty cool bases with locked doors so only ppl you want in can get in ( or out )). It has a decent size community so you have ability to make friends and enemies and generate a lot of drama on a server which is where this game really shines. I think the devs should focus on that aspect instead of just another grinder game. I'm sick of performing the same task over and over again. That's not fun nore is it a good use of my time. I greatly enjoyed the time i spent making friends and going on hunts/raids and defending others when they needed help or asking for help from the friends i made. I'm waiting for the game to come out not as an early access but as a full release.
title: Rust

review: Rust is a survival game that beats Minecraft and any other competitors on the market. Rust allows a realistic fun feel of survival. In normal Rust there is plenty to do messing around with friends running down the road screaming in your microphone and even being a naked man running around with your rock bashing down houses. Experimental branch is where I would say the fun really starts. With all the new updates Garry and Facepunch Studios release there is no deadline on what you can do. Climb to the tallest mountain build the titanic explore caves or simply build your epic fortress against all the other cannibals. Garry and his team are always releasing new updates to the game and I can't wait to see you and the future of Rust!

review: I decided to edit my previous review since so much has changed since I wrote it. All I can say is holy !! This game has gone downhill in so many ways... I used to enjoy this game. HOURS of fun and gametime. The community was terrible when I started playing but it was bearable. But its 1 000 times worse... Its so bad that the fun has been completely taken out of the game. Every server is full of annoying little kids who have yet to experience what natural selection should have delt with a long time ago. I'm not complaining about dying or getting raided (don't get me wrong it sucks). The truly annoying part is the complete immaturity of %80 of the community. Now that I discussed the issue of the community I want to mention the issue of hackers. They're on EVERY server. I even watched a guy raid my ARMOURED base with just a bow and arrow but whatever just try a new server (where I THOUGHT I'd be safe). But recently I was on a server where a guy admitted to hacking and the admin permabanned him but before he left he said he doesn't care if he gets EAC/VAC banned since Rust key's are only $7 8 %90 of the time. Once I heard that I had to really ask myself if it was worth it. All I can say is avoid this game it's not worth it. Unless you don't mind hackers and/or a game with one of the WORST communities in the history of gaming.

review: To put it simplyLegacy is bossnew rust is tatnegative firstso far they have given up on updating legacy and have decided to make a new rust which has only just been playable recently. the new rust is somewhat enjoyable I do enjoy the realism of the makeshift guns instead of m4's with lasers. but I have an alienware x51 computer with 8gigs of ram and I have to have this on fast or fastest mode inorder to not be lagged out. Even on local servers people can be seen teleporting out of your view because of connection issues.Okay now for the positive the gunplay feels better and bows are better. we now have radtowns. animal movement works with where the animal is in relativity on whether you shoot them or they attack you (meaning they dont moonwalk anymore). There are still mods for it and they make the game much more fun to play. we still have airdrops. codelocks mean you can have a secure house now.all in all still a good game but wouldn't recomend it to you if you don't like waiting 50 years untill its a full game10/10 would have trust issues with other people again

review: Rust... could be really good would it not be eating my RAM away...The loading times are beyond anything I have seen so far. If you think GTAV has long loading times prepare yourself for some epic You can t do anything while the game loads can t use Steam can t Tab out. You are literally stuck and forced to watch the numbers roll by... Very very annoying. (And I have this game on Potato settings due to the RAM issue...)I have 8GB of RAM and this game uses all of it to its core. Wich forces my computer to shut the game down every 30 minutes due to memory loss. Atm this game is unplayable for me. They should defenetly optimise this game instead punching out weapon and spawning tweaks. How about you take care of the performance before you start implementing useless stuff day in and day out. )It feels like there is an Update ever third day wich may sound nice but with an own Server the maintenance is just tidious. The looting system is good allthough it s too easy to find everything you need with one run. The housing system is nice nothing revolutionary but never the less decent. I spent hours building my first refugee. A huge variaty on servers PVE / PVP / Creative what ever the you want. All in all you need a high end pc to play this game with atleast 16GB RAM.

review: An unbelievably addicting game. Right on release me and my friends spent days without sleeping in fear for our digital lives and loot. No matter how much time spent on the game the only thing that got old was the very beginning of your life and even that could get interesting. You can have 0 loot and people will chase you across the entire map for 40 minutes just to kill you it's absolutely hilarious. Some of the client is helpful/friendly and about 95% wants you dead thats what I love about it. For the longest time I was a bandit i was the guy who got accused by every little whiny little kid for hacking because i had a good shot nothing is more rewarding feeling than messing up some angry people on rust. The only problems i had when it's legacy was the main game (basically where all my time was spent on this game) was the lag hacking and ddos attacks. I honestly believe that the first version of the game was better than the new version. My reasoning isn't because of graphics or anything like that just the uniqueness of the game. It was simple to build easy to gather resources and through almost all of my time playing the game i spent laughing at situations only the legacy version brought. The new version of the game is extremely great looking has realistic and immersive armor but in my opinion had they just worked to improve lag and bugs and fix the hacking problem on the original game i would be more likely to play the game like i used to. The original version can never get beat on their mission to change the game completely they lost a lot of their clientell. Spent the greater part of 6 months waiting for them to do a big update and they basically scrapped the game and started all over. Still i can't not recommend this game for how much fun i had and how gary neumann actually keeps his community updated and interacts with them.All in all the game has gone backwards the new version may have upgraded features but it is downgraded from the original game. The first alpha version 11/10 New version 6/10. They should have just upgraded the first version.EDIT The game has practically died now. The old version was much better dont waste $20 on a game nobody plays anymore. The legacy version was the revolutionary chance for this game to take over but Gary gave up and hackers took over along with russian fake servers. The new version just isn't fun if that's what you're looking for. you build like in minecraft but the PvP is broken and buggy. Nice way to kill the game Gary should have added these changes to the legacy.
title: Rust

review: I've had this game since very early alpha. I bought it about a week after it was released into early access. It was kinda boring you had to make to many things to make one important thing. Resources were scarce. The HUD was too small and it looked funky. From what I saw things have improved. HUD looks great better crafting menu trees actually yield a nice amount of wood. Here's where it all goes downhill. I have a high end of the medium end gaming PC. It runs most games I own at between 120 150 frames. But the grass in Rust. The grass.The way it waves so sexily in the wind makes the game unplayably laggy. I checked the ping of the server I joined it was low 27.I knew it was a client issue becuase as soon as I stepped off the beach I woke up nude on and into the pretty forests my FPS took an epic cliff dive. 5/10 until I can change the damn grass settings.

review: A game where you spend hours gathering resources under constant fear of a quick death from your fellow players. Everytime you see another user in Rust your heart rate will double. That is really the thrill of the game. Sure there is building a base and gathering resources even animals you can fight and kill but it's the interactions with other players that are the core experience of Rust.Most of those experiences really depend on who you meet. There will be some players that kindly say hello and might even offer to help you. For every such user there are at least 5 players that will murder you on sight which can make for very nervous interactions with others.There is the ability to build in Rust which is necessary to store your resources and protect your sleeping body when you log out. Building is horrendously expensive when you move past a single wooden shelter. It takes thousands of wood or metal pieces to create a base solid and complex enough to prevent other players from simply using 1 5 c4 to enter and take EVERYTHING you own. In contrast that c4 is very easy for a player that was fortunate enough to research both c4 and explosives allowing them to produce unlimited amounts. C4 is expensive but only a fraction of the resources obtained from raiding.This is the main problem in Rust. Unless you are an offensive player that was fortunate enough to obtain a source of C4 you are essencially just collecting resources for the 1% that do who grow exponentially more wealthy as time goes on if they remain unchallenged. This eventually leads to a completely untouchable one to five player group with a base so large and laiden with walls traps and expensive to destroy decoys that they are nearly invincible to all on the server.As a result of all this if you don't have a friend or two to play this game with find one or skip it. Having a partner you can trust and work with will make everything easier. Essentially it doubles or triples your ability to collect resources build and defend yourself. If you work together running into another player is less of a big deal there are 2 3 against 1 and those odds are usually good enough to be left alone. Even if you do get smoked you buddies will be there to get revenge protect your dropped inventory or just get you back up on your feet. And if all you stuff gets raided you still had a good time with friends and will recover twice as fast rather than just thinking about how you wasted the last 20 hours of your life grinding to lose it all.Conclusion If you play Rust alone you're gonna have a bad time.

review: I have only played this game for a couple of hours and I really enjoy what this game is offering. Its like it wants me to fail. I start off with nothing more than a rock to use as a weapon or mining a torch that will give your position away a health kit (for when you are attacked by bears wolves or people) and you have no armor. Besides that the game looks amazing and seems to be on the right track in its alpha stage. The very thing that i enjoy about this game is the teamwork needed for survival. Once I was able to join up with some friends the game became more enjoyable and we worked together to build a base gather some materials and build up our armory. When the time comes to defend our fortification or remove unwanted visitors we are ready. The game has a lot to offer and with it only being in alpha I am excited to see what it will bring to the table with full release. **BE WARNED NOT EVERYONE WILL BE A FRIENDLY JUST BECAUSE THEY ARE HOLDING A PICKAXE DOES NOT MEAN THEY WONT KILL YOU WITH IT**

review: Rust is a lot of fun... At first. However after a few weeks of owning it and putting many hours into it it's grown stale. I do believe the game is wonderful if you have the friends to play it with if not it gets boring and frustrating alone. Another issue seems to be the way the community is right now. There's a large issue of hackers in almost any server you go into. At first I joined a less populated server to explore and build with a friend but as he started to not play as much that stopped being interesting. A lot of the fun comes in player combat as well. That being said this can also be a downside since often spawning into a new server with near nothing means getting killed by everyone. So if you're lucky enough to find a spot where you're secluded and have resources then you can build yourself a nice little base gather weapons and defend yourself. But the opportunity for this to happen has been rare to me. I'd say this game is still interesting. But with it being early access many bugs and changes still are to be fixed. I'd say wait for full release. I believe the game still has the potential to be better (I don't know how yet though). This is by no means a bad game it can be very pretty (especially with its lighting) and building things with people and PvP can be fun and interesting. It just needs to be fixed and tweaked.

review: So you can see the time I've spent that I've done my fair share of playing Rust. It use to be great but it is no longer worth paying nor playing.Ironic how these Early Access games go. They become decent at first with a crap load of bugs then approves later onward and suddenly goes back to the crap hole. Rust is one of those games.It use to be a struggle when Blueprints first existed fighting to get the prints and praying to god to get that Bolt Action Rifle template or AK 47 template. Requiring one to get a bow and arrow to self defend ones self against other players till you research decent quality weapons. Oh forget to mention it required a decent size amount of resources to create a Research Table (That had value) unless you're a risk taker to research in a nearby monumentum which 9/10 is a battleground between solo's or clans. Wood use to be good (Till Flamethrower became a thing) then again why would you even go wood? You're silly to stick with wood over stone or metal seeing that it takes 1 C4 or a Rocket to destroy the entire structure lol. But now days it's easier to get that AK that Bolt That thompson or any good weapon simply by farming boxes crates and airdrops throughout the Rust valley. Blueprints haven't existed for a while and it's diffirculty has been banished turning into a hand holding playthrough. Even soloing is now easier. What broke the camels back to quitting Rust though is this new update 158. Where one can build twig structures around a nearby base that has an active cupboard around it's radius. Cupboards officially have 0 use. It's defense is gone. Having external walls is now a waste of resources and time. One can easily build upgrade then build around it and conquer the domain easier rather than raiding it the old fashion way that requires X amount of C4's or Rockets. With this new update it makes veterans like me turn away from Rust and say good bye.Lastly of course are the aimbotters but we all know aimbotting doesn't exist due to Rusts "Anti Cheat System" Pffft right. This issue has been ongoing since Rust's existence so I won't bother complaining. That complaint is on the bottom of my cry list for every FPS shooter that is MMO have this issue. Move along.If you enjoy hand holding quick to play and conquer games Rust is for you. If you're looking for an actual survival game that has real mechanics a challenge and requires the individual to work at it Rust is not the game I would suggest. I'll miss you Rust but Facepunch can no longer polish your ugliness. The developers have officially ruined your beauty and existence. RIP Jan 2016 5/14/2017.
title: Rust

review: So lets go over the positives and negatives to this game. I personally love Rust (if you cant tell by my 900+ hours) and most that play Rust seem to believe it is in a broken state. As for the controversial update that was just released I will skip over that as I believe it gives the game a large disliking at the moment. So pre twig update will be used in this review.Positives Amazing GunplayBase building is funRaiding is funDoing anything in this game can be funLots of stuff to doDecent amount of ammo and weapon attachment customizabilityDifferent playstylesVery balanced (pre twig update remember?)Negatives Zergs are opSolo players are underratedGrinding can be annoying (unless you are a zerg)Components are clunky and need a bit more tweakingGeneral response to a running naked is to shoot at itThe game has great mechanics and gunplay but lacks the appropriate means to keep a player base sustained. I understand that facepunch does look at player feedback but they lacked the appropriate foresight to see what this would do. The twig update for example should have been put in the experimental branch and used as a means to test and see if the general player base liked it. I can understand from their viewpoint that the best way to reach the majority of their audience is to put it right into the main branch but I cannot understand why the experimental branch is not used sometimes this game has a massive amount of work put in and is still in development. So why not have the community help develop the game and test updates before they go into effect.

review: I'm disappointed (and oddly disturbed) by this game. perhaps it's just that I haven't given it enough time and/or something else. but basically you log into a server which loads you into the game with a bunch of strangers who are pretty much just out to kill you and get your meager stuff which most often is just a rock and torch. Upon respawning I often passed by a killing field of bodies with just a rock and torch in their inventory.I started the game died respawned ran around trying to hide and craft things to survive only to get killed numerous times by what seemed like very cruel people. This happened over and over again until I was fortunate enough to craft a nice little safe house nestled up in the mountain in the rocks where I thought I could respawn safely (so I hoped) when I returned the next day. Alsa when I did someone had trashed into my place killed my sleeping body and stolen everything. The Moral of this story is why bother? You basically run around dying stealing and killing. Unless you perservere enough to craft a stone fort which even then doesn't guarantee security this game is more of some cruel nightmare dying and then reborn only to watch yourself die over and over.Once a player asked via chat if someone wanted to collaborate. No one replied. After awhile the player offered again and again no one replied except those who mocked or joked about it. His offers sounded oddly like the bleating of a sheep asking for slaughter and any reply would only bring on the wolves when we met. This gave the game a distinct "Lord of the Flies" air. I accepted his offter and he replied back to me but when I asked how we could meet safely he stopped chatting.What is particularly creepy and cruel is that when you are killed you fall to the ground facing up. Your viewpoint is of whatever is around and above you which is most often your killer. The screen says you are wounded and need help. yet most often none comes and you and your killer just stare at each other until you either die or they kill you. Once I could hear my killer stabbing me over and over and over which had a bad psychopathic feeling. I really hope it was just the game sound glitching. The graphics are good the crafting system seems fairly intuitive and the gameplay is decnet. I hope that the game develops into something that I can enjoy playing and not feel like sick about afterwards.

review: Great concept but skeptical considering its an indie developer. Its hard to be invested in this game. I've had my hopes crushed on games with much more progress at this stage of development. I think for its genre its probably one of the better ideas out there. I've never been a big fan of survival games. I was hoping to find one that changes the trend of them. I'm curious if the developers are qualified enough and have the financial backing to make the engine into a stable fully functional game. As of right now? I wouldn't recommend purchasing the game in hopes that you're going to get much more than a shell. IT IS ALPHA. I would purchase the game under the idea that you're supporting the company's path they plan to take. For me personally? I have my own list of concerns granted its engine and the natural problems that come with making persistent world games through it. First and foremost being the onslaught of hackers. That will be what makes or breaks this game if they can manage to figure out their desync problems and stability issues. There needs to be some more features out there because the content isn't there to really sustain a sandbox game long term. I am only recommending this game because I have friends who absolutely love it. If it wasn't for their testimony and their passion for it I would encourage people to stay away. All in all I'm 50/50 at this point. Only time will tell if this game is or isn't a complete waste of money.

review: Horrible Waste of money. Gary did well with Gary's mod but has utterly failed with this one. I know it's early access but it should never have been made available in the first place. This is way too unpolished and instead of going forward has gone backwards a amount. Quite frankly I wish steam would have guidelines for early access. That would deter publishers from releasing or seeking funding for a project that has no business being in the wild. Considering it was early access for almost a year then it was essentially wiped back to the stone age. This just smacks of a cash grab. So in short if you havent spent your money on this "Early Access" game. Just save your money. There are enough games with the same genre that are actually finished.

review: I've longed to find an aesthetically pleasing survival based game where it pits man vs. the elements so when I researched this game I was taken in by the allure of the beautiful scenic views in the clips....but that's where the appeal ends. I purchased the game in high anticipation only to be drawn into grave disappointment. This game supports an underculture where the murder and deciet of player characters in a PvP setting flourishes which makes it difficult for new players to dive into the crafting aspects of the game. It's not unusual for a new player to arrive upon a new world only to be sniped down within mere seconds by a high powered rifle before one can learn anything about the controls to the game. If one can survive the first few hours they will begin the arduous journey of scavenging for scarce resources...and I mean scarce. One can search a long time before finding animals to hunt (which I also found to be a joke) or natural materials for crafting which can often lead to frustration. I also found the world to be more a littered junk yard as shacks left behind by other players dot the landscape. Now this does take place in a post apocalyptic setting so the scarcity of resources and to some extent the behavior of the player characters may be in line to what can be expected in such a setting. But this game seems more focused on PvP than world building as keyboard commandos continually scour the landscape gunning down one another and stealing their resources....even victimizing new players as they spawn into the world through coercion or deciet. All this given that wasn't the deal breaker.What really irked me the most was spending hours scavenging resources logging off then returning only to find everything I've worked for missing from my character. I don't mean those kept in inventory stored in boxes on the world....those are always subject to be looted by bandits....no I mean stuff literally kept on the player character itself....food weapons armor medical supplies..... and this happened more than a handful of times. In conclusion the game is big on promise but short on delivery for gamers who look for character and world building and customization....and you won't be guaranteed you'll keep what you work for. PvPers might find it appealing if you can keep from getting ganked long enough to learn anything about the game. No this game is a huge disappointment and not worth the money spent on it.

review: First off let's be clear. I don't like games that do this pre release alpha crap. It's annoying sickening and drives me nutty.Having said that? THIS GAME IS AMAZING. I've been a fan of FPS games (even though I'm no good at them) since the days of Quake and this game solves a major problem I have seen in alot of MMO style FPS games loss.What do you mean you ask? Well if you die in any other game (say PlanetSide 2) you will spawn with a new set of guns full ammo and so on. Here? If you die at best you'll be sent back to your home base holding a rock and your balls worst case is you get flung to some random part of the island with nothing but a rock and your balls.This game is definitely not meant to be played solo however and it's highly recommended you forge an alliance or find a server your friends play on. Teamwork is cruical when everyone else wants to see you dead so they can take your chicken and bullets.There are still a number of bugs that need to be worked out but I believe this game will become something.

review: The good It is quite interesting starting with nothing and having to make your way basically from stone age to somewhat modern age (at least speaking of weapons) this was indeed quite intreaging. The grafics are nice and it really gets your heart pumping if you are semi naked and run across some animal.The bad The game is not that stable (specifically if you die an respan you might crash). Animlas seem to cling to rocks and run circles there which kills immersion some.The ugly The Playerbase Well as many reviews before already stated the worst enemy is not hunger or thirst (as stated) but actually other players where 95% try to kill you on sight (even without reason). One example you span and some other player spans next to you on the beach both have nothing exept a torch and a stone. And the first thing happens is that you get hit by the stone. But note there es nothing to gain from a fresh player.Some sever issues regarding bugs/exploits/hacking (i cannot tell for sure what exackly) After a few days i actually managed to build a base and start getting somewhere everything bad previously witnessed seems to just be a begging hardship (ppl still try to kill you even if you have a gun and they are somewhat naked still). So spend some days buildin the base doing research when a group 3 ccome acress and you retreat to you base and assume they are not able to get it (stone walls multiple armored doors). WHat happens ? You get shot throught 2 layers of stone walls don'T even see any enemy and the just hop 2 stores high and loot everything you gathered (and killing you right away if you respan).Maybe this is the game's intention but i wish to warn others about what they may get into if start Rust.

review: Rust is a well done survival game that has you crafting scavenging and protecting yourself. However it is ruined entirely by people and the inability to play alone or with just friends.Gameplay+ Fun survival gameplay+ Nice variety of things to do People No offline/singleplayer mode Hackers I will start off by saying Rust is a well done survival game. You go out collect resources scavenge what you can and simply try to not only survive but thrive. Build weapons ammo medpacks walls doors and basically anything you need to live. Rust does this quite well however what Rust does not do well is people. I cannot say that this will ruin the game for everyone but for me it does. There is no single player. If you enjoy working for hours and hours day after day gathering resources and making your fort only to log on the next day and find yourself dead naked and having to start over then this is the game for you. If you find that fun by all means get Rust but if you are like me then I suggest staying away.Graphics+ Look pretty great+ Well polished in most areas Graphical glitches Some game breaking glitchesThe graphics in Rust have always looked pretty nice if you can run it on the best graphics. However they have always had problem with glitches (as do most survival games) and some can be either game breaking or simply very very irritating.Overall/Quick ReviewUnless you have a group of friends well sized that play quite often and you trust fully you will NOT enjoy this game. It is designed for you to spend your time collecting resources blueprints and making yourself an arsenal and fort to try and protect yourself. You log out and you are "sleeping in the house" and other players can see you break in kill you take everything and walk away. You then log in the next time naked with nothing and when you go back to your home it is destroyed.I do not recommend this game it is built around the idea of surviving with people when in reality all it does is promote griefing by people who play 24/7 and those who have friends dedicated to the game.Do NOT buy.
title: Rust

review: Rust is still the same game it was close to 2 years ago with graphical improvements and a few bug fixes. Keep in mind this game sold over 1 000 000 copies at $19.99. How they still haven't ironed out the bugs and completed the game yet is beyond me. There's still rampant cheating and in a game like this there's nothing more frustrating than to watch helplessly as 10+ hours of your work wiped out in seconds by someone using cheats.I wouldn't recommend this game at all and I'll refrain from purchasing future games by Facepunch until they get their priorites straight. The fact that Garry Newman saw the need to make a blog complaining about the criticism levied upon Facepunch for starting MULTIPLE projects while Rust still isn't near finished is repugnant. Take the justly deserved criticism in stride you fat faced chinless zilch.
title: Rust

review: This game is very similar to DayZ. However the difference is that it's much simpler. View this how you may this game features less in the way of weapons and combat. However unlike DayZ Rust's appeal is centered around the ability to collect resources and make your own base as well as tools armor weapons and supplies. A solid 85% of all items in game can be crafted using resources you collect. However like DayZ there's a threat of bandits. Bandits may raid your home kill you and take your stuff so you have to start over again. However all crafting recipes you learn are saved to your profile on the server so dying won't reset your progress on learning how to craft things. This game is still in alpha so expect more to come.9/10

review: Game really is something speacial. There are times in Rust when I think " Best 200 bucks ever". There are updates every Thursday so the game seems forever moving and never exactly the same. Whether new items or weapons or even new landscape I always look forward towards the updates.That being said here are pros and cons.Pros Extremely Fun Looks Good Weekly Updates Good bases to build Playing with others is so fun Nice weapons (From Bows to Guns Rocks to Maces) Very fun PvP that keeps you on your toes when fighting Nice classic survival elements (Too cold too hot hungry thirsty radiation) No game breaking bugs Over all a joll and a solid gameCons Animal AI system can be frustrating (Deer running away through a mountain bear killing you through the floor) Grass can stick through the floor of the base (Irritating if you OCD like me xD) In certain areas there are about 5 bears in a small areaOverallMy biggest pro is that I know the develpoers will work to get rid of the cons and make the game greater than it already is. So far nothing that makes my game unfun or wants me to turn off my systeam. Great game such fun much thanks.Score 9/10

review: From collecting skulls to blowing up bases there is a huge amount of fun you can get in this game. But you have to play in a group that's the only way you can really get to end game loot like ak 47's and c4. Unless you're some ballsy masochist. Also there is a large learning curve right now so you should watch some videos on base building raiding etc. But if you have a group you will have a lot more fun. But if you're skilled enough you could probably play this solo and build trap bases like KCMO. look that guy up he's a master at building trap bases. But the developers are constantly updating the game on a biweekly basis. And they are constantly adding new things fixing things and even overhauling entire gameplay mechanics! I play this game with a group of friends and I have a load of fun hopefully you do too.p.s. dont trust anyone you'll probably get stabbed bludgeoned or shot by them.link to kcmo's channel https //www.youtube.com/channel/UCNoMMO5NsdTOUCwVo3xjRPw

review: This game needs two ratings. If you play alone then no do not buy this game. The community is pretty picky about who it wants to team up with and unless you know someone that also has the game and is willing to play with you the game will wind up one complete bust. HOWEVER if you play with a group you can build massive bases raid other players for their stuff and have massive PVP battles where death has meaning. My review however will be a thumbs down for now. Its so hard to play alone as if you build a shack then the bigger bandit clans will wipe you clean as you sleep and pick your stuff. If you have friends that will let you group up with them then turn that finger around to a thumbs up. Almost all of the flaws the game has are 'fixed' with a group but not so as a single player. Honestly if there was a better way to search for a group ingame as a solo player the game would be better to. But in both the game's current state and community state dont play this solo.

review: If you enjoy watching pros play this game on Youtube then keep watching it on Youtube. Playing the game itself is a much different experience and I heavily regret dropping 33 bucks into this game. It's NOT READY. Not even close. It has a really long way to go before it's servicable and in its current state 22$ CAD is way too much. This shouldn't be priced anywhere above 10$ because the value just isn't there. People are gonna call you salty if you get mad at this game. You will get mad you will be salty and if you lose too many fights and lose too many bases you're gonna finally be humble enough to walk away from this game like I did. I have some bullet points explaing my issues with this game but I'll be less formal to start. The people on this game aren't "funny" like you've seen in youtube videos they don't talk to eachother. They kill eachother. This game is not noob friendly. Everything and everyone is going to try to kill you and take everything you own and burn down what they can't take with them. And they will succeed. You will die a lot. I have no problem with the developers of this game. They've made a decent game that is a little overpriced and visibly unfinished. It is the community that butchers any sense of enjoyment. I thought it was funny at first how toxic it was. But it is too toxic. And yes I am salty.1. Toxic Community (the sALT)Players in Rust are hostile offensive and above all else...SALTY. Some encounters with players can by pleasant but it's mostly people killing eachother over resources (which is a traumatic experience given how hard it is to gather much of anything). Most conversations between players are people blasting music over their mic players swearing and saying some pretty racist things and threats of real life violence. None of this is surprising apart from the racism and swearing since servers claim to have banned this behaviour. If they have then they've done a pretty terrible job so far. 2. PVP combat (slow clunky laggy)The combat looks absolutely stupid. It's looks like gmod character models swinging rubber crowbars while jumping and strafing as best as the engine can handle it. Frame drops and lag issues tend to ruin fights and doesn't pair well with the slow clunky movement controls. Most weapons lack any feeling of impact apart from some guns which actually control and handle pretty well. The issue with that is that guns are SO difficult to come by so you'll be getting shot with them more than you'll actually be holding one. 3. Resources gathering (Minecraft did it better)Gathering wood and stone to make your first house takes RIDICULOUSLY long. Hatchets/Picks foundations/walls/roofs and upgrading them to stone costs a LOT of resources. Actually mining all of it to make a solid base can potentially lead up to 1/2 an hour to a full hour of JUST grinding. For this reason the stakes of fights with other players are just too high. If you lose a fight after grinding enough to build a house then you've lost a half hour at least. And if you couldn't find enough cloth to make a sleeping bag then you'll be respawned on the other side of the map. Good luck there. 4. Raids (offline raids accesible to few)ALL of the the raids I experienced happened offline. Around 2 00Am to 4 00Am was primetime for people to often blow open my front door and chop my body and sleeping bag and clear my house of all loot and furnishings. Raiding other people takes explosives or serious mining tools which let's be honest. Unless you have a clan or a friend or two who are masters at this game and know where to look for the right components you're not making these anytime soon So raiding is only for the rich to grief the less fortunate. 5. No room for nakeds (noob killing no tutorials)This is actually a phenomenon that I don't see in a lot of other games. Sure enough call of duty/battlefield/any multiplayer game makes fun of noobs but usually there are a few people willing to teach someone the ropes. But Rust treats noobs horribly. People often camp the beaches and shoot new players who have just spawned in. There isn't a tutorial or any fellow players to teach nakeds how to even play the game so they're thrust into the game world where they're killed for sport over and over again. I understand the idea of "earning the right to be good" through player encounters and getting in fights but that doesn't work when people with guns are shooting you for your rock and torch. If you havent heard of it yet Ark is another survival game. It looks like clans are easier to join and that there is a little less player interaction since a large focus of the game is NPC dinosaurs that you can tame.It too seems overpriced at 80$ Canadian but it has some semblance of finish to it. It has many of the same problems from what I can tell but what I do know is that in terms of survival games Rust still has a long way to go. Don't waste your time or money here there are better games that can offer a much better expierience at a better price. Hopefully in a few years this game is finished but the community isn't going to be changing anytime soon. Stay salty.

review: Rust is the kinda game you'll probably want to learn about before you start playing to make sure it's worth your time/money. Watch a couple videos read into what the devs are aiming for and if you still want to play after learning about its flaws and frustrations it will probably be one of if not your favorite game like it is mine. Welcome to a survival game that meets Stanford prison experiment. My most helpful tip is to take the time to find a good server. This might mean you get killed on sight on 5 before you find one with friendly enough people to let you live while you make the very basics... and then lose it all once they see you've gathered enough valuable things to waste C4 on you. As I said before people are unforgiving and will make you pay for your mistakes. The feel of the game reminds me of Fallout 4 while the challenge of a mostly relentless playerbase brings back memories of Dark Souls. It's a psychological thriller on top of being the most challenging frustrating yet rewarding game I've ever played. The interactions of this game are completely unique from any other online/co op and is a strange sort of window into the humanity behind our choices. Reputations matter here.Given that I leave the game running while I'm asleep or out because of the ridiculous load in times on this mac I still played an unhealthy amount of hours in my first 2 weeks. Once you load into 1 server it only takes 30 seconds or so to load into any other so get through the initial load and take the time to find a good server. There are bot servers so you can practice aiming non pvp/raid servers for builders and plenty of hidden gems with friendly enough players whose majority will let you live until you become a force of your own.Even playing on a mac with all its flaws this is the game I've been wanting to play. New favorite.

review: I want to like this game.No actually I want to love this game.Rust has the kind of building simulation I've been waiting for since the emergence of the craft your own world genre. Extensive blueprint systems allow players to collect and piece together amazing things from raw materials and there is just enough scavenging to keep things interesting. Graphically Rust is well beyond several games of this type. It combines with an open style sandbox that can be enjoyed by several players which would ideally form a vibrant active always online community.That is it would were it not for the community.I've seen that some players have compared the general game community to cancer and I wouldn't say it's an unfair comparison. That said I think a more accurate description of the Rust community at large would be to say they're like a case of anal herpes. They're nothing if not a consistent incurable pain in the Upon spending more than a few minutes on any given server new players will notice there are mainly two types of player in this game. The first treats the game like Minecraft happily setting about building magnificent structures and some of them are really fantastic. Skilled builders can really show off the best points of the system creating intricate constructions that really show what an open concept and a creative mind can accomplish.These players are the minority.The other type of player in this game treats everything as a low rent Call of Doody whereupon discovering other players sharing a map they proceed to clip through walls (or just shoot through them as though they were nonexistent) and run about happily defecating all over everything. Nine out of nine servers tested has returned positive for this breed of cancerous anal herpes.Sadly this game breeds that kind of player like inbreeding breeds low IQs.If you have the ability to piece together your own dedicated private server by all means grab this game and mess around with your friends. If you're stuck on public servers well.. just don't get stuck on public servers. You're better off playing other games.

review: UPDATE!!! 2017 11 04***I keep my old review very negative. Just because I am honest.Wow...! What a twist! This game feels like a new game completely.Everything feels so fresh and nice.I learned there are biweekly and monthly wipe servers and boy am I glad for that.I finally figured out a lot of things in the game.No game give such a thrill to go out and get stuff and hope you make it home alive as this one.For me a pleb it's an extreme rush and the battles get super intense and scary when you have things to lose.Base building is a lot easier due to balanced map generators now.There are tiers on the map that seperate players from fresh spawns to geared to the teeth.Sure this "law" can be broken by geared end game players simply just building bases in fresh spawn areas but it sure helps.And come on if they chose to do so it will be more like before anyways so what's the difference.I completely get that it's gonna be hard in the beginning and embrace it more as it truly feel like a proud accomplishment getting a base set up.The tiered map make the hotspots a lot easier to get to and away from alive!Good!I have only played on a server for 2 days now with this change and we are already unlocking a lot of weapons and items.The game feels a lot better and it feels a lot more fair.Surely there could be a lot of other issues I haven't played enough to encounter and nobody have really explored these changes fully (maby).But I have my hopes up and I see the game in a whole new light.Sure it will beat you up hard and good but you sorta love to hate that in some weird way.OLD REVIEW Where to begin...There are so many things that are thematically and logically flawed with this current design (2017 11 01)This game is by all means an elitist no life mess. Hear me out.So I will tell you about the biggest issue that many don't seem to understand fully.Servers do wipe weekly (or so ish)This is the only survival game I know that does this. And it's super weird.Sure some people get everything they'll ever need in days.But that means you HAVE to play with a group. Solo isn't an option for normal people. Only hardcore elitists will stand a chance really.You don't want to start playing on a server if it's not freshly wiped. So you can try to get a fair chance and not get gunned down every 30 seconds by people with guns when you just go around wielding a rock.And it create the problem with unless it's freshly wiped you sorta don't want to go on a server.Servers (ALL SERVERS) wipe the same dates for some reason.Meaning if you missed out the chance to start on a fresh server you HAVE to wait until they all wipe.They don't do something clever so that servers wipe in cycles meaning there will always be fresh servers for people who give up on one server.This is beyond .Game map is always way too open and you cannot really get resources to do anything.Sometimes you have to chase your off to find even basic stone.The current blueprint system force you to run towards hotspots on the map. Making large portions of the maps useless and it even further shrink the map in size.These hotspots are camped with gunmen and heavly trafficed and you will be very lucky or unhuman to survive enough runs in and out to collect loot and be able to research blueprints or collect scrap.It's all about scrap farming.If there were more double or more of these hotspots everyone would have a more fair chance of getting to them.And since maps are so open it's even more favored to having a gun. Since sneaking up on people is barely possible or outrunning them due to lack of things to disorient them or hide behind.Getting a base started take tremendous amounts of resources for solo/duo people and really isn't a whole lot of fun.There is no steady progression curve as other survivals have or so.Maby this super frequent wiping will vanish when release happen.It's really . Sure they say you get things too fast but that is the problem to me then make it so that you care every second of the time you play on a server.Make it so that you want to join a server regardless of the time it has been up.At the time of typing it is 1 2 days until the server wipe. People on the server don't care about anything and just run around like stupid.People give away their bases and throw guns everywhere.It's ...Why do even people spend huge amount of time building a base nobody can raid... when it will vanish within days.It make no sense at all.Finding guns is also way too ing hard. And it seems only people who pretty much can camp the hotspots for loot get them.I have made MANY runs to hotspots (monuments) to loot all the crates but the only gun I ever found was a revolver pistol which is still bad against assault rifles which all big clans get within hours.Game ofc has so much potential. But it's just a mess overall. I have no idea why people like it so much.It doesn't maky any sense at all.ARK and Conan are sadly way superior as they are balanced smoother and provide a better experience with loot versus progression.You can still have crazy raids and pvp in those games since in ARK you can move between servers so there is always a bigger clan out there to get you no matter what.In Rust you know if someone is the alpha clan and you can't touch them. Unless you bring friends many friends.Raiding is IMPOSSIBLE in this short time span to gather all those resources and craft rockets and satchel charges to be able to raid is IMPOSSIBLE for solo/duo or low population groups of people.Whilst big clans just do it for the of it since they are bored already having everything in the game.It's a flawed system and the little guy can't compete with anyone. Not even do nifty little things and high risk/reward things and take down the big guys.

review: People joke about naked men and dongers but fail to properly give an opinion on this game. My opinion is not to get rust YET. I believe if the developers (they ARE competent) continue the way they are then the game will be worth it's salt in half a year minimum. This is NOT because of ingame content. In game content is fine BUT The game is PLAGUED by the ABC's of gaming being missing. Hackers are everywhere you go in Rust this is because anti cheat is either non existant or poorly made SO FAR. The other thing is that the engine running the game IS IN AN ALPHA. No server can currently run more than 30 players for 24 hours without experiencing frame tearing no matter how good your machine is you will fall victim to frames skipping and dying because of it. The plot and essence of the game is AWESOME truly BUT The 2 fallouts (Engine lag and No powerful anti cheat) make this not worth $20 right now. My honest opinion with over 400+ hours in Rust.

review: Rust is a game that I have had some of the best times in my gaming career. In the good old days when rust was still a fresh new game it was very new to me the crafting and base building aspect of the game really took me by surprise of how good it was. I really did have alot of fun playing this game for a couple of days... until... the hackers invaded. Hackers and cheaters really did ruin rust for me.. It is really very sad to see a game fall like this and I hope that later projects by Facepunch Studios will be more protected from hackers and cheaters.

review: I used to enjoy playing the old version of Rust it looked really promising and did well at evoking a range of emotions I'm talking about genuine fear when you hear someone running around outside or seeing someone peaking through the gaps of your wooden hut whilst your hidden in the opposite corner in almost complete darkness.You can still find these aspects in the game but I don't like the ways it's (d)evolved and is a shadow of what it once was. Graphics look good but instantly the game doesn't feel right.Hackers are a real issue meaning your precious in game mats and weapons are never safe it really puts you off.I will come back to this game in the future it may have improved.

review: Early access Alpha and it is already hauntingly immersive &amp addictive! this game has alot of strongpoints n potential that i am certain the developers will tweak &amp add to as the game progresses.. I would like to see the game progress away from the "Call of Duty" FPS direction to the "Stone age" on the the balls of your &amp need to craft to survive angle. Developers should add seasons &amp weather wider the range of tools &amp raw weaponry make the powerful military equip avail only by finding such in wrecked military quip abandoned bases etc.. not craftable by players!. As the map fills out with development scatter resources so people in the north will need to seek out the south for example for unique elements. For an Alpha game the lighting &amp ambience is already breathtaking.. I have over 40hrs gameplay logged on rust.. Sure there are s that try to bash your head open with a rock lovely prospect but not a big threat.. The bad i seen was new players weilding stockpiles of C4 (somehow?) just blowing up &amp ruining the structures &amp morale of people trying to play this game right &amp start communities in the game. Other guys running around with M4 machine guns in full body armor slaughtering people who are just gathering resources.. Knucklehead kids that think this game is the new COD Black Ops.. This direction must be steered away from by the develpers now before it goes any furthur.. The game will actually be MORE enjoyable without these godlike goofballs causing chaos unchecked.. Add more animals add an in game map &amp regionalize things in the map ect.. But make the big steer now guys lets see this game as a unique addictive &amp enjoyable survival game not Call of Duty.. All in all i highly recommend Rust

review: It's hard to believe that Rust is less than 20% done at this point considering I put in 47 hours the first week I've owned it. My first spawn landed me on the front lawn of my soon to be friends they took me in showed me the ropes and gave me some basic gear. My second day none of them were on so i built my own building in their area. No sooner had I put a door on the hinges than a pair of well armed players started knocking on my door and demanding resources my tiny hut obviously did not contain. I was armed with only a revolver and they were toting automatic weapons and grenades. They eventually hacked down my door and shot me up.Yesterday I was being chased by a guy with a shotgun and i made it to my house told him I had something for him and asked him to stay around. I peeked out from my roof and filled his head with 5.56. I've come full circle.Great game can't wait to see where it goes. Facepunch deserves every dollar they get from alpha sales and they are actively working to fix and expand this great survival sandbox.10/10 Recommending to all my friends.

review: (Updated Review 2016)Still a very good game and my original post from below is still accurate. I do enjoy the addition of the helicopter the new weapons and the added skins are a neat addition as well. Unfortunatly one of the new things I really do not care for is the randomised character attatched to my steam account that is unchangable. I looked in the forums and saw pretty poor responses from Gary on the matter. Its a little upsetting to me that since Rust's creator is unable to see why a certain portion of the community wish to "play as themselves" that those people will flat out be ignored. To me its a big deal and playing as a white female is immersion breaking to me as thats not what I am nor how I want to be identified as. Ive never been able to enjoy games any games that force me to be something I am not. The most convienient example being tomb raider. I bought one of those games many years ago and have never bought one since. Its not my thing. When I sit down to play a game it is me on the screen in my mind thats how its always been even before character creation became rediculously in depth. Hopefully it changes at some point but Im not holding my breath as Gary seems to find it liberating to becoming a (fill in randomized characteristics here). Still a good game but enjoy it less than last year due to the above. If one doesnt care about it than its a near flawless survival game.(Original Review 2015)Would highly recommend. Excellent game and my favorite in its class. My only complaint as of now...it's too intense for me. It's hard to sleep after a play session and I need about four hours to wind down. )

review: This game is absolute garbage. I orriginally got this game a few years ago when it was released and I hated it due to me logging in every day and finding that I had to start over. After hearing that there had been a 'big update' and the game had changed a lot i thought id try it again I managed to find a nce quiet server and had fun for like 5 min. Then I died due to walking into a bear trap and bleeding out instantly then I died to a bear who came out of the middle of a solid rock then I died to a wolf after the game froze on me and crashed. I logged in to find I had to start all over again I was miles from where I was and had to spend an hour finding it again.This game ran better on a laptop with integrated graphics than a desktop with a dedicated graphics card. in playing the game for about 6 hours in the past 24 hours i've had 8 crashes 4 logins where I can't even wake up due to some bug 3 instances where I've been playing for about an hour and then It just freezes and I cant move numerous instances of rubber banding and animals disapearing or apearing into or out of rocks or cliffs.I'm so glad that I didnt pay for either of the rust keys my household has I would want my money back if I had paid. This game has been in early dev for 2 or 3 years and it can't even hold a stable connection or keep mobs from glitching out. Let alone the fact that there really isnt much to do after you've made the later game stuff.

review: Of all the early access games I've purchased recently for being only 10% completed Rust is by far the most playable in its current state. I have not experienced a single framerate drop or a second of lag. There are a ton of reviews complaining about PVP and bandits but if you play smart you can mostly avoid them. Of the half a dozen deaths I've had only one was caused by another player. Yes getting raided is a but this is a survival simulation.. and in the real world that is exactly what would happen. Sometimes you lose a little sometimes you lose everything but you dust yourself off and keep on truckin'. There are over 40 pages of servers surely not all of them are filled with jerks. For the $20 price tag I am quite pleased with this game as it stands.

review: It's still very early on as stated officially.The resources are easily contested due to a small relevant map but this will undoubtedly change... sometime.I strongly recommend finding someone or two to collaboratively protect what's yours and theirs. You will learn very quickly the purpose of human society although it is possible to live a quiet life in the mountains (at your inconvenience of acquiring stuff). This game is a learning experience but does what people thought was a stupid/terrible idea a decade ago and if you're a GMod Stranded veteran you'll feel very much at home in this much more dramatic setting.If it has problems one which is intrinsic it is the nature of people who obtain guns. Additionally perhaps notably the terrible placeholder clothing meshes/skins. I guess another crappy part is the lack of incentive to stick around on a server after your gets wrecked or you become the "prime wrecker" without any comparable competition. What I mean by this last sentiment is that due to a lack of real permanent character progression you'll find yourself wondering about all those greener pastures on other servers until you migrate again.This game has turned into something much bigger and the crew cannot keep up with the myriad of voices. Stick around and something more phenomenal may emerge. (Also Rust is cheaper than 7 Days to Die.)

review: Extremely frustrating community is full of not so pleasent people and serve admins ban you for killing them. I would not recommend this game at all. Do not buy it unelss you are a gluten for punishment and like getting mauled by bears and or wolves at every spawn. The bears and wolves are everywhere spawn too often and if they don't kill you then a player will. The wolves are especially bad. They clip underneath the level and attack you relentlessy. When they glitch like that you are a dead man. This happens way too often. You will be killed over and over again. If someone else has a gun and there is a bear charging them they will shoot and kill you first then deal with the bear. you can be completely unarmed and you will be shot and killed no questions. People also get jelly that you are mining their rock so that is also a good way to die. This game is a great social exparment. It really reveals how terrible people are to each other. This game has huge potential but is ruined by the community poor mechanics and hackers/glitches. I know it is an alpha so the glitches aren't so much much of a problem to me. review: This game consists of naked men running around hitting rocks with a rock with which you can make bigger rocks and then somehow turn those rocks into a fully automatic assault rifle. And for some reason the developers think that you can adequately protect yourself from a pack of 6 wolves all chasing you at once with a medium sized rock. Here I will sum up my experience with the game I spawn on the map. I run over to the convenient pile of logs stacked naturally on the grass. I hit my rock at it until I get wood. I run over to the big rock and hit it until I get stones and metal. I notice I am running low on health so I try to find an animal to kill. I spend 30 minutes looking for a docile animal having died continuously from being bashed across the head with a rock and being chased and eaten by a pack of wolves who will never stop following you until your flesh has been torn off your body and become an afternoon snack. After several attempts at finding an animal to kill I am finally successful in finding one. As I run over to kill the pig and claim my prize after a long awaited finish a pack of wolves chase me away from the pig and eat me after chasing me for 10 consecutive minutes. After that infuriating experience I am just about to give up when I respawn in front of 10 pigs. I happily slaughter every single one of them ripping every resource from their body as I relish the fact that I finally have cloth and food and can start playing this game. Not 2 minutes after I have killed the pigs a pack of wolves chase me off a cliff resulting in my legs being broken. I thought it was over for me again but suddenly a fully clothed man in kevlar with an assault rifle comes to my rescue and kills the wolves. I felt so relieved and thanked him for saving me. He responded by asking me if I had any cloth. I told him yes and 3 seconds later he switched to his shotgun and blew my head off instantly splattering my brains all over the grass. And to top it all off when I respawned I was greeted by a pack of wolves already hungry again.However I still cannot stop playing this game. Its a good concept but needs some work on the wolves. This may sound like I hate this game but I actually enjoy playing it once I am lucky enough to get past all of the bs this early access game has to offer.
title: Rust

review: First Impression "OMFG...WTF...just....wha!?" Yep those were my first words after having my door broken down and then shot by an M4. All this after building a small hovel near a radioactive town and working to get some cool gear. At least I thought the shotgun was cool not so much anymore. The game is pretty harsh for new players. Almost any server you decide to work on will have already established players. By that I mean those people who started on the server many moons ago and will grief the out of you just because they're bored. Its frustrating and intense having to rush to get another building up and secured before being wiped out for your resources. Or even worse trapped in what was supposed to be your home but has now turned into your grave. I'd recommed Rust to those people with a good deal of patience or a friend or two willing to battle the established griefers. A bit of a heads up though your character does not save learned blueprints between servers and with a wave of the admin's hand the server can be cleared entirely of buildings.
