review: This is a very nice game one of the best survival i've ever seen.Since it's still an Alpha you can't completely judge this game for what it's made of BUT it has a LOT of potential and the thing i like most is that they keep updating the game every week without break since they are really on this work.Pros Very fascinating environment it really makes you a nude caveman without any hope that must survive. Playing with friends make this game really awesome. It makes you feel like you're inside it like you can feel the emotion of your player when they invade you you are really feared to die and lose all your things (most for the loss of items though). Pretty nice graphics and they keep updating them with the User Interface too that it's getting better and better. Get scared because a nude caveman is chasing you with a spear and you don't know what to do.Cons For Low end PCs it can be hard to play this game even on lowest settings For High end PCs you can't go on Fantastic without some fps drop (R9 270X and a 8 core FX 8320) but hey it's still an alpha and they are getting better on optimization Hackers managed to RULE this game but things are getting better here too. Nude caveman that chase you with a spear.tl dr Nice game lot of potential still needs development nude caveman with spears it's getting better every day.

review: So I originally had a review up for rust talking about how they need to fix AI and some other minor complaints but now they are fixed so now I want to write an updated review and talk about what they have changed from my last review. Rust is a game where people will do anything and everything to get themselves higher in the server status. They will backstab and kill you without hesitation. I have met some very nice people on this game but I have also encountered lots of people who only care about themselves and their own survival. What I have learned out of my 1 100 ish hours in Rust is that if you want to get anywhere the easiest way to do it is to kill everyone that you think you have a chance at killing. Sometimes you have to use your mic and act like you are friendly then when they turn their back *WHAM* they are dead and you have more loot. If you choose NOT to play this way then good luck you are in for a crazy grind. Most of the time in rust you will be looking for supplies and have goals like 1 Get a weapon2 Gather Materials3 Put Down a Base4 Secure the BaseEtc...Rust was probably one of the most intense games I have ever gotten into and I don't regret it at all. If you choose to buy this game watch your back.

review: Addicting alpha game that should be amazing when (or if) the devs can finish it. The possibilites are endless in this sandbox survivalist PvP minecraft hybrid. Getting on a good server is key to having a good time. As of 03.10.14 servers (perhaps too many) are rented at cost and then administrated with different rules and conditions. It is possible to get a server where the admin abuses the system (gives themselves mass loot teleports unwilling players etc) or a server where the admin is never on. Look for 'No admin abuse' and 'active admin'. Some servers are more pvp and others are more minecraft. Some have low populations to no players and others are swimming with crazy. Some are riddled with hackers and such. Pick the one that suits your playstyle and don't let the server color your impressions of this game but look at it for what it is now in its early stages and what it could become.The game has gone through continuous change over the past 2017 year as the developers try to find a long term solution for its short comings. Game is still strongly supported and updated weekly. One has not truly games until they've tried to survive in RUST.

review: Ok so I have played this game for a long period of time I played the legacy version and the new version and I have to say that I can NOT reccomend this game in it's current form. The idea of rust is a well used one but rust does it well my problem lies in the optimization. In a game that is BUILT arround fighting other people when most people are running at 12fps (thats what I run at) and then come up against someone running at 60fps it is not fair AT ALL to the person running at 12. This would be fine if you could actually use the graphics options to help but those don't even work. If your run the game with the grass quality at 0 it will be SLOWER then if the grass quality is at 100. Those graphics options don't work for Sh*t and it just makes the game not worth playing when you can spend hours beefing up your character just to be smashed to death by a guy with a rock because he has a better computer than you. Also my computer is not one of the best but deffinaitly not one of the worst seeing as though I can run GTA V on medium quality so it falls down to THIS GAME IS NOT OPTOMIZED. When the game can actually run at an acceptible speed I will be coming back to it but untill then I cannot reccomend people buy this laggy POS. However when the game gets fixed I would deffinaitly reccomend it.

review: Rust is one of my favorite games but man it has its issues. This game is so unbalanced that its nearly impossible to play solo on a vanilla server and if you dont start on wipe day you're screwed. You could build a giant base with 20 airlocks to the lootroom but with the twig update a few c4 can completely screw you over. The community is horendous. Its nearly impossible to befriend anyone since the majority of the playerbase are backstabbing 12 year olds. I would recommend this game ONLY if you play on modded servers. With the current state of the game vanilla servers are practiacally unplayable on vanilla.
title: Rust

review: First off I personally really enjoy this game. Despite the fact of its alpha state it has been one of my most played games on steam for a while now. Whether I'm proud of that fact or not it shows that I came back for more multiple times which is generally a good thing.To anyone who has played this game they know that in terms of gameplay this game can be extremely aggravating. The game always follows the concept of constantly gaining and losing loot over and over again whatever the circumstance may be. There are many moments in the game where you could be ahead one day but then you wake up the next morning to nothin but a raided base or you die again and again by one large group both of which make the game very rage inducing. From my perspective the game is all about decision making when to raid when to move base when to de spawn all of your loot because they are blowing your door down when to make the right move. The game is very unpredictable at times. However with all that said when you are on the upside of things and are raiding and/or on a hunting party or something it can be really fun.The game s graphics are pretty good. Its been in alpha for a while now but has received a lot of updates one every Thursday I believe. I m curious what final product they have in stock for us all who knows what it will be.Some Tips 1. Playing with friends in a group is probably your best bet at getting anywhere going solo can be pretty dang hard.2. Don't trust anyone who is not in your group especially nakeds.3. There are always scheduled wipes for each server usually around 1 2 week(s) where everything gets deleted and you start over and it will probably always be that way.4. With #3 in mind remember it's a video game and solely that don't allow it to overcome your life. That may sound silly but it can be one of those games that make you pull all nighters every night.

review: Rust is a great game and it is the only game that I cant tear my eyes away from. I still cant believe that it is only around 10% done and it is already in early alpha. Most early alpha games are around 60 to 70% done. I think Rust is one of the only games that gives you a sence of loss but also a sence of true accompishment. There are a few hackers but as long as you have a bed or sleeping bag you can respawn at your base in no time. Some advice I have is to not bring your good stuff to resource valley or anywhere away from your home because there are alot of snipers and bandits. Something I would like to see would be scopes and some way of trasportation a bigger map and more wildlife.Great game but can be a little annoying to get started off in.

review: The name of the game should be changed to GRIEF. The only ones who get ahead are those who run around killing other players and looting everyone else's belongings. Even a single griefer on the server can ruin the game for everyone else. I tried for hours to get a simple shack built only to be repeatedly killed by the same tool with advanced weapons over and over again. There are no safe zones so forget hiding in your shack or running away. You're on a timer to get food or you die quickly. So the only option for casual players is to die by starvation or die by getting a bullet in the head from someone you can't even see. Want to set up a clan or a village? Forget it. If you manage to overcome the massive paranoia this game instills and form an alliance with someone you still have to constantly watch them because hey they get close to you and wait until you have tons of stuff before they shoot you in the back. This isn't just my experience on one server either it's several. TBH the only time this game was any fun was when I was the ONLY ONE ON THE SERVER! Until this game develops some safeguards for friendly players it will be DOA. Sad because it's got potential otherwise.

review: Review of GameThis is an amazing game after the first few moments of uncertain spawns frustrating deaths at the hands of either players or aggresive wolves/bears and heckling by more experienced players I really started getting the hang of it.Its an addictive game I played it for 24.7 hours in the last 3 days alone. For anyone looking for a survival simulator its a game you should try.In my opinion it is better than its obvious competitor (DayZ) in scope. You don't just scavenge you farm and hunt. Whereas in DayZ it is purely scavenging with the constant pressure to avoid zombies and other (hostile) players. Most of my time in DayZ I die from wounds or hunger as there simply isn't much to scavenge. In Rust however as the scavenging is but one aspect of the game you will find it easier to survive and progress in the game. As compared to constantly dying. Also you are able to build structures to help defend you and your loot. In DayZ all your loot is on your character when you die you more or less lose it as the spawns can be hours from your point of death. The weapon system however is much more sophisticated in DayZ. Note to Devs The developers should really roll out updates in a higher frequencies as after you reach a point you get bored of the constant farming and hunting and building and scavenging. It becomes a routine. Guide for New Players1. You start off with a rock. Its a slow cumbersome tool. You'll want to chop trees or wood piles for wood (Wood piles give 7 per "chop" whereas trees give 1 per chop go for the pile)2. Once you have a sizeable amount of wood go for the rocks to gather stones.3. Build a stone hatchet as soon as you can it will improve your farming abilities drastically. 4. Get more wood build a wooden shelter and a wooden door. Close the door whenever you leave the shelter.5. By this time your hunger should be going up. Hunt animals (Chicken Rabbit Boars and Deer avoid Bears and Wolves) by crouching and sneaking up to them then hitting them with your hatchet. 6. Make a campfire with some wood place it in the middle of your shelter cook meat by "using" the campfire and "opening" it to place your raw meat in the fire. Check back in approximately a min to retrieve cooked meat. 7. Use cloth another by product of the animals you farmed to make a hunting bow. Collect stones &amp wood to make arrows. This is THE most useful and efficient hunting weapon you will find (for now?) 8. Collect more wood and stones build a couple of wood foundations pillars walls doorways stairs windows and ceilings. Find a good spot preferably near a radiation zone village (for scavenging purposes) but hidden from plain sight. (Around some huge mountainous rocks) 9. Set up main base in your new wooden structure. At this point till further updates are released this is it. You've beaten the survival part of the game. From here on forth your goal is to gather materials weapons and supplies ( latter 2 from the radiation zones) in anticipation of the updates. Hope it helps. Rash

review: Game is unfinished. I had a lot of fun when I first began playing made a lot of new friends and enemies. The hackers in the game really ruin the immersion and it takes away the whole point of them game which is to survive. In the end you will be shot from 400m in the head through a wall or you will have a person walk through your wall and take your stuff. I'm more into competitive games where everyone is on a fair playing field. If they managed to stop the hackers fix the bugs and and actually throw out some updates every couple of months Id start playing again. They can use all the excuses they want about the updates but I have other games like 7 days to die and they are throwing updates out every week without a problem. One more thing to add I was actually kicked from a server for apparent hacking. This is the excuse the developer gave everyone that this happened to yet there was no permanent ban. It was just a big cover up to his failure. If this game sells for maybe $2 5 you should buy it. Other than that it's not worth the bother and frustration.

review: Imagine thisYou awake alone in a forest. You are naked and armed only with a rock and basic survival knowledge. In the distance you hear a man singing near some shack. As you wander around you encounter many rundown buildings some with remaining loot. Suddenly you are attacked by a naked man with a rock screaming wildly. You try to give him chance to surrender but he knows that he has nothing to lose. After a deep breath and some applied pressure the naked man is dead. With all his sounds you did not hear the wolf approaching and now you have a hole in your side and a hungry canine chasing you. Further down in a canyon you spot a well managed structure so you run in and block the door. You find some supplies not much but enough for a home of your own. You managed to survive the following weeks by hiding in the mountains only coming down to get supplies. You have built yourself a shack here a tiny hut that by all standards is a piece of crap but hey that is your home. You return one night from a day of hunting and gathering to rest in your little shack and cook up some chicken. Suddenly you hear something quite unusual the sound of rapid construction outside your door. You open it to find a entire room blocking access to the outside world. You try to bust down the walls but they are built to last. You have a shimmer of hope as you hear a singular voice from outside the walls calling to you in a friendly manner... but then they start singing... "Oh! Mr. Shack Man!!!! I have trapped you and we will be together forever! OH!!! Mr. Shack Man! you will slowely starve and I will wait out here!"... the singing never stops... and for 2 hours the crazed singing man circled the shack... banging on the walls with a rock... taunting you with his freedom... so finally you make a decision... you are not going to let him have his fun... you take one last look around at the shack that had been home so long... and you commit suicide...You awake in the middle of a forest... naked... armed with a rock and basic survival knowledge... in the distance you hear a man sing love songs to a shack... and a wolf closes in for a meal

I finally figured it out and build an amazing fort on top of a mountian made shotguns MP5's and Kevlar. Then the next day when I went to play my house was raided. This time I made a raid proof house 10 storeies tall an aditional 20 stories up for a supply room and it was perfect I never got raided. Then I went out of town for a weekend. When I cam back I woke up 30 floors up with no walls no stairs and no supplies. I fell 300 feet to my death. Without stuff. I am not sure how to actually survive because the enemies are too many Other players Animals Infected animals Radiation Starvation Getting Lost and Decay.

review: As the first and so far only game I've had to demand a refund for I felt compelled to write a review.I could not play the game for more than 20 30 minutes at a time as the controls eventually become severely delayed or entirely non functional. While the graphics/textures are acceptable for a small developer game and I can run the game at a high FPS the FPS randomly drops for no reason at all. Lowering the graphics settings did nothing to alleviate this.Beyond the over arching technical issues unless you have some friends that can help you out right from the beginning you'll be in an annoying grind craft explore grind grind die tempo in all your playthroughs. I guess it depends on your pain tolerance do you want to have everything you accomplish get wiped every hour by roving goon squads with automatic weapons?Also I've been in gaming long enough to have no respect for the early access trend this game has followed. Finish the game and maybe I would have found it acceptable to waste $20 on this masochistic experience developers. Two years later and this game is still in "very early development". What a bunch of two timing clowns.

review: This game is great I've played it for about 250 hours and I still have fun. In my opinion its the best survival game out there people say 7 days 2 die is the best I think not.The in game player community is one of the most interesting and this being my first survival game it was interesting to see how my play style evolved over time. * first I was kiled by all most everyone I saw exept the view kind people i met* then when i became good at the game i was friednly but then people started lieying about being frendly * so then if they were armed and looked suppspisous i kill or avoided them* then i started killing noobs and fresh spawn for funin short i became the thing i hated which just to show over time you become the monsterThis game is amazing Pros * Good sized map* lots of serves with the right amount of players* great building (now with triangles)* lots of was to raid e.g. nads rockets and c4* loting barels and rad town is fun* decent crafting * for the most part good graphics* not many glitchs * combat is intense and fun (there is some much a state espesaly if your the one being raided)* updates that actully add to the game e.g. the most recent one added farming and mining * and signs to draw on* your character looks bads with cloth amour/cloths* Large varity of weapons e.g. blot acction machin gun bow sspear pistal pipe shot guns ect.* various types of ammo for each weapon e.g. HV arrow arrow HV rocket rocket * differing envirenment e.g. snow desert beach and woods* upgrading structures is easyCons *big exploits that need to be patched e.g. you can have 30 sleeping bag and the spawn cool down is only per sleeping bag you can set your spawn out side rad town to travel there with ease (most of these are opsaleat when you play in vanila)* not to many survival aspects the only thing you have to worry about is the cold heat and hunger * not many dangerous A.I* you can't ride horses * you can't through the spear* building black can be used as a trolling tool* not really any tips to help you so you will die a few time before you get the hang of it* you can't modify your weapons like you could in the old engine e.g. silencer laser flash light and red dot scope.over all the game is worth it i payed $25 and have got 250 hour of play time and fun witch $1 pre 10 hours great value for money and you can still play the old engine if you want though I'm sad to say now has more hackers then ever before.
title: Rust

review: Now althought I voted down this game that does not mean its bad. If I were making this review a year ago I would say thunbs up 100%. Poor optimization leading to poor fps on a good pc Graphics are mediocre Game is clunky Over pricedThe game was very solid before in the legacy build which is what I paid $20 for and did not regret. I didnt pay $20 for this laggy piece of they call rust today. What you see in that preview film is what rust used to be its nothing close to that anymore.

review: When I first started I went to two different servers. Both of which I had encountered one friendly guy. He told me to follow him. I went through intensive training jumping over wood and swimming across the ocean. My final test was to stand infront of him and crouch towards his body.'Nuff said. 10/10 would "train" again. Seriously though the game is pretty fun. Gathering resources and building a house is satisfying but you will be constantly worrying about guys with ak's who will kill you. It is extremely rough if you're going to play solo gathering resources isn't a problem. Older players or large groups will most likely kill you once you reach the point that you're going to build a house. Just recently I've found a friend whom I could trust and we built a house together that was the longest a base I created had ever survived. Majority of players have to play at low settings to get a decent amount of fps in the game (20 30). Unless you have an expensive PC and want to go in gunfights without your fps dropping to 10 you might want to rethink about buying this game. Overall the only problem about this game are the player's behaviors other than that multiplayer is fun.

review: The best game that I have ever played. It is a very unique blend of survival and pvp. You can play the game in a lot of different ways.The developers have consistently put a lot of effort into refining Rust. They are very open to feedback from the community but know when to draw the line for the vision of their game. Rust has been stuck in alpha for a long time but it has never been for lack of passion. This game is slowly and surely heading in a very good direction. I have gotten more than my money's worth out of it. It has been a worthwhile ride.Be forewarned playing solo is not for the faint of heart. I personally enjoy hiding and avoiding people as long as possible. The game is best played with a group of friends that you trust. You may also need thick skin because the game and its players are not forgiving.

If they don't have enough hands to build or progress the game quickly then they should have waited to release it when they had more content. And this has already been out 8 months with not much changed. Sorry Rust but by the time you and DayZ fix the game and there will be games already out that we all will leave to. 7 days to Die and H1Z1 already look more promising of the 8 months of rust already being released just for quick money.Now it's not like I played for the first week it was released and complained I actually waited to see if it grew and frankly they are taking too long for 20 bucks.

review: Rust is both the best and worst game ever all at the same time. It provides you with a capable building platform similar to minecraft and a beautiful world to survive in and a huge community of players. While these things are great they also are the downside to themselves. The building mechanics are decent but not varied enough and limited for building components. There isn't much else to do but build simple structures and craft. While there is huge community of players many of them are not friendly even if they say they are and many of them are going to immediately kill you. That's just how it is. I have also watched players completely quit rust and never play again because of it. You work at your structure for hours and loose everything cause you log off and aren't there to defend it. All of that put aside. I still really really enjoy Rust. Even when I spend 20 hrs mining resources to have someone raid it and take it all away from me. Why would I enjoy this you say? Because that's how life is. You work really hard for things and struggle to make friends and trust people. Even when you do make friends and are all working to gether it can still be hard and you have to work and fight for eveything you have. Then sometimes maybe even several times you will lose a lot. Maybe even everything. But that's how life just works. Then when you log off you have to go to work and school and basically do the exact same thing. And in the end things don't always work out as planned or you have to lose out on some things. Which is why I will never hate Rust even though it can very greatly frustrate me. Because of how it just so very closely mimics the real world. A very blood thirsty and impulsive world. What does all this mean for you as the player looking to buy this reading this review? It means you should really only buy this game if you are ready to struggle tooth and nail for every scrap of material you have and then possible loose it. You can make friends but it will be equally as hard. The best thing to think about when purchasing this is 'Will you be able to make the game enjoyable for yourself if you get it?' Because that's what this game relies upon is how you can make it fun for yourself while struggling against overwhelming odds.Really think about it cause it will be a waste to spend $20 get mad never play again. Alot of people play for ten minutes post a review that says naked hits rocks. 10 10. It's sounds fun and funny and great. Then you play and you realize that it's not all fun in games. You will have to dedicate some time to this when you want to play. When you're not playing you have to realize that everything you have is at jeopardy. When you take a break from the game for any amount of time days weeks etc. You will have to be willing to most likely give up all your work and start over because as the days go by all of your creations are exposed and at risk. People will try and raid them and sometimes they will succeed. The longer you wait to play again the higher the chance of a raid on your stuff.One thing you also really have to realize is this game is not updated very often since he is working on another much larger ip.All that being said. I would totally give this game a 9 10. I really do enjoy it even when it's rough. I would recommend it to anyone who is willing and patient enough to play.

review: Note first that this is definitely an Early Access game not many features exist in it and what features do exist are clunky and buggy as all of Hell. Plus the devs aren't completely sure which direction they want to go with it.That being said what's here is good. It's a solid Minecraft/DayZ combination that trades off some gunplay for some basic (at the moment) building mechanics. I hope that the devs keep going down that route but we'll see.I recommend this game to those who are willing to pay for an Early Access game very early in development. review: Pretty good so far.I'm liking this game so far and i'm eager to see where it goes in the future. MUCH more addicting than i originally thought it would be. if you're looking for criticism then i would say that it's much more fun if you have friends with you alone the game can feel lonely and boring (and frustrating) at times . also personally the game does not have that minecraft feel of forever expanding you house or building random stuff because crafting is limited and you want to keep yourself hidden from other players who might be out raiding. So once your house is complete and you got resources for days theres not much to do unless you want to start raiding. The game isssss still in Alpha so its hard to nitpick when so many things will be changed in the future.I do recommend this game to the people who're looking for a fun survival game that can be played with friends.if i had to rate this game from 1 10 i would give it a solid 7/10.and again it's still in Alpha so expect glitches and bugs and stuff

review: Day 305 Built a civilization thriving and filled with characters of joy and happiness. We all lived together foraging and surviving the onslaught of radiation zombies and the occasional bears or wolves. Todd...I remember him well the local cook could grill the best chicken breast this side of Rad Town...good man...didn't deserve what was done to him. Then oh god his wife Clarice...she was so beautiful and so full of life...They took them both behind the rocks and shot them with pipe shotguns. I could still hear the screams in my sleep. I know they are coming for me I hear them chanting "Let us in we wont kill you if you just unlock your doors." They scratch at the door with pickaxes and rocks trying to taunt me.The inevitable happened I was gunned down in front of my house with my dignity far far behind my back.I then spawned with a rock got killed by another man because he said my rock was sexier than his and he wanted it.10/10

review: Rust... where do I even begin? I used to hate this game because I would spawn with a rock run around craft a bow and die by some guy with an AK 47. I see a lot of people get into this situation where they cannot even build a base. However that is almost what this game is about. When one starts to play rust they must know what they are getting into. There are hundreds of whiny 12 year old mic spamers that will make you wish you were deaf. There are random wolves that will eat you when you are almost done with your base. It is a SURVIVAL game. Not survival like DayZ or H1Z1 where you simply have to get lucky and find an OP gun. Rust you have to go about strategically hiding in bushes as a genocidal helicopter flies overhead building a small base that you hope no one sees so that you might make it to the end of the server wipe. All in all Rust is not for the faint of heart. You must be patient wise and do your research. You get out of this game what you put in. If you take it as a die hard survival game that's the sort of experience you will have. If you want to be a high powered clan that dominates the server you have to work for it. If you want to take this game lightly and just to have some fun you will have some of the funniest experiences in gaming ever. But everything considered buy this game. You will not regret it.

I hope you will expand the *crafting* and *building* aspects of the game. Millions of MineCraft builders should give you a hint that this is much much more important than PVP to a huge segment of customers (including me). Especially I am hoping for the ability to construct *active* elements in the game (like the many kinds of machines one can build in MineCraft). Anyway at this point I am finding it pretty painful to play the game but I am hopeful for future improvements. Keep up the good work!

review: Game is broken and buggy as hell. Got stuck between some rocks had to wait until my hunger and then health went all the way down until I could die and get out took about 20 minutes. The game has a "Sleeper" system which basically means that whenever you log off your body falls to the ground asleep and you then get robbed and killed when you are away so if you want to progress you can't log off. Early shelters are easily broken into so all your progress can and will be reset if you aren't willing to sink 4 hours of just farming materials when you start up to get a decent house. Unfortunately even higher quality homes are easily broken into due to the easy availability of C4. Expect to lose everything and have to restart often it's fun for a bit then it just gets old. Game encourages bullying of newer players expect to be shot by more experience players for fun regularly. Players are actively malicious and often attempt to trap you in cells so that you can only get out by starving and wasting 20 minutes of your time. Horrible playerbase poorly thought out mechanics. Do not get.

review: If your into survival community games this is the perfect game.I would recommend you to play this game with your friends cuz it will be way funnier and easier to get startet and it gives you and your friend(s) and great experience. In Rust you can pvp against other players/teams that could be a clan war you can raid other people and get all their stuff and destroy their base so your clan can be the best on the server!I think that the community on Rust is awesome there is a lot of kind ppl but theres ofc also some really mean ppl no matter what game your playing there will allways be atleast 1 mean person.New you just startet on a Rust server you wont have that much but then you can go arround break some barrels near the roads so you can find stuff called ''***** Blueprint'' these blueprint items makes you better because you can study them and then you can make them yourself which is freaking awesome!!There is different kind of servers there is the Official servers which is the normal Rust servers where you start completely new there is community servers which mean and there is the modded servers i love the modded servers on the modded servers you will ofc start completely new but on some of the modded servers there can be kits (/kit) which can give you an amazing start all the servers will/can wipe which means they will be resat so every house thats build will dissapear BUT your blueprints wont dissapear!!But ofc there is also a few bugs in Rust but they wont kill you etc just ignore them and you'll be fine!! &lt 3I hope you'll give Rust a chance!Remember this game if funniest with your friends BUT can also be funny alone because you can find ppl ingame and talk to them (you can use mic ingame). I recommend playing this game with your friends.Have fun and Good luck being the best clan!

review: "The only aim in Rust is to survive. To do this you will need to overcome struggles such as hunger thirst and cold. Build a fire. Build a shelter. Kill animals for meat. Protect yourself from other players and kill them for meat. Create alliances with other players and form a town." Rule #1 Trust Nobody not even yourself. Rule #2 If you see others and have nothing more than a stone and a torch try to talk to them. Use a microphone! If they don't respond smash them ) Rule #3 Always keep an eye on your health etc.! Rule #4 Animals aren't stupid they can attack you as well. If you're unarmed run! And don't eat rare meat )Rule #5 If you find a river drink as much as you can.Rule #6 Don't build a large house. Start with a little shelter and then extend if others haven't found you yet.Rule #7 Try to pick only useful things when you've smashed a barrel searched a building etc. You can melt unuseful things at the recycler! Rule #8 Don't stay too long at one place this increases the chance of being found.Rule #9 If you find useful things try to save them asap! (Small stashes are pretty good for that but remember where you hide them!)And last but not least DO WHATEVER IT TAKES TO SURVIVE!!!1!!11!!

review: Rust is a game that I keep coming back to. The developers are still actively working on the game and changing things mostly for the better. It's interesting to see every week what changes they're bringing to the game. This game is definitely more fun if you have a group of friends to play with but if you get on a less populated server I've definitely had a lot of fun playing solo and trying to survive against the other generally small groups of players. Not every experience is going to be good though if you're unprepared it can be daunting and downright depressing getting killed almost as soon as you spawn but once you get a foothold it can be a lot of fun. I've absolutely gotten my money's worth from this game and enjoyed both the good times and the bad times.

review: Best way to describe Rust? with guns. I had a choice between Day Z and Rust. I chose rust due to the building concept. I regret my purchase and will be going with Day Z instead. Atleast that game has more polish. Rust is so full of hackers and aim botters the community is complete trash. The building concept is not even that good. The game is sluggish and tiresome as if it's a struggle just to get through the atrociously lag infested drag down on the system and I have a high end rig.Everything you want to find in Rust you can do in Day Z and after watching one Video clip of it it was easy to see where Rust Lacks. Garry should of stuck with just Garrys Mod the graphics and programing of this game is so bad it's beyond a joke. Yeah the trash community will say. Oh it's only early stages. Oh you just died. Dude people die in Day Z all the time but it's a hell of alot better game then even this trash of an excuse for a 'new and upbeat game'.And just for your information this game concept of crafting in a post apocolyptic setting is nothing new Fallen Earth was doing it way better and way before it was even an Idea in Garrys head (plaugerize much Garry?). A offset and mix of Minecraft and Day Z? My Fallen Earth does this WAY better and that game has Dune Buggies. (Now no doubt garry will go look at that game add it's features and go OH new concept! plaugerize.) Disgusted.Stay away from this game it's so sluggish and trashy when it comes to community and game mechanics programming and graphics stick with Day Z for the extra $ there's a reason it's worth more or try Fallen Earth which is free to play. (FA has a few querks but better by truck loads in Graphics and Game depth then this Rust tripe).All in all NOT recommended at all. Even the developer aka Garry has more of a priority in fixing the sky graphics then dealing with aimbotters or hackers and the self made anti hacker hardly works. Did I mention Abusive Admins who abuse their power by banning people who kill them?All'in'allTrash Game Trash Community. Don't make the same mistake I did save your purchase.

review: This game is alright but you should not pay the full price of $20. I would rate the game 7/10 because it is a hard time getting started as a noob or a good player. The system that you build and craft is too difficult and requires large amounts of scrap and other materials. I played for a while now and some tip would be not to play on the official servers unless you are good at the game. The people in high population servers kill you on sight even if you have nothing. Great game but needs work and a better community. At this point it is your choice if you want to buy the game just remenber the return policy.

review: You know those games that you talk to your friends about? The ones that strike that extreme addiction level from the get go? The ones where you hastily go and check the dev site for more updates just jonesing for more? One of those games where time just seems to slip through your fingers?This is one of those games.I sunk over 100 hours into this game in maybe 3 weeks. This game will break you and suck away your soul. BUT you will love every minute of it. Don't listen to the players that say the game isn't fun solo. Be creative! Hunt those other sick bastards on your server and steal their belongings. Be a nomad. Playing with a group will ensure some dominance but you have to be careful who you bring in. That should say enough.I've also gotten some major adrenaline rushes from both raids and raid defense. Things get tense. And when things get tense things get awesome. This game nails that on the head.But then you have to tell yourself... It's just a game. Right? Rustlyfe 4evrtldrThe game is a TON of fun and is a game I will keep coming back to time after time to check out what's new. Check it out!!!!

review: I really enjoy the game. There is just one problem The servers are ran by players. Each server is ran by a person that also happens to play on that server.......Every server that I have joined there has been a cheater server admin. It is really quite ridiculous as the premise of the game is to hide and build supplies and a house yet the admin knows excactly where you are at all times and has complete control over you......So there are two options befriend the server admin and become a cheater like him/her or join an empty server and play by yourself. That is it.This does essentially ruin the game BUT....I still think it is worth the asking price as you can still have hours of good times....that is until the admin decides he doesn't like you or you begin to stock items and materials that he wants. They will be taken and your house will be destroyed.

review: This game used to be amazing ever since the blueprint system got canned and Andre and Maurino started working as Devs at Facepunch everything just started going downhill. It is pointless update week after week.Pros Intense PVPCons Terrible AI Servers filled with children. Pure grind. Can't win without a large group. Updates add useless things instead of fixing bugs. Horrible optimization (Yet the company says get a better computer) HORRIBLE anti cheat (EAC is possibly the worst anti cheat out there.) Cancerous community. Cheaters don't get banned non cheaters do. No game management.All in all I would avoid Rust and try other survival games such as Conan The Forest ARK etc.Note1 EAC has been false banning accounts left and right for profit reasons. (Not just on Rust either)Note2 Gary has a net worth over the billions and he is still too cheap to get REAL unity libraries &amp assets. Instead he keeps using outdated network engines like RakNet then he tells his customers to upgrade their computers or go play another game. Note3 Facepunch has done nothing but make games in alpha then abandon them. I would stay FAR away from any Facepunch development AND Rust!

review: Extremely buggy and laggy game not worth the 20 euros. Even with the lowest graphical settings i experienced heavy lag on my new gaming PC. Not to forget the 'always friendly' community willing to show the harsh reality Rust which goes something like this Yes you did just buy that game. Yes you did waste the money on that. Yes Rust is just another early access pile of excrement on the market released on the market to make the developer some extra money for further development.I do not expect highly of any survival game but with a ludicrous 20 euro price for a early access (which the developers did state was buggy I had hoped that they would atleast focus on enhancing the game and removing unnecessary coding but with the reason trend of survival games I can guess the developers were overwhelmed with the demand for more features just like Independent DayZ which today is still battling with server maintenance and massive lagspikes.My advise? Do not buy atleast until a major patch is done and have fixed most of the lag. Unless you have a super computer in which case go right ahead but Rust really is over the top and I there highly suggest you to go find another survival game with your friends ( or even better find another kind of game! ) play that. Rust will most likely be stuck in development hell forever

review: Has many great ideas. Garry has said it's 10% done so how can anyone reccomend it? I have built so many different types of forts only to spend most of my time in game getting resources to build a fort for all the things I gather so they can't be stolen. Hackers though are a major problem... I am sure they can still jump high in the air and then use 10 c4 to break into your stuff easily with ESP box location. That is the main problem with this game other than these photos on the main page. Who the has time to build a metal base that big? Do I need to stay on rust 24/7 to build my base then I can go out and hunt people? My group never got the chance to go out and hunt/raid bases very much in the 300 hours I've played because we were stuck gathering to build our defenses. Large spike walls are a joke.. place one camp fire and use med kits to break it down.. useless. There are no building defenses that actually work. You can sit there placing foundation after foundation but all someone needs to do is find the right spot and build next to your foundation and up up up. How many noobs must waste their mortal life to learn these harsh lessons? Now what about player customization? This game everyone looks the same so in a pvp fight it's hard to tell friend from foe in the heat of the action. No female models so it's all the time is Garry gay or something? People say "All the females died in the world of Rust" but that is the most stupid thing I've ever read or heard. Who would live in a world with out females? JUST . sounds pretty gay.Now if that wasn't bad enough the world is so big yet so empty. You can climb to the top of any mountain just for your fingers to hurt realizing theres no resources around or npcs to hunt. One of the worst aspects of this game is joining a server only for people to be hogging resources. The whole map can be explored but it takes forever and who the hell wants to run for 20 minutes to the middle of no where.I think the last thing I want to talk about is the combat system. The shooting feels really weird the bullets drop unreaslitcally and some how a pistol has a larger range than an mp5. Not to mention you have useless trash like the revolver pump shot gun etc.. These weapons are great if they were gearing for a fall out game but instead they provide military grade weapons that spoil the experience. How much more fun would it be if bandits were raiding you with bats and ghetto guns vs m4/kevlar/shotgun/grenades/c4. I just don't think unmodern items (like the rock too wtf?) have a place in this game that's trying so hard to be modern. Save your money if you read my review it's not worh it right now.
title: Rust

review: This game is very fun in all the ways that I love. I have a few suggestions for the editors though I was thinking it would be better if when you unlock a weapon with a blueprint you not only unlock the gun but the ammunition as well. also I think it would be a good improvement to add vehicles to the game as well. so like if you wanted a car you would have to craft the engine wheels hull and car controls. It would be better to keep the resources expensive though to give the gamer something to look forward to and collect for a while and plus you would have to craft a key for it and must have it with you at all times if you wish to travel by car. it would also be really cool to add the ability to climb trees if you had rope that you could craft using a workbench. Then you could climb up the tree to escape predators or players with melee weapons or you could place a "tree house platform" on it and make a tree house. Also while on the topic you guys should add a sniper rifle to snipe while in trees or on top of mountains or at long distances and if you wanted to upgrade you sight you would have to find a blueprint for it so you could start with it having a x2 scope then you can craft a x3 and x4 scope but then you have to find blueprints for any other scopes with higher magnification. and last but but not least I think it would be more realistic if there was a thirst bar and there would be ponds scattered across the map for you to drink but you could also craft a flask for carrying water and you would craft it with a certain amount of cloth. I would really appreciate if you considered these suggestions and I think it would be awesome if you added some of them.

review: Pros Graphics are pretty nice runs fairly well on my upper medium rig Building a base with some friends gathering resources and getting blueprints for weapons is very satisfying You can occasionally meet someone who won't shoot you on sight then maybe you'll have a laugh together The paintable signs are a great idea and add some much needed personal touch to the worldCons The community is toxic 9/10 people will kill you instantly on sight even if you are a fresh spawn but whats worse is half of them sound like spoiled 10 yr olds over voip which is extremely annoying Logging in and seeing your base and all your stuff completely gone just cos you couldn't play for a day is pretty disheartening so unless you want to be a 24/7 rusthead then don't bother all you'll get is frustration time and again. Makes you hate the community turning you into another kill on sight cos you're sick of getting shot for no reason hence the community breeds it's own demise. Hackers (not to name names but cough *russians* cough)Basically if you want to have a game that you have to dedicate 4 hours a day to AT LEAST then you might enjoy rust but for me its just a bunch of sitting in their towers shooting everyone they see only going outside to shoot more people on sight.Having said that you might want to be one of those people and it can be really good fun don't get me wrong. I just want you to be a little more knowledgeable about what you're getting with rust which is what a review should be.Edit This is the most complete early access game I've ever witnessed. While the gameplay isnt my cup of tea anymore I do recommend playing this if you have friends to play with.

review: Overall I think Rust is great game if you're willing/interested in playing a lot and like survival/crafting/fps type games. If you like Minecraft AND PUBG there's a good chance you'll like this.It's good to see regular updates on a consistent schedule. And they are usually impactful major updates so you get the sense that there's progress towards the finished product. There are always good and bad things with each update but there is an overall positive trend and looking at their roadmap of disclosed goals for the game I'm confident the end product will be something I'm happy with.That said Rust is not a game for someone who wants to play for 30 minutes here and there. It really takes hours of play between wipes to make significant progress. This is both a positive and negative. It's positive in the sense that I can easily lose track of time and lose myself in this world experiencing the emotional journey of gaining resources over time and then losing them when I inevitably get raided. Obviously it's bad for anyone who doesn't have the time or who doesn't want to invest the time into making progress in this game.
title: Rust

review: Joke of a dev team. Usually I try not to buy early access games with caution that you may get such a trash dev team like this game has. I brought this back when it first came out and sunk MASSIVE hours into it the original idea and the basis of starting out as a naked dude and making your way through the ages as almost a caveman to a kevlar wearing gun blazing bad was just awesome and felt rewarding. I followed the websites dev blog updates each week and each week we got a sweet jack released. A few months past and Garry (the owner) releases an update saying they didn't expect their game to be so popular and it's been to stressful so his going on holidays for 2 weeks. Comes back more updates followed along the lines of 'don't expect so much from us guys we just wanted to take our time with this project we are only like a 4 man team so stfu and stop asking for updates'. After months of really just concept ideas some genius thought it would be crack to totally scrap the old engine of the game and start fresh and that's basically the point they lost their entire playerbase. I feel like a got my monies worth in the end so it was whatever only $30 but it is such a shame to see a great idea that just got screwed. Garry said himself they sold way more then expected so instead of INVESTING and hiring more then a f*cking 4 man team he decides a holiday is a more wise choice basically taking our money and running with it. Don't buy the game it's now not even worth 10 bucks

review: Amazing game with alot of potential. This game is already good in Alpha I can't even imagine by the time its released. The pvp is a bit clunky but I like it the idea of rad zones and better items within them is great! I can't wait till they replace zombies with something even more awesome and when they add more loot and improve pvp this game will beat all others. The idea of crafting you gear has really set this apart from DayZ and i dont know why anyone would compare it with that. Great game you really should get it. Though its a bit more for intense gamers than casual ones because when you log out you can still be killed.P.S. I really think military would fit what we have now and make this game amazing. This would still set us apart because in most games you are the military but in this you are against the military and it would not even be the most important part of the game. review: Rust is honestly a very very fun survival game. Of course there are no zombies in the game which i had heard they took out before i ever purchased the game. Which is just fine by me because there is honestly no other survival game like this one. I was so intrigued when i read about running around hardly dressed with just a rock and a torch to weild. So i have experienced it for myself finally. There is A LOT of PVP which im more of a PVE type of gamer besides there are plenty of No PVP servers just as well. So the game contributes to both type of gamers who love to grief and others that play solo or just want to help others and build survive etc. I have come acrossed more friendly players than i have trolls/griefers to be honest. My first pvp experience was not willingly and i was bludgened to death with a stone hatchet twice over. So i stick to no pvp servers. Plus i like this game so much i purchased my own rental server for 3 months! Its fun to be an admin too. Anyways if pure survival running around half naked sounds good to you... you got to check out RUST!

review: this game is hard challenging in every way imaginable! when i first bought this game a year ago and began playing i couldn't get more then 5 minutes into a new server without being brutally murdered every 30 seconds. it was hard and frustrating and i set the game down for awhile without giving this game any more thought or consideration. several months ago i came back and gave it a fresh start. i immediatly ran into the same toxic community and the same brutal skill curve as before but this time i was persistent i tried other options i made friends i battled hard and i found my niche into this wonderful game. now i can't set this game down and just when i consider taking a break or stepping away the amazing team at facepunch waterfalls tons of new content updates bug fixes and optimizes the game on a whole new level that i have never seen with any other early access game out there! this studio and this game deserve much needed love! they bust to provide a kick game and i feel they deliver on many levels! this game is tough and it is hard but it is so worth it!welcome to rust!

review: Been playing this game since early Legacy and have nearly 1000 hours on it. Played mostly solo or with one friend. The game is a gem it's incredibly fun and challenging. The devs are very motivated and updates and new features fly out by the week. The amount of variety there is in how you can play this game is immense. Playing in massive groups of 10+ people and building castles versus playing solo or even playing on a wide variety of different servers with mods and different rules that change how the game plays. I love this game but it isn't perfect. Que the love rant about the current state of the game There is still a lot that must be done especially about player interactions and how the game has turned into a glorified pubg with crafting and building. Look to other hardcore survival games and you will see very quickly why this is an issue. We need weapons especially high tier weapons and ammo to feel extremely valuable and rare. At the moment you struggle for an hour or so and then you start creating an armory inside of your base as if its WW3 and roll around with the sole purpose to just kill and raid that's all. There's zero danger from the environment animals radiation etc. Running through the radiated towns is easy and getting loot is as well. We've moved in a good direction with the BP update recently but we need to go full on back to the survival game roots. I don't want to just have the goal of the game to not be raided survive player interactions and raid other people. The game gets boring fast as it would be more worth my time playing CS GO or pubg if I want to role around shooting at as many people as I can. We need sickness dangerous animals and weather conditions rare weapons and ammo bounty systems for the server variation in injuries struggle for food and water. Terminus servers are doing something right and thats by making the game difficult and posing you with more varied and difficult decisions to make. DayZ is a truer survival game than Rust has ever been (for a lot of the reasons I've already stated) but lacks its polish and dedicated staff. I have faith that the game will eventually end up where it needs to be the devs need to just ignore the crying little children who want a CoD esk game experience from this. The dev team is amazing the quality of the game and how it plays and looks is superb we have everything we could want but hardcore progression incentivized and varied player interactions hardcore survival mechanics etc. All in all this game has been beyond worth the initial 20$ I spent a long time ago and has continued make that purchase way beyond worth it. I just hope that the devs heed the words their long term player base and aren't afraid to make drastic survival based changes to the game. If they do this Rust will become the single best survival game ever created (it's already very close to that title even with so much more improvement to be had).

review: Rust combines the crafting and survival elements of Minecraft into a zombie survival game with a twist. You are on a server with other people and you have to be wary of others. You're not sure if they are hostile or are friendly so every encounter with another player is more dangerous than an encounter with NPC's. It's a very fun and rewarding game when you can stake your own piece of the country side and forage and survive. Defending yourself and your area becomes an instinct as you're wary of other players. At times any chance of having friends breaks down and it's a kill on sight game where nobody trusts anyone. It's very fun and I recommend it to anyone who enjoys survival type games.

review: I love this game to death. If you ever get the chance to buy it go ahead. It can take some getting used to as many s roam the game killing on site but the occasional friendly always turns out well. I can honestly say that the whole survival aspect is based off of community. The more people you band up with the better. I reccomend playing with friends but I've had equally enough fun finding new ones in game. Nothing feels better than finding someone who has a mutual enemy as you and taking them out together to split the spoils. The whole hunting/gathering aspect is great too as it keeps you on your toes. You can't hide forever in a base or you'll starve. It requires constant exploring and fighting. It's never a boring game as something/someone is always chasing you or you'll be chasing them. Overall this is a kickass game.

review: I have currently been playing this game for the past few days and love it. Some of the issues people have stated in other reviews have been fixed or they are simply oppinions for example one review said it is too quiet but I personally like the lack of music and its simple all natural sound pallet. Also the community is not all trash. I met a player last night who practically built a base for me and we are friends now. PvP is a feature in the game so if you don't like constantly getting shot by people in 4 story bases consider running away immediately or looking through the server lists and finding a procedurely generated server with say 3 4 people in it and seclude yourself. The game itself is a work in progress but as far as I'm concerned the only the thing that needs nerffed are the F***ing bears and the only thing that needs work is the graphics (it has fairly poor resolution). If you enjoy survival games with no limits on your gameplay rust is going to be the game for you.

review: Quick breakdown of my summary Hacking (My only real issue with this game)Customer ServiceOverall gameplayI am really surprised to see how many "helpful" reviews were positive. Even though this game might be in Alpha and I have to wonder if this game is in forever Alpha. 3 weeks ago I bought this game thinking "looks good!" at first the game was fun I even built a house with a metal door to safe guard my stuff (I was wrong). Although I don't mind my door being blown up by C4 and my place raided I do however mind the rampant hacking in the game. It isn't even the flying or the speed hacking people are doing it is the flat out clipping through walls which makes it pointless to even build anything. I watched a player do it to me I've seen dozens of players fly through the air and well even the trusty Aimbot is used howelse does someone shoot you in the middle of the night pitch black from a distance?Just do a google for the hacks and you will find them are they detected NO and there will not be a ban either. The one good thing you can count on is the hacking is no secret they will admit it and even do it right in front of you! Why? Well that is a good question... because no one will ban them. Look at the companies stance on it look at what it takes to report this issue. They literally put the responsibility off on Steam to do something which isn't there problem it is the company who produces this kind of bad programming with no server side checks.Make your own decision but remember you have been warned!! P.S. The same hack that has been getting used for along time. You can follow in on a forum and nothing has been done to stop it. Due to rules and guidelines I cannot link you it or I would I will not name it because I want this post to be seen.

review: The first hour and a half of my game time was spent hunting and gathering food and resources. I struggled every night to stay alive since I had not built a house yet. Eventually I found someone else's house which had a furnace and workbench. I was able to equip myself with clothes bow and arrows and a shotgun. I thought I was invincible until I saw a naked man holding a rock... I thought I was superior so I threatened him telling him to get away from my newly claimed land. He responded with "alright alright I'm leaving. I felt like I owned the world at that very second. As I was running back to my home I found a deer and decided to kill it with my shotgun. I ran to loot my game but I was killed by the same naked man who I thought I had ran off with my shotgun. His name was FapsPerSecond.As I was dying the last thing I heard was "There can only be one Fap." 10/10

review: It's a fantastically difficult game and your own drive for progress is what keeps you enthralled. This is however the most difficult first person survival shooter I have ever played (at the start). You learn rather quickly that the challenge in the game comes not from the risk of starvation the wild animals or the difficulty of finding resources. No you learn quickly that your fellow players are the most intense threat you face. There is no other game that makes your heart pump like it does when you see another human player in Rust. Even hearing distant footsteps while sitting in the safety of your ramshackle home makes your palms sweat and will make even the most devout atheist pray to a higher power that the person doesn't raid your home. There is no game that makes you rage quit harder upon death (not even you Dark Souls) and certainly no game that makes you cheer in ecstasy at a successful in game day. I wholeheartedly recommend this game. It's fantastic. I do have one problem with it The community is full of morons. You will absolutely find some wonderful people in game and you can join a clan of hardcore survivalists who will help you on the way but first you have to wade through a sea of innappropriate jokes and high pitched voices bragging about banging your mother. It's well worth the struggle.

review: Its hard to give this game a "no"...let me explain why.Its a great game in theory. Start from scratch gather resources craft new items craft a home kill animals cook food meet friends start a colony work together. YAY!It's too bad it doesn't happen that way...what ends up happening is you are spawn killed for the first hour or so. Eventually you learn to stick far from the road and only go out at night. The first thing you will probably end up asking is how to craft. You will get the normal answers "alt+f4" "console quit" etc.. To be expected it is an online game deployed via steam afterall. You might and I mean MIGHT find a kind soul who will guide you in creating a fire cooking meat and not dieing from starvation. This battle continues with almost any question you have in the game.So lets say you've got the basics down. You got 100 wood in your pocket a shed set up with a wooden door and some cooked meat. Hey you even just got enough cloth to craft a bow and arrow! How awesome! Guess what? You are going to get killed. I garauntee it. Some clown with kevlar and a shotgun will find you taunt you and then kill you. This doesnt sound so bad really...I mean in games with PvP involved its bound to happen right? Did I mention you lose all your items? Yes thats correct you lose everything. The last 3 hours your spent crafting your cloth armor bow and arrow mining resources? Wasted. Some assclown just shot you in the head and took it all. You have to start ALL over agian. If you do not find the 1/10 people who are not noobkillers you are going to want your money back. It seems the only way to play this game is to beg to join someones colony/group and pray they dont decide to go HAM on you. This game would be infinitely fun with some sort of career mode or being able to turn off your PvP elegibility. That would be awesome...
title: Rust

review: "Keep in mind this game is alpha. I would pay $60 for this current alpha build. This game is great. Absolutely amazing. 10/10 would recommend." That was the original review with the version of the game that was released first. Over 1(?) year later my review is now this. I lost my faith in Facepunch. They had a great thing going with legacy and now it just simply isn't fun. Making the maps way too large and making landmarks impossible to find is just some of the issues. Playing as a solo player is extremely brutal now. You will be hunted down and raided to the end of the earth. The "new and improved" graphics and engine don't feel better to play in at all. Melee combat still feels terrible ESPECIALLY with the wildlife. Oh how I wish the new Rust was half as exciting or engaging as Legacy.Unfortunately many of the positive reviews for this game talk of grand adventures and hilarious events but most likely these reviews are outdated and are for legacy rust.But honestly and simply this game is not fun anymore. I would love to play it but it just is too huge of a time sink for too litte of a reward. Legacy was not perfect but it was a whole lot better than whatever this game is.
title: Rust

review: First experience with this game I log in and get sniped after moving a few feet. Not a huge problem. Second spawn some guy comes up to me attacking me with his rock while shouting racial slurs at me in voice. Everything about this game encourages griefer behavior and so that is exactly the type of players you will encounter in this game. I was originally lured in by the description which describes this game as a "man vs nature" survival game and while it does have those elements in it they are severly downplayed by the primary focus of "player vs player". Most deaths you will encounter will come from other players and VERY few from actually failing to "survive" the environment. The landscape is bleak and boring and the interactions with the enviroment are few. There are only 2 "types" of resource nodes (wood and rock) to gather every single resource you will ever craft with. Sadly I didn't even get to craft anything due to the violent nature of other players so I can't attest to it's robustness. All in all the game feels more like a first person shooter that tries (poorly) to jump on the popularity of the survival genre. They even had zombies in the game for a time being and then removed them when the zombie theme became over saturated. Ultimately I feel this game suffers from either a poorly worded description or a development team who has strayed from the genre they want their game to be.
title: Rust

review: My recommendation comes at a heavy price so for now it's technically positive but will show as negative until things are updated.Firstly understand that at the time of this review the game is still in early release and is considered in Alpha status (as made evident by the permanent stamp in the upper right upon loading the game). So there's no doubt there will be changes made and plenty of things added in there.With that said Rust has amazing potential to be a good game. The environment although repetitious in many ways doesn't fail to be scenic. My fondest memory so far was during my first 2 hours of play. I had been constantly dying due to the many dangers of the wild and finally got to a point where I had a stone hatchet to mine more efficiently. It was exhausting and nerve wracking trying to avoid wolves and bears and radiated zones just to get a solid foundation. Night fell and I built up a campfire roasted up a chicken breast (the only meat featured so far) and took a moment to look around. The campfire light was flickering against the stone wall behind me and illuminated the immediate area around. I looked up at the starry night as the virtual moon crawled overhead. It looked just like the rural country skies where you could lay in the grass and stare carefree. It was a beautiful 15 minutes (average nighttime) and I recommend you find your own nature moment in Rust.HOWEVER I have played this game for what must be close to 5 hours and have YET to be safe. Here's problem number one when you log out your body is there open for anyone to see. And should they see you they can kill you and loot your body. Should you forget to craft a sleeping bag and place it somewhere you will now be randomly spawned somewhere on the map. Problem number two the only way to make yourself safe from pvp'ers murdering your body is building a house with a metal door.Not so bad? Consider how much resources you need for safety here.. Hitting trees give you 10 wood each. That 10 wood 1 wooden plank. A foundation requires 8 wood planks walls cost 4 wood planks pillars cost 2 wood planks a ceiling costs 6 wood planks and you'll want a metal door or else smart pvp'ers can break down wooden doors with little effort. Let's do the math real quick here... 8+(4*3sides)+(2*4pillars)+6 34 wood planks or 340 wood pieces or 34 trees straight chopped down. That doesn't sound too bad right? Now you need a metal door. Wuh oh how you get that? Well you need metal pieces from boulders/ore stones which are currently only found in one of maybe 4 specific areas on the map randomly spawned and randomly drops Metal Ore. Each Metal Ore generates 3 8 fragments and you need 200 metal fragments to craft a metal door meaning you would potentially need at most 67 metal ore to provide enough fragments. However in order to produce metal fragments you need a furnace to smelt the ore. AHA! Now you need 15 Stones 20 Wood and 10 Low Grade Fuel (made from Animal Fat + Cloth). Wtf? And even then there's apparently a chance that smelting too much at one time may cause a loss in product from the ore used. Okay if that isn't frustrating yet here's another component to the equation in order to smelt something you need Wood pieces....really? So you're telling me I need 20 wood for the furnace 340 wood for the house and about 67 120 wood for smelting a process that might not yield enough metal fragments?Okaaay so you have the time to devote to this resource grind. Let's assume you're *not* in a PVP server and let's assume you already know where to get all this and you have yet to be attacked by "Surprise Bear" or "Gangrape Wolf". Congratulations you're winning.I can't recommend this game yet. I just can't. Maybe I had a bad server experience but I purposely joined a non pvp server because I can't stand going through any amount of hard earned resource gathering just to lose it all to some d bag with a gun. And yet my downfall was not just the animals it wasn't just the resources it was the fact that the pillars have a weird placement system which makes the house building wonky if you have a 2x1 foundation now my "house" had no room for doorways even if I had them.So after 5 hours of learning the damn game and 1 hour of actual building I decided to pack my sleeping bag and find a spot where I hopefully won't be found. But guess what if I get attacked and lose all my stuff I just won't care.I just won't care. Please keep this game updating because it has potential. Pleeeease make it easier to survive in some fashion. I don't care if you have to make the boulders more populated/easily accessible or if you make the formulae less strict. But whatever you do don't make it...as one humorous gentleman who helped us newbies out put it...a wood chopping simulator.

Make some friends learn how to play then go to the official servers and try your luck. There is a grind to farm the materials that you need but you can always raid a base for materials. Always knowing that you probably get raided sooner or later yourself. So don't become to attached to your stuff and always have a backup base just in case.

review: Ive been playing rust for a while now and after id played a while I found many pros and cons of rust and things that just make the game downright unplayable. First off ill start with the pros 1. The game is highly addicting id say personally me ive very rarly ran across a game like this that i just feel the need that i have to play more.2. I love the building system its so much fun the first time you build your own house you just feel so proud of your accomplishment. 3. The atmosphere at night times. Ive never played a game where i actually feared the noises outside. You never know what can happen night time is the time most people do the raiding so every noise you hear youll think someones coming for you.4. The crafting system could use tiny touch ups but other than that is pretty good i never found myself not knowing how to make something.5. A true survival experience. Compared to a lot of other games it goes above and beyond you will feel like your actually surviving in this game. Youll have to make a shelter hunt for food make effective weapons to hunt collect resources important to your survival and make life and death decisions when it comes to other players on the game.Now for the cons 1. Hackers are one of the biggest problems in the game. They have taken steps to try and stop hackers but most the time it doesnt work. Now the problem with the hackers is they like to use a hack that kills everyone in a huge radius around them so if you just started and your sitting in your little shack praying no one attacks you BAM! death comes from a mile away. Also some people use speed hacks and auto aim hacks but those arent used as much as the area of effect instant death hacks.2. The community. Now understand sometimes you'll find some alright people you can team up with or just in general are nice(rarely) but most the time you will run into people who will shoot first ask questions later. Now I accept this and i can appreciate the fact that this is part of the "survival" aspect of the game. So when im in a area with people and i get gunned down there is no reason for me to get upset and i dont most the time. thats a risk you take walking outside be it day or night. Now the reason this is in the cons however is the fact that lets say you buy the game start it up select your server and you get in the game for the first time you look around to see whats around and BOOM shot in the face. Most players in the game even if its obvious you have nothing of value to them or youve done nothing will still shoot you on sight.3. Unless you have a lot of people on a team its a slower process to do stuff meaning if you want to get resources (which people like to make houses around) you have to go out and harvest trees stone or wood piles. Which leaves you open to peoples attacks which will happen more times than you will be able to count. Which brings me to point 4.4. While playing the game i found places that might have 1 or 2 of a resourcce in the area then theres areas where theres tons of resources and animals to hunt the perfect place right? Wrong there will be people that have made massive houses nearby that are all armored up with fully auto guns and a itchy trigger finger that are just waiting for you to take "their" resources and i say their because to them that entire part of the map is their property even though others live there.With the pros and the cons done theres only one more thing that makes the game at times unplayable and frankly irritating as hell ROLLBACKS. Now if you dont know what happens in a roll back basiclly a roll back takes everything you've done anywhere from 5 minutes to 5 hours and sometimes even longer and undos all of it and most the time youll have no clue when its gonna happen. So lets say you build yourself this nice secure house with metal doors metal walls youve just made it look really nice......ROLLBACK.......all of thats gone basically like youve been standing around doing nothing the whole time.Ill give you a example that happened to me. I got up early because i wanted to see if my house was still secure (it was) so then i started to build expansions on it to make it even safer so to do that i had to harvest a massive amount of metal ore (for metal doors) and wood (for the structures) now if i wasnt in the area i was in it would have taken much longer luckly i found a area with nice people with big guns that lives nearby (that is extremely rare) which was also a risk cause if they wanted they could have messed me up and took everything but they didnt. So after about 2 hours of this out of no where there was a roll back so i wasted all my time. But despite that even though i was angry i let it go and started again this time harvesting wasnt so easy beacuse random people wandering around the map decided that this was a good place to make their home to which was fine with me i was showed kindness who was i to turn them away. Well they kept trying to attack me and kept trying to break into my house (which they couldnt) which made me take a lot longer to get resources. After about 3 hours of this i was about half way done and guess what happened. Ill wait...................If you guessed a random individual gave me everything i need and more out of the kindness of his heart......you were wrong but if you guessed another rollback you were 100% right. So everything was gone once again at that point id had enough.So to conclude Rust is a very fun game highly addictive and can be a great time alone or with friends. I highly recommend it.......AFTER the alpha AFTER the hackers are gone AFTER the rollbacks and once the community in it calms down. So as of right now i Highly recommend you wait till all the issues are sorted out
