review: 240 HOURS OF GAMEPLAY My "don't recommend it" review is below this one. I have changed my stance surrounding the game a bit. It can be fun if you manage to get a couple of walls and a metal door up. Don't hoard stuff it's just going to end up in some other guy's crates anyway! Live in the now don't save stuff for later.As I play alone I tend to have a harder time than most. No one to cover me defend our base or help gathering resources. I have learned your best bet at survival in this case is to be friendly to anyone you meet.See guys in armour with guns? Give them some ammo for a gun you don't even have.See a guy being chased by animals? Shoot them lend him some food and go on.Just by doing this and never ever shooting them I became friends with an entire server. No one raided me no one shot me (on purpose) they gave me stuff for being a good sport if I get killed they give me my stuff back etc...The game is brutal survival is hard with all the hostile people. But perserverance and patience WILL get you along the dangerous roads of the world of Rust. 30 HOURS OF GAMEPLAY I've been playing Rust for 30 hours now and all I can say is that it's anything but entertaining. Not because of the game. But because of the community.Do you plan to play this game without friends? Don't. You will get robbed raided shot clubbed and mauled by everything. Do not think of making friends inside the game the people you share a fire with will kill you as soon as they can. do not think someone who says he's friendly will be friendly. He'll be that until you turn your back to him. When you finaly manage to build a house of your own know that the next day it WILL be raided of everything of value. They wait until you leave so they can take your belongings unopposed. But that doesn't matter because they all have modern weapons they can always recraft against your flimsy bow or medieval rifle.Do you plan to play this game with friends? Good luck it will take an hour before everyone is at the same place and alive! After that your main problem will be food and shelter. But because you are in a big group of people this will not be difficult. After that all that's left to be done is craft guns and rob people really. The next problem will be keeping your base defended. Big group of people big base large treasure chest for other people. Be prepared to do the same thing each night all over again unless you have someone who can stay online 24/7.I must say not everyone's corrupted but those people are new to the game and havent yet seen the devastating lack of morality this game radiates. You think the community of LoL is bad? Or that of Call of Duty? Try Rust.Let's talk about the game itself now shall we? The game looks nice astounding even for the Unity Engine it's built on. It doesn't shun adult nudity. Oh and the concept is wonderfull. But that's probably it the animals have only one sound effect per type they run stuttery from location to location. Wolves and bears do NOT stop chasing you even if they can't see nor hear nor smell you. Your only choice is to face them or let them kill you. And then there are the zombies who populate the irradiated places. Or rather used to populate.At first the zombies were dangerous yet manageable for even a freshly spawned person albeit a bit of finesse and skill was needed. Facepunch has chosen to replace them with something else because "they didn't want Rust to be a DayZ clone". Now we have regular wolves and bears. And red painted wolves and bears! So the exact same annoying creature you can't even kill meleewise unless you are loaded on medkits or it lags to one spot. Just got copy pasted and painted red. The zombies made sense this however...Before I end this review I'd like to say I did not make this out of pettyness like most of the other negative reviews. I played the game for a good enough amount of time and experienced it all. For as much I could at least. I did not enjoy myself for the most part. The only times I did was when I managed to take over a house no one lived in. I have yet to kill another human in this game mostly because I didn't want too. I regret my decision of never killing others as well as buying this game.TL DR don't buy it unless you plan to play with friends and expect hours of work for a bit of fun.

review: A survival crafting game with some passing similarities to both Minecraft and DAYZ this game is nothing without other players. Played on a very low population server the game is far too easy to beat played on a high population server where everyone is fighting for limited resources you start to see the true genius. As a new player you will get ganked a huge number of times. During my very first playthrough I got chased halfway across the map by two players (who I managed to lose by hiding in some rocks near another newbie who then got killed in my stead) and spent my first night in the hills trying to hide my camp fire so I could cook what litte food I had managed to gather without poisoning myself. Spent the days hiding and the nights creeping around without a torch trying desperately to scrape together enough stuff to actually stand a chance....Brilliant game.

I just can't find the effort and spirit to play this any more nothing seems to excite me in the game anymore. Overall though the game is good but because it is an early access game you will find at times that the content in the game might not be enough at this current date. (I do realise that is the point in Early Access but some might want to know what others think about the content you have to use right now)

review: As I finally settle into my little shack fireplace burning furnace cooking night has fallen. I hear footsteps above my shack. Then I hear voices. "Let me in! Somebody is trying to kill me!" I answer back "Uhm... can't you just go back to your base?" He replies "Its already dark man let me in..." Me being the nice guy sure why not? I open the door. He is fully geared with a nice pistol in his hands. "Can't you defend yourself?" He scurries on inside and says "Close the door." I close it. I sit there staring at him he's looking all around but not looking in my storage. fireplace or furnace. As time passes I start to realize what he is really after. Me. He shot me dead right when the sun came up. Awesome game. 10/10

review: I've been playing since Alpha Extremely fun but challenging game. This is the first game I bought on STEAM and I haven't gotten tired of it. It's an instant classic for survival games honestly in a league of it's own. I've also had the fortune to meet some amazing online friends to play with. But as in any game I have also had the misfortune to meet some less than reputable people. This game is only in it's beginning stages but it is not for the faint of heart. You will die you will get set back but eventually after spending enough time learning to play and investing yourself in the game. You will begin to find your nitch and that moment is when this game really becomes enjoyable. The world map looks small but it couldn't be any bigger with day and night cycles you will actually measure distance in "Days" and begin to say things like "It will take me (x amount) of days" to get to there" or "We will head out in the morning". I would suggest this game to anyone and everyone who likes survival games and a challenge. I don't want to use a rating scale because everyone is promised to have a different experience. My personal one I'm hooked and I wouldn't have it any other way. It is an individualistic experience that can't be explained in words. It is worth the money you pay for it even through your frustration of dying or being "robbed" you will still want to play.

review: Best $20 bucks in a game. Been through the long haul and has seen it reincarnated over several times. Think of it as a social simulator. Different servers different mentalities. On one it can be a battle royale where the strong survive over the naked bodies of freshly spawned fodder. On another the players can set aside their competition and build structures to fight the helicopters and acheive larger goals. Each server is influenced by the players. Adventure is found in your imagination. Totally worth playing as long as you don't use cheats to ruin the experience for everyone.

review: Overall rust is a pretty great game. Really fun to mess around with other players when you have friends about. The Minecraft esque crafting is fluent and easy to use for the most part but could use a little work. The only problem I have the game is that getting M4's or other extremely valuable resources can be a problem. Players decked out in Kevlar armed with M4's will run around collecting airdrops and then raiding other people's homes. Also if anyone spots you in this game there's a 99% chance they'll be attempting to kill you in the next 5 seconds. All this aside Rust is a great game when with friends and has a lot of potential. I'd recommend getting it.

review: I liked this game at first but it's waaaaaay too unfinished and frustrating.It's a very big time sink and you will have to spend hours and hours grinding mindlessly and it's super boring just getting decent items and gear and when you finally get decent gear you'll probably just be so sick of how bad everything is about the game you'll just lose interest and move onto something else.The community is also really bad probably the worst I've seen in a video game in a long time. People constantly hack and grief just to be jerks and everyone abuses the game as well. It kinda ruins the experience since it's a multiplayer only title and you're just gonna get on immediately when you join a server (even if the server just wiped as well those people on there are so dedicated).It's basically Minecraft except the building and crafting part takes even more grinding and it's full of an even worse community really.BUT THE WORST PART OF ALL IS everything you do will probably get wiped in a week and since it's all bound by which server you join you'll lose any and all progress you make. The only way to succeed is probably by somehow finding a big group to join or trick your friends into buying this game to help you (make sure it's people who have too much money and are really annoying though they'll probably like this one).I guess it has potential really there are some really cool parts about it and it is an intense experience but I'm just sick of it completely right now and really frustrated with it.

review: Its a game in development and has deserted the zombie idea. I don't see it taking a drastic turn anytime in the near future so it's probably best to get it now and watch it improve. Dont trust many people until you see how they are around others. It takes a while to get some legit weapons. My suggestion is to get on the modded servers they offer so the game can run a little quicker. I personally never play on the game the way it is. (only reason is really the crafting time)Its worth a play with friends over alone. but hey you can still have fun alone so go for it.Review 2 The game has came allot further in the many months. It is a great game. some of the cons though are consisting of very glitchy animals and close combat I have a spear that kills in three hits of a naked person. yet this dude with a rock hit me at the spears distance and somehow took no damage. It will you off really easy at that point. but its still worth a try. increased gathering on modded servers are still the way to go to get a good feel for the game quickly.

review: This game is currently on its second version (first rewrite).Its primary issue is that it's plagued by relentless hackers of all kinds walls aim clipping etc.It's been in Early Access for a very long time and the developers are still using that to their advantage. Essentially they claim support for three platforms collect money from users on all three and then publicly announce their discontent for 2/3 of these platforms. They chose to list them and sell the game to those platforms. They also choose not to support them whatsoever. As a result the game is unplayable on them.Additionally the game's performance is terrible frame rates are bad and network code provides lovely 10 second lockups.Wait until this game leaves Early Access to purchase at a bare minimum. It has been years since it originally released as an EA title and very likley has at few more to go before they're ready to actually support the decisions they made at release.

review: I own 3 servers and have invested a lot of time/money into this game. The lack of further development/updates is completely unacceptable. Now before all of you start screaming "this is an Alpha" please keep in mind how supporting an Alpha is supposed to work. An Alpha is presented to a group of players if players feel that it the game has potential they invest their money so that the developers can make advancements and improvements by hiring new staff discussing bugs with the Alpha community and incorporating game play recommendations into later builds (think Oculus Rift before FB acquisition). Garry and Facepunch cashed in on this desire to support a VERY promising game but have not hired new personnel rolled out consistent updates or cared to seriously consider the input of their backers and supporters. Facepunch also recently disabled comments on the Rust Alpha blog which says to me that they truly do not care what the community thinks (they could have hired a few interns to screen comments). I am going to cancel my server rental agreements delete this game from my library and wait for H1Z1 to drop. Screw you Garry. Get off your high horse and stop whining about how hard coding is. Hire some professionals.

review: This is a game that was introduced to me by a friend (the same person who introduced me to Steam as a matter of fact). And after seeing the footage and being a huge Minecraft guy I was pretty excited about the concept of this game. It looked really fun and intense! Not to mention another game that I can get together and play with some of my college buds from time to time.Like Minecraft you just spawn randomly in this large woodland area full of wildlife and you are given a rock a torch and some bandages (not to heal only to stop you from bleeding. Get used to that happening a lot). My first objective find my friends. After about an hour of aimlessly jogging through the woods and getting killed by animals I managed to find one of my buddies. I was so exicted and after about a night (In game of course) of searching for my friend number 2 we finally found him and could get started on the objective of the game Survive.Next thing you know we hear gunfire. A man in a white t shirt and a black mask comes in after the three of us. We weren't even the least bit prepared but since my buddies and I are regular team members across multiple games we spread out and thought of a plan. One of my friends managed to make hatchets for all of us along the way before he found me. So we all were armed with these homemade stone hatchets. Unfortunately the masked man got the best of us and killed us all.It's not like we had any weapons and the guy didn't even bother to address anything of the sort. He just walked up to us and opened fire on us 'Call of Duty' style.I respawned now distraught over having to re search for my friends over miles of hostile territory full of bears and wolves. Not to mention the local players of the somewhat crowded server we were on.I stumbled across another tower seemingly empty. I walked up to it and called out "Hello?"CRACKSuddenly I turn around to find some guy trying to beat me over the head with a rock. He's fully clothed and wears a white mask. Then a voice from nearby says "And in this corner we have *So and so* and in the other corner we have 'Costa Rica' "It was another dude with a gun and in a black mask. I didn't recall volunteering for a brawl with rocks for some other dudes entertainment. So I tried to run but was gunned down quickly. Even after I quickly tried to explain that I was just passing through seeking my friends. Again no reason really to kill me. Nothing other than to watch me brawl with some player for his amusement.I respawn yet again.This time along my search for my buds I come across a guy asleep on the ground. He was in a poorly built structure with a foundation and some walls. I told my friends over Skype that I had found someone and they quickly told me to kill him.I didn't really want to but so far within mere hours of owning this game I have been defenseless and gunned down twice. For no real reason other than for one's own amusement most likely. So I did what needed to be done.In the world of Rust it is a cruel existance and only the strong survive. I managed to get some decent items from this sleeping man but nothing that would defend me from the gun weilding fort keepers. So I continued on.I passed through some of the mountain rocks when I came across a fortress. I didn't know if anyone was home but I was just trying to pass through to find a road.Someone was home and he was holding a shotgun in his hands. Aimed right at me.I stopped and went to tell him I was unarmed and friendly.BLAM!Dead.Not even a word from the other guy. Just opened fire because I got near his fort.Cool.Long story short my friends and I moved to a quieter server and managed to find a good spot with some good weapons. Recently however our fort was ransacked of some things and then again when we accidentally left our gate open. This dude waited for one of us to get back and shot us dead took our and left. Great.Not to mention today we finally met our not so friendly neighbors. We managed to make a truce but for how long only time will tell. As myself and my friends are planning on getting our and getting out of that area quickly.Conclusion I didn't really come here to complain and tell my story of how the whole KOS thing is amongst players. Because really this game is fun. If you are like me and are coming from a background in Minecraft then you will already be familiar with how most of this game works. Lots of crafting and building things.All of this is just a cautionary tale for those who were like me looking to find the same kind of peace Minecraft mainains. Or maybe just simply excited for this game because you saw a popular "Let's Play er" play it on YouTube.I don't recommend playing this game without some friends. As it is far too difficult to trust those who inhabit the deep bear infested woods. Not to mention the hundreds of inhabited forts filled with trigger happy trolls waiting to shoot you just because they can.Otherwise you are bound to grow very familiar with the respawn screen and the long nights alone with no resources and nobody to trust.Beware.TL DR This game is ing Minecraft on crack. Just add some guns radiation poisioning bears deer pigs and wolves. Not to mention tens of thousands of other players sharing the same map that you do with resources worlds better that are willing to shoot you just because they can. I DO NOT recommend playing this without a tusted friend. Because no matter what unarmed or not there are going to be people who want to kill you just because they want your Beware.

review: Now I don't usually review things but this one really deserved a great ing review. Rust used to be great actually. Until these problems arose. HackersThis is a big problem in Rust. You join a server get wood and supplies. Build a nice crap hut. Boom. A hacker flies right into your hard earned base steals your precious items and flies right back out. Have you ever gotten a head shot with a pistol from 1000 meters? Well the hackers sure have! It doesnt even matter if you are inside a base or not you still get shot! Hackers are ruining the game and when they dont want to get caught the blame falls on you. Reporting a hacker is horrible! You can't get any thing from reporting a hacker They still go on server and turn them into GlitchesA problem in every early access game is glitches. The glitches arent major but there are a few that people take to advantages. Rock glitching. Here's a great idea lets place a sleeping bag inside a rock and build our base there! This is so annoying. Lets say you get raided the people take your loot either suicide into the rock or just set home. All your loot is now impossible to get back because you cant go into a rock. Those things are invincible! you can sleeping bag glitch like they did. But only to find that you have been banned ServersServers in Rust arent the best. Everytime you log on search for a new server to start on you find hundreds of empty servers flaoting around hiding all the good ones. Also most admins are careless. Banning innocent players letting hackers stay on. "Let me turn on invisible and stalk the hackers!" News flash they can still see you! Its called ESP. IM sure every player has heard of it. The reason why hackers are still on is because once the "see" the invisible admin they turn their hacks off and still continue shooting down players. Pretending that the admins arent there. Sometimes They may shoot or kill the admin. Still the admin doesnt want to ban them and continues to ban you because the hackers friends have newly joined and start blaming you for hacking. Its 7 against 1. Of course the admins will believe the hackers. So you get banned. This is a horrible proble in rust. Also the official servers have no admins. Ever. i had a "good" hacker fly up to me and say "Hackers own this game and this server" That is incredibly true The CommunityThe Rust community sucks. Most of the players are total jerks and dont care what they do. You join a server you have your wood and But you look behind you and see are fully geared players. Youre naked he is full kevlar. You beg with him not to kill you. He pulls out his M4 and shoots you . The worst part is. He doesnt take your items. He leaves it to degenerate. What was the point in killing the new player if you werent going to takr his stuff? I liked this game. Now i dont 4/10

review: I've played Rust for almost 2 years and I've had a blast with all the fun and great moments but I can't recommend the game in it's current state. The recent component blueprint update is fantastic and the mechanics are being patched up well but that's pointless if you can't even run the damn game. I never had problems running Rust in the past up until March 2017. Some weird update came along and is causing ridiculously bad performance. Many say it's a memory leak and I think so too because my fps slowly drops from 70 to 15 over the span of 1 hour. It's definitely playable but very unenjoyable to have to constantly restart the client every hour. I've tried every trick in the book and nothing fixes the problem. It's not my problem it's Facepunch's. Not everyone experiences this but many still do. If you turn out to be one of the unlucky people to suffer from the memory leak you'll understand how frustrating it is. This is the reason why I am quitting Rust. Until this bug is finally fixed I'll change my review to positive and start playing again.

review: It took a good 5 minutes to finally join a server due to the long loading time. The bad optimisation was obvious from the start I had to tune down the graphics to almost minimum to get a somewhat playable game even though I'm able to run most AAA games on medium/high at least but yeh yeh it's Early Access so it was expected nevermind.As soon as I got that right two teenagers ran up to me with a heavily irritating voice. They asked me if I have a mic I didn't even know which one is the push to talk button at that point so i shaked my camera and they understood. Not a moment too soon someone killed me from behind while I was distracted. The three guys just stood there on my corpse and said "lol" out loud multiple times while the screen slowly turned to black. I also met a guy who's only aim in life was to kill every newly spawned played fully geared with body armor and a Thompson machine gun. I discovered half the community of this game under 20 minutes just by these random encounters idiotic teenagers and trolls. Also note that literally 90% of the people will try to kill you if they have the upper hand even if it's pointless because you have no real loot on you. "Just for the lolz."Lacking friends to play with I realised that's probablly all I'm going to get in the first hours of the game so I kindly asked for a refund. Did not regret it.To sum it all up graphics are ok but requires way better hardware to run it smoothly than it should but this hopefully gets taken care of before release game occasionally stops for a second character movement and actions can be laggy sometimes need more spawn variety to prevent constant spawncamping/piling up on each other to the point it becomes a naked man free for all community is mixed you'll meet a bunch of and trolls early on get into a clan or make friends as fast as possible but... don't trust anyone most people would do anything to get your stuff that includes ganging up on you with their friends PLAY THIS GAME WITH YOUR FRIENDS seriously don't go solo it will considerably reduce your playing experience.
title: Rust

review: Giving Rust a thumbs down here. I understand its early access.&gt Graphics Not that great. A lot of clipping and tearing. Animations were horrid. Looked nothing like the pictures. A lot more cartoony.&gt World Other than the landscape littered with half destroyed structures it was empty and it felt that way. Hardly any wildlife roaming around to farm for useful stuff and when I did find them they slid away from out of sight in a half run half skating motion.&gt Gameplay lit my torch at night making me a beacon for other players. Was quickly killed because of it. Respawned and harvested materials for about a half hour. Was promptly killed again at first sight of another player.Overall I found the community to be horrid. The game itself lacks any depth or complexity of gameplay. Basically a naked version of hunger games with more sausage flying around than a farmers market. If your into getting nowhere and having naked dudes stove your head in with a rock every 20 minutes then by all means buy it. I get enough of that sh*t in real life.

review: This game is one of the best survival games out there. The game is beautiful and extremely fun even when you meet a couple of non friendly players that only want to kill you. The graphics are great for an Alpha state game some textures could use a little tweaking like the trees and mutated animals. The sound effects are great everything has sound effects even when you equip armor you hear how your character zips up. One of the coolest features is that once you place something it stay there forever but it is also a problem since a misplaced pillar can ruin your house. This forces you to build carefully something most games can't acomplish. Overall this game is really great and can only get better. One more thing beware the community some will help but others will stab you in the back.

review: An oddly realistic reimagining of the survival elements of Minecraft on a server. Currently you are victim more to the whims of other players than those of the game itself but despite infinite resources the joy of creating a home for yourself and getting together all you need to protect yourself is very satisfying. I'm looking forward to it being finished.As a side note the community servers are wonderful. As a new player asking for advice and information will get you advice and information and I've even had people friendly enough to adopt me into their little groups.Great players great game. Very recommended.

review: I'm of two minds whether to actually recommend this or not. It's a grand social experiment and a well done and very playable game already (reviewing alpha early access). But the results of the experiment for the short term seems to reward the worst sort of people. And so the d bags seem to stay and the sorts who would make it a more interesting game seem to be passing on it at least for now. tl dr for early access If it's worth $20 to spend a weekend exploring a unique game experience and aren't easily frustrated and won't feel badly discovering it's not for you then buy it. I'm glad I did but I don't expect to play much unless the community evolves a little.As an eve online player I actually got happy the first few times I died in unfortunate circumstances. The learning curve is steep and the rules unforgiving and I generally enjoy that sort of gameplay.In its present form the game's biggest turnoff arguably is its vulnerability to hackers and exploiters. Until holes are patched expect to encounter players who can outrun you can walk through walls or can cause you to disconnect on contact. If I understand bans on official servers are batched and performed every few weeks but bans on community servers only apply to that specific server rather than to the account and admins may not be around when needed.The second turnoff is the present state of the community and the fact that the game mechanics seem to deter the evolution of true settlements and teamwork. If you have a semi safe building to stash things in it seems the most effective way to increase your supply is to kill every player you come across and take what they have. Even if they're just a naked player with a rock they're likely to have a small pile of wood and stone or cloth and there's no repurcussions for just shooting them and taking it. This is made a little worse by the fact that you cannot see another player's name over long distances. By the time you can identify an individual you're too close for safety or more likely already dead.Now all this wouldn't be terrible if there were more in the game that facilitated the ability for a law abiding society to rise from the anarchy which I would think should be the natural evolution for this game. One an individual level however there is no way to mark territory or claim land other than patroling with guns and teaching everyone the hard way to give your home a wider berth. On a commuity level again there is no way of telling at an appropriate range who is a member vs an 'outlaw' so even attempts to build a safe community seem to fail especially with a relatively small player base per server coming and going throughout the day.And yet there's fun and there are strategies I've learned in just a few days playing that help mitigate a lot of the shortcomings. You learn to hide things and never all of anything in one place. You learn not to carry what you cant afford to lose. You learn the map and the landmarks. You learn efficient ways to re equip as a freshspawn. And I learned to remember it's in alpha and not to rage over its shortcomings.

review: It's a great game and a great experience although you can only fully enjoy the game if you're in a group or with friends. For me I was lucky as I made friends pretty quickly. I had nothing I was constantly dying due to hunger and I could never get enough wood to build a home as everytime I would get the right amount some random guy would kill me and take everything. In the end (about a few hours into playing) I start talking on the chat asking if anyone wanted to team up. It wasn't long before a nice guy said that he would be my friend and shortly after that someone else asked if he could be my friend. The two guys I met knew the map well however I didn't. I added them both and the next day I set off trying to find them and this I what I hate about Rust the most. The navigation is impossible and everything looks the same to a newbie which means that finding people takes hours. I understand it's all about survival and in real life situations there wouldn't be maps but surely adding in a compass you can craft wouldn't hurt anyone? After eventually finding my friends and moving into their house I finally began to enjoy the game so much more. We could go out on hunts and meet new people without the constant fear of hunger and loneliness. I guess the fact that so many people kill on sight adds to the problems of getting started on the game especially since the game has been out for a while. My downfall is that I'm too nice and I always try to make friends and never kill anyone which usually ends up with them killing me instead. My best advice is just to talk to people on chat and try to make friends but I know from my own experiences how difficult that can be...

review: I will be fairly honest. This game is just Ok at the moment It does take alot of time to start up as there are plenty of people running around with guns killing fresh spawns.In addition The characters teleport everywhere due to bad integration with servers maybe due to 150 people having different pings but its still no excuse as the "stone age" or start up weapons are almost useless such as arrows and stone hatchet as it is nearly impossible to hit them. but Once you get to stage with Pistol It becomes Ok. Its like there are no object and feels bland when you are playing the gameYes I do understand its a Survival game and still in Alpha stage. but its been the same for awhile and I am slowly getting tired of the gameplay as it just don't have anything else other than kill people and eat and live.In terms of the Alpha stage people's been getting Chicken breasts since the release of the game and its still the same It literally feels like that there is no progress of development at all as a player. It feels like the community is more involved than the Developer themselves as community made their own maps for sakes and named the location themselves. This game would potentially be dead without the community's support. The devs says they do have a plan and to trust them but I am slowly losing the trust. and most of the updates were utterly useless. and it feels awful as a player in the game.

review: So far the game is really good. It has its cons however which i shall list first!CONS Many players in certain servers are too "far ahead" and very unforgiving on naked unequipped players (Even when you shout friendly down the mic) I found it really difficult initially to kill any animals they are so fast when you only have a melee weapon I recommend crafting a BOW ASAP!! Not sure if its just me or my setup but each time I left click my character moves forward which can be a pain!! I found the map quite hard to figure out initially. In nearly all servers I've played on the rocks I harvest do not seem to regenerate at all. 9 hours i played on one server on and off night and day with a fixed base etc and the rocks around me never respawned? Not sure if this is supposed to be that way or not but barrels and collectibles did random respawn! Cant think of any more Cons. Will be setting up a server tomorrow and most likely be using some Oxide mods to see what kind of fun i can have for server address please just ask I will be tailoring it to what players want!!!

review: The game is fun a lot of fun but only for a very short time. When I first bought it and played with friends it was a blast and we played it all the time but now I cannot ever get an urge to crank it back up. The development time of new content has been poor and it's sad because it's the dev's from GMOD. The development of the game was halted when they abruptly decided to completely rebuild the game. This is a big issue with most early access games. The dev's keep showing you hints and glimpses at new content but it's never released. If it hadn't been so long for the development team to push out a more functional and better working game than I would gladly be placing it as a recommended game. DON'T GET ME WRONG the game is fun with friends if you wanna joke around and raid but it loses it's spark quickly. This is a very stale game to play alone. PROS Fun with friendsHumor is rich in a very indirect wayCONS The world is dull and bland with really no environmentThe weapons in the game take away from it being a survival game to a grind as many resources as fast as possible to kill the people annoying you game.UI is still poorly done even after the game being avilalbe for so longThe map is HUGE but only 1/7 of it is actually playable. Not fun to play aloneNo PvE (personal opinion PvE should be in this game)Overall the game isn't bad despite me giving it so many cons. It is an average game that has SO MUCH potential but isn't being used. Final PERSONAL Verdict 6/10 It is an average game with base building simulation and raiding. A lot of fun with friends.The only reason I would not recommend this game is solely because of the lack of content after how long it's been out and for those that look to play alone may not enjoy being raiding by 6 or 7 guys right after spending a few hours building and gathering.

review: Rust does right for the people who enjoy it.Rust gives the players who get into it the rush they crave such as spotting someone in the distance approaching your base and feeling a twange of apprehension. By using other players as the wall between you and progress it gives a level of competition that isn't present in most games. For the people who enjoy this game it is a rare gem of difficulty in a field of games that have gone soft.... I'm not one of those players and I suspect most people arent.I remember sometime ago when I was a bit younger a friend of mine showed me an idea he had for a game. After looking through it a couple of times I told him "this game would only allow a small handful of people to win at any given time". I told him no one in their right mind would make such a game because it wouldn't be much of a money maker. Funny thing is Rust is exactly that type of game. The limited nature of resources and the superiority of having the best equipment ensures that a small handful of people will do well on any given server at any given time... to everyone else's detriment.I found myself drawn into Rust for the promise of being able to build up my own ideas for forts and defend them against other players but quickly found that if I didn't team up with others I stood little chance of survival. And that's fine. I usually solo but I can play in groups if the need arises. I siddled up with a small group of players trying to make it in the world. I understand that this probably meant that my ideas would go unused as I'm not really the leader type. I was more then willing to tolerate that but it turns out it didn't really matter. Whenever we got anything remotely resemble progress we were quickly targeted by the top players of the server who had plenty of means to break through our meager doorways and rob us blind. Even limiting our base building and trying to look impoverised didn't help much. It seems the best players have ways of telling who's faking it. I tried to stick with it and ended up to be the only person not to rage quit but that essentially left me alone and at square one.It probably a good thing that Rust doesn't offer a demo period because I wouldn't have bought the game otherwise. I hear the game was snapped up by a lot of people when it first opened up.And the thing is I want to play this game. I've had ideas for tricky buildings that would target the raiders specifically sending them to their doom. Hell I'm not opposed to playing to other people's detriment. But my position as a soloist/non leader type means I either play solo and never get anywhere significant or join a team and have a small chance at helping other people achieve their ideas... but probably not. Difficulty is one thing. But making other players the chief obsticle really means only small amounts of players will be able to get the full benefit of this game at any given time. Hey if your good and your lucky you'll be one of them. Well maybe. If your a leader type personallity then you will occasionally do well in Rust. Probably. You'll have a better chance then me at any rate. But for anyone coming into this hoping to build your own designs to fight off other players well think twice. Okay? I'm not saying you won't do well. I'm not telling you not to get this game. Just think twice. The odds are against it but for the most determined of players that's the best kind of game. I just saying that if your looking for a high wall that's surmountable with enough effort play Dark Souls instead. Some games are always surmountable with enough effort. Whether Rust is surmountable depends on the other players. And they're not that kind.All that being said you know Rust is 20 bucks. That's not that much. If you fancy yourself a hardcore competive player by all means. It's definatelly one of those love it or hate it type games.

Being a tester I am happy to say I could lose myelf in this game for days if I had time. D

review: The game is a wide open world map concept. The maps are enormous. You start as a primal man no clothes no resources no shelter nor weapons. You are prey to the roaming wolves and bears. Food is your top proirity.Using your wits and determination you can find and recover resources that will enable you to cloth and arm yourself. You can be robbed or even killed by other players. Your survival depends on your ability to build a sturdy and defensible structure. The wide open building capability makes this a fantastic game if you love to build and create. Stock your fortress well as you will be challenged by heathenistic gangs and lone wolf low lifes.You can form a clan and work as a group.Remember hide in the dark.I highly recommend this game. Be aware that the "Official" servers are very laggy and unstable. Go to the publicly hosted maps that have a low "ping".

review: Rust10/10 Still play over and over...What can I say? I've played the early alpha the new version early alpha and have been keeping up on most of the work (gaming wise) as much as I can. I'm really enthused about this release and have gone quite far with it not as much as some although. The game play is amazing the weapons feel realistic and the crafting system is starting to get fine tuned. The graphics are excellent I play on beautiful. Every night has its moments a few pants and some mental mind boggling happens. "Was that a bear or a deer?" With the maps available online for the server you're playing on one can get their bearings as well as create their own map in game. The loot on the ground makes it much easier for casual players to not get and rage quit when someone comes along kills you... over and over and over... rinse and repeat. Get used to it or find a nice server or some nice friends to play with. I'd recommend this game to anyone and everyone. Have a nice stay or at least enjoy that thrill you used to get when playing a really good game. The agile development of the game I bet is allowing us the customer to join them along the creation of something great and help along the way. I don't follow release notes or complain on forums I enjoy the game they made for me. Props to the whole Rust team at Facepunch and thanks for making a super game! I can't wait for the future of Rust.Sincerely Hayzlit

review: I check back in on this game every few months. Unfortunately while new content is getting added (which is great!) the same problems that have always plagued the game continue to do so. The official servers are full of hackers and plagued by lag which makes the game near unplayable (that one lag spike in pvp means all that nice gear is now gone). Gameplay is good and if you go onto the private servers the problems that plague the game are near none existant however your then basically playing a single player game due to low numbers of people so what's the point? The game showed such potential but if such a basic concept of fixing the lag hasn't been fixed since it's release then my faith in this project is all but lost. If I could get a refund I would.

review: DO NOT SPEND $20 ON THIS GAME....I am aware that this game is in Alpha however The game is virtually unplayable thanks to the huge amount of hackers on every server.From aimbot to superspeed they are unavoidable and constant regardless the server or time of day you play.Admins are suppose to be present to inhibit such behavior and ban the most agressive offenders Good luck. IF an admin is on there is far too much cheating occur at any moment that they cannot actively manage the server or they simply dont care. Admin Abuse itself is even rampant!Graphics and terrain is simple and cartoon like. Character Models are a trainwreck. Animations are choppy and delayed. To actually hit someone you must watch their glitching charachter and attempt to guess where they will be when your bullet/arrow lands.The guns lack physics or a bullet drop. So you can snipe anyone w/o skill as long as you have line of sight. I mean the combat it just horrible. To watch 3 or four people run around in a scrum with hatchets as they all glitch and clip around eachother unable to make contact with one another is painful to watch.The sandbox style resource gathering and base building is the highlight of this game but is unfortunately broken by the reasons mentioned above. Please don't waste your money on this game Dayz is a similar Alpha stage title that is far better has great combat high risk high reward playstyle that I would reccomend well before you venture into Rust.

review: 3 hours in...I finally had the foundations down for my house. It was a little off the beaten path but not too far from those precious resources. The new procedurally generated map offered a much better experience than my previous involvement in rust a year ago. More varied less predictable establishments. Except for the big clan bases. Those guys plant right in the center of large fields. My home was a little out of view of the largest base. I was out collecting wood one day when some naked man came up behind me with a torch. He beat me with it. And stole all I had. Including the key to my lock. Luckily he didnt know where my place actually was. I had to build a second establishment close by. Unfortantly it was a little in view. 5 hours in...I never play with fire at night. Too dangerous. Too foolish. So I was chilling in my shack avoiding the cold. i could only scrape enough cloth together for some pants to hide my shame. But it was enough. I had food shelter and clothing. The only thing I lacked was friends. In the pitch black of the night was the worst for raiders. They went to high ground looking for fires and unsuspecting victims. Really thos people deserved it. Better them than me rigth? Unfortuitiously a man happened to come down the hill precisely where i had hid the shack. I heard the foot steps and shuddered. I could hear him traversing the remains of my previous base where I had hid the entrance to the new one. It was a quick job but it had befuddled others. I figured he would assume it was empty and move on as there was no door in view at a glance. He decided to look further however. I didnt have time to shut my door. I huddled to the corner beside the door clutching my bone blade I had made not but an hour before. He came into view. Head to toe in full armor and AK47 in hand. He didnt see me as my storage chest were directly across from the door. He went for it and I went for him. Stab Stab Stab i floundered in the dark. I heard a clunk as my blade bounced off his helmet. $#!t he turned to me with the AK and opened up. I tell you this! I did not expect the shoddiness of my construction to safe me. His bullets destroyed my base. I fell two floors down. I heard a scream of agony. "What the heck?" The sun was starting to come up. I could kindof see. I made my way back upstairs... Silence. My house was in shambles. Only two walls remained. One section of floor. Where did he go? Surely he wanted my loot. The it hit me. The cliff beside my home the scream. I rushed down to inspect and sure enough. All his nights loot armor warm clothes weapons. A gold mine. Six hours it would have taken for me to gain whart I had just won by chance. I grabbed all I could and ran. He would be back. ASAPI scurried away up the hill to start a new base. One the was secret. Another tricky cliff dive I think. And someplace far away from... him... and vengeanceWhat a good game this is turning out to be. Im glad they redid everything. I had to turn down the graphics for my meager rig. But once I did it was great fun. Sucked a whole day away. And I feel like playing so much more. Well worth the money I think. Just take your time. Ask for advice. And dont mind the trolls.
title: Rust

review: _The game Rust has made me only play for a few hours. It has gotten boring and the reason why it is boring in my opinion is because there isnt much to do except build and kill._What I mean is what is given is a large variety of servers and as you get on the server you have to run like a bat out of hell when you first spawn. Because many players like to camp there and kill you and chat is filled with many people accusing others of "hacking" when really they are just pro when it comes to shooting. (Most players treat this game like COD or any other shooting game out there) _You have the corupt/abusive staff on most servers who join in on a group chat bullying a noob and calling names or just not helping anyone at all. _I do love the concept of the game but it also needs lots and LOTS of work... I mean really it shouldnt have even been released. And I dont think anyone will update it any time soon. _The game is very buggy and it starts to get on my nerves which is why I dont want to play it anymore. _The building in this game sucks. I can only make a square house if I do build it doesnt come out right and placing things to build the house can cause it to have a space you cannot fill in. Basically you have a gap in your house wall and someone can walk into your home and there is no way of filling it up. Most servers you cant break down something you built. _I dont reccomend this game YET. I say give it a year and maybe just maybe the game will be better then what it is today.
title: Rust

review: Rust...what can i say about a fun enjoyable game like rust.let's see...oh COMPLETLY AWSOMEyou spawn with a rock 2 bandages and a torch your only goal is to survive.i only got the game because my friend said it was fun i realy didnt enjoy but thats because i didnt understand itthis game is so amazing when my friend finaly got on our big trouble was trying to find eachother but we finaly did we did so many amazing things we decided to hide in the mountain's since its more peacefule there untill we could get a gun we noticed that there are these rad zones filled with radiation if your rads go over 500 your dead but the rad areas are full of research kits if you cant craft something you can use these research kits so when you die you can craft it again but me and my friend (jeseipi) decided to wait untill were more radiation resistant come to find out we find this guy's house full of epic loot he had a 9mm pistol along with 9mm ammo i took that when i saw it and found these things called rad pills that take off radiation so after i gathered those i thought we should set camp for the night it began as two little shaks and a campfire outside the a little later after gathering enough materials we had a little tiny fort then we set up this thing called a foundatio wich was wood block used for walls or something so after a little bit more we had this room that noone could raid unless they had c4's (very rare in the game) then i decided to finaly use the rad pill's and go get some epic loot i heard about in the rad zones i brought my gun with me because there are radiated animals and are deadly so after picking off the animals i entered the zone and found lots of things like research kits and rad armor while jeseipi was gathering resources i thought while he gather's resources ill just help us advance in technology and we got to the point where jeseipi had made us this nice sized fort and i had gotten us from 1 pistol to m4's and silencer's so we decided to go to the rad zone together (we had gathered alot more rad pills) and we would work on getting research kits so we can learn how to craft things we dont know how to craft (when you start you can craft the basic stuff under the crafting list you use this research kit to add to the list so you can craft it) and then we had to go for the day so when i got back on i found that a noob had taken his time to break one of my walls and steal all of my things this included m4 two 9mm pistol's and three p250's all my good armor and bunches of important mateial's. so that leaves with me having to recraft everything i did eventualy gt everything (jeseipi was offline and i decided to check on our base while he was away and when you disconnect your character's body will lay there till you log on again leaving you 100% vulnerable unless ur behind a metal door) and the rest of the story will continue tommorow 5/11/2014 at 5 00pm.i highly recommend this game it is extremly fun everyone needs to know this game it is so realistic as well i love the ambience as well there are even Some servers where people have built large villages me and jeseipi went on an empty server so we wouldnt get raided right away.

review: Chapter 1 BeginningsSomething about the mountains distant goliaths towering in perpetual gloom pulled me towards them. Newly awake on the sunlit beach sand still clinging to my bare head and body where they had pressed upon the earth in my slumber I knew that I must travel north to seek these giants. Though I failed to understand the perils and the journey required to reach them I understood that I must live upon them in humble awe of their presence.It was as I contemplated this that I first heard footsteps. New to this world a humble babe drinking in his surroundings I turned to greet whatever traveler called these lands home. My first neighbor perhaps? Alas a brief glimpse of flesh the swing of an axe and my brains spattered across the pristine sands. My body fell back to the ground as if returning to the rest it had so recently awakened from.Chapter 2 And So We LearnRising again from the sands of Newman Beach I once again stared off towards the far distant mountains this time wiser for my traumatic end. I immediately set out running not sure of my path but ultimately sure of my destination. Heading vaguely towards the Mother of Mountains towering above the other peaks like a stern mother gazing over her brood I stopped along the way to gather the supplies that I knew I would need for my journey and new home.Wood for the fires that would warm and the shelter that would protect. Stone for the tools that would shape and the foundations that would support. Metal ore for the blades that would rend. Sulfer ore for the powders that would propel. Flesh for the hunger that would consume.These things I gathered through means both true and unsavory. Wood from young saplings that would grow no more. Ore from ancient boulders that had witnessed the birth and death of my ancestors for time uncountable. Flesh from the bones wildlife who fell prey to my hammer. Once starving and bleeding faced with an undeniable need to consume or to die I slew a wary traveler and ate of his corpse. Calming and coaxing him to join me in resource gathering I struck him down from behind while he chopped at a tree. While this deed haunts me I must admit I enjoyed the savor of his flesh.Thus after countless hours spent gathering foraging and killing I felt prepared to complete my journey up the ever closer mountains so that I might settle a small shack live in austerity and contemplate on the deeds I had committed in reaching my goal. Alas as I turned north once again to face my Gods I heard the fateful patter of food steps. More wise yes much more wise I spun to greet them hammer in hand prepared to maul any who would threaten my sojourn.I was greeted by the flare of a muzzle and the roar of a shotgun blast that took me squarely in the chest ripping me open the contents of my inventory and body both spilling on the loamy forest floor. From the Island do we rise and from the Island do we return.Chapter 3 The Spinning of the WheelI awoke on the beach sand wet cold and hard beneath my body. I was sore. How long had I laid there clicking the "Click here to wake up" button? Groggily I stood tense and afraid of what felt like the already approaching bearer of death. But no no footsteps. Slowly then intensely the anger set in. My loss. My efforts. My struggle. My crimes.All for naught.In rage I shouted at the world "NICE ING KILL WAY TO KILL AN UNARMED NOOB! DO YOU FEEL TOUGH NOW HEAD?!?"My nerves ragged my head pounding my keyboard pounded I began to run towards the mountains at full speed. Their call was as strong as ever and with deadly determination I set out to meet them. As I ran in the distance to the left I saw something move. Yes there was definitely something there. Stopping I could only barely make out another naked man running chopping at trees in the night. My desire to feast on his flesh was surprising and overpowering as was my murderous rage at a world filled with thieves and villians. I would join them. I would become the murderer. I ran towards him with abandon rock swinging up and down in front of me as I anticipated caving in his head and watching the fountain of blood spurt high into the air. As I drew near my victim must have heard those fateful footsteps for he turned towards me hammer held high. Unfortunately for him my aim was true and my strike was well timed. Down he went in a rumple of flesh. Checking his inventory I liberated wood cloth and meat. I then gleefully began pounding his corpse with my rock bashing his bones while cackling to the sound of stone on sinew. Rushing away from this victim in a euphoria I found others. Others would know my stone and my axe that day. Bodies littered the earth and my inventory filled with skulls. I would build a house of skulls upon the mountains and live in my misery and violence. I also miraculously began to have quite the collection of resources thanks to my string of murders. It appeared that I would in fact be able to journey to the mountains once again.And so once again I directed myself northwardly with bones meat and resources in tow. I began to see the mountains in a new light as I approached them dark and full of hatred. Gods of violence death betrayal. These were the dark Gods and their rule was a harsh one. I would greet them in kind. Almost on cue I saw my last victim. Off to the right running around and clearly unaware of me I savored my final act of violence before going up the mountains which I had finally reached the foot of. So close and yet I understood that this final death would ready me for my life of solitude above. Additionally the lure of yet more resources was intoxicating.It was time to kill again.And so I sprinted towards the lone naked figure. As I approached I saw that he held only a crude hatchet made of stone. An easy kill for my War Hammer of the Dark Gods. I pulled my hammer back to deliver my initial blow and was surprised to find that this figure was no mere mortal man but a Lagger with the incredible talent to shift locations unnaturally and instantaneously. He shifted to the side and then behind me with two blinks delivering a nasty blow to my head with his hatchet. Dazed on his strange unpredictably movements the pain of the blow and the blood now obscuring my vision I began to swing my hammer wildly hoping to connect to this demonic foe at random so that I might survive this encounter. Swing after swing I made running in wild circles yet he alluded me with ease taunting me all the while in Russian and showering hatchet blows down upon me like harsh winter rains.Finally in my despair I understood what was to be. I had come to the only end that there could have been. This was always the way it was going to be. My health low and dropping with my loss of blood I stood still eyes lifted towards the mountains that now stood so close yet looked colder and more distant than ever. I heard the crunch of snow as my other worldly adversary closed in and then the final thwack of hatchet on flesh. My body crashed to the earth my vision flying askew and then fading all to the demonic chatter of my Russian foe. The world growing dark the sound of a hatchet pounding away at my corpse all of my work and my sin spilled to the earth for enemy to collect. I died with the faint impression that the mountains mocked me laughing in their deep ancient tongue.Chapter 4 This AgainI woke up on a beach and started all over. Again and again and again and again. Those blasted beautiful magical mountains still haunt and call me but I have not yet set foot upon their mythical slopes.10/10 Would ing try again.

review: I assume that you know the vary baisics of Rust or at least what is going on in the game.This is a preety neat game gets updated every friday (only late when there are big updates).Its a "survival game" but most of the time its just trying to survivr from the other players then the enviorment (i will get back on the players). The game is quite chalanging gatehering food and water isnt hard but it is hard to progress espacily when you have to deffend yourself from other players trying to take your loot because they need it to progress are envious or have a gruge against you.The base building is ok not too good and not too bad nothing special.The optimization is ok not the best but the devs are working on it almost every update last year i could bearly run Rust now i get to play at 40 60fps at medium settings (i have a outdated PC and need to upgrade it).The players can be a bit toxic that is if you consider little children and grown men spew out rascist sexsist and complete utter bulshit. And lets not froget the many many nazi swatstikas everywhere painted on banners and sighns (yes you can pain in Rust).A huge problem can be if you play solo or with a small group (3 5) and run in to a Zerg.Zergs are large groups that use numbers over brains and tactics (like the zerglings in Starcraft hence the name).New chalanges are being implemented there was a heli from a long time ago now we got Bradly (a APC/Tank) and soon we should get scientist searching the radiated rad towns and monuments (they are armed ofcourse).Be warned you will get killed on sight a lot of times but sometimes you can find a friendy person who you can become friends with start a group go raiding and make some neat memories together.From me it gets a 7.5/10(Sorry if my english was bad in this review)

review: Other players will see and be 'amazed' by your house that they will likely try to break in and steal all your belongings. Why not go further by destroying your house! Very probable you will encounter this on your first run and many more. If you can last a day successfully don't think you can just remain inside forever you need food and other resources so it is mandatory to head out to collect these...all while looking over your shoulder for any stalkers. Hey you could get lucky and be riddled with bullets! At death good luck finding your way back home if it is still intact. You will have to watch out since others will be jealous of a new spawn they will hunt you down. Some may earn your trust and then kill you when you are not expecting it. Others will pretend to go the other way when your paths cross only to follow you. A select few may give you supplies and be friendly leading to teamwork and happiness. Alas because of an update to remove zombies Rust was uninstalled. There were no challenges at all and building can only go so far. If a worthwhile update should release in the future I'll likely return. As of this writing I have read they are doing a complete reboot of Rust. How long must I wait? Am I in for a pleasant surprise? I don't know but for now I know I can wait by keeping busy with other better games.

Trust no one they will kill you I found the best way to try to be friendly is use voice chat people naturally think you are going to kill them so are defensive all the time so speaking to them before they get close can help with that. (I don t at the moment use voice though just a prefernce). If the DEVS read this please FIX THE FOUNDATION BUG. review: Most people will ask the question Day Z vs. Rust? Spoiler alert Rust is much better. Join dozens of other players in building a giant town and harbor new players and residents of the server or play as a lone bandit who moves from area to area in shacks raiding major bases for supplies. This is an amazing game and a steal for it's price. I give this a 9/10 as is still in development therefore features aren't fully implemented such as textures and mechanics.
title: Rust

review: You spend a few days sneaking around collecting resources researching guns and building your base while trying to avoid being killed by other players. Your squad moves out in the middle of the night and heads towards an enemy compound. "Let's split up our c4 evenly guys so that we don't lose it all if I die". The presious C4 you saved up and worked so hard for. You build a staircase along the side of the hostile tower. Everyone rushes up. "I hope they won't hear our foot steps". Building appears dark and quiet. Looks like there is nobody in. You find a wall to breach. "Seems like this is their storage room! Look at all the boxes!". 2 distinct C4 explosions break the silence of the night. It's a motherload! "Grab all you can guys! Don't forget to check that hidden stash!". Your rush back to your base. There is an unfamiliar structure by your front door. "Did somebody leave the door open?" "NO! We've been raided!" You hear multiple footsteps around your base. Shots fired! "I'm hit!" The inside of your bases lights up with tracers. Laser sights scan across your rooms. Loud pop. "I'm dead" "I can't respawn! They destroyed my sleeping bag!" "They got me too!" "I'm dead!" "I respawned 2 minutes away guys I'm running back!" "Guys... it's all gone... They took everything..." That's rust.

review: This is a great game to play with friends make a house cook some food scavenge for mats to make weapons and ammo and have a blast doing it. However there a lot of flaws as all early access games have buggy combat sometimes people do little teleports making melee combat hard (not sure if it just the server or the game itself doing it but which ever i hope it is fixed). The gun plays really nice IMO sometimes can be a bit annoying but other wise good gun play even with all the bugs. However i would prefer to see guns be crafted not found like all the guns have the unique flare and the pipe shotty and even the hand cannon even though its not very effective still cool concept in its own right. I havent played rust in sometime because the updates have been..absent for sometime but im sure it's for a good reason and they will have a really big one soon a lot of the content in there dev blogs looks really nice. 20 dollars is really nice price for early access game it helps support the games progress. I would wait thought till it updates which i feel is soon before giving it a shot it's still very fun with friends alone its kinda hard and also gets boring a lot quicker but lone wolfing has it's perks sometimes. all and all fun game to play i would say 8/10 at its current stage i expect great things to come.

review: Generally a great game. Graphics are good. Aiming mechanics needs more work. It's a beautiful game. Servers are filled with trolls the game allows everyone to act like Neanderthals. Essentially it's a big sandbox for anyone to pay for the game to get killed over and over again and get called "salty" when you call them out. Or vice versa. Things hit a dead end with nothing to do other than chop more trees or mine more ores. Or hunt more players. Whichever is your cup of tea.So far there is no clear direction where the game is going other than letting players kill each other and raid each other. Or create a non hostile community and move your life into Rust. Also if you are a bully an $$hole can't play nice hates everyone in your life have no life and/or likes contributing toxicity and negativity into an otherwise neutral environment this game is definitely for you.So by all means save your cash if you want to raid bases there's Starcraft 2. It's free now. If you want to shoot other players there's CSGO or the COD series or Destiny 2 or any other fps games. Until the game gets better please love yourself and your wallet. It's not expensive but it's definitely not worth it. Go have fun somewhere else.

review: Okay so I feel with nearly 580 hours of Rust playtime I can finally write a review.I'm rather late to the game but have watched a friend play around 800 hours of Rust before I even touched the game myself.Its fun for what it is a sociopath hoarding simulator. It's got some fun player interaction you don't really get in other PVP games.I feel the gun mechanics could be a little more polished but it's still a beta. I'd say grab it it's usually under $30 and I'd say I've got my money's worth. The devs are updating the game all the time unlike some of the indie survival games on Steam that are all but dead.

title: Rust

review: Rust uses the Minecraft formula perfectly. You don't know what you're doing but you know that you can't stop doing it. The only difference? The main enemy in Rust is your fellow man. PvP follows DayZ's shoot on sight technique so be careful! Crafting is exactly like the console versions of Minecraft meaning you don't have to place materials in a pattern to craft them. Building structures however is more indicitive of The Forest where you have walls and campfires etc. that can be placed based on their specifications. Your main experience in Rust will be building a house or series of houses while fending off hordes of naked men with axes resulting in a sort of beautiful chaos unseen in any game before it. Rust is in short an incredible game.

review: About 98% of the time spent in this game you'll spend farming resources and building your base (if you're playing on a low pop server like me) and the other 2% you'll spend fighting other players you come across in the open world. Now what I enjoy with this game is mostly the social aspect the trash talking in the server chat while you farm the jokes some random player told you about his in game neighbor or the drama that arises when you blame someone else for having mugged some poor soul in the forest.The best part however is the thrill you feel when fighting other players as you risk losing the stuff you've spent hours of hard work to acquire if you die. Or you could win big and get their stuff. I now understand why some people find gambling so addictive as it is the closest feeling I can use to describe this game.11/10 would blame their neighbor again for mugging the sqeaker of the server.

review: 25 hours spent playing after 6 days of owning the game. It's taken me this long to really get the basics down. Rust is great fun and maybe the most frustrating game I've ever played. In my experience not playing on an official server and especially finding one with a low population is key for noob survival . Today I was finally able to really get a nice little fort built up with a good little weapons cache only to have become too comfortable. I was killed with my door open by a couple of jerk raiders. When I come back they'll have looted all my belongings and either destroyed what took me hours to build or taken it over as their own. As I said very frustrating. But I'm already looking forward to going back in re starting from scratch and hopefully remembering this time to not get comfortable enough that I'm on my roof at night crafting when I should be inside hiding from the awful people this game attracts. There have been several friendlies in various servers I've been on who have been very helpful but by and large this game seems to attract psychopaths who might kill you irl as well. Remain vigilant!

The second important thing is that there are not much an updates going on. The devolpers have blog where they public stuff that they will put in the game but belive me you will not see them in the game. Yes the devolpers put two branches (the base game and a branch where you can try the new stuff) but in the dev branch they do not put all they made. The point is that you buy the game you will have A LOT OF FUN but do not expect new content.P.S The game is better with a friend.

review: Product received for free. Probably the best "survival" game within it's genre as of this review. In rust you start with hardly any knowledge of the weapons clothing trinkets and building materials within the game. You learn over time by finding blueprints or tinkering with items to create blueprints. On a vanilla server you will slowly over the course of days find yourself progressing be it with your base growing or you getting better and better gear by crafting finding or stealing. I think rust really shines on modded servers with ease of access plugins and the ability to up the rate at which you progress within the game. Definitely a good game if you don't mind grinding and are looking for a game to progress on over time and especially with friends.8.5/10

review: I love this game. Have been playing it for about a week and have put in around 100 hours. So first thing first this is not the game for you if you get mad about dying. You die ALOT! Players will kill animals will kill you you die of starvation you will die from about everything that is generated. You will start gathering your mats to make a dwelling and some is going to kill you and take it all however that is the point of a survival game. To learn how to survive. There is so much risk in this game you have to adapt. If you are looking for a game to just jump into and shoot everyone on sight this game isn't for you. If you are looking for a game that you have to claw your way to the top while enduring attacks from enemies and counterattacking building a base and breaching others. Then you will enjoy this game. I feel like it is a good mix of Minecraft meets Resident Evil meets Call of Duty. You start with a rock and build your empire. Sometimes it seems like the world is collasping around you and everyone is just using you as the proverbial toliet paper of the world however once you set up and start to climb there is no better feeling. So in conclusion I think this is an amazing game for anyone that desires a SURVIVAL game due to the rags to riches build up and the high risk system. ENJOY and let the odds be ever in your favor.
title: Rust

review: This game really makes you think about human interactions. Take a group of friends tell them to survive and they will eventually have enough supplies to outlast time. Give one of them a gun however and we'll see how loyal they really are.I'm not saying I'm a saint in this game but it seems that when I or others try to be nice in this game the thanks we get is a shotgun blast to the face. Unfortunately this game came out in a time where everyone has the Call of Duty mentality. I have a gun guns are for killing i should kill. This isn't the only game with this problem but it seems like the perpertraters are being rewarded particularily in this game. At least in GTA V they have a sanity system that encourages good behaviour. But altogether I have really found this game enjoyable. If you manage to find a decent server like I have and can figure out the subtle hints between friend and murderous psychopath then you will honestly enjoy this. Just make sure you play with a friend you'll need the backup.I love this game and can't wait to see it grow.

review: At this stage of development Rust only offers a few hours of enjoyment before things get stale and repeatitive. Once you build your home gather food and resources there really isn't much more to do except listen to people whine and curse eachother out over the chat on how unfair it is that they got raided/killed. I've played on multiple servers and overall I find that people take this game way too seriously. Perhaps if there was an option to hide the chat the experience may be a bit more enjoyable. In short I would not recommend putting down $20 for this game this early in its development. Maybe down the road the developers will improve the game to be a much more fulfilling experience but for now I'm sorry to say it just seems like a glorified Minecraft.

review: I LOVE this game the mechanics can be a bit tedious and the learning curve isnt all too steep but the interactions between you and the other players is really what youre paying for. the constant paranoia and overall tension between you your fellow "nakeds' and the other players that kill on sight add an unexoected goal to the game. that being protect your friends and survive. like most survival games this one requires HOURS of play its definitely not a game you can play for 5 mins and log off. if you wanna make ANY progress it takes some serious devotion. which isnt exactly a bad thing. like with any Building esque game youll run into greafers but with the right team put together its really enjoyable. the game mechanics forces you to seek assistance from the other players and the majority that ive met a pretty noob friendly. all in all i would highly reccomend this game. WARNING FOR WINDOWS XP USERS. this game is not currently stable on XP playable but you gat whats called player ghosting after about 5 mins of play which forces you to disconnect and reconnect again. this can be frustrating and game breaking. with the new experimental rust servers coming out im not sure if this might change unless youre running a 64 bit OS this game might not be for you. I run Windows xp and im just too damned thick to quit playing rust. Games just that good. hope to see you all on a server.
