review: Brilliant game! Don t get me wrong. The idea and execution are brilliant. It delivers exactly what it s supposed to. The survival and crafting elements are fun. Gathering materials is a labour of love.However the cons massively outway the pros for me In order to get the most out of this game it forces you to play with friends or join other players groups (if you re lucky enough to be accepted). This may be in the pro column for some people but for me it s proving very difficult to get started. I can spend hours and hours gathering mats stash them in my store box inside my base only to log out for the night and find that an entire day s exploits have been stolen by another player when I log back in.So it would appear that in order to get started you either need to sink a few sleepless days into gathering the mats for a metal door (instead of the wooden one which can easily be broken down by other players) or join a group and beg things off them completely defeating the object of the game in my opinion.I WANT to go out and pass time by gathering materials to get the sense of achievement when I build structures. I WANT to work for my creations and belongings. But to have an entire day of gathering mats wasted makes me never want to play this game again despite enjoying most of it s content.I spend time creating a home and spawnpoint only to find I do not spawn there when I choose "spawn at camp".I log out and find I'm not where I was when I logged out making it pointless playing this game in the long term (why spend time gathering mats and building a home if it takes me 2 hours to find it again (and every time I log back in))So I decide to join in with stealing from other players. I hack at a wooden door for what seems like for EVER steal his belongings (which were better than mine!) only to be shot and looted...I just find it all a complete waste of time ..

review: Rust is a game you probably don't want to play.Let me explain.No other game makes you wish actual death upon your opponent. I have yelled at my own friends allied with random people murdered my friends and destroy random bases. I love nothing more to ruin people's week by using C4 on every foundation of some ***holes base. I will drop loot for people only to shoot them in the back of the head when they're trying to pick it up. Positives Extremely intense no other game gives you an actual adrenaline rushHundreds of different ways to play Battlefields building servers modded community gun game on and onFacepunch is one of the only developers in the genre that cares about their game. They are very active in the communityYou can play for a few hundred hours for a game that is only $20You get to kill racists murderers theives and vandalsYou eventually get to become a racists a murderer a theif and a vandalMeh Depends on how you look at it but there are often weekly server resets. or Biweekly and once a month total reset.It has positives and negatives good after having a bad week of rust bad after having a good week of rust.Negatives All of your hard work will get destroyed. All of it.You cannot be weak of heart no other game will make you more mad. Dark Souls doesn't even come closeAll in all one of the best games I have ever played. 10/10 would kill more nakeds

review: Review update. October Rust curently announced that the xp system is being gutted out. They are bringing back radiation to the rad towns. It is too early to say what the new system will look like but I find it great that the developers listened to the comunity and are hard at work to make the game great again. Right now all the bp are unlocked on the prerelease beta just as a place holder untill the new system is in place. I find a lot of the tweeks they did are beutiful. The flame torents are something many people wanted for a while. The iron sights are fixed and the new cave system seams great. This game is going to be great again. August I have about 3000 hours on this game. Been playing since legacy. Since they added the Xp system they destroyed the game. makes it so that there is no other way to play that hit on a tree all day. It is boring and it makes it imposible for a new player to come in mid wipe. You basically have to join in every 1st thursday of every month and just never get off. It is a race on who can mine the most now and not a skill based game anymore. With the new system if you raid someone and get their stuff they are the ones that get exp when you craft with them. Same when you kill them. It's some sort of socialistic t that makes it that everyone gets rewarded even if they are not good at the game. Last I checked Rust was pvp. I really doubt the Assult rile is in the game to hunt bears. Not only that now you have to be ompletly end game to raid. That is dumb some of the best raids I ever had was as a noob with only bows pipe shotguns and revolvers c4ing a bas of deffenders in fulll armor. It makes it more exciting because you never know who you are messing with. Even if someone is half naked they might have some boom boom in their 2x2. Also as soon as a big clan makes the other 1 or 2 big clans from the server rage quit. New ones that jump on will have no chance to contest them mid wipe. You can't even make a bow till lvl 6. I am actually a veterane of a large 30 person clan and we don't play with the new system because there is no challenge. We just have one person give the tools to everyone and then they can get to c4 in the fist day then there is no challenge you just spend the rest of the wipe kos all the new guys and dumping their inventory so no one catches up. Don't waste your money on this game at this point. If you want a good xp survival go play Ark if you want PVE go play Minecraft if you want rust.... well you are ed because they ruined it.

review: Everything's in the pursuit of meat.Never before have I seen all of Human history over a span of an hour. This game should be classified as a Documentary.Stone Age Watch as tribes of people armed with spears and rocks discover fire gather meager possesions and poke opposing tribes with pointy sticks!Feudal Age Watch as said tribes discover smelting and forgery building massive castles and fortresses and arrowing/swording enemy Feudal clans!Industrial Age Watch as said Feudal civilization discovers forgery smelting and gunpowder. Watch as they engineer rifles and proceed to erect a metric ton of factories and engage in brutal gunfights with enemy Industrialists!Early Modern Age Watch as said Industrial civilization hits the skill cap and proceeds to either gun down or enslave everyone else in the former ages! World Wars happen in this era!Chances are you're going to die well before reaching any of the aformentioned advances in technology. Over and over and over.That's alright though Human ingenuity is a helluva thing. Those who are unwaivered by this Dark Souls esque pounding that this game delivers you'll make it through the ranks before you become The One True Raider.Will you kill? Definitely.Will you enforce peace in your realm? Possibly.Will you strive to bring the world (Server) together? Probably not.

review: I do recommend this game to new players. Content is always coming out nowadays and you can accept fully that this game has turned from a game with depth to pretty much a kill on sight kind of community. This is due to the new system in place that completely cuts out blue prints. Now everyone will always be the same on what they can craft. This can be both good and bad.About this system Good You start off like anyone else in the server who just died.Possibly allows better access to newer items.Bad Community is more for killing you and taking what you have than being your firend for the sake of crafting them something they do not have.Does not inspire one to stay in a server after being raided since your only worth is your buildings and inventory. This game is not bad. But it was hard for me to give this a positive review with what the game has become.If you like a mainly pvp based game then this is for you but if you rage over getting your taken away after hours of game play then stay away. Personally for me this game was better before June 2016 when the blueprints were still around Much more addicting. I hope newer players can enjoy it much more than I can now.

review: Editing my review since there have been a lot of updates.Still love the game think it's awesome for people who can find the right server for them. A lot of servers nowadays are very specialized so don't expect to go into a 50 man server and be chummy with everyone or join an established building server and wreck havoc.Playing this game solo in my opinion is extremely boring I relate it more closely to the Minecraft experience than anything. The feeling of progression with friends is very tangible in Rust and I really think the blueprint overhaul helped with that feeling. The moment I get the Lantern blueprint I know my lakehouse is going to look badass and everyone has that one thing that they love getting *Cough*C4*Cough*Progress is definately slow but very steady and generally quality. Fall damage is rational the controls feel *JUST* clunky enough to be fun. Think ARMA but still responsive enough to enjoy how it handles. (God I hate ARMA's controls.)If I have one complaint it would be building honestly. The one problem I have with building the only thing I wish was better stairs. Corner stair specifically corner and spiral stairs. I get this isn't minecraft or building simulator 2069 but as someone who would highly prefer building to PVP I feel like most projects would look nicer with even the old 1/2 block stairs glitchy or not.All in all solid 8/10 from me. It's definately still in development and it will probably be for a long time but that's fine for something like Rust which needs constant updates.Would buy friends reccomended.

review: Other people have said it and it's true Rust in its current Alpha state is no fun for beginners (maybe not even for the more seasoned players). Here's why in a nutshell Starting out with just a rock and a torch is hard. Duh! But that's all fine and good if you can build something from that and start to make something of your naked self. So you start out and you get killed (A LOT) before you can build anything up. Ok ok you'll say I might be dying and losing everything but it still seems like so much FUN and I think I can establish myself so I'll keep trying!So you keep trying. Eventually you are able to survive long enough to build a house! Wahooo! You add a door you add a lock you start to store things you upgrade your twig hut to wood and now you're thinking hey! I've finally established a small little foothold here! I got some clothes! I got food! I even found some way cooler weapons! I'm on a roll!!Then you log out to you know live your real life.You return. You end up naked on a beach. You go back to your former home to discover that not only did someone break in and kill you but they stole your house and changed the lock too! You must once again live in the cold dark world trying desperately to survive.Over and over again the same thing happens. It's the inability to make a real foothold in this game for longer than a few hours that makes it so frustrating and in my opinion not really an enjoyable game to play.The game is beautiful and it has a lot of really positive traits the ability to build your own house raid for items hunting even running away from the bad guys and the bears can be exhilirating. What it really needs though in order to appeal to the masses is a chance for people to actually establish themselves. Otherwise who really cares? You'll just end up naked on a beach again anyway.

review: So disappointed. This was not what I expected for a survival game. Their definition of survival must be different from mine and a lot of others.I'm hoping that as the game progresses that it will eventually come out of alpha mode and hopefully be playable well thought out game.I had managed to find a server that no one was on at the time thought this was a good sign and then I logged in. My first few minutes of the game were upsetting because nothing looked like the promo trailers they have advertising it.No trees no wood to pick up to create tools with just naked with only a unlit torch and a rock which seems weird until you learn that you can't craft anything without blueprints and you can only get them through destroying man made trash cans randomly generated on the world....There is no intro to this game. You literally start the game somewhere on land or in my case water and are suppose to know what to do right off the bat.I was punching buttons for minutes to try and figure out the controls all while trying to play the game.No health/condition/hunger stats were available that I could find and when I did manage to kill something it's health bar went right back up to where it was before I killed it! That's just not right can't even go hunt properly....Your rock is not an indestructible rock. And after you use it to its full potential it breaks in a few pieces and that's that. I had picked up over 1 000 rocks and couldn't use even just 1 of them to replace my starter rock when it broke!No starter rock no mining. No mining no blueprint shards and no shardes no more progression in the game. This game is extremely frustrating for new players just starting out no tutorial no opening story mode... Nothing.I hope that after a few months I will be able to get back on here and reevaluate this review I have of the game and hopefully have a better outcome playing the game then I did when I first downloaded it.Why does there have to be blue prints? Why can I make ammo before I can make a base or even a basic tool? I will attempt to play again... And hopes that my new game will have a better outcome.Until then I highly do NOT recommend this game.

review: First and foremost the graphics for this game are pretty insane. (yes. a good Far Cry 3 insane) Im playing on a 2002 build of XP service pack 3 i just meet the minimum requirements for this game and it looks amazing. However all is not just well and dandy as nothing seems to stops a random from player walking up and murdering you for no reason thus ending potentially hours of progress (*ahem* DayZ anyone?) the tedious resource gathering is a bit annoying like where the HELL are all the bloody rocks!? i understand the survival aspect but going from naked caveman wielding a rock that ccuts trees to building M4's and hosing into zombies (or whatever they are) and Bears? A bit over the top. But still delightful in some respects.PROS Great graphics In depth crafting system beautiful open world design possibility to make towns and communitiesCONS too much PvP gathering materials is a bit too tedious at first BIG step from a cave man to Spec ops grunt why is radiation a thing?(Note* this based off of roughly just two hours of repetitive spawning and dying player kills and general gameplay)EDITIn the 3 months ive owned and played this game they've added weapon/item degrading and removed zombies. thats it. oh and of course the normal bug fixes. but not much to this game. at all. I dont underrstand the thrill like first it seemed cool and promising now it feels deserted and empty. Rust doesnt know what Rust is anymore. and people keep buying it.

review: Before I state anything else I would suggest that those who are new to start out on a No PvP server to avoid immediate frustration of having to deal with the awful communities on normal PvP servers. They show no quarter there as they shouldn't but it is just not worth the frustration while trying to learn the basics. Wait till you have a good grasp on how to play before attempting rolling on one.Aside from the awful community on most servers the game is fantastic if you enjoy the survival genre. A bit simplified in its current state but it's an Alpha currently so I hope to see that change and a lot more features get fleshed out. Due to a lack of any real help from the game itself expect to ask a fair share of questions in chat as the way some things work (specifically what buttons to press / hold) or how to operate certain structures. Once you get the hang of it it gets enjoyable.The potential is incredible and I can't wait to see how the game evolves throughout the development.

review: I would definitely recommend this game to anyone that loves survival games. It is an alpha so it is gonna be clunky it mite run slow sometimes and it is gonna lag but you have too look past all of that and look at the game and where it is as an alpha. It has a working gathering/crafting system sounds are fairly decent(except for bears) map is massive and packed with mountains different biomes wildlife urban environments and much more. As far as the community goes I have not ran into any people that have just shot me on sight I have had one incedent where a player approached my home with me and my friend inside and we were able to kill him. That is it. Other than that I have had several different players(most who I have now added on steam) approach me and ask if I needed help with food or they have given me weapons and ammo and armor. At an alpha state I would give this game a solid 7/10. I would deduct some from the rating because the servers have been down all day today despite the fact of valve working on a patch as I am typing this I would also deduct some from the rating because the game can be quite laggy on the official servers whether it is a stress test server or not and there is also a lot of rubber banding and I often find my self quickly sinking into the ground and rising up every 10 seconds on some servers and the last thing I would deduct some of the rating would be for the sloppy sounds I mean the gun sounds are good footsteps and fire noises are excellent but the wildlife just sounds flat out . Bears sounds like my German Shepard and the Wild Boars sounds like little tiny farm piglets whining for their mother milk.

review: Spent about 15 ours playing. Then the server I was on decided they were going to wipe everything. Yeah no. I for one dont have time to waste building a secure base and gathering supplies to build weapons and armor just to have it go poof because someone running the server thought a wipe would be good. Now I do believe that server based characters is good in the sense that its fixes server hopping like in DayZ. But servers having the ability to just resest everything is not cool.Also just like in DayZ everyone just Kills on sight. I did have one group of 2 people tell me to stop I said no thanks ill be on my way then get an arrow in the back. When confronted in chat he claimed it was a "warning shot" Not a very good one considering it killed....Most people don't seem to grasp the wise old proverb " Don't where you eat". If you build a base within 200 feet of anyone else they spend the whole time harassing you and raiding your base..... Instead of grouping up and forming a neighborhood/alliance. These kind of games Rust DayZ 7 days to die are for younger people. People with a part time job and 6+ hours a day to just sit at their pc. Basically its an MMO. If you dont have the time to sink in it you'll never get anywhere at all.

review: I haven't yet played this game for a time long enough to give at a completely accurate review however Rust is an excellent game from my experience. The only things that I dislike about it don't come from the game but from the devs themselves.The devs of Rust are oddballs. They will add a cool feature like the experience system and all of a sudden remove it in the next patch. They also add unecessary items like vending machines and so on (I guess it's cool for players to be able to make their own shops). If you are looking for realistic combat and firefights this isn't a very good game for that. Though the weapon sounds are pretty cool and sound quite realistic combat is a little bit odd for a survival game. IBullet drop is extremely exaggerated and unrealistic and players can heal generally quickly through the use of syringes and medkits. I don't have many complaints besides those (it's annoying to lose a firefight however because someone pulled out a syringe faster than you). The game can also get pretty intense when helicopters controlled by NPCs come hovering around your base looking for trouble or when a plane brings in an airdrop and you can hear the massive amount of gunshots which are being fired by the people fighting to the death to see who can claim the rewards of the drop.The firearm crafting doesn't make much sense either you need to find certain 'bodies' of a weapon (as of win.1172.69) and then you just need pieces of metal springs and pipes. In reality you would need not just a 'body' but a reciever (I guess the weapon's body could include the reciever) an action a stock a barrel and all sorts of screws other parts to hold the gun together. Firearm bodies can only be found in certain places for some reason you can't make them but you can made a working codelock with some metal scraps and wood.This game is generally good but only truly fun to play with a group. I would recommend it if you could find a group to play it with.
title: Rust

review: This game is pretty fun. It takes some of my favorite aspects of Minecraft and applies it to a nice realistic open world. The controls are decent although perhaps a tad clunky at times. THe graphics are pretty nice.Depending on what server you play on your experiences will vary significantly. Sometimes its really hard to find food and supplies and sometimes the people are complete s who kill and raid regularly which takes away a lot of the fun for me personally. But perhaps thats appealing to some people. Me? I like this game as a nice survival game in which I can explore and build nice communities with my friends and thrive in the nice open world. Im not really interested in the whole raiding/being a aspect.Overall I recommend. Its fun but theres no doubt that there is improvement to be made. Perhaps more building construction options. Maybe some more ways to "live off the land" like drinking spring water from a river eating greenery making potions transportation (horses or something).It would be much more fun for me with the ability to make your own server. Hopefully that will come in time. Overall I rate it a 7.5/10

review: It's Rust. It's what you expected when you heard about it long ago. It's a game where you're thrown in to a huge world with just a rock and you have to survive. Essentially it's a game where you're a naked caveman trying to live and avoiding and/or killing other naked cavemen. That being said do NOT go into this solo as it is not meant to be played as such. The possibilities of things you can do and things you can craft are near endless until some asshat shoots you and you die and lose all your stuff. Be sure to bring a buddy and help each other survive but don't kill each other. Death holds a lot of meaning in this game so if you don't like that steer clear of Rust. It's still in alpha which means it has a lot of room for improvement and it has a ton of potential. It's a really great game if you're into surviving and killing other people to dominate their stuff. That being said don't be the asshat who picks a fight he/she can't win. Because then everyone will hate you. Overall this is a game that is definitely worth trying. Might as well get it in alpha because you don't know if the price may go up when it goes into beta or releases. It's worth the 20 bucks just make sure you take precautions to ensure your survival. Oh yeah servers may be a little laggy or slow depending on your computer but it'll get better as the game develops. Definitely well hyped another great gem by Garry. 8.5/10 (Alpha Ver.)
title: Rust

review: After waiting a long time for Dayz to be released I stumbled upon Rust. Dayz was a tad expensive for an alpha so after reading numerous good reviews I purchased Rust. I've only played for a small amount but so far I feel ripped off. I expected issues from an alpha but this game is just disappointing. If I wasn't murdered over and over again or I could actually find rocks I may have enjoyed it more.Pros There appears to be a lot of potential here in the minecraft/dayz crossBeing able to build the world is awesomeVoice chat is a good ideaCons Everything feels like a choreEven hitting something with a rock lagsThe menu is unusableThe members are AWFUL.

review: I stood there on the thin pole desperately trying to jump over the railing. After numerous attempt I accepted the fate that there's no way to jump back where I came from I glanced over at the lonely dangling platform beside me almost too far to reach. I've made up my mind I'll do it I'll do the leap of faith it's either I go back base a rich man or I die in this radiated hollow dome I held my breath wanting to take a step back before launching myself forward onto the safe land almost tripped over I did a small step and jumped all my might I jumped as far as I could as hard as my thin legs could launch me. It was far from close it was almost too far to even grab hold onto the platform I fell I fell and fell the fall feels like an eternity I close my eyes bracing myself from what is coming a cold lonely death. Everything I did in my life as a naked flashed in front of my very eyes I prayed to whoever's listening how I wish god our holy admin is here to save me but luck was sadly not on my side I reached the bottom the cracking of my bones crushed my dreams my very dreams of becoming a rich man in this deserted island. I failed I lied there as blood rushed and blurred my vision I let out an agony cry no one was there to help the bare metal feels colder than usual against my hazmat suit. I closed my eyes as I was greeted by doom "you've died from falling" I held my breath and looked up I asked god why? Why me? Why today? I couldn't help it as tears rolled down my rosy cheeks the salty defeat landed on my waterproof keyboard "at least my keyboard ain't gonna let me down" I thought I sighed and hit the respawn button. I was brought back to this cruel world the familiar sight of the bed room I built in the castle I built. A place where I call home. Funny how with all these dominations and big base it feels empty today. Guess it's true money can't buy you happiness. Cause when you die a lonely death falling off an abandoned dome you'll realise that you are just a speck of dust in this vast galaxy.TLDR I fell and died.Was this review helpful? Yes.

review: At about 600 hours into Rust I feel the need to express how much fun it has been. Starting out confused naked and near starving an ending up with an enourmous base advanced gear + weapons and a couple new friends is all you can ask from a game like this. Although not perfect the building and crafting aspects are easy to grasp yet take long enough to really get into as to supply at least a dozen extra hours of gameplay before even reaching "endgame". The community is pretty bad to be quite honest but I've managed to find tons of worthwhile people to play with. Having a small solid group of people to experience the game with makes it feel like you and your group v.s. the rest of the server which I find enjoyable. Teamwork pays off in Rust and even players like myself who prefer solo experinces will come to appreciate the feeling of cooperating with others in this game. If you want a good survival game to become immersed in compete in engaging pvp make friends and enemies and lose dozens upon dozens of hours of your life to Rust is the game.
title: Rust

review: It's a great Zombie Survival game that i think has whatmost people desire. However since this is under development there are a lot of things that need to be improved. Dont get me wrong your work so far has ben amazing I would just like to point out some things that i think would improve the game and attract more people to play it. here we go 1. Character customization. it feels as running aroung looking the same way isnt a step forward. plus it is always fun to make your a little more unique. add genders. another option would be to implement skins like monecraft but more advanced and a clint where you can make and upload skins to the workshop. 2. More roads a larger map and more radtowns. this is pretty important if you want a larger community and makes the game a little more challenging. also add Mines and lumber mills where you can go to harvest stone and wood. note that these to would be covered in radiation and thus making it harder(and more fun) for people to get these resources. if the map would be larger you could implement transportation however this is not something that is nescessary and something for the future 3. Map. make it possible to craft a map so you dont get lost all the time. navigation is pretty important for a survival game and i think it would make it easier to find your friends. this is all i can come up with at the moment. i know this game can go so much further and i really hope you implement more things into the gamefor a game in alpha i give the rating 8/10. seeing as when you have all the gear there's really not much to do.

review: While this game is currently in an early alpha build and contains a huge amount of glitches and inconveniences I do not regret buying this game. In the past two days I have logged more than six hours which is more than I can say for the majority of the games I own. This game has so much potential which the developers are working to unlock. The possibilities for this game are seemingly endless and that fills me with excitement I have not felt since the early days of Minecraft.Rust will surely bring you huge satisfaction in your success and great frustration in your failure both of which are inevitable for every player due to the nature of your game. The emotional response to this game is such that I've nothing to really compare it to. Creating allies with players in this game creates a stronger bond than I've seen in most other games as well as that I can honestly say I've never felt such hatred for my enemies in a game before.I expect great things from this game and as it is now I would rate it 8/10. I recommend that if you are considering buying this game to do so.

review: Very Good Game Stoped Playing It Due To Some Certain Problems But Will Play Again When A Few Updates Roll Out.Notes On The Game Wonderful Great Graphics Good World But I Think It Needs A New One Like When It Gets Out Of DEV For huge Servers Needs Many Items+Features (But Its Still In Dev) NEEDS MORE UPDATES! I Know What They Are Doing (Check The Logs For The Weekly Progress (playrust.com) ) But Maybe They Could've Added Something Dumb Just To Keep People Busy (Lots Of People Left The Game Cause Of This) Not Going To Add Any More Because It Will Involve LOTS Of Opinions+IdeasTips On The Game Dont Play On Official Servers May Have Changed Since I Quit Playing But Official Servers Always Had Stress Tests+ Too Many People On Play On A Community Server (Usually More Support Becuase Of Actual Admins+Mods On) Check Out The Wiki! Learn The Map It Really Helps ALOT (Just Google It Dont Remember URL) NEVER PLAY ALONE It Sucks Make An Alliance With Someone (Prefer To Have IRL Friend) Maybe Check Out A Few Bases Get A Good Idea Of What You Want To Build Have You+Your Friend (Or Loner You) Collect Wood Make A Shack Some What Hidden And Put Beds+Door+Crete+ Work Bench if Possible Can Put Workbench Out Side Build House Piece By Piece Shacks Get Raided Easily But Still Have A Shack Dont Plan To Build House In Huge Chuncks At A Time Look Up Game Mechanics Such As Deteration Or Air Drops Rad Towns Repair Shack And New House Build A Gun Like Pipe Shot Gun Cheap And Kills Wolves And Bears Live Reletively Close To A Rad Town Have Your House Have Some Sort Of Balcony Talk To People With Your Mic When Someone Comes Next To Your Base Talk With A Gun Pointed At Them To Show Him Not To Play Games But Dont Shoot Unless You Have To More Friends The Better Shoot And Your Instantly His+Everyone He Is Friends With's Enemy Have Doors On The Inside Of Your Base More Protection I Had Front Door Go To A Room With Doors (Like An Air Lock) Or Guest Holding Cell (Look At Bottom Of Review) METAL DOORS Wood Are Fine For Noob Days Use Chat Be Social Dont Be Mean If People Like You They Even Will Avenge You AND Give Your Stuff Back See Good To Have Friends Dont Go Toward Air Drops At Noob Stage Unless You Know What Happens Such As The Mass Genocide That Happens Around It XD Know All The Guns And Game Features Dont Do Censor.Nudity.False (Unless You Want To See Naked People But I Dont Remember If Thats The Actual Command But Its Somewhat Like That)Now For The Guest Holding Cell This Holds People Who Run To Your Base Asking For Entry As Them Being Chased But Sometimes Its A Thief Gaining EntryI Love The Game But I Cant Stress How Important Some Of Those Tips Are Friends+Learn Game Mechanics It Really Is Worth It.In All The Game Is Worth It For The Price ONE Could Go To The Movies (Without Snack+Food) And Enjoy 2.5 Hours TOPS On A Good Movie While Here You Could Buy A Good Game + Snacks And Enjoy Infinate Fun(Movie Prices May Very By Location Mine Are Expensive) XD

review: Rust can be a really fun and rewarding gaming experience. There is a disclaimer though This game is very hardcore the community is unforgiving and you can lose hours of gameplay in a single second. That being said Rust may not be for everyone. All of this adds to a truly fun and rewarding game where your accomplishments feel greatly satisfying. Building your first base will make you feel like you have conquered all odds and are finally safe. Until someone exploits it and gets inside or someone raids your base and blows down your walls with C4. This will teach you to value NOTHING but friendship in this harsh world. All of these horrible experiences will force you to start over but you will get better and better at it. Eventually you will build a raid proof exploit proof base and will know all the ins and outs of Rust.One thing I highely recommend is to play Rust with friends or try to make friends. Trying to make friends can be a tough experience but it will pay off if you actually find a good person to shack up with. Two people or three or four etc will make it much easier to face all the odds that are stacked against you in your attempts at survival.Rust is in very early stages of development and the updates are coming kind of slowely at the moment. But the devs do have some very cool ideas that they are working on and they always make sure everything is rock solid before implementing it into the game. They seem like good people. They have plenty of money to work with but just need time to get their ideas and their staff in order. Overall get Rust! Even if you don't get addicted straight away and don't like where the game is at the moment it will change it will evolve and it will become a better game in time. I find it extremely fun as it is though.

review: "Hitler" redirects here. For other uses see Hitler (disambiguation).Adolf HitlerAdolf Hitler cropped restored.jpgHitler in 1937Führer of GermanyIn office2 August 1934 30 April 1945Deputy Rudolf Hess (1933 41)Position vacantPreceded by Paul von Hindenburg(as President)Succeeded by Karl Dönitz(as President)Reich Chancellor of GermanyIn office30 January 1933 30 April 1945President Paul von Hindenburg (until 1934)Deputy Franz von Papen (1933 34)Position vacantPreceded by Kurt von SchleicherSucceeded by Joseph GoebbelsLeader of the Nazi PartyIn office29 June 1921 30 April 1945Deputy Rudolf HessPreceded by Anton DrexlerSucceeded by Martin BormannPersonal detailsBorn 20 April 1889Braunau am Inn Austria HungaryDied 30 April 1945 (aged 56)Berlin GermanyNationality Austrian citizen until 7 April 1925 1 German citizen after 25 February 1932Political party National Socialist German Workers' Party (1921 45)Other politicalaffiliations German Workers' Party (1920 21)Spouse(s) Eva Braun(29 30 April 1945)Parents Alois Hitler (father)Klara Pölzl (mother)Occupation PoliticianReligion See Religious views of Adolf HitlerSignature Military serviceAllegiance German EmpireService/branch Bavarian ArmyYears of service 1914 20Rank GefreiterVerbindungsmannUnit 16th Bavarian Reserve RegimentReichswehr intelligenceBattles/wars World War IAwards Iron Cross First ClassIron Cross Second ClassWound BadgeAdolf Hitler (20 April 1889 30 April 1945) was an Austrian born German politician who was the leader of the Nazi Party (NSDAP) Chancellor of Germany from 1933 to 1945 and Führer ("leader") of Nazi Germany from 1934 to 1945. He was effectively dictator of Nazi Germany and was at the centre of World War II in Europe and the Holocaust.Hitler was a decorated veteran of World War I. He joined the precursor of the NSDAP the German Workers' Party in 1919 and became leader of the NSDAP in 1921. In 1923 he attempted a coup in Munich to seize power. The failed coup resulted in Hitler's imprisonment during which time he dictated his autobiography and political manifesto Mein Kampf ("My Struggle"). After his release in 1924 Hitler gained popular support by attacking the Treaty of Versailles and promoting Pan Germanism anti Semitism and anti communism with charismatic oratory and Nazi propaganda. Hitler frequently denounced international capitalism and communism as being part of a Jewish conspiracy.Hitler's Nazi Party became the largest elected party in the German Reichstag leading to his appointment as chancellor in 1933. Following fresh elections won by his coalition the Reichstag passed the Enabling Act which began the process of transforming the Weimar Republic into Nazi Germany a single party dictatorship based on the totalitarian and autocratic ideology of National Socialism. Hitler aimed to eliminate Jews from Germany and establish a New Order to counter what he saw as the injustice of the post World War I international order dominated by Britain and France. His first six years in power resulted in rapid economic recovery from the Great Depression the denunciation of restrictions imposed on Germany after World War I and the annexation of territories that were home to millions of ethnic Germans actions which gave him significant popular support.Hitler sought Lebensraum ("living space") for the German people. His aggressive foreign policy is considered to be the primary cause of the outbreak of World War II in Europe. He directed large scale rearmament and on 1 September 1939 invaded Poland resulting in British and French declarations of war on Germany. In June 1941 Hitler ordered an invasion of the Soviet Union. By the end of 1941 German forces and the European Axis powers occupied most of Europe and North Africa. Failure to defeat the Soviets and the entry of the United States into the war forced Germany onto the defensive and it suffered a series of escalating defeats. In the final days of the war during the Battle of Berlin in 1945 Hitler married his long time lover Eva Braun. On 30 April 1945 less than two days later the two committed suicide to avoid capture by the Red Army and their corpses were burned.Under Hitler's leadership and racially motivated ideology the Nazi regime was responsible for the genocide of at least 5.5 million Jews and millions of other victims whom he and his followers deemed Untermenschen ("sub humans") and socially undesirable. Hitler and the Nazi regime were also responsible for the killing of an estimated 19.3 million civilians and prisoners of war. In addition 29 million soldiers and civilians died as a result of military action in the European Theatre of World War II. The number of civilians killed during the Second World War was unprecedented in warfare and constitutes the deadliest conflict in human history.

review: The thoughts and ideas for this game are awesome. They draw you in. The game is highly addictive in my opinion. It is crazy how well the game is put together for an open Alpha. When they have this game fully polished watch out! There are a few bugs and some things that I would love to see changed. A more active valve based reporting system for hackers for one. I was googline stuff about this and found many sites advertising the hacks they sell this realy needs addressing. Active nodes instead of what the game has now get rid of military grade craftables C4 should be air drop only and they should only allow crafting of very crude weapons. The game also needs a better melee/skinning system. I'm hoping they expand the map in the next two updates or set like 3 different maps to play on and have them auto load so its not always the same thing.I am super excited to see some of the changes I have read about and some of the things players have recomended in the forums.Well worth 20 bucks Enjoy!

review: If you've got $20 bucks laying around then get this game if you're looking for game of the year material then don't. As of now it's a rinse and repeat process. If you have other friends on the same server as you it's near impossible to find eachother. There's no map system implemented so your forced to communicate out of game. If you manage to find your friends you have to start gathering materials. There's three different types as of now wood stone and ore. They spawn randomly in locations around the world. The entire map is huge but not the entire thing is used. If you ever played the Arma 2 DayZ mod it's the same as debug land. It's nothing just trees and low quality textures. The game becomes grindy when you begin constructing a base. It takes a TON of wood for building a good base. The gun system is alright but it's RNG based if you find the plan to make the good ones. You have to camp the rad bases to get them. The way that raiding/griefing works at the moment is awful. When you log off the game your character stays in the place that you logged off. Often people will raid your base while you're offline and you will log and and lose all previous progress. Short term gain short term fun.Overall I've enjoyed the game and there are some features that make a great game but there is a lot of work to be done.

review: Okay lets just sum up this game really ing quick.Rust is an any on any clan based PvP talking simulator disguised as an incredibly grindy survival game.So if dear reader you wish to get a survival game about actually surviving perhaps solo? Don't get this game. Rust I feel at present is heavily geared towards those people who actually have the time and schedules to hop onto the game every single day.No not many adults can manage this schedule.That's why there's so many kids in Rust.Give it a miss if you're not into a seriously competitive experience and I don't mean in terms of content over price or something like that. I mean CS GO competitive. The real I can't stress this enough. If you haven't got at least half a dozen buddies willing to take the $20 plunge with you don't waste your money or your time.Rust no longer has any room for anything non PvP.

review: 95% of the people you meet will kill you regardless of your progression on the server. Its sad but in my first 10 hours of Rust I was killed after looting a town by two guys. I was very ed as I was hoarding my supplies and good weapons. I typed furiously in chat how much of a ing those guys were and asked why they killed me for no reason. The one guy pointlessly boasts his hours played and other random crap but the thing that stuck to me was when he said "Well welcome to Rust. What did you expect?" At that moment it clicked and I was no longer mad at the guys for ing me over my stuff. I spawned back at camp and went about my way. Point being you will be killed for no real reason you will lose hours worth of collecting in minutes and you will be betrayed. Its a game based on survival so don't expect everyone to be friendly or even leave you alone. I love the game and have 70+ hours clocked and atleast 80% has been for nothing (raided killed etc.)What you need to ask yourself is wether you are ok will losing everything spawning back with a rock in one hand a torch in the other a couple bandages in your pocket and doing it all over again.

review: DO NOT BUY THIS GAME!Unless you enjoy being killed by hackers do not even bother with this game. I have been to i believe 8 different servers and every one of them had hackers. In my most recent and very last encounter me and 3 friends had spent over 12 hours in one server. We had finally got a fortress and all that fun stuff only to be destroyed by a hacker with moonjump and a hack that he could instakill you with the second he saw you. There are NO servers that hackers won't find. Also even IF there ACTUALLY is an admin on they can't ban the hackers They are un bannable! title: Rust

review: I have only had about 5 sessions of this game me and 3 of my buddies. Rust has several features that I absolutely love about it. For example #1 It's a great survival/crafting/MMO #2 Crafting system is pretty realistic and customizable #3 Graphics and engine are "alright" for alpha #4 Extremely fun to play with friends.. and probably a few more reasons that I just can't think of right now.. But unfortuneatly it's the bad features about this game that pushed me to the point of uninstalling it... Just hear me out before you spend money on this. There are these "wonderful" people called hackers and they are not fun at all.. You spend hours upon hours upon days building your fort or house preparing hunting and gathering and then all of the sudden your dead for no reason. Why? Lag? Maybe the server crashed. Or it was a rare glitch? NOPE! There's a "hacker" who's invisble invincible and can teleport to the inside of your base. (Which you have spent days fortifying it and making it nearly impenetrable by a "normal" player) Checking your inventory inside your comfy and secure base next thing ya know DEAD!! I guess from the hacker's point of view it would probably be really funny to kill someone repeatedly and steal all of their things. Your just spawning over and over hoping to get away while the admin of the server can't even ban them to help you due to another hack! It's frustrating! This has happened to me and my buddies on 4 out of the 5 servers that we have played on.. So please!! Please!! Save yourself the hours of work time and stress (and possibly actual physical pain as well depending on how long you've been sitting in your computer chair) and wait for this to be fixed. The game is still in Alpha so I'm praying that there will be an update down the road that fixes the hacks.. Like I said this game is great!! One of the best survival crafters that I've played. I hate uninstalling it but it's not worth the trouble I'm putting myself through. I would have no problem recommending this game to everyone I know if it wasn't for all of the ridiculous hacking going on. So until this problem is fixed I won't play it and I'm not going to recommend it. (And yes I wrote this reveiw directly after having an aweful experience once again.. hence the anger and frustration in my words.)

review: If you have/want DayZ you will like this game. aside from the usual problems of a beta like a couple bugs and glitches (which have mostly been fixed since ER status) Rust is a well made fun and interesting game and whether or not you play it alone or with a clan it is an extremely tactical game. Especially on large servers the wars and skirmishes that can take place are astonishing. several days ago i dropped into a random server of about 25 30 people. I was immediately assigned a team and TP'ed to the teams base where I meant everyone suited up given a job room to sleep (their base was built like a medevial castle existing in the south) and participated for several hours in a massive 25 v. 25 war between the teams on the server. there we several battles day and night but we ended up winning. after that it was rebuilding for a day and back to it. Such exemplifies the broad spectrum of possibilities in this game. I recommend this game to any and everyone who likes games like Skyrim DayZ 7 Days to Die and Minecraft.

review: Rust is a post apocalyptic multiplayer survival game in which you can t trust anyone. The game is good at making you paranoid and I love it. You start with nothing but a rock a torch and two bandages which you have to use to survive the zombies wolves bears and other survivors. You have to make a house to live in but this house can be taken over by others if you don t look after it. You have to gather resources but these can be stolen from both your corpse and your house. You have to set a spawn point by making a sleeping bag but this can also be destroyed. You can even be killed while you're offline so you're never safe!One of the great things about this game is that it doesn t have a minimap. You can't just look at a map in the corner of your screen and see where everything is you have to memorize the environment. This might seem really harsh and it sort of is but after playing it for a couple of hours I knew where I could find everything. Just follow the road my friends told me and they were right. By following the road and memorizing its surroundings you know where everything is and it really adds to the experience.I would definitely recommend this game to everyone who doesn't care for a story and just wants to have fun. It's more fun with friends but even on your own you can accomplish a whole lot. The game is still in alpha so there are a lot of small things that don't seem quite right and bugs are found everywhere too. Servers keep going down lately because of hackers but this is not the game's fault. I'm sure the game itself will be a lot better when it's finished but even now I can recommend this game.

review: I was absolutely obsessed with this game back in 2014 I loved the feeling of constant anxeity of hearing another player (or radioactive wolves and bears) coming up behind you whilst you gathered resources or waited out the night in you rickety little wooden shack. Then for some reason I just stopped playing.Last night was my first play through since then and I was absolutely amazed by how things changed.I LOVE the inventory system it's so simplistic and a lot easier to manageAnd the building system is another feature that has taken the simplistic road making it a lot less of a headache and a lot easier to build quickly under pressure of other players in the area.Also the maps a beautiful filled with colour and sound the only thing is (maybe it was just the server I was on) I struggled to find any deer or boars (but that's not a fault of the game and was just possibly the server I was on)I would definately re recommend this to previous Rust enthusiasts I'm glad after months of debating whether to get back into it or not that I did. So much work has been done (as opposed to other early access games I've been playing) and you can tell developers are moulding this into a top contender of the mulitplayer survival genre

Every night when i try to play i'm given a launcher error. after fiddling around with it for a few hours SOMETIMES i'm able to get back into it. Tonight i've been trying to get in for 3 hours. I can't deal with this crap anymore.I'LL BE BACK to see what changes have been done to the game if/when they ever make EAC more compatible with Windows 10 or they pick up a more popular anti cheat program.

review: This game is absolute gold. I like DayZ and played it a good bit but DayZ is so buggy and I feel that in DayZ you can more easily die get lost and its way harder to find your friends. In Rust I have found 0 bugs so far and minor lag in servers. Now understand that both of these games are both not in full version and its hard to judge which is better. In Rust you can type in the chat which is linked to everyone in the whole server unlike DayZ in which you can chat to only people in your vicinity. But in Rust like DayZ you can only voice chat to your vicinity.But enough about DayZ.In Rust Its kind of easier to find your friends. There is one road in the whole entire game ( see the map on my profile ) and the road goes in kinda a figure 8 shape without crossing in the middle. The game also kinda has a Minecraft feel to it. When you start in the game you start with 2 Medkits a torch (for night) and a rock. This rock you can use to beat people zombies bears deer pigs and mine rocks and trees. You can craft in this game but dont think its anything like Minecraft for a second. This game isn't blocky like minecraft which is the mistake i made when my friend told me that this game was like minecraft and DayZ mixed. Also theres radiation in this game and its resembles a lot like Falllout. Radiation kills you and they can be found in these little towns thats you find if you continue on the road. Your radiation levels are in the bottom right hand of the screen and you hear a ticking noise (like in fallout) when your in radiation. Now why do they have radiation in this game you ask? Well they put radiation in these towns because in these towns there is good loot that respawns everys 5 10 minutes. It would be ashame if someone camped in the town and took the loot. Its exciting to loot the towns because you find some great things like Guns Ammo blueprints (talk about this in a second) pickaxes armor. The PvP is fun too finding people while you have a loaded gun is better. Also in this game you can craft anything that is in the game but you wont be able to just craft a gun straight from the start. When you loot towns you can find blueprints which unlock the capability to craft more advanced stuff. Also there are airdrops where a giant plane flys over and drops boxes of loots. Its kinda like the Hunger Games with the Cornocopia and how everyone at the same time rushes to get to the loot lol. Also you can build pretty cool houses (its not like minecraft building) and when you put a door on your house only you can open that door so if you manage to keep your door closed when your not there people cant get in... Actually i lied they can. If you have a wooden door people can hit down your door with a Rock Pickaxe Stoneaxe or the hatchet. It actually takes a while but if you have good stuff in your house its worth their while. You can craft metal doors that people CANT break down unless they have explosives which are pretty hard to find. One last thing When you log off the game your charecter does not just disapear and you are no longer in the game. No no. When you log off the game Your character just falls down and goes to sleep and you are still able to be killed. So make sure your somewhere safeOverall like I said this game is gold. And i totally recommend anyone to purchase it.9/10
title: Rust

review: Absolutely can not get enough of this game. It has the suspense of survival down pat and its only in an early alpha state. Survival building similar to minecraft Zombie ai and radiactive loot caches Wildlife to hunt Players!!! Best part of the game.. most are super "dbags" according to chat but seriously... in a post apocalyptic world with minimal ai at this point there are hardly any reasons to not kill someone on sight and soo many reasons to kill someone food suupplies safety knowing they wont cut you down and steal your when you turn your back on them. Really makes it hard and enjoyable to have to earn trust of players but when you all finally build something great together its just awesome to look at it and exciting to defend it from others.

review: All i need to say about this game is that if you are willing to play hours and hours of it then make sure you prepare for some strong "Feels" and moments that make you want to throw you computer out the window. That being said this game is quite great for a Alpha due to the fact that in my time i only managed to see on bug and that is one were a player dies and there body twerks as if they were taken over by Miley Cyrus. Now lets get into what the game is really about Rust is a surviaval game mixed with many features like base building and crafting . While playing Rust i got a huge vibe that this game was made by the shadows of Minecraft and Dayz which is a good thing because both are popular and have a huge fan base. Another feature are the many guns that the game has that are all craftable with blueprints that are found in many places such as boxes and zombies. Due to the fact that there are guns you should asume that there will be players shooting other players and there is no better immersion than someone with the best gear shooting at you with all of you and with all of yoiur loot you want to get to safety but at the same time bring a sad ending to you hunters life and taking there loot. One side not is that the game is very easy to learn the curves and if you ever run into someone you still have the chance to shoot them due to the fact that guns behave like no other game and it is imposible to have 100% accuracy but i would tell you to say friendly but it is your choice ). Now lets get to the pros and cons.Pros Immersion Base Building Addicting Gameplay The felling of "Just one more Hour"Cons Some bugs (points not taken away due to Alpha) No way to protect new spawns because they have a rock and others have assult rifles Score 85/100 (can't wait to see what this game brings)

review: Ok so I think ive played enough of this to give it a reveiw this game is better with a friend or two. So where to start. The gun play and really good along with the weapons you get just enough reciol but not too much. The base building is easy to use and it just flows. The crafting system is fluid and is really easy to use and pick up. Hunting for food feels really hard if you don't find a road and this is where players come in and kill you. Riot zones (towns) there is a massive risk with the players but if you get out alive the equipment is really good in there. Supply drops can give you extremley good equipment so if any drop near you try to get them before everyone else. ALWAYS shoot randoms if they shoot at you first this is risky but you don't want to make enemys. Also prep your base for any form of attakc you WILL get raided and must be prepard. To sum things up this game is amazing for an alpha and I give an Alpha review of 9/10.

review: Things I've learned while playing Rust 1) As they very clearly warn you it's an alpha game. At the time of writing (Dec 31st release of the Alpha) the Developers seem to be more focused on the environment and mechanics of the sandbox and less focused on content. There's not much to do once you've built your base up and raided every other home except pick another server and do it all again. I did this on three different servers before I got bored. That said the game itself seems relatively free of major bugs. There are plenty of minor bugs to be found but they don't really have any effect on the outcome or possible enjoyment of the game.2) There are far too many hackers. It takes way too much effort to build up a supposedly "safe" base only to have it griefed and/or ruined by no clippers and wall hack thieves. I expect people to do legitimate raids (I know I do) but you are powerless against hackers. It takes several hours of play time to acquire enough resources to build a secure home and hackers can undo all your work in a matter of seconds. If you're lucky they will only kill your sleeping body and steal your stuff. If you're not they'll wall off access to your base and you won't be able to use it again. You can't adjust parts of your base without obnoxious amounts of explosives...3) As with all open PvP games "there's safety in numbers" in this world as well. If you have more friends to play with you it's likely that you will have a good time raiding other people's homes and wreaking havok until you get bored. If you're solo you had better be a good negotiator a really good shot really sneaky or some reasonable combination.In short it is a novel idea but it is not fleshed out enough at this time. Maybe check it out in a few months.

review: You spawn in a new server wanting to start fresh. You picked one of the more populated servers thinking "I can handle other players!"So with your trusty rock in hand you begin to hack away at the resource piles in front of you. As you gather your stone you hear footprints from in front of you. You stop hacking at the rock and peek around ever so slowly to see a man in full kevlar staring at you with a dangerous object resembling a gun pointed straight at your head. He says to you "Go away. Stay away from my base or I will kill you."So you run and you run and you run some more. Then BAM an M4 shot sounds and you hear a bullet ping off the ground from next to you. You turn around at the last second to see the same person shoot you in the face.You respawn in a peacefull valley next to a concrete bunker. You decide to explore. As you happily run up to a weapon crate you hear footsteps from behind you "probably just a deer" you say to yourself. You open the box to see an MP5A4! You are so happ tp get your first gun but then a voice comes from behind you "Thats mine B***H!"You turn around to see a man slam the blunt surface of a rock into your skull and you lose your first gun.TIPS!! if you are new join a rather unpopulated server. Just learn how the game works. When looting always check your surroundings. When you hear footsteps you should probably run. Dont go for the airdrop. Rock is your friend

This game gets a thumbs up from me although be prepared to deal with a heavy dose of raiders and griefers...
